name: consumption
trans: the act of consuming something

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: cogitate
trans: to meditate, to ponder, to think deeply

sentences.english: He sat silently cogitating.
sentences.chinese: 他静坐深思。

sentences.english: We cogitated on the meaning of life.
sentences.chinese: 我们深思生命的意义。

detailed_translations.english: If you are cogitating, you are thinking deeply about something

name: dare
trans: to have the courage to do something

sentences.english: He wanted to ask her, but he didn’t dare.
sentences.chinese: 他想问她，但又不敢。

sentences.english: ‘I’ll tell Dad.’ ‘You wouldn’t dare!’
sentences.chinese: “我要告诉爸爸。” “谅你也不敢！”

sentences.english: How dare you accuse me of lying!
sentences.chinese: 你竟敢说我撒谎！

detailed_translations.english: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

name: convolution
trans: something that is folded or rolled up

name: fraught
trans: filled or charged

sentences.english: The earliest operations employing this technique were fraught with dangers.
sentences.chinese: 最早采用这一技术的手术充满了危险。

detailed_translations.english: If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them

name: darwinism
trans: theory: species come from parent forms via natural selection

name: epicycle
trans: circle whose centre is on the circumference of a larger one

name: confidence
trans: self-assurance

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: broach
trans: to mention or suggest for the first time

name: brokerage
trans: a company whose business is to act as a broker

sentences.english: ...Japan's four biggest brokerages.
sentences.chinese: …日本的4大经纪公司。

detailed_translations.chinese: 经纪人佣金； 经纪人业务
detailed_translations.english: the business of being a broker

name: disseminate
trans: to scatter or spread widely, broadcast

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

name: elixir
trans: a liquid which converts lead to gold

sentences.english: the search for the elixir of life
sentences.chinese: 寻找长生不老药

detailed_translations.chinese: 炼金药, 不老长寿药
detailed_translations.english: a magical liquid that is supposed to cure people of illness, make them younger etc

name: cavort
trans: to prance, said of mounts

sentences.english: Satisfied, sun-warmed, we sprawl in the grass and watch our kites cavort.
sentences.chinese: 阳光和煦，我们心满意足地趴在草丛里，看风筝在天上欢跃。

detailed_translations.english: to jump or dance around in a playful or sexual way

name: entwine
trans: to twist or twine around something (or one another)

sentences.english: They walked together with their arms entwined.
sentences.chinese: 他们挽着胳膊一起走。

detailed_translations.english: to twist two things together or to wind one thing around another

name: gambol
trans: to skip about, as in dancing or playing, frolic

sentences.english: ...the sight of newborn lambs gambolling in the fields.
sentences.chinese: …初生羊羔在牧场上跳跃的景象。

detailed_translations.english: If animals or people gambol, they run or jump about in a playful way

name: furrow
trans: to make (a) groove, a cut(s) in (the ground etc )

sentences.english: A deep furrow appeared between his brows.
sentences.chinese: 他眉间出现了一道深深的皱纹。

detailed_translations.english: a deep line or fold in the skin of someone’s face, especially on the forehead
to make a wide deep line in the surface of something

name: agog
trans: in eager desire, eager, astir

sentences.english: I’ve been agog all afternoon, waiting for the next part of your story.
sentences.chinese: 整个下午我都在兴奋地期待着，等你讲下一段故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的， 有强烈兴趣的
detailed_translations.english: If you are agog, you are excited about something, and eager to know more about it

name: gratification
trans: the act of pleasing the mind, the taste, or the appetite

sentences.english: So even to-day, when we fail to see the truth of religion, we seek in its observance an artistic gratification.
sentences.chinese: 所以，甚至在今天，在我们还看不到宗教的真理时，我们只能从宗教的仪式里去寻求艺术的满足。

sentences.english: We live in a culture of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 我们生活在即时满足的文化中。

name: deacon
trans: a member of the clerical order below that of a priest

sentences.english: James Murphy, deacon of the diocese's mother church, the Cathedral of the Blessed Sacrament, said church leaders are always skeptical at first.
sentences.chinese: 主教教区的天主教大教堂执事詹姆斯·墨菲说，教堂的负责人一开始都对此持怀疑态度。

sentences.english: And, even with this terror in his heart, he could hardly avoid laughing, to imagine how the sanctified old patriarchal deacon would have been petrified by his minister's impiety.
sentences.chinese: 然而，尽管他内心如此惧怕，但一想到假着他当真说出那番大不敬的话来，那位圣洁的父辈老执事会吓得何等瞠目结舌，他还是禁不住要笑出声来！

sentences.english: I caught up with Coburn, a medical doctor and ordained Southern Baptist deacon.
sentences.chinese: 我约见了科伯恩，他是一位医学博士，也是南部浸礼会执事。

detailed_translations.english: a religious official, in some Christian churches, who is just below the rank of a priest

name: amoral
trans: being neither moral nor immoral

sentences.english: a completely amoral person
sentences.chinese: 毫无道德观念的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 与道德无关的；无从区分是非的；超道德的
detailed_translations.english: having no moral standards at all

name: distillation
trans: the act of pouring out or falling in drops

sentences.english: He tried to obtain another material by distillation.
sentences.chinese: 他试图通过蒸馏法获得另一种物质。

sentences.english: Also, in traditional black forest cakes, kirsch, which is a clear colorless fruit brandy which is made from double distillation of morellos is added.
sentences.chinese: 此外，传统的黑森林蛋糕中还会加入樱桃酒，这是一种清澈无色的水果白兰地，由欧洲酸樱桃经两次蒸馏后制成。

sentences.english: When carvone begins to distill, the condensation can be seen inside the thermometer adapter, thus the progress of carvone distillation can be readily monitored.
sentences.chinese: 当香芹酮开始蒸馏时，在温度计转接器内可看到有冷凝，因此能够容易地监察香芹酮的蒸馏过程。

name: acumen
trans: quickness of perception or discernment, penetration of mind

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.
sentences.chinese: 他在商业上的敏锐帮他在其他人失败的地方获得成功。

sentences.english: Science considers to make clear, the baby is to comparative to outside information of acumen, acceptance rate is quite rapid also.
sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

name: abscond
trans: to depart secretly

sentences.english: He was ordered to appear the following day, but absconded.
sentences.chinese: 他被传唤于第二天出庭，却逃跑了。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a place where you are being kept

name: battery
trans: a fortified emplacement for heavy guns

sentences.english: You have to take the top off to change the batteries .
sentences.chinese: 你得把顶盖拿掉才能更换电池。

sentences.english: When the red light comes on, you should recharge the battery .
sentences.chinese: 红灯亮起的时候你就应该给电池充电了。

sentences.english: The car’s got a flat battery .
sentences.chinese: 汽车的蓄电池没电了。

sentences.english: a battery-operated hairdryer
sentences.chinese: 使用电池的吹风机

detailed_translations.english: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

name: fumigate
trans: to disinfect, purify, rid of vermin with the chemical fumes

sentences.english: Also good for seed's long-term preservation. 7. There is a top dosage limit for AITC to fumigate different crop seeds.
sentences.chinese: 辣根精油活性成分AITC对不同的作物种子熏蒸时，其使用浓度有一定的限制。

sentences.english: Heat the vinegar, close doors and windows, fumigate in the room from time to time, which can effectively kill the flu virus.
sentences.chinese: 把陈醋加热，关上门窗，隔一段时间在房间里熏蒸一次，可有效杀除感冒等病毒。

detailed_translations.english: to remove disease,  bacteria  , insects etc from somewhere using chemicals, smoke, or gas

name: delegate
trans: to entrust (a task or responsibility)

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: hamper
trans: to hold back, hinder, impede

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: attribute
trans: to ascribe (something) to a given cause, reason etc

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: culminate
trans: to reach a climax or point of the highest development

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: epicycloid
trans: plane curve made by tracing the path of a point of a circle

name: cliche
trans: a trite, stereotyped expression

sentences.english: His article is stuffed with cliche.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中满是一些陈词滥调。

sentences.english: A cliche, I know, and until then I had not grasped what that feels like.
sentences.chinese: 我知道过于陈词滥调，但是我知道我已经抓不住那种感觉了。

sentences.english: Enjoy your life when you're young – it's a true cliche that you only have your youth once – but work harder than most people think you should.
sentences.chinese: 当你年轻时，享受你的生活— 因为青春只有一次，这是陈词滥调— 但别忘了要比别人想象的更努力工作。

name: divinity
trans: the property of being divine, of being like a god or god

sentences.english: a graduate of Harvard divinity school
sentences.chinese: 哈佛大学神学院的毕业生

detailed_translations.english: the study of God and religious beliefs

name: belligerent
trans: hostile, aggressive

sentences.english: a belligerent attitude
sentences.chinese: 敌对的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战的；好战的；交战国的
detailed_translations.english: a belligerent country is fighting a war against another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战国；参加斗殴的人或集团

name: dyne
trans: a unit of force in the cgs system. symbol: dyn

name: forbear
trans: to keep away from, to avoid, to abstain from, to give up

sentences.english: I forbore to comment on this.
sentences.chinese: 我不欲评论它

detailed_translations.english: to not do something you could or would like to do because you think it is wiser not to
a  forebear

name: concerto
trans: a piece of music for solo instruments and orchestra

sentences.english: ...Tchaikovsky's First Piano Concerto.
sentences.chinese: …柴可夫斯基的《第一钢琴协奏曲》。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of  classical  music, usually for one instrument and an  orchestra

name: archetype
trans: the original model from which all similar things are copied

sentences.english: He came to this country 20 years ago and is the archetype of the successful Asian businessman.
sentences.chinese: 他20年前来到这个国家，是成功的亚裔商人的典型。

detailed_translations.english: a perfect example of something, because it has all the most important qualities of things that belong to that type

name: diplomacy
trans: the art and practice of conducting international relations

sentences.english: international diplomacy
sentences.chinese: 国际外交

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交；外交手腕；交际手段
detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of managing the relationships between countries

name: abdomen
trans: the belly/stomach

sentences.english: He went into the hospital to undergo tests for a pain in his abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 他去了医院接受对他的腹部疼痛进行的各项检查。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,  bowel s  etc

name: antemeridian
trans: of or relating to morning, that happens in the morning

sentences.english: On the antemeridian of the 5th, connect headquarter from captain the sofa didn't can arrive on time as well toward the wrap car of HengYang.
sentences.chinese: 5日上午，就连总部从长沙发往衡阳的包裹车也没能按时抵达。

sentences.english: In the talk dated the antemeridian of September 1, Chen Zhao Xiong smiles toward Guo Tai Ming submission, can the lap talks that the lap forms a talks Ji to want.
sentences.chinese: 在9月1日上午的会谈中，陈肇雄笑着向郭台铭提出，能否边谈边形成一个洽谈纪要。

detailed_translations.english: before noon; in the morning

name: epithet
trans: any phrase applied to a person/thing to describe a quality

sentences.english: But it is impossible to predict the reaction of a man accosted by another with the words "you rat" without referring to the meaning that the man spoken to attaches to the epithet.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当你不带意识地，说出别人的绰号“老鼠”的时候，你还是无法预测这个人会有怎样的反应。

sentences.english: My teen years were marked by the common epithet “Camel Jockey” and the hit AM radio song “Ahab the A-rab.”
sentences.chinese: “骆驼骑师” （Camel Jockey）和调幅电台的热门歌曲“Ahab the A-rab”是我青少年时代人们通用的绰号。

sentences.english: For her part, though, Ono found the epithet less than distressing.
sentences.chinese: 不过，对于她来说，小野发现这一绰号决不她痛心。

name: cohere
trans: to stick together

sentences.english: All the details are there and are correct but they don’t cohere.
sentences.chinese: 所有的细节都摆在那里，而且都正确，但是它们并不一致。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连贯， 一致； 黏合； 齐心协力， 团结一致
detailed_translations.english: if ideas, arguments, beliefs, statements etc cohere, they are connected in a clear and reasonable way

name: cubicle
trans: a small separate part or one of the compartments of a room

name: garner
trans: to reap grain, gather it up, and store it in a granary

sentences.english: Durham had garnered three times as many votes as Carey.
sentences.chinese: 德拉姆获得的选票数是凯里的3倍。

sentences.english: He has garnered extensive support for his proposals.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的提议赢得了广泛的支持。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has garnered something useful or valuable, they have gained it or collected it

name: affluent
trans: having lots of wealth, property or other material goods

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: emblem
trans: a representative symbol, such as a trademark or logo

sentences.english: ...the emblem of the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: …苏联的国徽。

detailed_translations.english: a picture, shape, or object that is used to represent a country, organization etc

name: habitable
trans: safe and comfortable, fit for habitation

sentences.english: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for people to live in

name: christen
trans: to perform the religious act of the baptism, to baptise

sentences.english: She was christened Sarah.
sentences.chinese: 她在受洗时取名萨拉。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give a child its name at a Christian religious ceremony

detailed_translations.chinese: (Christen)人名；(法、德、西、丹、挪)克里斯滕；(英)克里森

name: espy
trans: to catch sight or, to perceive with the eyes, to discover

sentences.english: Here, from a window, did Guinevere espy a knight standing in a woodman's cart.
sentences.chinese: 吉尼维尔是从这里透过窗户看到了站在樵夫车上的骑士。

detailed_translations.english: If you espy something, you see or notice it

name: demented
trans: insane or mentally ill

sentences.english: She was almost demented with grief.
sentences.chinese: 她悲痛得几乎疯掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发狂的，疯狂的；精神错乱的
detailed_translations.english: crazy or behaving in a very strange way

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神错乱；变得痴呆（dement的过去分词）

name: curable
trans: able of being cured

sentences.english: Most skin cancers are completely curable if detected in the early stages.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的皮肤癌若在早期发现都能完全治愈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可治愈的；可医治的；可矫正的
detailed_translations.english: an illness that is curable can be cured

name: calvinism
trans: the doctrines and teachings of john calvin

name: aggress
trans: to set upon, to attack

sentences.english: Come here, I never aggress.
sentences.chinese: 来吧，我从不侵略；

sentences.english: While in ghost form, you will not be able to start battles, aggress, or run.
sentences.chinese: 处于幽灵状态时，你不能战斗，攻击，或者跑。

sentences.english: When translators translate, they usually invade and aggress on the original text, break the balance between the source text and target text and that between the source language and target language.
sentences.chinese: 当译者进行翻译时，他们通常会对原文进行攻击和侵犯，打破原文和译文、源语言和目标语言之间的平衡。

name: cadge
trans: ask for or obtain something to which one is not entitled

sentences.english: Can I cadge a cigarette?
sentences.chinese: 我可以讨一根香烟吗？

sentences.english: He could cadge a ride from somebody.
sentences.chinese: 他可以求别人搭个便车。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cadges food, money, or help from you, they ask you for it and succeed in getting it

name: conform
trans: to act in accordance with expectations

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: excruciate
trans: to inflict intense pain on (someone), to torture

name: comical
trans: funny, amusing

sentences.english: The note of pure panic in his voice was almost comical.
sentences.chinese: 他那种十分慌张的口气几乎有点滑稽。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or situations that are comical are funny in a strange or unexpected way

name: cantata
trans: a vocal composition accompanied by instruments

detailed_translations.chinese: 大合唱；（意）清唱剧；康塔塔（一种声乐套曲）
detailed_translations.english: a piece of religious music for singers and instruments

name: arbitrate
trans: to judge, to umpire

sentences.english: He arbitrates between investors and members of the association.
sentences.chinese: 他在投资者与该协会成员之间做仲裁。

detailed_translations.english: to officially judge how an argument between two opposing sides should be settled

name: earnest
trans: ardent in the pursuit of an object, eager to obtain or do

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

name: deplore
trans: to bewail, to weep bitterly over, to feel sorrow for

sentences.english: The UN deplored the invasion as a ‘violation of international law’.
sentences.chinese: 联合国谴责这次入侵 “违反了国际法” 。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谴责；悲悼；哀叹；对…深感遗憾
detailed_translations.english: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly

name: arrange
trans: to set up, to organize, especially in a positive manner

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: derivative
trans: imitative of the work of someone else

sentences.english: the derivatives market
sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数
detailed_translations.english: something that has developed or been produced from something else

name: cloy
trans: to fill up or choke up, to stop up

sentences.english: Her sweet submissive smile began to cloy after a while.
sentences.chinese: 不久，她那种甜甜的媚笑开始让人厌烦了。

name: amorphous
trans: lacking definite form

sentences.english: an amorphous mass of twisted metal
sentences.chinese: 一堆扭曲变形的金属

detailed_translations.chinese: 无定形的；无组织的；[物] 非晶形的
detailed_translations.english: having no definite shape or features

name: evacuate
trans: to leave or withdraw from

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

name: composure
trans: calmness of mind or matter, self-possession

sentences.english: He has lost his composure under the pressure of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他不堪形势的压力，失去了冷静。

detailed_translations.english: the state of feeling or seeming calm

name: bucolic
trans: a pastoral poem

sentences.english: ...the bucolic surroundings of Chantilly.
sentences.chinese: ...尚蒂伊的田园景致。

detailed_translations.chinese: 牧歌的；牧羊的；乡下风味的
detailed_translations.english: Bucolic means relating to the countryside

name: acute
trans: sharp

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: animus
trans: the basic impulses and instincts which govern one's actions

sentences.english: Your animus toward him suggests that you are the wrong man for the job.
sentences.chinese: 你对他的敌意说明你不适合这份工作。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of strong dislike or hatred

name: euphoric
trans: feeling of great well-being or intense feeling of happiness

name: chaos
trans: complete disorder and confusion

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

name: concatenation
trans: a series or order of connected things

name: calibre
trans: degree of capacity or competence, ability

sentences.english: The school attracts a high calibre of student.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校吸引高素质的学生。

detailed_translations.english: the level of quality or ability that someone or something has achieved

name: dubious
trans: hesitating or doubting

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

name: flue
trans: a pipe or duct that carries gaseous combustion products away

detailed_translations.english: a metal pipe or tube that lets smoke or heat from a fire out of a building

name: feudal
trans: of, or relating to the feudal system

sentences.english: the feudal system
sentences.chinese: 封建制度

sentences.english: feudal society
sentences.chinese: 封建社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 封建制度的；领地的；世仇的
detailed_translations.english: relating to feudalism

name: fervor
trans: an intense, heated emotion, passion, ardor

sentences.english: He took up the cause with evangelical fervor .
sentences.chinese: 他以传道者般的热情投身于这一事业。

sentences.english: The cathedral at Chartres is an expression of the religious fervor of the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在查特雷斯的大教堂是中世纪时期宗教热情的表现之一。

sentences.english: As social conflicts continue tosharpen, the party needs to divert attention, and of course a parade is a goodway to do that by whipping up nationalist fervor.
sentences.chinese: 随着社会冲突继续深化，中共需要转移人们的注意力，而阅兵就是实现这一点的好办法，可以激起人们的民族主义热情。

name: desperado
trans: a bold outlaw, especially one from the southern wild west

name: bastion
trans: a projecting part of a rampart or other fortification

sentences.english: Pearl Harbor was the principal American bastion in the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 珍珠港曾是美国在太平洋上的重要军事据点。

detailed_translations.english: something that protects a way of life, principle etc that seems likely to change or end completely

name: disburden
trans: to remove the load from a pack animal, unload a vehicle, etc

name: deduce
trans: to reach a conclusion from something known or assumed

sentences.english: Alison cleverly deduced that I was the author of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森聪明地推断出我是这封信的作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推论， 推断， 演绎
detailed_translations.english: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

name: deponent
trans: (Greek Grammar) having passive form but an active meaning

name: annex
trans: to add something to another, to incorporate into

sentences.english: Any annex is the integral part of this contract.
sentences.chinese: 本合同一切附件均为本合同的有效组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: to take control of a country or area next to your own, especially by using force

name: exult
trans: to rejoice, be very happy

sentences.english: ‘We made the front page!’ Jos exulted.
sentences.chinese: “我们上了头版！”乔斯欣喜若狂道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴
detailed_translations.english: to show that you are very happy and proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something

name: delirious
trans: in a state of wild excitement or ecstasy

sentences.english: I was delirious and blacked out several times.
sentences.chinese: 我当时神志不清，几次昏过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发狂的；神志昏迷的；精神错乱的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is delirious is unable to think or speak in a sensible and reasonable way, usually because they are very ill and have a fever

name: confinement
trans: the act of confining or the state of being confined

sentences.english: They were held in confinement for three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他们被关押了三个星期。

sentences.english: He visited prisoners at their place of confinement.
sentences.chinese: 他到犯人关押处访问了犯人。

detailed_translations.english: the act of putting someone in a room, prison etc that they are not allowed to leave, or the state of being there

name: fetish
trans: an object seen as being the habitation of a spirit

sentences.english: a leather fetish
sentences.chinese: 恋皮革癖

detailed_translations.english: something you are always thinking about or spending too much time doing

name: defiance
trans: open resistance, bold disobedience

sentences.english: ...his courageous defiance of the government.
sentences.chinese: …他对政府的大胆蔑视。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that shows you refuse to do what someone tells you to do, especially because you do not respect them

name: clemency
trans: the gentle or kind exercise of power

sentences.english: The republican party has vociferously opposed any clemency for convicted terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 共和党已经高声反对给被判有罪的恐怖分子以任何仁慈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和； 仁慈， 宽厚
detailed_translations.english: forgiveness and less severe punishment for a crime

name: acknowledge
trans: to admit the knowledge of, to recognize as a fact or truth

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: bulbous
trans: having the shape of or resembling a bulb, bloated

sentences.english: Design travelers will dig the big, bulbous lamps that hang from the ceiling over leather seats and carefully-placed table settings.
sentences.chinese: 这些设计使得游客会欣赏那些大大的从天花板垂下并悬于皮椅之上的球根状灯饰和精心设计的餐桌摆设。

detailed_translations.chinese: 球根的， 球根状的， 球根长成的

name: debase
trans: to reduce in quality or value

sentences.english: The medical profession has been debased by these revelations.
sentences.chinese: 这些事被披露后，医学界的声誉受到了损害。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something lose its value or people’s respect

name: christendom
trans: christians, collectively

name: cognizant
trans: having awareness of (something)

sentences.english: We are cognizant of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们认识到这个问题的存在。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is cognizant of something, they know about it and understand it

name: alder
trans: belonging to the birch tree family

sentences.english: A few scrubby trees, like red alder, have re-established themselves, and ants, frogs, meadowlarks, beavers and other species have moved in.
sentences.chinese: 一些矮灌木丛，像红桤木很快又长起来了，蚂蚁青蛙草地鸬海狸还有其他一些物种也都迁进来了。

sentences.english: Groves of stunted red spruce, huckleberry, blueberry, mountain laurel, mountain holly, speckled alder, and cranberry bogs, show combinations of colors throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 发育不良云杉的小树林、黑果木、蓝莓、山月桂、山冬青，斑点桤木和种越橘的沼泽地，显示着全年各种颜色的组合。

detailed_translations.english: An alder is a species of tree or shrub that grows especially in cool, damp places and loses its leaves in winter

name: calumniate
trans: to make false and defamatory statements

sentences.english: Calumniating me is to calumniate your friend!
sentences.chinese: 诽谤我也就是诽谤你的朋友！

sentences.english: I have never seen people like you calumniate others like this!
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有见过像你这样中伤别人的人！

sentences.english: You do more, under the pretext of unmasking yourself, you calumniate yourself.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是，借口说您要暴露自己，您其实是在诽谤自己，这真可怕。

detailed_translations.english: to slander

name: egress
trans: to exit or leave, to go or come out

name: covet
trans: to yearn to possess or have (something)

sentences.english: The Michelin Awards are coveted by restaurants all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 米其林评级是全世界所有餐厅的渴望。

detailed_translations.english: to have a very strong desire to have something that someone else has

name: docket
trans: a calendar or list of cases for trial

name: glutinous
trans: glue-like, sticky, viscid

sentences.english: The sauce was glutinous and tasted artificial.
sentences.chinese: 这种粘酱尝起来感觉不自然。

sentences.english: ...soft and glutinous mud.
sentences.chinese: ...柔软粘稠的泥巴。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is glutinous is very sticky

name: bass
trans: of sound which is low in pitch or frequency

sentences.english: The band features Johnson on bass (=  playing the bass guitar  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这支乐队由约翰逊弹奏低音吉他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鲈鱼；男低音；低音部；椴树
detailed_translations.english: a very low male singing voice, or a man with a voice like this
a bass instrument or voice produces low notes

name: fortuitous
trans: happening or produced by chance, accidental

sentences.english: The meeting with Jack was fortuitous.
sentences.chinese: 遇到杰克是机缘巧合。

detailed_translations.english: happening by chance, especially in a way that has a good result

name: abed
trans: in bed

sentences.english: I always think of many things abed .
sentences.chinese: 我总是想很多事情躺在床上。

sentences.english: Each morning they lay abed till the breakfast-bell.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨他们都躺在床上直到早餐铃响。

detailed_translations.english: in bed

name: foster
trans: to nurture offspring or to provide similar to another child

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: frowzy
trans: dirty and untidy, slovenly

sentences.english: There were frowzy fields, and cow-houses, and dunghills, and dustheaps, and ditches, and gardens, and summer-houses, and carpet-beating grounds, at the very door of the Railway.
sentences.chinese: 在铁路线开始的地方有霉臭难闻的田野、牛棚、粪堆、垃圾堆、水沟、菜园、凉亭和敲打地毯的场地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不整洁的（等于frowsy）；有臭味的；霉臭的

name: gyroscope
trans: apparatus of a wheel which spins inside of a frame

sentences.english: The gyroscope in tank is used to stabilize the aim system of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 坦克中的陀螺仪用于稳定火炮的瞄准系统。

sentences.english: Used in combination with GPS, an accelerometer, a compass and the gyroscope can be used for in indoor navigation with floor accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 与全球定位系统、加速度计、陀螺仪和指南针结合使用，可用于具有地面精度的室内导航。

sentences.english: Discovery is delivering a new astronaut sleeping quarters, an ammonia tank and a gyroscope for the space station.
sentences.chinese: “发现”号将为空间站送去一个新的宇航员睡觉舱，一个氨水箱和一个回转仪。

detailed_translations.english: a wheel that spins inside a frame and is used for keeping ships and aircraft steady. It can also be a child’s toy.

name: attrition
trans: wearing or grinding down by friction

sentences.english: a war of attrition
sentences.chinese: 消耗战

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually destroying your enemy or making them weak by attacking them continuously

name: famine
trans: extreme and general scarcity of food, as in a country

sentences.english: the great potato famine in Ireland
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰严重的土豆荒

sentences.english: A million people are facing famine .
sentences.chinese: 一百万人正面临饥荒。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

name: detrimental
trans: tending to cause harm

sentences.english: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染对环境的不利影响

detailed_translations.english: causing harm or damage

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的人（或物）；不受欢迎的求婚者

name: crematory
trans: pertaining to the act of cremating bodies

name: disavowal
trans: a denial of relationship or responsibility towards something

sentences.english: ...a public disavowal of his beliefs.
sentences.chinese: ...一个对他信仰的公开否认。

detailed_translations.english: A disavowal of something is a statement that you are not connected with it or responsible for it, or that you no longer agree with or believe in it

name: frantic
trans: desperate or wild with excitement, passion, fear, pain, etc

sentences.english: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸟被关了起来，到现在它都非常狂躁。

detailed_translations.english: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

name: ante
trans: risks, stakes

name: forejudge
trans: to prejudge, to judge beforehand

name: dexterity
trans: skill in performing tasks, especially with the hands

sentences.english: Computer games can improve children’s manual dexterity .
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏可以提高儿童手的灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: skill and speed in doing something with your hands

name: grantor
trans: a person who grants something

name: emulate
trans: to match or surpass (a person or achievement) by imitation

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: enthusiastic
trans: with zealous fervor, excited, motivated

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: disinformation
trans: publicly announced false information about a country

name: effete
trans: of substances, quantities etc: exhausted, spent, worn-out

sentences.english: effete intellectuals
sentences.chinese: 软弱的知识分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰老的；疲惫的；（土地）贫瘠的；（动植物）不育的

name: carte blanche
trans: complete freedom to act as one wishes or thinks best

name: continence
trans: the exercise of self constraint in sexual matters

name: ghoulish
trans: of or pertaining to ghouls

name: diplomatic
trans: of the relationships between the governments of countries

sentences.english: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

name: boor
trans: a rude, unmannerly person

sentences.english: Here is the consequence of being buried alive: she has thrown herself away upon that boor from sheer ignorance that better individuals existed!
sentences.chinese: 这就是隐居的结果：她把自己胡乱嫁给了一个粗俗的农民，全然不知还有更好的人存在！

detailed_translations.english: a man who behaves in a very rude way

name: audible
trans: capable of being heard

sentences.english: His voice was barely audible (=  could only just be heard  ) above the roar of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 人声嘈杂，几乎听不见他的说话声。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it

name: estuary
trans: coastal water body where ocean tides and river water merge

sentences.english: the Thames estuary
sentences.chinese: 泰晤士河河口

detailed_translations.english: the wide part of a river where it goes into the sea

name: acrophobia
trans: fear of heights

name: existential
trans: of, or relating to existence

sentences.english: Existential questions requiring religious answers still persist.
sentences.chinese: 需要宗教解答的生命问题持续存在着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 存在主义的；有关存在的；存在判断的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the existence of humans or to existentialism

name: burgess
trans: an inhabitant of a borough with full rights, a citizen

detailed_translations.english: any inhabitant of a borough

name: feasible
trans: that can be done in practice

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: adduce
trans: to cite (as proof)

sentences.english: Let me adduce more evidence.
sentences.chinese: 让我举出更多的证据。

sentences.english: Can you adduce any reason for His strange behavior?
sentences.chinese: 你是否能举出任何理由来说明他的奇特行为？

sentences.english: When you adduce evidence of this nature, you must be sure of your sources.
sentences.chinese: 你必须引用许多例证来证明你的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to give facts or reasons in order to prove that something is true

name: crystallize
trans: to make something form into crystals

sentences.english: The liquid will crystallize at 50 degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 这种液体在50摄氏度时结晶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使结晶；明确；使具体化；做成蜜饯
detailed_translations.english: if a liquid crystallizes, it forms  crystals

name: disclaim
trans: to renounce all claim to, to deny responsibility for

sentences.english: She disclaims any knowledge of her husband's business.
sentences.chinese: 她声称自己对她丈夫的生意一无所知。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否认，拒绝；放弃，弃权；拒绝承认
detailed_translations.english: to state, especially officially, that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it

name: collapse
trans: to fall down suddenly, to cave in

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: azure
trans: a light, purplish shade of blue

sentences.english: The apartment flag is gold lion rampant on a field of azure.
sentences.chinese: 公寓旗帜是一头在天蓝色背景下两腿站立的狮子。

sentences.english: Designed to offer a sampling of what Americans are thinking, the letters are read by the president, and he sometimes answers them by hand, in black ink on azure paper.
sentences.chinese: 选送民众来信供总统过目，旨在让总统了解美国民众的想法，总统要展阅这些来信，有时还要手书回信，回信是用黑墨水写在天蓝色信纸上的。

detailed_translations.english: having a bright blue colour like the sky

name: cynic
trans: churlish or satirical

sentences.english: Even hardened cynics believe the meeting is a step towards peace.
sentences.chinese: 就连最顽固的愤世嫉俗者也认为这次会议向和平迈出了一步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗者；犬儒学派的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is not willing to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

name: embroil
trans: to draw into a situation, to cause to be involved

sentences.english: Any hostilities could result in retaliation and further embroil U.N. troops in fighting.
sentences.chinese: 任何敌对活动都可能会招致报复，进而使联合国部队卷入战斗中。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone or something in a difficult situation

name: aesthete
trans: a person who has refined sensitivity towards art or nature

name: gaffe
trans: a foolish and embarrassing error, esp one made in public

sentences.english: The consul’s comments were a major diplomatic gaffe.
sentences.chinese: 领事的评论是一次重大的外交失言。

detailed_translations.english: an embarrassing mistake made in a social situation or in public

name: annihilate
trans: to reduce to nothing, to destroy, to eradicate

sentences.english: There are lots of ways of annihilating the planet.
sentences.chinese: 有很多毁灭那个星球的方式。

detailed_translations.english: To annihilate something means to destroy it completely

name: dishonest
trans: not honest

sentences.english: dishonest traders
sentences.chinese: 奸商

sentences.english: People on welfare are wrongly seen as lazy or dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 靠福利救济的人被误以为懒惰或不老实。

detailed_translations.english: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people

name: adjourn
trans: to postpone

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

name: expatiate
trans: to range at large, or without restraint

sentences.english: I'm in such a drive that I can't expatiate.
sentences.chinese: 我的时间实在紧迫，不能详述。

detailed_translations.english: to enlarge (on a theme, topic, etc) at length or in detail; elaborate (on)

name: bombard
trans: to attack something with bombs or other missiles

sentences.english: I had been in action, bombarding the Normandy coast.
sentences.chinese: 我参加过轰炸诺曼底海岸的行动。

detailed_translations.english: to attack a place for a long time using large weapons, bombs etc

name: cartographer
trans: the study and practice of making maps

sentences.english: This is my survey of a tumultuous landscape, done with all the uncertainty of a cartographer who does not know exactly where the boundaries of revolt begin and end.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我对这片动荡之地的调查，在调查中制图师完全不能确定起义发生和结束的界限范围。

sentences.english: According to enthusiasts' website Encyclopedia Titanica (ET), Dean worked for the government as a cartographer during World War II and then for an engineering company.
sentences.chinese: 据爱心人士创建的网站“泰坦尼克号百科全书”(Encyclopedia Titanica，简称为ET)记载，迪安曾于二战期间在政府中担任制图师一职，之后为一家工程公司工作。

sentences.english: Suppose you're a cartographer or geographic information system (GIS) professional, working on behalf of one, or an advanced hobbyist and want to bring in multiple datasets from a variety of sources.
sentences.chinese: 假设您是一名制图师或地理信息系统（GIS）专业人士，或是一名资深的爱好者，想要将不同来源的数据集中在一起。

detailed_translations.english: A cartographer is a person whose job is drawing maps

name: denude
trans: to divest of all covering, to make bare or naked, to strip

sentences.english: a hillside denuded in a fire
sentences.chinese: 被一场火烧得光秃秃的山坡

detailed_translations.english: to remove the plants and trees that cover an area of land

name: counterbalance
trans: a weight that balances another weight

sentences.english: Riskier investments tend to be counterbalanced by high rewards.
sentences.chinese: 较高风险的投资往往报以高回报。

sentences.english: ...organizations set up as a counterbalance to groups allied to the ANC.
sentences.chinese: ...作为对与非洲人国民大会联盟团体制衡而成立的各种组织。

detailed_translations.english: to have an equal and opposite effect to something such as a change, feeling etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 平衡量， 平衡力； 势均力敌
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a counterbalance to something else counterbalances that thing

name: conformist
trans: a person who conforms to the standards of a group

name: detriment
trans: the state if being harmed or damaged

sentences.english: Nor is the detriment only to the US industry .
sentences.chinese: 受到损害的不仅仅是美国轮胎行业。

sentences.english: Work hard to succeed but not to the detriment of others.
sentences.chinese: 在不损害他人利益的前提下为成功艰苦奋斗。

sentences.english: Governments which ignore them, however, do so to their own detriment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，政府忽略这些因素就是损害自己的利益。

detailed_translations.english: harm or damage

name: defamatory
trans: damaging to someone's reputation, especially if untrue

name: culinary
trans: relating to cookery or the activity of cooking

sentences.english: culinary skills
sentences.chinese: 烹饪技术

sentences.english: mushrooms dried for culinary use
sentences.chinese: 弄干作烹饪用的蘑菇

sentences.english: the region’s culinary delights
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的美味佳肴

detailed_translations.english: relating to cooking

name: decorate
trans: to furnish with ornaments

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

name: canny
trans: careful, prudent, cautious

sentences.english: a canny political advisor
sentences.chinese: 精明的政治顾问

detailed_translations.english: clever, careful, and not easily deceived, especially in business or politics

name: gendarme
trans: a member of the gendarmerie, a policing military body

name: dichotomy
trans: a cutting in two, a division

sentences.english: This dichotomy has its uses, but it can cause problems if taken too literally.
sentences.chinese: 这种二分法有它的用途，但如果死板地应用也会引发一些问题。

sentences.english: What is needed is a less rigid dichotomy between the autonomy of nurses and doctors, and more collaborative teamwork.
sentences.chinese: 需要减少护士和医生之间僵化的二分法，并进行更多团队合作。

name: abbess
trans: a female superior or governess of a nunnery

sentences.english: At age 43 she became abbess of her community.
sentences.chinese: 43岁时她成为当地的女修道院院长。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was an abbess in a small abbey .
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，一个小修道院里有一个女修道院院长。

sentences.english: Now the abbess is making her case for a religious life removed from worldly distractions-on the internet's world wide web.
sentences.chinese: 如今，这位女修道院院长正在国际互联网路上的“全球网”超级档上为超凡拔俗的宗教生活阐明自己的立场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女修道院院长， 尼姑庵住持
detailed_translations.english: a woman who is in charge of a  convent (=  a place where a group of  nun s  live  )

name: audit
trans: an official verification of records, especially financial

sentences.english: Each year they audit our accounts and certify them as being true and fair.
sentences.chinese: 每年他们都会审核我们的账目，以证明其准确合理。

detailed_translations.english: to officially examine a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct
an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

name: feign
trans: to represent by a false appearance of, to pretend

sentences.english: Feigning a headache, I went upstairs to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我假装头痛，上楼到自己房间去了。

detailed_translations.english: to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

name: generic
trans: very comprehensive, pertaining or appropriate to big groups

sentences.english: With this generic list node structure, you can now define lists and list operations that work regardless of the type of data stored in them.
sentences.chinese: 使用这个通用的列表节点结构，您现在可以定义列表和不需要考虑存储在列表中的数据类型的列表操作。

sentences.english: If your client code needs this kind of specific functionality, then this generic layer is not enough -- at least as it has been described so far.
sentences.chinese: 如果您的客户机代码需要这种特定的功能，那么这个一般层是不够的 ― 至少从迄今对它描述来看是不够的。

name: delectable
trans: pleasing to the taste, delicious

sentences.english: ...delectable wine.
sentences.chinese: ...美味可口的葡萄酒。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something, especially food or drink, as delectable, you mean that it is very pleasant

name: corollary
trans: something given beyond what is actually due

sentences.english: The number of prisoners increased as a corollary of the government's determination to combat violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府决心打击暴力犯罪，其后果是囚犯数量增加了。

detailed_translations.english: something that is the direct result of something else

name: adhesion
trans: the ability of a substance to stick to an unlike substance

name: dissolution
trans: the termination of an organized body or legislative assembly

sentences.english: the dissolution of the monasteries
sentences.chinese: 修道院的解散

detailed_translations.chinese: 分解，溶解；（议会等的）解散；（契约等的）解除；死亡
detailed_translations.english: the act of breaking up an organization, institution etc so that it no longer exists

name: ambulate
trans: to relocate one's self under the power of one's own legs

sentences.english: Patients in whom no orthotic was used were encouraged to ambulate immediately following randomization, maintaining "neutral spinal alignment" for 8 weeks.
sentences.chinese: 随机分组后，不使用矫形器组的病人即刻被鼓励行走，保持脊椎中立位8周。

detailed_translations.english: to wander about or move from one place to another

name: entomology
trans: the branch of zoology dealing with insects

name: evolve
trans: to develop gradually

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: banal
trans: so lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

name: facetious
trans: not meant to be taken seriously or literally

sentences.english: Don’t be so facetious!
sentences.chinese: 别这么乱开玩笑！

sentences.english: facetious comments
sentences.chinese: 不当的戏谑评论

detailed_translations.chinese: 诙谐的；爱开玩笑的；滑稽的；(尤指在不合适的时候)开玩笑的
detailed_translations.english: saying things that are intended to be clever and funny but are really silly and annoying

name: bar
trans: except fro, apart from

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: encore
trans: to call for an extra performance or repetition

sentences.english: The band came back onstage for an encore.
sentences.chinese: 乐队回到台上加演了一曲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 再演唱的要求；经要求而再唱

name: anesthesia
trans: a method of preventing sensation, used to eliminate pain

sentences.english: Studies in rodents and monkeys have repeatedly shown that exposure to anesthesia at a very young age kills brain cells.
sentences.chinese: 对于啮齿动物和猴子的研究也多次说明在年龄非常小的时候接受麻醉会杀死脑细胞。

sentences.english: For example, a certain kind of muscle relaxant for anesthesia will make certain kind of people choke. Finally, scientists found it was because they had certain kind of genes.
sentences.chinese: 例如，某种麻醉用肌肉松弛剂会导致特定的人无法呼吸，最终，科学家发现这种现象的原因在于他们拥有特定的基因。

sentences.english: Another Sierra is a Doctor of anatomy. He was credited fot inventing the first anesthetic. The anesthesia allowed him to operate on his patients without causing pain.
sentences.chinese: 另一位席埃拉是名解剖学博士。他被誉为发明麻醉药的第一人。在麻醉作用下，他可以为病无痛做手术。

name: conversion
trans: the act of having converted something or someone

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

name: aerial
trans: of, in, or from the air, atmospheric

sentences.english: an aerial attack
sentences.chinese: 空袭

sentences.english: aerial photographs
sentences.chinese: 在空中拍摄的照片

sentences.english: an aerial view of the Three Gorges Dam project
sentences.chinese: 一张三峡大坝工程鸟瞰图

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞机的，航空的；空中的，架空的
detailed_translations.english: from a plane
a piece of equipment for receiving or sending radio or television signals, usually consisting of a piece of metal or wire

name: discriminate
trans: to recognize a distinction, to differentiate

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: epitomize
trans: to serve as a typical example of, typify

sentences.english: This building epitomizes the spirit of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 这栋建筑体现了19世纪的时代精神。

detailed_translations.english: to be a very typical example of something

name: artful
trans: performed with, or characterized by, art or skill

sentences.english: artful tricks
sentences.chinese: 诡计

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧妙的；狡猾的；有技巧的；欺诈的
detailed_translations.english: clever at deceiving people

name: dispassionate
trans: not showing, and not affected by emotion, bias, or prejudice

sentences.english: We, as prosecutors, try to be dispassionate about the cases we bring.
sentences.chinese: 我们作为公诉人尽量在经手的案件上不带偏见。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is dispassionate is calm and reasonable, and not affected by emotions

name: glimmer
trans: to shine with a faint light

sentences.english: In the east there is the slightest glimmer of light.
sentences.chinese: 东方有一丝闪烁的微光。

detailed_translations.english: a light that is not very bright
to shine with a light that is not very bright

name: arboriculture
trans: the cultivation of trees and shrubs

sentences.english: The web site provides plant science consulting and research services for applications in horticulture, urban forestry, arboriculture , natural plant communities, and agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 网站提供了以下几个方面的植物科学咨询与研究信息服务：园艺、城市林学、植物栽培、自然植物群落、农学等。

detailed_translations.english: the cultivation of trees or shrubs, esp for the production of timber

name: excoriate
trans: to denounce or berate severely

sentences.english: He proceeded to excoriate me in front of the nurses.
sentences.chinese: 他继续在这些护士们面前指责我。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严厉的责难；擦破的皮肤
detailed_translations.english: To excoriate a person or organization means to criticize them severely, usually in public

name: constable
trans: a police officer ranking below sergeant (british)

detailed_translations.english: a British police officer of the lowest rank

name: athirst
trans: thirsty

sentences.english: I am athirst for faraway things.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望着遥远的事物。

sentences.english: I am restless. I am athirst for faraway things.
sentences.chinese: 我心绪不宁。我渴望着遥远的事物。

sentences.english: I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.
sentences.chinese: 我要将生命泉的水白白赐给那口渴的人喝。

detailed_translations.english: having an eager desire; longing

name: anomaly
trans: a deviation from a rule or from what is regarded as normal

sentences.english: In those days, a woman professor was still an anomaly.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候，女教授仍旧十分稀罕。

detailed_translations.english: something that is noticeable because it is different from what is usual

name: festal
trans: festive, relating to a festival or feast

name: destitute
trans: without the basic necessities of life

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute .
sentences.chinese: 这场洪水使许多人变得一无所有。

detailed_translations.english: having no money, no food, no home etc

name: endue
trans: to invest or endow with some gift, quality, or faculty

sentences.english: He prayed to God night and day endue him with the spirit of holiness.
sentences.chinese: 他日夜祈求上帝赋予他虔敬的心。

sentences.english: The value of life is up to the ultimate mission you endue with yourself .
sentences.chinese: 生命的价值取决于你赋予自己的终极使命。

sentences.english: The society endues us the mission , and the clients endue us the responsibility !
sentences.chinese: 社会赋予我们使命，客户赋予我们责任！

detailed_translations.english: to invest or provide, as with some quality or trait

name: fathom
trans: to penetrate to the truth of, comprehend, understand

sentences.english: I still can’t fathom out what she meant.
sentences.chinese: 我还是弄不清她的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 看穿；彻底了解；测量…的深度
detailed_translations.english: to understand what something means after thinking about it carefully

detailed_translations.chinese: 英寻（测量水深的长度单位）
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the depth of water, equal to six feet or about 1.8 metres

name: actuarial
trans: of or pertaining to actuaries

name: furrier
trans: comparative form of furry, more furry

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes or sells fur clothing

name: harbinger
trans: a person who makes known the approach of another, herald

sentences.english: The November air stung my cheeks, a harbinger of winter.
sentences.chinese: 11月的空气刺痛了我的脸颊，这是冬天要来的先兆。

detailed_translations.english: a sign that something is going to happen soon

name: fission
trans: the act of cleaving or splitting into parts

sentences.english: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentences.chinese: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制。

sentences.english: Essentially, all the neutrons and part of the gamma rays are emitted in the actual fission process .
sentences.chinese: 从根本上说，所有的中子和一部分射线都是在裂变实际的过程中放射出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion

name: congenial
trans: having the same or very similar nature or personality

sentences.english: Compost provides congenial conditions for roots to develop.
sentences.chinese: 堆肥为根部的生长提供了适宜的条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意气相投的；性格相似的；适意的；一致的
detailed_translations.english: suitable for something

name: discursive
trans: digressing from subject to subject

sentences.english: a long, discursive article
sentences.chinese: 一篇冗长且不着边际的文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 散漫的， 不得要领的
detailed_translations.english: discussing many different ideas, facts etc, without always having a clear purpose

name: abhor
trans: to loath

sentences.english: I abhor discrimination of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 我厌恶任何一种歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: bawdy
trans: soiled, dirty

sentences.english: Bold lipstick and bawdy dancing are the trademarks of Nida Chaudhry, who performs to packed houses at Lahore's Al Falah theater.
sentences.chinese: 大胆的口红和下流的舞蹈是奈达·乔杜里的招牌特征。 她在拉合尔阿尔法拉剧院的演出场场爆满。

name: coterie
trans: a circle of people who associate with one another

sentences.english: We three formed a little literary coterie.
sentences.chinese: 我们三人组成一个小文学团体。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people who enjoy doing the same things together, and do not like including others

name: aboriginal
trans: original or indigenous to a place

sentences.english: ...Aboriginal art.
sentences.chinese: …土著艺术。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Australian aborigines
an aborigine

name: albeit
trans: although, even if

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: alderman
trans: a member of several municipal legislative bodies

detailed_translations.chinese: 市议员；总督；市府参事；高级市政官
detailed_translations.english: an elected member of a town or city council in the US

name: erode
trans: to wear away by abrasion, corrosion or chemical reaction

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: colloquy
trans: a conversation or dialogue

sentences.english: Powell did not know why it was he had resolved to keep his own counsel as to his colloquy with Mr Smith.
sentences.chinese: 鲍威尔不知道为什么决定要把他跟史密斯先生的谈话保守秘密。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation

name: abject
trans: to cast off or down, to abase

sentences.english: an abject apology
sentences.chinese: 低声下气的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

name: falter
trans: to waver or be unsteady

sentences.english: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
sentences.chinese: 劳丽想谢谢他，却说得结结巴巴的。

sentences.english: ‘I can’t,’ she faltered.
sentences.chinese: “我做不到。”她支支吾吾地说道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping

name: dulcet
trans: sweet and soothing

sentences.english: Basil’s dulcet tones could be heard in the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 巴兹尔那 “悦耳” 的嗓音在走廊里都听得见。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s voice – used humorously

name: eradicate
trans: to remove or destroy utterly

sentences.english: an attempt to eradicate inflation
sentences.chinese: 为消除通货膨胀所作的努力

sentences.english: This problem has now been completely eradicated.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题现已彻底杜绝。

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

name: arid
trans: extremely dry

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: forecourt
trans: courtyard before the entrance to a building

sentences.english: The graveled forecourt in front of the manor was crowded with cars, and they weren't nun cars.
sentences.chinese: 庄园前院挤满了高档轿车，而且它们肯定不可能时修女们能负担地的起的。

sentences.english: Obama took several questions from young Indian men and women, who filled the forecourt of the Catholic college that was founded by German Jesuits in 1869.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马回答了印度男女青年提出的问题，他们挤满了这所由德国耶稣会创立于1869年的天主教大学的前院。

sentences.english: The landscape developed by Kew Gardens forms part of the Australia season on the museum's forecourt, and includes rare and unique plants from across the country.
sentences.chinese: 这一由邱园设计的景观构成了博物馆前院澳大利亚季节景致的一部分，其中包括了澳大利亚全境稀有独特的植物。

detailed_translations.english: a large open area in front of a building such as a garage or hotel

name: burgeon
trans: begin to grow or increase rapidly

sentences.english: When spring is coming all trees begin to burgeon .
sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.english: The brain-drain effect of studying abroad has started to burgeon due to flaws in the domestic academic environment.
sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.english: The seed of friendship and cooperation we sow today will burgeon and harvest in the future and China-US partnership of cooperation will definitely enjoy a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天播下的友好合作种子一定能够生根发芽、开花结果，中美合作伙伴关系一定能够迎来更加美好的明天。

name: florid
trans: having a rosy or pale red colour, ruddy

sentences.english: Jacobs was a stout, florid man.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布斯是个身材结实，脸色红润的男人。

name: circumnavigate
trans: to travel completely around somewhere or something

sentences.english: For this year at least, our race to circumnavigate the globe in less than 80 days is over.
sentences.chinese: 至少在今年，我们在八十天内完成环球航行结束了。

detailed_translations.english: to sail, fly, or travel completely around the Earth, an island etc

name: faction
trans: a group or clique within a larger group

sentences.english: struggles between the different factions within the party
sentences.chinese: 党内的派系斗争

sentences.english: the leaders of the warring factions
sentences.chinese: 交战各派的领导人

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

name: debunk
trans: to discredit, or expose the exaggerated claims of something

sentences.english: Historian Michael Beschloss debunks a few myths.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家迈克尔·贝斯切罗斯揭露了一些神话的真相。

detailed_translations.english: If you debunk a widely held belief, you show that it is false. If you debunk something that is widely admired, you show that it is not as good as people think it is.

name: forswear
trans: to renounce or deny something, especially under oath

sentences.english: The party was offered a share of government if it forswore violence.
sentences.chinese: 若发誓停用暴力，这个政党即可得到部分行政权。

detailed_translations.english: If you forswear something, you promise that you will stop doing it, having it, or using it

name: conversant
trans: closely familiar, current, having frequent interaction

sentences.english: Those in business are not, on the whole, conversant with basic scientific principles.
sentences.chinese: 总体来说，经商的人不熟悉基本的科学原理。

detailed_translations.english: having knowledge or experience of something

name: guinea
trans: a coastal region in w africa

detailed_translations.english: a British gold coin or unit of money used in the past, worth one pound and one  shilling  (£1.05). Prices are sometimes still given in guineas when buying or selling  racehorses .

name: decathlon
trans: an athletic event consisting of 10 prescribed events

name: facsimile
trans: to send via a facsimile machine, normally spoken as “fax”

sentences.english: ...a facsimile edition of Beethoven's musical manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: ...一份贝多芬音乐手稿的摹本版。

detailed_translations.english: a  fax

name: gnash
trans: to grind one's teeth in pain or in anger

sentences.english: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.chinese: 我宁可看他咬牙也不愿看这样的笑。

sentences.english: The wicked plot against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them;
sentences.chinese: 恶人设谋害义人，又向他咬牙。

sentences.english: It makes me gnash my teeth to see so much food deliberately destroyed or wasted when there are people starving in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 当非洲人民在 挨饿时，我看到这么多故意毁坏和浪费的食物，真 使我气得咬牙切齿。

detailed_translations.english: to be very angry or unhappy about something, or to move your teeth against each other so that they make a noise, especially because you are unhappy or angry

name: asseverate
trans: to declare earnestly, seriously, or positively, to affirm

name: aboveboard
trans: in open sight, without concealment, or deception

sentences.english: But while there are certainly aboveboard agents and applications, other recruiters engage in fraudulent behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但有一些光明正大的代理机构和申请的同时，另一些招生者从事欺诈行为。

sentences.english: It guarantees a fair and aboveboard election by letting every voter express his or her will freely without subject to coercion, surveillance or threat by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 它通过让每位选民自由表达自己的选举意志，并且没有任何人可以对选民进行胁迫、监视以及威胁，来保证选举是公平、光明正大的。

sentences.english: You can rebuild trust, but only if your husband behaves in a manner that is completely aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 只要你的丈夫的行为方式完全光明正大，你们完全可以重新建立信任。

sentences.english: His business dealings were aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 他的商业交易是光明正大的。

sentences.english: If there was one thing she prided herself on, it was being open and aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 如果她对自己有一事而自豪，那就是她的公开及光明正大。

detailed_translations.english: An arrangement or deal that is aboveboard is legal and is being carried out openly and honestly. A person who is aboveboard is open and honest about what they are doing.

name: foursome
trans: a group of four, a quartet or a game played by four players

name: canvas
trans: to cover an area or object

sentences.english: a canvas bag
sentences.chinese: 帆布包

detailed_translations.english: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

name: burgher
trans: a citizen, especially one belonging to middle class

sentences.english: Even take the word burgher or bourgeois.
sentences.chinese: 比如说"市民"或称之为"布尔乔亚"

sentences.english: The market square, flanked by the colourful gables of burgher houses, is probably the definitive site of the area.
sentences.chinese: 集市广场的两侧是色彩鲜艳的尖顶民居，这里应该是老城区的中心地带了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 市民（现主要指某些欧洲国家中产阶级的市民或镇民）；公民
detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town

name: deteriorate
trans: to make worse, to make inferior in quality or value

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: colleague
trans: a person with whom one works with

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: clergy
trans: body of persons who are ordained for religious service

sentences.english: Thus, his preaching was directed at not only the laity, but the clergy as well.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他的讲道面向的不只是世俗之人，也面向神职人员。

sentences.english: At most colleges, you can get counseling from members of the clergy. Some campuses have representatives from many different religions.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数的高校，你能够得到神职人员的劝导。有些学校有很多来自不同宗教的代表。

detailed_translations.english: the official leaders of religious activities in organized religions, such as priests,  rabbi s  , and  mullah s

name: disband
trans: cause (an organized group) to break up

sentences.english: All the armed groups will be disbanded.
sentences.chinese: 所有武装团体将被解散。

detailed_translations.english: to stop existing as an organization, or to make something do this

name: crusade
trans: to make a grand concerted effort toward some cause

sentences.english: Dante: I took up the crusade. The bishop assured us that our sins would be absolved.
sentences.chinese: 但丁： 我参与了十字军东征。主教向我们保证我们的罪会被赦免。

sentences.english: Hard to believe that a life of glamour and wealth would be able to rob Xuande of his noble ambitions and crusade to give peace and prosperity to the common people.
sentences.chinese: 很难相信一个生命充满魅力和财富的玄德会用抢和类似十字军东征的方式实现他高尚的抱负并给普通百姓带来安定与和平。

detailed_translations.chinese: 十字军东征， 宗教战争
detailed_translations.english: one of a series of wars fought in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries by Christian armies trying to take Palestine from the Muslims

name: bleak
trans: bare, desolate

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: diagnosis
trans: the identification of the nature and cause of an illness

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: fervid
trans: heated or vehement in spirit, enthusiasm, etc

sentences.english: It assailed her with all the violence of her fervid imagination.
sentences.chinese: 它以那种她热情想象的全部猛力袭击着她。

sentences.english: Has a girl of fourteen a heart large enough, vigorous enough, to hold the swelling spring of pure, full, fervid eloquence?
sentences.chinese: 一个十四岁的女孩有这样活跃、这样宽大的胸怀，装得下这纯洁、充盈、炽热的雄辩之泉么？

detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something too strongly

name: borough
trans: a fortified town, a town or city

sentences.english: the borough of Queens in New York City
sentences.chinese: 纽约市昆斯区

sentences.english: Lambeth Borough Council
sentences.chinese: 兰贝斯自治市议会

detailed_translations.english: a town, or part of a large city, that is responsible for managing its own schools, hospitals, roads etc

name: dissolute
trans: lax in morals, licentious

sentences.english: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.chinese: 桀是个极端残暴，放荡的人。

sentences.english: Nellie was married twice, the first time to a dissolute diplomat whose death left her a wealthy woman.
sentences.chinese: 妮利结过两次婚，第一次嫁给了一个风流的外交官，外交官死后给他留下了大笔财富，使她成为一个有钱的女人。

sentences.english: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.chinese: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁，但这也许只是恶意的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: having an immoral way of life, for example drinking too much alcohol or having sex with many people

name: conduce
trans: to contribute or lead to a specific result

detailed_translations.chinese: 有益于， 有助于； 导致
detailed_translations.english: to lead or contribute (to a result)

name: cumulative
trans: increasing in quantity or force by successive additions

sentences.english: Learning is a cumulative process.
sentences.chinese: 学习是个逐渐积累的过程。

detailed_translations.english: increasing gradually as more of something is added or happens

name: discord
trans: disagreement between people

sentences.english: marital discord
sentences.chinese: 婚姻不和

sentences.english: discord within NATO
sentences.chinese: 北约内部的纷争

detailed_translations.english: disagreement or arguing between people

name: comparable
trans: able to be compared

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: garish
trans: overly ostentatious, so colourful as to be in bad taste

sentences.english: Many of the rugs are too garish for my taste.
sentences.chinese: 许多地毯色彩太花哨，不合我的口味。

sentences.english: garish colors
sentences.chinese: 过分花哨的颜色

detailed_translations.chinese: 俗丽的， 过于艳丽的
detailed_translations.english: very brightly coloured in a way that is unpleasant to look at

name: arrogate
trans: assume, take or claim (something) without justification

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒称；霸占；没来由地将…归属于
detailed_translations.english: to claim that you have a particular right, position etc, without having the legal right to it

name: abundant
trans: fully sufficient, in great quantity

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: extremist
trans: holding extreme views, especially on a political subject

sentences.english: The bomb was planted by right-wing extremists.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹是右翼极端分子放置的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political opinions and aims, and who is willing to do unusual or illegal things in order to achieve them

name: corpulence
trans: the state or characteristic of being large, plump

name: constrain
trans: to force physically, to compel

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: detract
trans: to take away, to withdraw or remove

sentences.english: They feared that the publicity surrounding him would detract from their own election campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心围绕他的宣传会有损他们自已的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing detracts from another, it makes it seem less good or impressive

name: despondent
trans: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage

sentences.english: Gill had been out of work for a year and was getting very despondent.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔失业一年了，开始变得非常消沉。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy and without hope

name: beset
trans: to surround or hem in

sentences.english: the injuries which have beset the team all season
sentences.chinese: 困扰球队整个赛季的伤病问题

detailed_translations.english: to make someone experience serious problems or dangers

name: drivel
trans: childish, silly or meaningless talk

sentences.english: The question is whether one should work for a company that spouts cretinous drivel.
sentences.chinese: 问题的实质是，一个人是否应该为一家滔滔不绝说废话的公司工作。

sentences.english: Why do they want to stir North Korea upmore with their lefty drivel , these people have enough problems .
sentences.chinese: 为什么要用他们左翼的胡言乱语来搅动朝鲜呢，朝鲜已经面临足够多问题了。

sentences.english: What absolute drivel!
sentences.chinese: 一派胡言！

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something that is written or said as drivel, you are critical of it because you think it is very silly

name: grovel
trans: to humble oneself or act in an abject manner

sentences.english: I saw him grovelling in the road for his hat.
sentences.chinese: 我看到他趴在路上找帽子。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone a lot or behave with a lot of respect towards them because you think that they are important and will be able to help you in some way – used to show disapproval

name: facility
trans: ease in learning or in doing something, proficiency

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: effluvium
trans: a gaseous or vaporous emission, especially a foul odour

name: facade
trans: the face of a building, especially the front

sentences.english: an impressive building with a red brick facade
sentences.chinese: 正面为红砖的雄伟建筑

detailed_translations.english: the front of a building, especially a large and important one

name: elucidate
trans: to make clear, to clarify, to shed light upon

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: agitate
trans: to move with a violent, irregular action

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

name: accouterments
trans: dress, trappings, equipment

name: eugenic
