trans: of bringing about improvement in produced offspring

sentences.english: Force In order to eugenic and superior nurture, schumann formulated a series of family planning, hope the best with integrity.
sentences.chinese: 为了优生优育，舒曼制定了一系列的最佳生育计划，希望正直配合。

sentences.english: To regard reducing the achromatopsia and counting the proportion as the goal, it designs two kinds of eugenic schemes, and finds out its eugenic law.
sentences.chinese: 根据遗传规律得到遗传平衡方程，以减少色盲数比例为目标，设计出两种优生方案，并找出其优生规律。

name: euphony
trans: a pleasing pronunciation of letters and syllables

name: facile
trans: moving, acting, working, proceeding, etc , with ease

sentences.english: facile generalizations
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的概括

detailed_translations.english: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding

name: demeanor
trans: a person's conduct or behaviour

sentences.english: If you know your cat well you will be able to tell the difference in his demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你足够了解你的猫咪，那你应该能够分辨它行为上的不同。

sentences.english: She is acutely aware of the discrepancy between her inner state and her public demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 她很敏锐地意识到自己内心状态和公众行为之间的不同。

sentences.english: Your walk and posture and general physical demeanor before you talk to any potential one night stands is just as important, if not moreso.
sentences.chinese: 在你寻找任何潜在的一夜情之前，你走路的姿势和行为举止都非常重要，不然的话就需要更多的信心。

name: beatitude
trans: supreme, utmost bliss and happiness

sentences.english: This beatitude is as vast as the Bible itself.
sentences.chinese: 这个祝福，如同圣经本身一样广阔。

sentences.english: This beatitude encompasses the whole message of the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 这个祝福，盖括了整本圣经的信息。

sentences.english: I think that if I were allowed to add one small beatitude as a footnote to the other it might be: Blessed are the courteous .
sentences.chinese: 我想如果允许我在《圣经》中用脚注加上一小句祝福的话，那么这句话就是：“礼貌者有福。”

detailed_translations.english: supreme blessedness or happiness

name: dastard
trans: meanly shrinking from danger, cowardly

name: disenfranchise
trans: to deprive someone of a right of citizenship

sentences.english: ...fears of an organized attempt to disenfranchise supporters of Father Aristide.
sentences.chinese: …对剥夺阿里斯蒂德神父支持者选举权的一次有组织企图的担心。

detailed_translations.english: to take away someone’s rights, especially their right to vote

name: dauntless
trans: invulnerable to fear or intimidation

sentences.english: dauntless optimism
sentences.chinese: 无所畏惧的乐观

detailed_translations.chinese: 无畏的；勇敢的；不屈不挠的
detailed_translations.english: confident and not easily frightened

name: corruption
trans: the act of corrupting or of impairing integrity

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

name: bereave
trans: to deprive by or as if by violence, rob, strip

sentences.english: Sin can never quite bereave a saint of his jewel his grace; but it may steal away the key of the cabinet his assurance.
sentences.chinese: 罪恶全然无法夺去圣徒的珠宝，就是他所得到恩典；但是罪恶可以偷走珠宝柜的钥匙，那就是确据。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive (of) something or someone valued, esp through death

name: evanescence
trans: to disappear gradually, vanish, fade away

name: calorific
trans: pertaining to conversion into heat

name: bursar
trans: the treasurer of a university, college or school

detailed_translations.chinese: 财务主管；会计员；领取奖学金的学生
detailed_translations.english: someone at a school or college who deals with the accounts and office work

name: gritty
trans: containing sand or grit, full of hard particles

sentences.english: Henin gave a typically gritty performance, coming back from 4-0 down.
sentences.chinese: 海宁表现出一贯的坚毅，把零比四落后的比分扳回。

sentences.english: her gritty determination
sentences.chinese: 她那坚定的决心

detailed_translations.english: showing determination and courage

name: factious
trans: of, pertaining to, or caused by factions

detailed_translations.chinese: 好捣乱的；好搞派系的；源于派别的
detailed_translations.english: given to, producing, or characterized by faction

name: disyllable
trans: a word comprising two syllables

name: benediction
trans: the utterance or bestowing of a blessing

sentences.english: The minister pronounced the benediction.
sentences.chinese: 牧师做了赐福祈祷。

detailed_translations.chinese: 祝福；赐福；恩赐；祈求上帝赐福的仪式
detailed_translations.english: a Christian prayer that asks God to protect and help someone

name: bereft
trans: deprived

sentences.english: The place seemed to be utterly bereft of human life.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，这地方人迹罕至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丧失的；被剥夺的；失去亲人的
detailed_translations.english: If a person or thing is bereft of something, they no longer have it

name: degrade
trans: to lower in value or social position

sentences.english: a movie that degrades women
sentences.chinese: 贬损女性的影片

sentences.english: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

name: authoritarian
trans: of, or relating to, absolute obedience to an authority

sentences.english: an authoritarian government
sentences.chinese: 独裁政府

sentences.english: Critics claim his management has become too authoritarian.
sentences.chinese: 批评者称他的管理变得过于专制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独裁主义的；权力主义的
detailed_translations.english: strictly forcing people to obey a set of rules or laws, especially ones that are wrong or unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 权力主义者；独裁主义者

name: analogy
trans: similarity between like features of two things

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: campaign
trans: work in an organized and active way toward a particular goal

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: beau
trans: a frequent or attentive male companion

sentences.english: Questions vary wildly from the political and the literary to the intimately personal — the magazine features one annoyed girlfriend asking her beau when he’s finally going to marry her.
sentences.chinese: 问题多样而狂野，从政治、文学到个人私密——杂志专载了一位晕火的女孩，她问她的情郎什么时候敲定娶她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花花公子；喜修饰者；情郎
detailed_translations.english: a fashionable well-dressed man

name: corporeal
trans: tangible, material

sentences.english: corporeal desires
sentences.chinese: 肉欲

detailed_translations.chinese: 肉体的， 身体的； 物质的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the body, rather than to the mind, feelings, or spirit

name: fanatic
trans: a person with an extreme enthusiasm or zeal, as in religion

sentences.english: fanatics who represent a real danger to democracy
sentences.chinese: 对民主构成很大威胁的狂热分子

sentences.english: a religious fanatic
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热入迷者；盲信者；盲信
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous
Fanatic means the same as

name: epitaph
trans: an inscription on a gravestone in memory of the deceased

sentences.english: His epitaph for himself would have well suited man as he wanted him to be.
sentences.chinese: 他为自己写的墓志铭非常适合像他所期望成为的那种人。

sentences.english: No shockwave swept through the Arab world as news of Bin Laden's death spread, and that is perhaps the most fitting epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 拉登死讯的传播并未形成席卷阿拉伯世界的冲击波，也许这个作为墓志铭是再合适不过的了。

sentences.english: I would say that all of those ways of reading the epitaph are consistent with hermeneutics.
sentences.chinese: 可以说所有这些解读这条墓志铭的方法,都和现代阐释学相一致。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing on the stone over someone’s grave(= place in the ground where someone is buried )

name: emporium
trans: a market place or trading centre, particularly in antiquity

name: decorum
trans: appropriate social behavior, propriety

sentences.english: I was treated with decorum and respect throughout the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 整个调查当中我受到了礼遇和尊重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼仪；礼貌；端正；恪守礼仪
detailed_translations.english: Decorum is behaviour that people consider to be correct, polite, and respectable

name: defensive
trans: used or intended to defend or protect

sentences.english: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.
sentences.chinese: 亲王将部队布成坚固的防御阵势。

sentences.english: The rockets are a purely defensive measure against nuclear attack.
sentences.chinese: 火箭弹纯粹是针对核攻击的防御性措施。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack

name: exude
trans: to discharge through pores, to emit, to give out

sentences.english: The plant exudes a sticky liquid.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物会分泌一种黏液。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out slowly and steadily, or to make something do this

name: degeneracy
trans: the state of being physically or morally deteriorated

name: chimera
trans: any creature with parts from different animals

sentences.english: Religious unity remained as much a chimera as ever.
sentences.chinese: 宗教统一仍旧是一通幻想。

detailed_translations.english: A chimera is an unrealistic idea that you have about something or a hope that you have that is unlikely to be fulfilled

name: effusive
trans: expressing feelings in an unrestrained or heartfelt manner

sentences.english: Our host gave us an effusive welcome.
sentences.chinese: 主人热情地欢迎我们。

detailed_translations.english: showing your good feelings in a very excited way

name: discredit
trans: to harm the good reputation of a person, to defame

sentences.english: However, I believe in questionings, doubtings, searchings, skepticism, and I discredit credulity or blind faith.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我也相信询问、质疑、探索与怀疑，但拒绝轻信或盲从的信仰。

sentences.english: Lily: : But the interviewers don't think so, they discredit the unmarried women above the normal age have mentality defects, although they are turly bright people.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试官却认为年龄这么大了还没结婚也没男朋友，怀疑她们有心理缺陷，尽管她们确实是人才。 。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect or trust

name: census
trans: survey

sentences.english: He and Mary journeyed to Bethlehem to be counted in the Roman census, and while they were there the child was born.
sentences.chinese: 他和玛利亚一起去到伯利恒，罗马的人口普查把他们统计在内。 他们在那里时，孩子降生了。

detailed_translations.english: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

name: aroma
trans: smell (usually in relation to food)

sentences.english: the aroma of fresh coffee
sentences.chinese: 新煮咖啡的香味

detailed_translations.english: a strong pleasant smell

name: errant
trans: straying from the proper course or standard

sentences.english: Usually his cases involved errant husbands and wandering wives.
sentences.chinese: 通常他接手的案子都涉及出轨的丈夫和离家出走的妻子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不定的；周游的；错误的；偏离正路的
detailed_translations.english: Errant is used to describe someone whose actions are considered unacceptable or wrong by other people. For example, an errant husband is unfaithful to his wife.

name: cogent
trans: to the point, relevant

sentences.english: Every decision has to be backed up with rational and cogent arguments.
sentences.chinese: 每项决定都应该有合理和令人信服的论据做支持。

detailed_translations.english: if a statement is cogent, it seems reasonable and correct

name: disposition
trans: to remove or place in a different position

sentences.english: The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性格；排列,部署；倾向,意向
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

name: contort
trans: to twist in a violent manner

sentences.english: His face contorts as he screams out the lyrics.
sentences.chinese: 当他大声朗读这些抒情诗时，脸都变形了。

detailed_translations.english: if you contort something, or if it contorts, it twists out of its normal shape and looks strange or unattractive

name: betimes
trans: before the usual or expected time

sentences.english: The train arrived betimes.
sentences.chinese: 火车及时到达了。

detailed_translations.english: in good time; early

name: gauge
trans: to measure or determine capacity, character, or ability

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: aesthetic
trans: having a sense of beauty

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: flexibility
trans: the quality of being flexible, suppleness, pliability

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: existence
trans: the state of being, existing, or occurring, beinghood

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: disabuse
trans: to persuade someone that an idea or belief is mistaken

sentences.english: Their view of country people was that they like to please strangers. I did not disabuse them of this notion.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为乡下人爱讨好外地人。我没有纠正他们的这种想法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打消错误念头， 使醒悟
detailed_translations.english: If you disabuse someone of something, you tell them or persuade them that what they believe is in fact untrue

name: chicanery
trans: deception by use of trickery, quibbling, or subterfuge

sentences.english: Clearly there is some chicanery going on.
sentences.chinese: 这里面显然有诈。

detailed_translations.english: the use of clever plans or actions to deceive people

name: definite
trans: having distinct limits

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

name: effervesce
trans: to emit small bubbles of dissolved gas, to froth or fizz

name: enamor
trans: to attract, to capture

detailed_translations.english: to inspire with love; captivate; charm

name: dispatch
trans: to send a shipment with promptness

sentences.english: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 货物一般在24小时内派送。

sentences.english: I was carrying dispatches from the ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 我正拿着大使的急件。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose
a message or report sent quickly from one military officer to another or between government officials

name: enkindle
trans: to kindle, to arouse or evoke

name: comprise
trans: to consist of, being made up of

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: furlong
trans: a unit of distance, equal to 220 yards or 0.2 km

name: egregious
trans: outstandingly bad, shocking

sentences.english: ...the most egregious abuses of human rights.
sentences.chinese: ...最恶劣的人权侵犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的；过分的；恶名昭彰的

name: disunion
trans: separation of a union

name: circumspect
trans: wary and unwilling to take risks

sentences.english: The banks should have been more circumspect in their dealings.
sentences.chinese: 银行在交易时应更加谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: If you are circumspect, you are cautious in what you do and say and do not take risks

name: behemoth
trans: a huge or monstrous creature

name: allegory
trans: a symbolic narrative

sentences.english: The poem's comic allegory was transparent.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗歌的喜剧性讽寓很明显。

detailed_translations.english: a story, painting etc in which the events and characters represent ideas or teach a moral lesson

name: fundamental
trans: pertaining to the foundation or basis

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: cumbersome
trans: burdensome or hindering, as a weight or drag

sentences.english: Doctors are complaining that the system is cumbersome and bureaucratic.
sentences.chinese: 医生抱怨说该体制复杂繁琐，很官僚。

sentences.english: cumbersome procedures
sentences.chinese: 繁琐的程序

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: a process or system that is cumbersome is slow and difficult

name: bureau
trans: office

sentences.english: an employment bureau
sentences.chinese: 职业介绍所

sentences.english: the Citizens Advice Bureau
sentences.chinese: 公民咨询局

detailed_translations.english: an office or organization that collects or provides information

name: guffaw
trans: to laugh boisterously

sentences.english: We guffawed at what Graham had written.
sentences.chinese: 我们对格雷厄姆写的东西狂笑不已。

sentences.english: He bursts into a loud guffaw.
sentences.chinese: 他突然大笑起来。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh loudly
A guffaw is a very loud laugh

name: foreshore
trans: the ground between the water's edge and cultivated land

sentences.english: Heritage falls apart on the harbor's shore, iron rusts and there is no foreshore access.
sentences.chinese: 港口海岸上的遗迹已经分崩离析，钢铁生锈； 没有可以进入的海滩。

sentences.english: Heritage falls apart on the harbor's shore, iron rusts and there is no foreshore access. Two huge cement factories that dominate the view around the bay pollute the water.
sentences.chinese: 港口岸边到处是破碎的遗迹，所有的铁都生锈了，也不可能到海滩上去——岸边的两座水泥工厂污染了整个水域。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the shore between the highest and lowest levels that the sea reaches

name: fraudulent
trans: dishonest, based on fraud or deception

sentences.english: a fraudulent insurance claim
sentences.chinese: 欺诈性保险索赔

sentences.english: a fraudulent statement
sentences.chinese: 骗人的声明

detailed_translations.english: intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc

name: fabricate
trans: to form into a whole by uniting its parts, to construct

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: counting-house
trans: the facility in which a business carries out its operations

name: bona fide
trans: genuine, real

sentences.english: Only bona fide members are allowed to use the club pool.
sentences.chinese: 只有真正的会员才允许使用俱乐部的泳池。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可信的； 真诚的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: real, true, and not intended to deceive anyone

name: diva
trans: any female celebrity, usually a well known singer or actress

sentences.english: opera diva Jessye Norman
sentences.chinese: 著名歌剧女歌唱家杰茜·诺曼

detailed_translations.english: You can refer to a successful and famous female opera singer as a diva

name: censor
trans: to review in order to remove objectionable content

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

name: confederacy
trans: an alliance

sentences.english: They've entered this new confederacy because the central government's been unable to control the collapsing economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经参加了这个新同盟，因为中央政府已经不能控制摇摇欲坠的经济了。

detailed_translations.english: a confederation

name: evocation
trans: an act or instance of evoking,  a calling forth

name: divert
trans: to turn aside from a course

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: excavate
trans: to make a hole in (something), to hollow

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: ambush
trans: to act of lying in concealment as to attack by surprise

sentences.english: The soldiers were killed in an ambush.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵遭伏击身亡。

sentences.english: In winter the danger of ambush is much reduced.
sentences.chinese: 冬天，遭伏击的危险大大减少。

sentences.english: The Guatemalan army says rebels ambushed and killed 10 patrolmen.
sentences.chinese: 危地马拉军方称叛军伏击并杀死了10名巡逻兵。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden attack on someone by people who have been hiding and waiting for them, or the place where this happens
If a group of people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them

name: auroral
trans: pertaining to the dawn

name: comparison
trans: the act of comparing, to liken

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

name: exculpate
trans: to clear from a charge of guilt or fault,vindicate

sentences.english: These causes, however, never served to exculpate "ordinary Germans" who shared in the guilt either for participating in or not resisting Nazi rule in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 但这些原因，都不足以证明所谓“德国平民”是无罪的，因为他们有些也参与了这场罪行，至少并没有反抗纳粹在德国的统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开脱； 申明无罪， 证明无罪
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone is not guilty of something

name: flammable
trans: capable of burning, especially a liquid

sentences.english: Caution! Highly flammable liquid.
sentences.chinese: 小心！高度易燃液体。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易燃的；可燃的；可燃性的
detailed_translations.english: something that is flammable burns easily

name: bountiful
trans: having a quantity or amount that is generous or plentiful

sentences.english: bountiful harvests
sentences.chinese: 大丰收

detailed_translations.english: if something is bountiful, there is more than enough of it

name: demobilize
trans: to release someone from military duty

sentences.english: programmes to help demobilized soldiers fit into civilian life
sentences.chinese: 帮助复员军人适应平民生活的方案

detailed_translations.chinese: 使复员, 使退伍, 遣散
detailed_translations.english: to send home the members of an army, navy etc, especially at the end of a war

name: emote
trans: to display emotions openly, especially while acting

sentences.english: Siskind encourages the children to emote to the music as they dance.
sentences.chinese: 西斯金德鼓励孩子们跳舞时要根据音乐表现出情感。

detailed_translations.english: to clearly show emotion, especially when you are acting

name: discombobulate
trans: to disconcert or confuse (someone)

name: convivial
trans: of or relating to a feast or entertainment

sentences.english: a convivial atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 欢快友好的气氛

detailed_translations.chinese: 好交际的, 愉快而随和的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and pleasantly cheerful

name: artifice
trans: a crafty but underhanded deception

sentences.english: Weegee's photographs are full of artfulness, and artifice.
sentences.chinese: 维加的照片充满了奇技妙想。

detailed_translations.english: a trick used to deceive someone

name: bacterium
trans: a single celled organism with no nucleus

sentences.english: It was so large and complex, they initially assumed it was a bacterium.
sentences.chinese: 由于它们是如此庞大和复杂，最初被认为是一种细菌。

sentences.english: They also converted one species of bacterium into another through a “genome transplant”.
sentences.chinese: 他们还通过“基因移植”，把一个物种的细菌转变为另一种。

sentences.english: But it might be time to update that list. Because scientists have found a bacterium that can do without phosphorus—live on arsenic instead.
sentences.chinese: 但也许是时候更新这份必需元素目录了，因为科学家们发现一种细菌会用砷来代替磷，不需要磷也可生存。

name: anomalous
trans: deviating from what is standard, expected or normal

sentences.english: a highly anomalous situation
sentences.chinese: 极其反常的形势

sentences.english: anomalous results
sentences.chinese: 异常的结果

detailed_translations.english: different from what you expected to find

name: analogous
trans: corresponding to something else, bearing some resemblance

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: commemorate
trans: to honour the memory of someone or something with a ceremony

sentences.english: a parade to commemorate the town’s bicentenary
sentences.chinese: 庆祝该镇建立200周年的游行

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

name: enshrine
trans: to enclose (a sacred relic etc ) in a shrine or chest

sentences.english: This system is enshrined in our Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 我们的宪法使该制度神圣而不可侵犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭记，珍藏；把…置于神龛内；把…奉为神圣
detailed_translations.english: if something such as a tradition or right is enshrined in something, it is preserved and protected so that people will remember and respect it

name: enhance
trans: to raise to a higher degree, intensify, magnify

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: conformable
trans: corresponding in shape, similar

name: deference
trans: humble submission and respect

sentences.english: "Manners used to be enforced through fear and deference to the Maker, the monarch, and the men, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他继续说：“礼仪规范过去通过对上帝，君主和男子的畏惧和顺从得以实现。

sentences.english: The second virtue they develop is deference, the willingness to listen and learn from the moral and intellectual storehouses of the people you are trying to elp.
sentences.chinese: 他们发展的第二个美德是顺从敬意，乐意听从其他他们试图帮助的品行端正和智慧的人，并从他们知识宝库中学习。

sentences.english: In practice, each public school is an independent kingdom that pays nominal deference to education authorities.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每一所公办学校都是一个独立的王国，名义上顺从教育当局。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

name: athwart
trans: across, crosswise

name: devoid
trans: empty, having none of, completely without

sentences.english: We humans appear to be meaning-seeking creatures that have the misfortune to be thrown into a world devoid of intrinsic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类似乎是寻求意义的生物，而很不幸，我们却进入了一个本质上缺乏意义的世界。

sentences.english: Rice cakes may seem like a good option – after all they're fat-free and low in calories – but they're also devoid of fibre and protein and can make you crave something more satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 大米蛋糕似乎是好的选择-毕竟它们无脂肪，低卡路里-但是它们也缺乏纤维和蛋白质，会使你渴望更令人满意的东西。

name: avatar
trans: an incarnation or manifestation of a person or idea

name: bemoan
trans: to complain about, to dismay or worry about something

sentences.english: He was bemoaning the fact that lawyers charge so much.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨律师收费太高。

detailed_translations.english: to complain or say that you are disappointed about something

name: arsenal
trans: a collection or supply of weapons or munitions

sentences.english: The enemy bombers targeted our arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 敌机把我们的兵工厂作为轰炸目标。

detailed_translations.english: An arsenal is a building where weapons and military equipment are stored

name: bloated
trans: swollen, puffed up

sentences.english: a red bloated face
sentences.chinese: 一张红红的、浮肿的脸

sentences.english: I feel really bloated after that meal.
sentences.chinese: 吃完那顿饭后，我觉得肚子很鼓。

detailed_translations.english: full of liquid, gas, food etc, so that you look or feel much larger than normal

name: cession
trans: that which is ceded

sentences.english: Spanish cession of the territory in 1818
sentences.chinese: 1818年西班牙割让的领土

detailed_translations.chinese: （权利的）转让，出让；（领土的）割让
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving up land, property, or rights, especially to another country after a war, or something that is given up in this way

name: clothier
trans: a person who makes or sells cloth or clothing

name: efface
trans: to erase (a mark) from the surface

sentences.english: Nothing can efface the last picture I have of them from my mind.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能抹去他们在我脑海中留下的最后印象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or remove something

name: breach
trans: an act of breaking a law, agreement or code of conduct

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

name: blandish
trans: to persuade someone by using flattery, to cajole

name: alabaster
trans: a finely granular variety of gypsum

name: fastidiousness
trans: the quality of being fastidious

name: approbation
trans: approval

sentences.english: I anticipate nothing but grateful approbation .
sentences.chinese: 我预料大家只有感激赞许。

sentences.english: Julian Lloyd Webber thinks his brother would like the approbation of serious critics.
sentences.chinese: 朱利安·劳埃德·韦伯认为他弟弟希望获得严肃批评家的认可。

detailed_translations.english: official praise or approval

name: generosity
trans: the trait of being willing to donate money and/or time

sentences.english: an act of great generosity
sentences.chinese: 十分慷慨的行为

sentences.english: I shall never forget the generosity shownby the people of Bastaisk.
sentences.chinese: 我永远也不会忘记巴斯泰斯克人的慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: a generous attitude, or generous behaviour

name: corpulent
trans: large in body, fat, overweight

sentences.english: ...a rather corpulent farmer.
sentences.chinese: ...一位颇为肥胖的农人。

detailed_translations.english: fat

name: gibbering
trans: speaking inarticulately or meaninglessly

name: excellence
trans: the state of possessing good qualities in an eminent degree

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: brotherhood
trans: the state of being brothers or a brother

sentences.english: the spirit of brotherhood
sentences.chinese: 互爱精神

detailed_translations.chinese: 兄弟关系；手足情谊；四海之内皆兄弟的信念
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship between people

name: hail
trans: to cheer, salute, or greet, welcome

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: disinter
trans: to dig up (something buries)

sentences.english: The bones were disinterred and moved to a burial site.
sentences.chinese: 骨头被掘出并移到了一片墓地。

detailed_translations.english: to dig and remove a dead body from a  grave

name: antipodes
trans: any two places that are on opposite sides of the earth

sentences.english: The opposite side of the earth; the antipodes .
sentences.chinese: 对跖面，对跖点地球的对面；相对极。

detailed_translations.english: either or both of two points, places, or regions that are situated diametrically opposite to one another on the earth's surface, esp the country or region opposite one's own

name: bellicose
trans: demonstrating aggression and willingness to fight

sentences.english: bellicose criticism
sentences.chinese: 咄咄逼人的批评

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is likely to start an argument or fight

name: donator
trans: one who donates

sentences.english: Out of pressing need, the mother complies but the donator disappeared without forking up.
sentences.chinese: 迫于所需的母亲照办了，但是捐赠者却食言消失了。

name: anarchy
trans: a state of society without government or law

sentences.english: The prison is close to anarchy.
sentences.chinese: 那所监狱几乎一片混乱。

sentences.english: The classroom was in a constant state of anarchy .
sentences.chinese: 教室里永远是一片混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无政府状态；混乱；无秩序
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is no effective government in a country or no order in an organization or situation

name: bedaub
trans: to smear upon, to soil

name: diphthong
trans: a one-syllable sound made up of two vowels

sentences.english: The [ju:] diphthong. This combines the y, y, uh-y, Y consonant sound with the oo, closed oo.
sentences.chinese: 是一个复合元音，由辅音y, y, uh-y 连接oo构成，发woo时口型紧缩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 双元音；复合元音；元音连字
detailed_translations.english: a vowel sound made by pronouncing two vowels quickly one after the other. For example, the vowel sound in ‘main’ is a diphthong.

name: caprice
trans: a sudden and unaccountable change of mood or behavior

sentences.english: the caprices of a spoilt child
sentences.chinese: 一个被宠坏的孩子的任性行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇思怪想， 反复无常， 任性
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and unreasonable change of mind or behaviour

name: coalition
trans: a temporary group, usually formed for a particular advantage

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

name: exert
trans: to put in vigorous action

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: dither
trans: to be uncertain or unable to make a decision about something

sentences.english: Stop dithering, girl, and get on with it!
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫了，姑娘，快点！

detailed_translations.chinese: 发抖；递色；[电子] 高频脉动

detailed_translations.english: to keep being unable to make a final decision about something

name: chronicle
trans: a chronological record of important historical events

sentences.english: His life is chronicled in a new biography published last week.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平被写成一本新传记，于上周出版。

sentences.english: The book chronicles the events leading up to the war.
sentences.chinese: 该书记述了导致战争爆发的一系列事件。

detailed_translations.english: to describe events in the order in which they happened

name: dolt
trans: a stupid person

name: cacophony
trans: a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds

sentences.english: All around was a cacophony of voices.
sentences.chinese: 刺耳声响遍四周。

detailed_translations.english: a loud unpleasant mixture of sounds

name: acculturation
trans: adopting cultural elements of another culture

sentences.english: Culture conflict and culture syncretism are two of the most important stage of acculturation.
sentences.chinese: 文化冲突与文化融合是文化适应过程中两个最为重要的环节。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文化适应；文化移入；文化互渗（不同文化在频繁交流中的互相影响）

name: conjugation
trans: the inflection of verbs

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To prepare the collagenase immunizing conjugation product for injection.
sentences.chinese: 目的：制备注射用胶原蛋白酶免疫结合物。

name: editorial
trans: of, or relating to the preparing of material for publication

sentences.english: an editorial assistant
sentences.chinese: 编辑助理

detailed_translations.english: relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

name: enthrone
trans: to invest with sovereign or episcopal authority

sentences.english: Emperor Akihito of Japan has been enthroned in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 日皇明仁已在东京登基。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使登基；立…为王；任为主教；崇拜
detailed_translations.english: if a king or queen is enthroned, there is a ceremony to show that they are starting to rule

name: abominable
trans: very hateful, detestable

sentences.english: abominable cruelty
sentences.chinese: 令人发指的暴行

detailed_translations.chinese: 讨厌的；令人憎恶的；糟透的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant or of very bad quality

name: artisan
trans: a worker in a skilled trade

sentences.english: That allowed England to harness the creative potential of its artisan classes in a way that no other country had managed before.
sentences.chinese: 如此，使得英国得以在某种程度上利用本国工匠阶层创造性潜能产生巨大的能量，此为他国以前没有做到之事。

sentences.english: All of it appeared to be handmade, probably by a 17th century artisan.
sentences.chinese: 这里的一切似乎都是手工制作的，很可能出自一位17世纪工匠之手。

sentences.english: That would certainly not be true of the members of the artisan class or the military class for that reason.
sentences.chinese: 那对工匠阶级,与军人阶级,绝对不可能为真。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does skilled work, making things with their hands

name: divagation
trans: straying off from a course or way

name: buffet
trans: a blow, typically with the hand or fist

sentences.english: a cold buffet
sentences.chinese: 冷餐会

detailed_translations.chinese: 自助餐；小卖部；打击；猛烈冲击
detailed_translations.english: a meal at a party or other occasion, in which people serve themselves at a table and then move away to eat
if something, especially wind, rain, or the sea, buffets something, it hits it with a lot of force

name: aurora
trans: an atmospheric phenomenon creating bands of light in the sky

sentences.english: The light creates the aurora that we see.
sentences.chinese: 这些光亮造就了我们所看到的极光。

sentences.english: A vast dawn of ideas is the peculiarity of our century, and in that aurora England and Germany have a magnificent radiance.
sentences.chinese: 思想的广泛昌明是我们这一世纪的特征，在那曙光里，英国和德国都有它们辉煌的成就。

detailed_translations.english: an atmospheric phenomenon consisting of bands, curtains, or streamers of light, usually green, red, or yellow, that move across the sky in polar regions

name: defalcate
trans: to misappropriate funds, to embezzle

name: devout
trans: devoted to religion or to religious feelings and duties

sentences.english: a devout Catholic
sentences.chinese: 虔诚的天主徒

detailed_translations.english: someone who is devout has a very strong belief in a religion

name: abut
trans: to touch by means of a mutual border, to meet

sentences.english: The castles abut a natural forest.
sentences.chinese: 与城堡毗邻的是一片天然森林。

sentences.english: Today people think of it as a "frontier province", which lie just below the Tibetan plateau and abut Vietnam, Laos and Burma.
sentences.chinese: 今天，人们认为它是一个“边省”，这是在青藏高原及毗邻的越南、老挝和缅甸。

sentences.english: Frontier trade is not only the special form of the economic and trade among the abut countries' frontier regions, but also the important component part of the country's foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 边境贸易是毗邻国家边境地区之间经济、贸易活动的特殊形式，是国家对外经贸活动的重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: if one piece of land or a building abuts another, it is next to it or touches one side of it

name: handwriting
trans: writing done with a pen or pencil in the hand, script

sentences.english: I recognised her handwriting on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 我认出了信封上她的笔迹。

sentences.english: My handwriting has never been very neat.
sentences.chinese: 我的字从来都写得不够工整。

detailed_translations.english: the style of someone’s writing

name: dross
trans: something regarded as worthless, rubbish

name: gesture
trans: to make a gesture or gestures

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

name: grouse
trans: any gallinaceous birds of the subfamily tetraoninae

sentences.english: "How come we never know what's going on?" he groused.
sentences.chinese: “我们怎么会不知道发生了什么事？”他抱怨道。

detailed_translations.english: to complain about something
a small bird that is hunted and shot for food and sport, or the flesh of this bird

name: fray
trans: to unravel, used particularly for the edge of cloth

sentences.english: Three civilians were injured during the fray.
sentences.chinese: 三个平民在冲突中受伤。

sentences.english: The fabric is very fine or frays easily.
sentences.chinese: 这种布料很细，或者说是容易磨损。

sentences.english: The stitching had begun to fray at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 边缘处的针脚已经开始磨损了。

detailed_translations.english: an argument or fight

detailed_translations.chinese: 使磨损；变得令人紧张、急躁
detailed_translations.english: If something such as cloth or rope frays, or if something frays it, its threads or fibres start to come apart from each other and spoil its appearance

name: exasperate
trans: to irritate or provoke to a high degree, annoy extremely

sentences.english: It exasperates me to hear comments like that.
sentences.chinese: 听到那样的评论令我恼怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very annoyed by continuing to do something that upsets them

name: encumber
trans: to load down something with a burden

sentences.english: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
sentences.chinese: 他于1874年去世，负债累累。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen

name: allot
trans: to distribute by lot

sentences.english: The seats are allotted to the candidates who have won the most votes.
sentences.chinese: 这些席位被分配给了赢得了最多选票的候选人。

detailed_translations.english: to use a particular amount of time for something, or give a particular share of money, space etc to someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Allot)人名；(英)阿洛特；(西)阿略特；(法)阿洛

name: complaisant
trans: willing to please others, obliging

sentences.english: A Quaker preacher, traveling in the more complaisant colony of Maryland, came upon a party of young people who were dancing merrily together.
sentences.chinese: 一个贵格会的传道人，在更殷勤有礼的马里兰殖民地旅行时，遇到了一群年轻人在欢快的跳舞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 彬彬有礼的， 殷勤的； 柔顺的
detailed_translations.english: showing a desire to comply or oblige; polite

name: agrarian
trans: of, or relating to, the ownership and cultivation of land

sentences.english: This was a feature of agrarian development in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这是大不列颠土地发展的一个特征。

sentences.english: The patriarchal clan becomes the resistance revolution in the agrarian revolution the strength, therefore encounters suppresses and attacks.
sentences.chinese: 在土地革命中宗族成为对抗革命的力量，所以遭到抑制和打击。

detailed_translations.english: Agrarian means relating to the ownership and use of land, especially farmland, or relating to the part of a society or economy that is concerned with agriculture

name: crockery
trans: eating and serving tableware, usually made of ceramic

sentences.english: a stack of dirty crockery
sentences.chinese: 一大堆脏碗碟

detailed_translations.english: cups, dishes, plates etc

name: elated
trans: very happy or proud, jubilant, in high spirits

sentences.english: He felt elated and mildly drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他感到欢欣鼓舞，而且喝得有点醉了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴高采烈的；得意洋洋的
detailed_translations.english: extremely happy and excited, especially because of something that has happened or is going to happen

detailed_translations.chinese: 使兴奋（elate的过去式和过去分词）

name: acme
trans: the top or highest point, pinnacle, culmination

sentences.english: the acme of perfection
sentences.chinese: 尽善尽美

detailed_translations.english: the best and highest level of something

name: ardent
trans: intensely devoted, fervent, passionate

sentences.english: an ardent supporter of free trade
sentences.chinese: 自由贸易的热心支持者

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情的；热心的；激烈的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: showing strong positive feelings about an activity and determination to succeed at it

name: casualty
trans: something that happens by chance

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: crescendo
trans: a gradual increase in loudness

sentences.english: The shouting rose to a deafening crescendo .
sentences.chinese: 喊叫声越来越响，到了震耳欲聋的强度。

sentences.english: The curtains opened as the music reached a crescendo .
sentences.chinese: 当音乐到达高潮时，大幕拉开了。

detailed_translations.english: if a sound or a piece of music rises to a cre-scendo, it gradually becomes louder until it is very loud

name: dissimilar
trans: not similar, unlike, different

sentences.english: His methods were not dissimilar to those used by Freud.
sentences.chinese: 他用的方法和弗洛伊德用的没有什么不同。

detailed_translations.english: not the same

name: dynamic
trans: characterized by constant change, activity, or progress

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: equalize
trans: to make equal

sentences.english: We have tried to equalize the workload between the different teachers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求把工作量平均分配给各位老师。

detailed_translations.english: to make two or more things the same in size, value, amount etc

name: demure
trans: reserved, modest, and shy

sentences.english: Old photos of Maggie show her young and demure.
sentences.chinese: 老照片上的玛吉显得年轻而又端庄娴静。

detailed_translations.chinese: 端庄的；娴静的；严肃的；假装正直的
detailed_translations.english: quiet, serious, and well-behaved – used especially about women in the past

name: annul
trans: to formally revoke the validity of

sentences.english: Their marriage was annulled last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻关系去年宣告解除。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a marriage or legal agreement no longer exists

name: efflorescent
trans: bursting into flower

name: caitiff
trans: especially despicable, cowardly

detailed_translations.english: cowardly; base
a cowardly or base person

name: congruity
trans: the quality of agreeing, the quality of being suitable

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致性， 适合性； 共同点

name: circumvent
trans: to overcome a difficulty, typically in a clever way

sentences.english: The company opened an account abroad, in order to circumvent the tax laws.
sentences.chinese: 为规避税法，这家公司在国外开设了账户。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid a problem or rule that restricts you, especially in a clever or dishonest way – used to show disapproval

name: clan
trans: a group of people all descended from a common ancestor

sentences.english: the Campbell clan
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔家族

sentences.english: warring clans
sentences.chinese: 交战的各氏族

detailed_translations.english: a large group of families who often share the same name

name: contusion
trans: bruise

name: brash
trans: impetuous or rash

sentences.english: brash journalists
sentences.chinese: 嚣张的新闻记者

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的，傲慢的；仓促的，性急的
detailed_translations.english: behaving too confidently and speaking too loudly – used to show disapproval

name: foresee
trans: to anticipate, to predict

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: dolesome
trans: doleful, dismal, gloomy

name: barren
trans: empty, vacant

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

name: cherish
trans: to treat with tenderness and affection

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

name: arthurian
trans: of or relating to the legend of king arthur

name: apolitical
trans: having no interest or involvement in politics

name: belie
trans: to lie around, encompass

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

name: habitude
trans: the essential character of one's being or existence

sentences.english: From long time ago, Chinese and Russia has become a kind of unique culture in tea history, tea habitude, tea sets and poems for tea.
sentences.chinese: 千百年来，中华民族和俄罗斯民族在饮茶的历史、饮茶习俗、茶具等方面，都形成了独具特色的茶文化。

sentences.english: While Modern emigrant reclaimed and Mongolian and Chinese lived together, the traditional living habitude of Mongolian has made many changes in Inner Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 近代以来的移民开垦和蒙汉杂居局面的形成，使得内蒙古地区蒙古人传统生活习俗发生了诸多变化。

detailed_translations.english: habit or tendency

name: confide
trans: to trust, have faith (in)

sentences.english: I knew she had some fundamental problems in her marriage because she had confided in me a year earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我知道她的婚姻存在一些根本问题，因为她一年前曾向我吐露过。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone you trust about personal things that you do not want other people to know

name: fugacious
trans: fleeting, fading quickly, transient

sentences.english: We apperceive joy and cheers, apperceive variance of fugacious years during the life long journey.
sentences.chinese: 生生不息中，我们悟到的是生命绽放的喜悦，岁月无常的变迁；

detailed_translations.chinese: 无常的；短暂的；易逃逸的
detailed_translations.english: passing quickly away; transitory; fleeting

name: blare
trans: to make a loud sound

sentences.english: Horns blared in the street outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面街道上汽车喇叭发出刺耳的鸣响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发嘟嘟声；发出响而刺耳的声音
detailed_translations.english: to make a very loud unpleasant noise

name: doe
trans: the female of the deer, antelope, and certain other animals

name: assent
trans: to agree to, give approval to

sentences.english: I assented to the request of the American publishers to write this book.
sentences.chinese: 我同意了美国出版商们写这本书的请求。

detailed_translations.english: to agree to a suggestion, idea etc after considering it carefully
approval or agreement from someone who has authority

name: competent
trans: having the necessary ability, knowledge, or skill

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: foreign
trans: from a different country

sentences.english: foreign students
sentences.chinese: 外国学生

sentences.english: Can you speak any foreign languages?
sentences.chinese: 你会讲外语吗？

detailed_translations.english: from or relating to a country that is not your own

name: hardy
trans: having rugged physical strength, inured to fatigue

sentences.english: hardy mountain goats
sentences.chinese: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；勇敢的；能吃苦耐劳的；鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的人；耐寒植物；方柄凿
detailed_translations.english: any blacksmith's tool made with a square shank so that it can be lodged in a square hole in an anvil

name: enrapture
trans: to fill with great delight or joy, to fascinate

sentences.english: The place at once enraptured me.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方立刻把我迷住了。

sentences.english: The 20,000-strong audience listened, enraptured.
sentences.chinese: 两万多名观众听得入了迷。

sentences.english: ...an enraptured audience.
sentences.chinese: ...一场观众如痴如醉。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone enraptures you, you think they are wonderful or fascinating

name: eulogy
trans: an oration to honor a deceased person, usually at a funeral

sentences.english: The minister delivered a long eulogy.
sentences.chinese: 部长致长篇悼词。

detailed_translations.english: a speech or piece of writing in which you praise someone or something very much, especially at a funeral

name: compliance
trans: the action or fact of meeting rules or standards

sentences.english: Inspectors were sent to visit nuclear sites and verify compliance with the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 监察员被派去参观核址并核实条约的遵守情况。

detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a rule, agreement, or demand

name: bizarre
trans: strangely unconventional in style or appearance

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: declamatory
trans: bombastic, ostentatiously lofty in style

name: angular
trans: relating to an angle or angles, having an angle or angles

sentences.english: a cubist painting with angular shapes
sentences.chinese: 一幅有棱角图案的立体派绘画

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 有角的；生硬的，笨拙的；瘦削的
detailed_translations.english: having sharp and definite corners

name: extrajudicial
trans: carried out without legal authority

name: affix
trans: to attach

sentences.english: Will discuss concepts such as phoneme, morpheme , affix, rules and constraints.
sentences.chinese: 将被提及的概念包括音位、 语素、 词缀、 规则和限制。

sentences.english: After surveying all the structures with "de", we hold that there are three different "de" in modern Chinese, they are auxiliary verb, auxiliary word and affix.
sentences.chinese: 最后，综观现代汉语中与“得”有关的各种结构，本文认为现代汉语中有助动词、助词、词缀三个不同性质的轻声“得”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 黏上， 贴上； 添上
detailed_translations.english: to fasten or stick something to something else
a group of letters added to the beginning or end of a word to change its meaning or use, such as ‘un-’, ‘mis-’, ‘-ness’, or ‘-ly’

name: exorbitance
trans: exceeding the bounds of custom, propriety, or reason

name: antigen
trans: a toxin that induces an immune response in the body

name: commodity
trans: a useful or valuable thing

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: figurative
trans: metaphorical, as opposed to literal

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

name: carp
trans: to complain about a fault, to harp on

sentences.english: He cannot understand why she's constantly carping at him.
sentences.chinese: 他不理解为什么她对他总是百般的挑剔。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining about something in a way that is annoying
a large fish that lives in lakes and rivers and can be eaten

name: boatswain
trans: an officer on a vessel, in charge of rigging, cables, etc

sentences.english: The head of Job Anderson , the boatswain, appeared at the middle loophole.
sentences.chinese: 水手长乔伯-安德森的脑袋出现在了中间那个枪眼里。

sentences.english: And I was going to sea myself, to sea in a schooner, with a piping boatswain and pig-tailed singing seamen, to sea, bound for an unknown island, and to seek for buried treasure!
sentences.chinese: 而我本人也即将出海，乘着双桅船，和一个吹哨子的水手长以及留着辫子、唱着歌的水手们一道出海； 出海，驶向一个不知名的岛，去寻找埋藏着的宝藏！

detailed_translations.english: a petty officer on a merchant ship or a warrant officer on a warship who is responsible for the maintenance of the ship and its equipment

name: baconian
trans: of or pertaining to the philosopher Francis Bacon

name: disdain
trans: to regard (someone or something) with strong contempt

sentences.english: a look of complete disdain
sentences.chinese: 极为鄙视的样子

detailed_translations.english: a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough
to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough

name: forby
trans: close by, near

name: disfigure
trans: change the appearance of something/someone to the negative

sentences.english: His face had been disfigured in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 在一次意外事故中他毁了容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使变丑；损毁…的外形；使大为减色
detailed_translations.english: to spoil the appearance that something naturally has

name: cartilage
trans: a type of dense, non-vascular connective tissue

sentences.english: Andre Agassi has pulled out of next week's Grand Slam Cup after tearing a cartilage in his chest.
sentences.chinese: 安德烈·阿加西胸部软骨拉伤后已退出了下周的大满贯赛事。

detailed_translations.english: a strong substance that can bend, which is around the joints in your body and in your outer ear

name: convulse
trans: to violently shake or agitate

sentences.english: He sat down, his shoulders convulsing with sobs.
sentences.chinese: 他坐下来，因抽泣肩膀剧烈抖动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 震撼；使剧烈震动；使抽搐
detailed_translations.english: if your body or a part of it convulses, it moves violently and you are not able to control it

name: expunge
trans: to strike or blot out, erase

sentences.english: The revolutionaries expunged domestic opposition.
sentences.chinese: 革命者清洗了国内反对派。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a name from a list, piece of information, or book

name: avow
trans: assert or confess openly

sentences.english: He avowed his commitment to Marxist ideals.
sentences.chinese: 他宣称对马克思主义理想矢志不渝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认
detailed_translations.english: to make a public statement about something you believe in

name: bequeath
trans: to pass or to leave something over to someone else

sentences.english: He bequeathed all his silver to his children.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的银币都留给了他的孩子们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗赠；把…遗赠给；把…传下去
detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death

name: concerted
trans: planned or devised together

sentences.english: Libraries have made a concerted effort to attract young people.
sentences.chinese: 各图书馆同心协力吸引年轻人。

detailed_translations.english: a concerted effort etc is done by people working together in a carefully planned and very determined way

name: disbeliever
trans: one who disbelieves, one who does not believe

name: deluge
trans: to flood with water

sentences.english: There was a deluge of requests for interviews and statements.
sentences.chinese: 对接受访谈和发表声明的要求铺天盖地地涌来。

detailed_translations.english: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain

name: ado
trans: to do, in doing, as, there is nothing ado

sentences.english: So without further ado, I’ll now ask Mr Davis to open the debate.
sentences.chinese: 不再多说了，现在我请戴维斯先生开始辩论。

name: calculus
trans: a particular method of calculation

sentences.english: We have to factor that into the calculus.
sentences.chinese: 我们要在微积分学中考虑这些因素。

sentences.english: All this leads up to the most fundamental of theorems of calculus .
sentences.chinese: 综上所述就导出了微积分学中的最基本的定理。

sentences.english: Obstruction with stasis also led to the formation of the yellow-brown calculus (stone).
sentences.chinese: 伴有尿液郁积的阻塞还能导致黄褐色的结石（石头）形成。

detailed_translations.english: the part of mathematics that deals with changing quantities, such as the speed of a falling stone or the slope of a curved line

name: blunder
trans: to make a stupid mistake

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: dissimulate
trans: to disguise or conceal under a false appearance

sentences.english: This man was too injured to dissimulate well.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人伤得太重，不可能掩盖得住。

sentences.english: He didn't attempt to dissimulate or conceal his true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他没有尝试着掩饰或隐瞒自己的感受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩盖， 掩饰， 假装
detailed_translations.english: When people dissimulate, they hide their true feelings, intentions, or nature

name: delectation
trans: great pleasure, delight

sentences.english: Wish we cooperate the delectation!
sentences.chinese: 祝愿我们合作愉快！

sentences.english: Choose the rattan farmland, spend the delectation and comfortable time.
sentences.chinese: 选择藤田，度过愉快与舒适的时光。

sentences.english: Today is Mother's Day and wish all mother festival delectation in the world!
sentences.chinese: 今天是母亲节，祝世界上所有的母亲节日愉快！

detailed_translations.english: if you do something for someone’s delectation, you do it to give them enjoyment, pleasure, or amusement

name: adverse
trans: unfavorable, antagonistic in purpose or effect, hostile

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: diminution
trans: a lessening, decrease or reduction

sentences.english: ...despite a slight diminution in asset value.
sentences.chinese: ...尽管资产价值略有减少。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the size, number, or amount of something

name: figment
trans: a fabrication, fantasy, invention, something fictitious

sentences.english: Being one myself, I know that they are not just some figment, but the truth of the matter is, gaming is male dominated, the same way knitting is dominated by females.
sentences.chinese: 因为我本人就是一个游戏迷，所以知道这样的女孩绝非虚构。 然而事情的真相是，视频游戏是男人的地盘，就好像编织衣物大多由女人从事一样。

detailed_translations.english: something that you imagine is real, but does not exist

name: forethought
trans: thinking beforehand, planning, prior consideration

sentences.english: The moral of this article is that a little forethought can pay off tremendously.
sentences.chinese: 本文给我们的启示是：一点点深谋远虑可以带来极大的回报。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深谋远虑；先见；考虑将来

name: equity
trans: the quality of being fair or impartial, fairness

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

name: assiduous
trans: diligent, industrious

sentences.english: Podulski had been assiduous in learning his adopted language.
sentences.chinese: 珀杜斯基曾经勤奋地学习他所选的外语。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is assiduous works hard or does things very thoroughly

name: convergent
trans: coming closer together, to focus

detailed_translations.english: (of two or more lines, paths, etc) moving towards or meeting at some common point

name: achillean
trans: invincible

name: applicable
trans: suitable for application, relevant, appropriate

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: fete
trans: to celebrate (a person)

sentences.english: The pop star flew 100 friends in from London and Paris for a two-day fete.
sentences.chinese: 这名歌星从伦敦和巴黎把100位朋友空运过来参加一个两天的游园会。

detailed_translations.english: A fete is a fancy party or celebration

name: entail
trans: to imply or require

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: disencumber
trans: to remove a burden

name: culprit
trans: the person or thing at fault for a problem or crime

sentences.english: Police finally managed to catch the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 警察终于抓住了罪犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯人，罪犯；被控犯罪的人
detailed_translations.english: the person who is guilty of a crime or doing something wrong

name: habitant
trans: inhabitant, dweller

name: attenuate
trans: to reduce in size, force, value, amount, or degree

sentences.english: The repetition of symbols was to be enough, without trauma, as well, perhaps, to attenuate it, or even jar it altogether loose from her memory.
sentences.chinese: 象征的重复快要足够，即便没有可能的从她记忆中流出的创伤，去减弱它去刺激它。

sentences.english: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it.
sentences.chinese: 风险不可能完全消除，但可以通过防范和培训来降低。

detailed_translations.english: To attenuate something means to reduce it or weaken it

name: alien
trans: a person who has been estranged or excluded

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: foppery
trans: the dress or actions of a fop

name: confidant
trans: a person in whom one can confide or share one's secrets

sentences.english: ...a close confidant of the president.
sentences.chinese: ...总统的一位亲密心腹。

detailed_translations.english: someone you tell your secrets to or who you talk to about personal things

name: breech
trans: the lower, rear trunk of the body

sentences.english: Soon after we arrived, we learned Hillary would have to give birth by cesarean section because the baby was in breech, upside down in the womb.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵达医院后不久，就听说希拉里需要做剖腹产，因为孩子是“臀位”，也就是说，孩子在子宫里的姿势是上下颠倒的。

sentences.english: Miya and Leah were delivered by Caesarean section at Frimley Park Hospital, in Surrey, at just 37 weeks of pregnancy after scans revealed both babies were in the breech position.
sentences.chinese: 米亚和利亚是在萨里的菲姆雷公园医院剖腹生产的，只经过37周的孕期通过检查显示两个孩子都在臀部位置。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun into which you put the bullets

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…穿上裤子；给…装上炮尾

name: converge
trans: of two or more entities, to approach each other

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会合， 互相靠拢； 聚集， 集中； 趋近
detailed_translations.english: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing

name: canard
trans: a false or misleading report, especially if deliberately so

sentences.english: The charge that Harding was a political stooge may be a canard.
sentences.chinese: 关于哈丁是政治密探的指控可能是个谣传。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of news that is false and is told to people deliberately in order to harm someone

name: extrinsic
trans: external, separable from the thing itself, inessential

sentences.english: Nowadays there are fewer extrinsic pressures to get married.
sentences.chinese: 现在，结婚与否很少受到来自外部的压力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的， 外在的， 非本质的
detailed_translations.english: Extrinsic reasons, forces, or factors exist outside the person or situation they affect

name: gothic
trans: a style of architecture from the mid-12th century

name: divisor
trans: a number or expression that another is to be divided by

sentences.english: To be an exact divisor of.
sentences.chinese: 以…来除成为…的精确除数。

sentences.english: The value of the divider or divisor.
sentences.chinese: 被除以的值，或除数。

sentences.english: The divisor is subtracted from the dividend.
sentences.chinese: 从被除数中减去除数。

detailed_translations.english: the number by which another number is to be divided

name: certitude
trans: sureness, certainty

sentences.english: Doubt and certitude are subjective reactions to the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑与确信都是对于证据的主观反映。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being or feeling certain about something

name: expository
trans: serving to explain, explicate, or elucidate

sentences.english: An expository treatise or series of annotations; an exegesis .
sentences.chinese: 注释，训诂说明性的论述或一系列注解；

sentences.english: A theatrical scene requires an obstacle unless it is a pure connective or expository situation.
sentences.chinese: 一个戏剧砙靶枰桓稣习?除非是单纯的连接或说明性的情况。

name: consummate
trans: to bring to a state of perfectio, fulfill

sentences.english: Factory with consummate skill, good reputation, good service, won the praise and trust of our customers, business across the country.
sentences.chinese: 本厂以精湛的技艺、良好的信誉、周到的服务，深得广大客户的好评和信赖，业务遍布全国各地。 %。

sentences.english: Combining with its practice, this article draws lessons from the experiences of Japanese examinational committee, and brings out some suggestions to consummate the system.
sentences.chinese: 本文结合人民监督员制度运行的实践，借鉴日本检察审查会制度的经验，就完善人民监督员制度提出构想。

detailed_translations.english: to make something complete, especially an agreement

name: guileless
trans: sincere, honest, straightforward, frank

sentences.english: Joanne was so guileless that Claire had no option but to believe her.
sentences.chinese: 乔安妮如此诚实，所以克莱尔除了相信她以外没有别的选择。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an honest way, without trying to hide anything or deceive people

name: coronation
trans: the ceremony of crowning a sovereign or sovereign's consort

sentences.english: When they first saw each other in royal clothing, the fine robes and shining crowns for their coronation, that was when they fell in love.
sentences.chinese: 当他们第一次看到对方穿着王室的衣服——为他们的加冕礼而穿戴的精美的袍子和华丽的王冠——时，那就是他们坠入爱河的时候。

sentences.english: What they regarded as the end of life was the very preparation for coronation; for Christ was silent that He might live again in tenfold power.
sentences.chinese: 她们所认为的生命末日，殊不知正是加冕大典的筹备过程；基督之所以静默安息，是为了在再醒时能增加十倍的力量。

sentences.english: But the world began to warm in 1650; when Charles II was crowned king of England in 1660, the coronation sparked the Enlightenment era in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 但是从1650年开始，全球开始转暖，当查理二世于1660年在英国即位时，他的加冕礼成为启动欧洲启蒙时代的转机。

detailed_translations.english: the ceremony at which someone is officially made king or queen

name: antitoxin
trans: a substance, formed in the body, that counters a toxin

sentences.english: In Thailand, delivery of a botulism antitoxin prevented multiple deaths.
sentences.chinese: 在泰国，肉毒抗毒素避免了多起死亡的发生。

sentences.english: Although antitoxin for the treatment of botulism is only available in some countries, WHO was able to ensure delivery of antitoxin to Thailand by the morning of 19 March.
sentences.chinese: 虽然只在某些国家可获得治疗肉毒中毒的抗毒素，但是世卫组织能确保到3月19日上午向泰国提供抗毒素。

detailed_translations.english: a medicine or substance produced by your body which stops the effects of a poison

name: derisible
trans: subject to or deserving of contemptuous ridicule

name: compromise
trans: to bind by mutual agreement

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: ecstatic
trans: feeling or characterized by extreme happiness

sentences.english: an ecstatic welcome from the thousands who lined the streets
sentences.chinese: 数千人狂热的夹道欢迎

detailed_translations.english: feeling extremely happy and excited

name: discordant
trans: not in harmony or accord

name: contiguous
trans: connected, touching, abutting

sentences.english: America’s 48 contiguous states
sentences.chinese: 美国的48个互相毗连的州

detailed_translations.english: next to something, or next to each other

name: chameleon
trans: describing something that changes color

detailed_translations.chinese: 变色龙， 蜥蜴； 善变之人
detailed_translations.english: a  lizard  that can change its colour to match the colours around it

name: ascent
trans: the act of ascending a motion upwards

sentences.english: the first ascent of Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 首次攀登珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

name: grievous
trans: causing grief, pain or sorrow

sentences.english: a grievous shortage of hospital beds
sentences.chinese: 医院床位的严重短缺

detailed_translations.english: very serious and causing great pain or suffering

name: apprehensive
trans: anticipating something with anxiety or fear

sentences.english: Some had apprehensive looks on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 有些人面带愁容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的
detailed_translations.english: worried or nervous about something that you are going to do, or about the future

name: doctrine
trans: a belief or tenet, especially about theological matters

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: germinate
trans: to begin to grow or develop

sentences.english: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.
sentences.chinese: 有一些品种的种子发芽快，所以差不多每天都要察看一下。

detailed_translations.english: if a seed germinates, or if it is germinated, it begins to grow

name: cosmos
trans: the universe seen as a well-ordered whole

sentences.english: ...the natural laws of the cosmos.
sentences.chinese: …宇宙的自然法则。

detailed_translations.english: the whole universe, especially when you think of it as a system

name: acquiesce
trans: to rest satisfied

sentences.english: Steve seemed to acquiesce in the decision.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂夫看样子默许了这个决定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone else wants, or allow something to happen, even though you do not really agree with it

name: consumptive
trans: tending to consume, destructive, wasteful

name: berserk
trans: furiously violent or out of control

sentences.english: Dad went berserk when he found out.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸知道以后勃然大怒。

detailed_translations.english: to become very angry and violent

name: extirpate
trans: to remove or destroy totally, do away with, exterminate

name: clientele
trans: the body or class of people who frequent an establishment

sentences.english: This pub had a mixed clientele.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒吧有混杂的顾客群。

detailed_translations.english: The clientele of a place or organization are its customers or clients

name: crevice
trans: a narrow crack or fissure, in a rock or wall

sentences.english: small creatures that hide in crevices in the rock
sentences.chinese: 藏在岩石缝里的小生物

detailed_translations.english: a narrow crack in the surface of something, especially in rock

name: forego
trans: to precede, to go before

sentences.english: Many skiers are happy to forego a summer holiday to go skiing.
sentences.chinese: 许多滑雪者乐于放弃暑假去滑雪。

detailed_translations.english: If you forego something, you decide to do without it, although you would like it

name: felony
trans: an offense, as murder or burglary, of grave character

sentences.english: He pleaded guilty to six felonies.
sentences.chinese: 他承认犯了6项重罪。

detailed_translations.english: a serious crime such as murder

name: endear
trans: to make dear or precious

sentences.english: Their taste for gambling has endeared them to Las Vegas casino owners.
sentences.chinese: 他们对赌博的爱好使其受到了拉斯韦加斯赌场老板们的欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: If something endears you to someone or if you endear yourself to them, you become popular with them and well liked by them

name: external
trans: outside of something

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: exceptionable
trans: liable to exception  or objection, objectionable
