detailed_translations.english: open to or subject to objection; objectionable

name: disobedient
trans: not obedient

sentences.english: Her tone was that of a parent to a disobedient child.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音听上去好像家长在教训不听话的小孩。

detailed_translations.english: deliberately not doing what you are told to do by your parents, teacher, etc

name: allocate
trans: to assign or plot

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: extenuate
trans: to represent (a fault, offense, etc ) as less serious

sentences.english: Nothing can extenuate his base conduct.
sentences.chinese: 他的卑鄙行为无可掩饰。

sentences.english: My dear sir, I've no wish to extenuate the Count'stransgressions;
sentences.chinese: 先生，我井不想减轻伯爵的过失；

detailed_translations.english: to represent (an offence, a fault, etc) as being less serious than it appears, as by showing mitigating circumstances

name: burnish
trans: to make smooth or shiny by rubbing, to polish, to shine

sentences.english: The agency hired a New York public-relations firm to burnish Washington's image.
sentences.chinese: 该机构雇用了一家纽约公关公司来提升华盛顿的形象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 擦亮；使…光亮；将…打磨光亮
detailed_translations.english: to polish metal or another substance until it shines

name: animalcule
trans: an older term for a microscopic animal or protozoan

name: cunning
trans: having or showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: contaminate
trans: to introduce impurities or foreign matter

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: fabrication
trans: the act of framing, construction, manufacture

sentences.english: Her story was a complete fabrication from start to finish.
sentences.chinese: 她的叙述从头到尾都是编造出来的。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of information or story that someone has invented in order to deceive people

name: accommodate
trans: to adapt, as, to accommodate ourselves to circumstances

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: clique
trans: a small, exclusive group of individuals, cabal

name: credence
trans: acceptance of something as true

sentences.english: Good studies are needed to lend credence to the notion that genuine progress can be made in this important field.
sentences.chinese: 要有优秀的研究才能使人相信在这一重大领域能取得真正的进步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 信任；凭证；祭器台（等于credence table，credenza）
detailed_translations.english: the acceptance of something as true

name: cadence
trans: a modulation or inflection of the voice

sentences.english: the cadence of my mother’s voice
sentences.chinese: 我母亲语调的抑扬顿挫

detailed_translations.english: the way someone’s voice rises and falls, especially when reading out loud

name: cornucopia
trans: a goat's horn overflowing with fruit, flowers, grain, etc.

name: floral
trans: of, pertaining to, or connected with flowers

sentences.english: a scarf with a bold floral pattern
sentences.chinese: 印有鲜艳花卉图案的围巾

sentences.english: a pretty floral dress
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的印花连衣裙

sentences.english: a light floral fragrance
sentences.chinese: 幽幽的花香

sentences.english: There were floral tributes (= flowers sent as a sign of respect after someone has died ) from his colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 有他同事敬献的鲜花。

detailed_translations.english: made of flowers or decorated with flowers or pictures of flowers

name: depreciation
trans: reduction in value over time

sentences.english: the depreciation of the dollar
sentences.chinese: 美元的贬值

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the value or price of something

name: analyst
trans: someone who analyzes

sentences.english: Political analysts expect the Conservatives to win.
sentences.chinese: 政治分析家预计保守党获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it

name: disingenuous
trans: not candid or sincere

sentences.english: Keeping the details of the tax changes vague is disingenuous.
sentences.chinese: 对税收变革的细节含糊其词并不光明正大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚伪的；不诚实的；不老实的；狡猾的
detailed_translations.english: not sincere and slightly dishonest

name: distort
trans: to bring something out of shape

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: generalize
trans: to speak in generalities, or in vague terms

sentences.english: She has a tendency to generalize from her husband to all men.
sentences.chinese: 她总爱把自己对丈夫的看法推及所有的男人。

detailed_translations.english: to form a general principle or opinion after considering only a small number of facts or examples

name: autobiography
trans: a self-written biography, the story of one's own life

sentences.english: He published his autobiography last autumn.
sentences.chinese: 他去年秋天出版了他的自传。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which someone writes about their own life, or books of this type

name: critical
trans: inclined to find fault or to judge with severity

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: emancipate
trans: to set free from the power of another, to liberate, as:

sentences.english: Slaves were emancipated in 1834.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶于1834年获得了解放。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the political or legal rights that they did not have before

name: accomplish
trans: to finish successfully

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: compensate
trans: to pay someone in exchange for work done, etc.

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: conspirator
trans: a person who plans to do something unlawful or harmful

name: compound
trans: to come together

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: habitual
trans: behaving in a regular manner, as a habit

sentences.english: James took his habitual morning walk around the garden.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯又像往常习惯的那样绕花园作晨间散步去了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的
detailed_translations.english: doing something from habit, and unable to stop doing it

name: akin
trans: related by blood, similar

sentences.english: Something akin to panic overwhelmed him.
sentences.chinese: 一种近似惊恐的感觉使他不知所措。

detailed_translations.english: very similar to something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Akin)人名；(土、瑞典、尼日利)阿金；(匈)奥金；(英)埃金

name: fawn
trans: to exhibit affection or attempt to please

sentences.english: The fawn ran to the top of the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 那只小鹿跑上山脊。

detailed_translations.english: to seek attention and admiration (from) by cringing and flattering
a young  deer
having a pale yellow-brown colour

name: epode
trans: a lyric poem in which a short verse follws a long one

name: decisive
trans: settling an issue, producing a definite result

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

name: drone
trans: to produce a low-pitched hum or buzz

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

name: financier
trans: a person skilled in managing large financial operations

sentences.english: The bank is controlled by a famous financier.
sentences.chinese: 这家银行由一位著名的金融家控制。

sentences.english: In person, he has the air of a philosophy professor rather than a gimlet-eyed financier.
sentences.chinese: 索罗斯本人并不像一个目光敏锐的金融家，他更具有哲学教授的气质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or lends large sums of money

name: blaze
trans: a bright flame or fire

sentences.english: Some 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 约有四千名消防人员正在与大火搏斗。

sentences.english: the blaze of light from the security lamps
sentences.chinese: 安全灯的强光

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
to burn very brightly and strongly

name: domain
trans: a geographic area owned by a single person or organization

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: continuator
trans: a person or thing that continues

sentences.english: Whether you are the anti-innovator or the traditional continuator, the indispensable premise and foundation is fully understanding about tradition.
sentences.chinese: 无论是反传统的革新者，还是维护传统的继承派，都必须充分地认识并理解传统是其必要的前提和基础。

sentences.english: In other words, much attention was paid on that Mao Zedong is a continuator and developer of Marxism, rather than that he is also a continuator and developer of traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，以往只关注毛泽东是马克思主义的继承者和发展者，而忽略了发掘他作为传统文化继承者和弘扬者的一面。

detailed_translations.english: a person who continues something, esp the work of someone else

name: eloquence
trans: the quality of artistry and persuasiveness in language

sentences.english: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 他天生具有罕见的口才。

sentences.english: On the one hand to expand my insight, on the other hand exercise my eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 一方面扩大我的洞察力，另一方面锻炼我的口才。

sentences.english: I exercise in the race his eloquence and ability to cope, to learn some basic manners.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中我锻炼了自己口才和应变能力， 学习到了一些基本的礼仪。

name: exhale
trans: to expel air from the lungs

sentences.english: Take a deep breath, then exhale slowly.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢呼出。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

name: condemn
trans: to sentence (someone) to a particular punishment

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: depositor
trans: a person who makes a deposit, especially of money in a bank

sentences.english: Notice that the St. Louis memo tiptoes around the question of telling a depositor that he has a demand deposit while telling the rest of the country that he has a time deposit.
sentences.chinese: 请注意，圣路易斯储备银行的备忘录一直在一个问题上遮遮掩掩，那就是把存款人的活期存款说成定期存款，欺骗国人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who puts money in a bank or other financial organization

name: amphitheater
trans: a semi-circular acoustic backdrop for an outdoor venue

detailed_translations.chinese: 竞技场；[建] 圆形露天剧场；古罗马剧场
detailed_translations.english: a building, usually circular or oval, in which tiers of seats rise from a central open arena, as in those of ancient Rome

name: adoration
trans: an act of religious worship

sentences.english: the look of adoration in his eyes
sentences.chinese: 他爱慕的眼神

detailed_translations.english: great love and admiration

name: calamity
trans: an event causing great and often sudden damage or distress

sentences.english: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.chinese: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering

name: defoliate
trans: to remove foliage from one or more plants

sentences.english: Infestations of these caterpillars may defoliate oaks and other hardwood trees but usually do no permanent damage.
sentences.chinese: 这些毛虫的侵扰可能使橡树落叶和其它硬木树，但是通常不会有永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to use defoliant on a plant or tree

name: blaspheme
trans: to speak against god or religious doctrine

sentences.english: "Don't blaspheme," my mother said.
sentences.chinese: “不要亵渎神明，”我妈妈说。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a way that insults God or people’s religious beliefs, or to use the names of God and holy things when swearing

name: complement
trans: to complete, to bring to perfection, to make whole

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

name: amend
trans: to make better, to change

sentences.english: The law was amended to include women.
sentences.chinese: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。

sentences.english: The defendant later amended his evidence.
sentences.chinese: 被告后来修改了证词。

sentences.english: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
sentences.chinese: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

detailed_translations.english: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

name: alcove
trans: a small recessed area set off from a larger room

sentences.english: In the alcoves on either side of the fire were bookshelves.
sentences.chinese: 凹室内炉火的两侧是书架。

detailed_translations.english: a place in the wall of a room that is built further back than the rest of the wall

name: adamant
trans: resistant to reason, determined, inflexible

sentences.english: She begged me to change my mind, but I remained adamant .
sentences.chinese: 她求我改变主意，但我坚决不肯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 固执的，坚强的；坚定不移的；坚硬无比的
detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your opinion or a decision that you have made

name: dictum
trans: an authoritative statement, a dogmatic saying

sentences.english: Descartes’ famous dictum: ‘I think; therefore, I am’
sentences.chinese: 笛卡尔的名言 “我思故我在”

detailed_translations.chinese: 格言；声明；法官的附带意见
detailed_translations.english: a formal statement of opinion by someone who is respected or has authority

name: audition
trans: a trial to test a performer's suitability for something

sentences.english: ...an audition for a Broadway musical.
sentences.chinese: …一部百老汇歌舞剧的试演。

detailed_translations.english: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra
to take part in an audition

name: hard-hearted
trans: unfeeling, unmerciful, pitiless

name: endanger
trans: to expose to danger, to risk causing harm to

sentences.english: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

name: antipathy
trans: a deep seated feeling of dislike

sentences.english: ...the voting public's antipathy toward the president.
sentences.chinese: …投票民众对总统的憎恶。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of strong dislike towards someone or something

name: forgery
trans: the production of a fake work that is claimed to be genuine

sentences.english: The painting was a very clever forgery.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是件很巧妙的赝品。

detailed_translations.english: a document, painting, or piece of paper money that has been copied illegally

name: exact
trans: strictly accurate or correct

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: canon
trans: a generally accepted principle

sentences.english: the Shakespearean canon
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚真作集

detailed_translations.english: a list of books or pieces of music that are officially recognized as being the work of a certain writer

name: candor
trans: whiteness, brilliance

sentences.english: This candor is even evident in the human rights plan.
sentences.chinese: 甚至在人权计划中，这种坦率也是很明显的。

sentences.english: The rare moments of candor come at other people’s expense.
sentences.chinese: 书里罕见的坦白之处，则以其他人作为代价。

sentences.english: For all those reasons, Gates should be applauded for his candor.
sentences.chinese: 出于所有这些原因，盖茨应该为他的坦率拍手叫好。

name: denunciation
trans: proclamation, announcement, a publishing

name: desist
trans: to cease to proceed or act, to stop

sentences.english: We hope that the military regime will desist from its acts of violence.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望军人政权停止暴力行为。

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something

name: gossamer
trans: a fine, filmy cobweb seen on grass or floating in the air

sentences.english: ...the daring gossamer dresses of sheer black lace.
sentences.chinese: ...样式大胆的纯黑蕾丝薄洋装。

detailed_translations.english: a very light thin material
You use gossamer to indicate that something is very light, thin, or delicate

name: antemundane
trans: being or occurring prior to the creation of the world

name: bungle
trans: to botch up, bumble or incompetently perform a task

sentences.english: The whole police operation was bungled.
sentences.chinese: 警方的整个行动都给弄砸了。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to do something properly, because you have made stupid mistakes – used especially in news reports

name: debonair
trans: gracious, courteous

sentences.english: Her father walked down the path, debonair in a three-piece suit, hat, and cane.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲走下小路，温文尔雅，穿着三件套，头戴帽子，手执拐杖。

detailed_translations.english: A man who is debonair is confident, charming, and well dressed

name: ambivalent
trans: experiencing contradictory feelings, beliefs, or motivations

sentences.english: As a group, they are ambivalent about whether the quality of online content would suffer if companies could not charge for it—34% think so while 30% do not; and the remaining 36% have no firm opinion.
sentences.chinese: 对于如果网站对内容不收费这些内容的质量是否会变差的调查有矛盾：34%的人认为会变差，同时30%的认为不会，而36%的人没有固定的意见。

sentences.english: Looking back on it, I can see how the statement looked ambivalent and a touch arrogant, but it was an honest expression of how I felt, as I began the first campaign since 1982 that I could have lost.
sentences.chinese: 现在回头想想，我能够看出，在这个声明中，我所流露出的矛盾心理和些许的傲慢，但它确实是我内心感受的真实表达，因为这是自1982年以来，我第一次开始进行可能会失利的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: not sure whether you want or like something or not

name: asylum
trans: a place of safety

sentences.english: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.
sentences.chinese: 他于1987年逃脱本国的警察之后申请了避难许可。

detailed_translations.english: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

name: fracas
trans: a noisy, disorderly disturbance or fight

name: divulge
trans: to tell (a secret) so that it may become generally known

sentences.english: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 官员们拒绝透露谈判的细节。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone information that should be secret

name: contravene
trans: to act contrary to an order, or fail to conform

sentences.english: Some portions of the bill may contravene state law.
sentences.chinese: 这项议案中的一些部分可能与州法律相抵触。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is not allowed according to a law or rule

name: abrade
trans: to rub or wear away

sentences.english: My skin was abraded and very tender.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮肤被擦伤了，非常敏感。

detailed_translations.english: to rub something so hard that the surface becomes damaged

name: aplomb
trans: self-confidence, poise, composure

sentences.english: He delivered the speech with his usual aplomb.
sentences.chinese: 他以惯常的沉着语气作了演讲。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something with aplomb, you do it with confidence in a relaxed way

name: endemic
trans: natural to or characteristic of a specific people or place

sentences.english: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

detailed_translations.english: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

name: emphatic
trans: expressing something forcibly and clearly

sentences.english: an emphatic denial
sentences.chinese: 断然否认

detailed_translations.english: expressing an opinion, idea etc in a clear, strong way to show its importance

name: hallow
trans: to make holy, to sanctify

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…视为神圣； 尊敬， 敬畏
detailed_translations.english: to consecrate or set apart as being holy

name: coronet
trans: a circular decoration for the head

name: apprise
trans: to notify, or to make aware, to inform

sentences.english: Have customers been fully apprised of the advantages?
sentences.chinese: 客户有没有被充分告知各项好处呢？

detailed_translations.english: to tell or give someone information about something

name: encompass
trans: to form a circle around, to encircle

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: chide
trans: to scold or rebuke

sentences.english: ‘Edward, you are naughty,’ Dorothy chided.
sentences.chinese: “爱德华，你真顽皮。”多萝西斥责道。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you do not approve of something that they have done or said

name: dissection
trans: the act of dissecting, or something dissected

name: grisly
trans: horrifyingly repellent, terrifying, gruesome

sentences.english: a series of grisly murders
sentences.chinese: 一连串恐怖的凶杀案

name: acerbic
trans: acid in temper, mood or tone

sentences.english: acerbic wit
sentences.chinese: 尖刻的俏皮话

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖刻的（等于acerb）；酸的；辛辣的
detailed_translations.english: criticizing someone or something in a clever but cruel way

name: dispel
trans: to drive away by scattering, or to cause to vanish

sentences.english: We want to dispel the myth that you cannot eat well in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 我们要消除在英国吃不好的误解。

sentences.english: Light poured into the hall, dispelling the shadows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光洒进大厅，驱散了阴影。

detailed_translations.english: to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling

name: execration
trans: a curse dictated by violent feelings of hatred

name: concordance
trans: agreement, accordance, consonance

name: commute
trans: to travel from one's home to one's workplace

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: digraph
trans: a directed graph

name: convoluted
trans: extremely complex and difficult to follow (argument, often)

sentences.english: long paragraphs and convoluted sentences
sentences.chinese: 冗长的段落和费解的句子

sentences.english: The argument is rather convoluted.
sentences.chinese: 这一论点令人颇为费解。

detailed_translations.english: complicated and difficult to understand

name: cavalcade
trans: a company of riders

name: acetate
trans: any salt or ester of acetic acid

sentences.english: Y20 is a type of re-dispersible vinyl/acetate ethylene copolymerized emulsion powder.
sentences.chinese: Y20胶粉是一种可再分散的乙烯/醋酸乙烯共聚胶粉.

sentences.english: He then gave them doses of caffeine and anti-inflammatories to find it blocked the acetate and relieved the headaches.
sentences.chinese: 然后他给小鼠服用了咖啡因和抗炎药，意图发现这些物质是否阻断醋酸的产生，进而缓解头痛。

sentences.english: Some models wore black straw hats traditionally used by male farmers, and many also had their waists cinched by elaborate acetate belts.
sentences.chinese: 有的模特戴上传统农夫使用的黑色草帽，还有些用精心制作的醋酸纤维腰带束紧腰部。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical made from acetic acid

name: defer
trans: to delay, or put off to a future time

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

name: cant
trans: to speak with the jargon of a class or subgroup

sentences.english: thieves’ cant
sentences.chinese: 小偷的黑话

detailed_translations.chinese: 斜面；伪善之言；黑话；角落
detailed_translations.english: insincere talk about moral or religious principles by someone who is pretending to be better than they really are
to lean, or make something lean

detailed_translations.chinese: 行话的；哀诉声的；假仁假义的

name: antidote
trans: a remedy to counteract the effects of poison

sentences.english: When he returned, he noticed their sickness and prepared an antidote.
sentences.chinese: 当他返回时，他注意到了他们的病情，准备了解毒药。

detailed_translations.chinese: [药] 解毒剂；解药；矫正方法
detailed_translations.english: a substance that stops the effects of a poison

name: duteous
trans: willingly obedient out of a sense of duty and respect

name: beret
trans: a type of round, brimless cap with a soft top and a headband

name: fastidious
trans: excessively particular, demanding, or fussy about details

sentences.english: people who are fastidious about personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 十分讲究个人卫生的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑剔的；苛求的，难取悦的；（微生物等）需要复杂营养地
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details in your appearance, work etc

name: carcass
trans: body of a dead animal

sentences.english: A cluster of vultures crouched on the carcass of a dead buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 一群秃鹫伏在一头水牛的尸体上啄食。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人或动物的）尸体；残骸；（除脏去头备食用的）畜体
detailed_translations.english: the body of a dead animal

name: expatriate
trans: to banish (a person) from his or her native country

sentences.english: ...British expatriates in Spain.
sentences.chinese: …侨居西班牙的英国人。

sentences.english: The expatriate vote could help determine who wins in November.
sentences.chinese: 侨居者们的投票有助于决定谁在11月获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使移居国外；流放，放逐；使放弃国籍

detailed_translations.english: An expatriate is someone who is living in a country that is not their own
Expatriate is also an adjective

name: futile
trans: incapable of producing any result, ineffective, useless

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

name: fulcrum
trans: the support about which a lever pivots

name: coincidence
trans: an occurence, by chance, of more than one event at one time

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

name: fief
trans: a territory held in fee

name: economize
trans: to avoid waste or extravagance

sentences.english: We're going to have to economize from now on.
sentences.chinese: 我们得从现在起节省开支。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the amount of money, time, goods etc that you use

name: discern
trans: to perceive or recognize (something)

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: avert
trans: to turn aside or away

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

name: cerebral
trans: intellectual rather than emotional or physical

sentences.english: a cerebral haemorrhage
sentences.chinese: 脑出[溢]血

detailed_translations.english: relating to or affecting your brain

name: fortitude
trans: the mental strength that enables courage

sentences.english: Winnie is a woman of quiet fortitude who has endured a lot of suffering.
sentences.chinese: 温妮是个坚强寡言的女子，她忍受了许多痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: courage shown when you are in great pain or experiencing a lot of trouble

name: differentia
trans: trait that discerns a species from another of same genus

name: divest
trans: to undress, disrobe

sentences.english: The company divested itself of its oil interests.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司从石油生意中抽身。

detailed_translations.english: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it

name: effrontery
trans: insolent or impertinent behavior

sentences.english: The man had the effrontery to be sarcastic.
sentences.chinese: 那个男人有冷嘲热讽的放肆劲。

detailed_translations.english: rude behaviour that shocks you because it is so confident

name: coerce
trans: to persuade

sentences.english: Potter had argued that the government coerced him into pleading guilty.
sentences.chinese: 波特曾争辩说是政府胁迫他认罪。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something they do not want to do by threatening them

name: forestall
trans: to prevent, delay or hinder something, to avert

sentences.english: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
sentences.chinese: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

detailed_translations.chinese: 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first

name: aver
trans: to state or assert to be the case

detailed_translations.chinese: 极力声明； 断言； 证实
detailed_translations.english: to say something firmly and strongly because you are sure that it is true

name: contraband
trans: prohibited from being traded

sentences.english: a cargo of contraband
sentences.chinese: 一批走私货

detailed_translations.chinese: 走私；走私货；战时禁运品（等于contraband of war）
detailed_translations.english: goods that are brought into a country illegally, especially to avoid tax

name: atypical
trans: not conforming to the normal type

sentences.english: The economy of the province was atypical because it was particularly small.
sentences.chinese: 该省的经济并不算典型，因为它的规模特别小。

detailed_translations.english: not typical or usual

name: diabolic
trans: showing wickedness typical of a devil

name: alienate
trans: to make indifferent or hostile

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

name: convene
trans: to come together, to meet, to unite

sentences.english: a report by experts convened by the National Institutes of Health
sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting
if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

name: encyclopedia
trans: a book or set of books containing articles on various topics

sentences.english: the Encyclopedia of Music
sentences.chinese: 音乐百科全书

detailed_translations.english: a book or cd, or a set of these, containing facts about many different subjects, or containing detailed facts about one subject

name: deride
trans: to harshly mock, ridicule

sentences.english: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

name: cosmopolitanism
trans: the idea that all people belong to a single moral community

sentences.english: A certain optimism adheres to the notion of a new cosmopolitanism.
sentences.chinese: 坚持某种乐观的概念，一个新的世界主义。

sentences.english: Nope . What communism teach us is just to abandon our own culture and to advocate so-called cosmopolitanism .
sentences.chinese: 不，共产主义教我们做的除了抛弃自己的文化就是提倡所谓的世界主义四海一家。

sentences.english: The cosmopolitanism of the may4th movement was the important thought medium by which the enlightening intelligentsia turned to accept socialism.
sentences.chinese: 而五四的世界主义也是启蒙知识份子转而接受社会主义的重要思想媒介。

name: flamboyant
trans: showy, bold or audacious in behaviour, appearance, etc

sentences.english: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .
sentences.chinese: 他抬起胳膊，做了个炫耀的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident or exciting way that makes people notice you

name: abnegate
trans: to deny (oneself something)

sentences.english: It can abnegate useless samples and make the knowledge of study objects accumulate.
sentences.chinese: 该算法舍弃对最终结论无用的样本，使得学习对象的知识得到了积累。

sentences.english: What a real growth is need courage and faith to try new thing and abnegate old things.
sentences.chinese: 真正的成长是要有勇气和信心去尝试新的事物，同时放弃旧有的事物。

detailed_translations.english: to deny to oneself; renounce (privileges, pleasure, etc)

name: biped
trans: an animal, or being that goes about on two feet or legs

sentences.english: Some biologists, along with Plato, define hominid as “featherless biped.”
sentences.chinese: 有些生物学家，作为柏拉图的跟随者，定义原始人类为“没有羽毛的两足动物” 。

sentences.english: "It is still difficult for a biped robot to walk on a bumpy surface, even on Earth," the official said.
sentences.chinese: 这位官员说，“即使是在地球上，两足机器人在颠簸的路面行走仍然有困难。”

sentences.english: Whether it's through the forest or across the savanna, it doesn't matter — you're a biped when you're moving, " Jungers says.
sentences.chinese: 无论是穿过森林或是走过热带稀树草原都没关系，当你运动时，你就是一只两足动物，”容格斯说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal with two legs, such as a human

name: baton
trans: a short stick or staff used to conduct

sentences.english: The maestro raises his baton.
sentences.chinese: 大师举起他的指挥棒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指挥棒；接力棒；警棍；司令棒
detailed_translations.english: a short thin stick used by a  conductor (=  the leader of a group of musicians  )  to direct the music

name: confound
trans: to cause surprise or confusion in (someone)

sentences.english: His amazing recovery confounded the medical specialists.
sentences.chinese: 他的神奇康复使医学专家感到惊讶。

name: anterior
trans: before in place

sentences.english: anterior vertebrae
sentences.chinese: 前椎

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the front

name: disengage
trans: to release or loosen from something that binds, unfasten

sentences.english: Disengage the gears when you park the car.
sentences.chinese: 停车时要松开排挡。

detailed_translations.english: to move so that you are not touching or holding someone

name: bogus
trans: counterfeit or fake, not genuine

sentences.english: bogus insurance claims
sentences.chinese: 虚报的保险索赔

sentences.english: bogus applications for asylum
sentences.chinese: 虚假的避难申请

detailed_translations.english: not true or real, although someone is trying to make you think it is

name: calvary
trans: a sculpture of the crucifixion on a piece of raised ground

name: fluster
trans: to confuse, befuddle

name: collateral
trans: parallel, along the same vein, side by side

sentences.english: There may be collateral benefits to the scheme.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划可能有附带的益处。

detailed_translations.english: relating to something or happening as a result of it, but not as important

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵押品；[法] 担保品；旁系亲属
detailed_translations.english: property or other goods that you promise to give someone if you cannot pay back the money they lend you

name: enunciate
trans: to make a definite or systematic statement of

sentences.english: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.english: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地、仔细地读着。

detailed_translations.english: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly

name: caterwaul
trans: to have a noisy argument

name: extremity
trans: the most extreme or furthest point of something

sentences.english: In spite of the extremity of her seclusion she was sane.
sentences.chinese: 尽管完全与世隔绝，她依然神智清醒。

sentences.english: In the past, the region had been protected by its forbidding geography and the extremities of its climate.
sentences.chinese: 过去，这个地区受到令人生畏的地理条件和极端的天气状况的保护。

detailed_translations.english: The extremity of a situation or of someone's behaviour is the degree to which it is severe, unusual, or unacceptable

name: gratify
trans: to give pleasure by satisfying desires, to indulge

sentences.english: He was gratified by Lucy’s response.
sentences.chinese: 他对露西的回答很满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied

name: effuse
trans: to give (a liquid, light, smell, or quality)

detailed_translations.english: to pour or flow out

name: enmity
trans: a feeling or condition of hostility, hatred, animosity

sentences.english: I think there is an historic enmity between them.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们之间存在着宿怨。

detailed_translations.english: Enmity is a feeling of hatred toward someone that lasts for a long time

name: acquisitive
trans: acquired

sentences.english: We live in an acquisitive society.
sentences.chinese: 我们活在一个贪婪的社会里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望得到的， 贪婪的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions

name: gingerly
trans: with great care or caution

sentences.english: She was touching the dressing gingerly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 她用双手小心翼翼地触摸着敷药。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something gingerly, you do it in a careful manner, usually because you expect it to be dangerous, unpleasant, or painful

name: canter
trans: to move at such pace

sentences.english: Carnac set off at a canter.
sentences.chinese: 卡纳克以慢步小跑出发了。

detailed_translations.english: Canter is also a noun
to ride or make a horse run quite fast, but not as fast as possible

name: granule
trans: a tiny grain, a small particle

sentences.english: coffee granules
sentences.chinese: 咖啡颗粒

detailed_translations.english: a small hard piece of something

name: crepuscular
trans: of or resembling twilight, dim

sentences.english: ...peering through the crepuscular gloom.
sentences.chinese: ...透过昏暗的暮色凝视。

detailed_translations.english: Crepuscular means relating to

name: distinguish
trans: to see someone or something as different from others

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: alibi
trans: an excuse, especially to avoid blame

sentences.english: He manages to persuade both his wife and girlfriend to provide him with an alibi.
sentences.chinese: 他设法说服他的妻子和女友都为他提供不在场的证明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不在场证明或辩解；托辞
detailed_translations.english: something that proves that someone was not where a crime happened and therefore could not have done it

name: exonerate
trans: to relieve (someone or something) of a load, to unburden

sentences.english: The official report basically exonerated everyone.
sentences.chinese: 该官方报告基本洗脱了所有人的干系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 证明…无罪；  免受指控
detailed_translations.english: to state officially that someone who has been blamed for something is not guilty

name: accretion
trans: growth by slow buildup

sentences.english: The script has been gathering editorial accretions for years.
sentences.chinese: 该剧本经历了多年的修改加工。

detailed_translations.chinese: 添加；增加物；连生；冲积层
detailed_translations.english: a gradual process by which new things are added and something gradually changes or gets bigger

name: accolade
trans: to embrace or kiss in salutation

sentences.english: The Nobel Prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences.
sentences.chinese: 诺贝尔奖已成为科学界的最高荣誉。

sentences.english: He won accolades as one of America's top test pilots.
sentences.chinese: 他作为美国顶级试飞员之一赢得了众多荣誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 荣誉；荣誉称号授予仪式；连谱号；称赞
detailed_translations.english: If someone is given an accolade, something is done or said about them which shows how much people admire them

name: coddle
trans: to treat in an indulgent or overprotective way

sentences.english: Don’t coddle the child – he’s fine!
sentences.chinese: 别太娇惯那孩子——他没事的！

detailed_translations.chinese: 娇养；溺爱（等于mollycoddle）；用文火煮
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone in a way that is too kind and gentle and that protects them from pain or difficulty

name: dispensation
trans: the act of dispensing or dealing out, distribution

sentences.english: They were promised dispensation from military service.
sentences.chinese: 他们被许诺将被特免不用服兵役。

detailed_translations.english: A dispensation is special permission to do something that is normally not allowed

name: corporate
trans: of, or relating to a corporation

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

name: exacerbate
trans: to increase the severity, bitterness, or violence of

sentences.english: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。

sentences.english: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation worse

name: compliment
trans: a polite expression of praise or admiration

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: expiate
trans: to atone or make reparation for

sentences.english: It seemed that Alice was expiating her father's sins with her charity work.
sentences.chinese: 看来爱丽丝要用自己的善行来赎她父亲的罪恶。

detailed_translations.english: If you expiate guilty feelings or bad behaviour, you do something to indicate that you are sorry for what you have done

name: distend
trans: to extend or expand, as from internal pressure, to swell

sentences.english: Blood vessels in the lungs are filled and distend. Capillary changes have been observed in the animal model of simulated microgravity.
sentences.chinese: 肺血管充盈、扩张，并在模拟微重力动物模型中观察到肺微血管损伤。

sentences.english: The primary role of AM is to distend blood vessel and decrease blood pressure, and it can also restrain the migration of vessel smooth muscle cells.
sentences.chinese: AM在休克发生发展过程的作用主要是扩张血管，降低血压，还具有抑制血管平滑肌细胞迁移等作用。

sentences.english: Conclusion:Nifedipine could distend ophthalmic artery and has similar function on other micro-cerebral vessels.
sentences.chinese: 结论：硝苯地平可扩张眼动脉，对脑部其它小动脉可能有相似作用。

name: ally
trans: to unite, or form a connection between

sentences.english: a meeting of the European allies
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.english: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手
detailed_translations.english: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

name: delude
trans: to deceive someone into believing something which is false

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism;
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism; both should understand that a crisis in one country can hurt the other.
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；双方都应认识到，一国的危机可以伤害到另一国。

name: evasion
trans: the act of eluding or avoiding, particularly some pressure

sentences.english: I’m tired of his lies and evasions.
sentences.chinese: 我听腻了他的谎言和托词。

detailed_translations.english: when you deliberately avoid talking about something or answering a question

name: amusement
trans: entertainment

sentences.english: Steve couldn’t hide his amusement.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: The cats are a constant source of amusement to us.
sentences.chinese: 那些猫给我们带来无穷的乐趣。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you think something is funny

name: curtsy
trans: a respectful bow made by women and girls

sentences.english: We were taught how to curtsy to the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 有人教我们如何向女王行屈膝礼。

sentences.english: She gave a curtsy.
sentences.chinese: 她行了个屈膝礼。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman curtsies, she bends her knees with one foot in front of the other as a sign of respect for an important person
Curtsy is also a noun

name: antiphony
trans: alternate, responsive singing by a two part choir

name: ailment
trans: a disease, sickness

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["minor ailments"]}
sentences.chinese: 小恙

detailed_translations.english: an illness that is not very serious

name: absolve
trans: to set free from an obligation

sentences.english: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.
sentences.chinese: 警方昨天的调查为其开脱了在这件事故中所有的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

name: enzyme
trans: a protein that catalyses a biological chemical reaction

sentences.english: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.chinese: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.english: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.chinese: 这种酶在幼虫体内积累到一定浓度，就会变得有毒并杀死它们。

sentences.english: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.chinese: 虽然表面上是这样，CYP2E1却影响着大脑对酒精的敏感度，或许因为它—不像在肝脏中的酶—产生了自由基，能损害细胞的微小分子。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal

name: alias
trans: a false name used to conceal one's identity

sentences.english: a spy operating under the alias Barsad
sentences.chinese: 一个化名巴萨德进行活动的间谍

detailed_translations.english: a false name, usually used by a criminal

name: exuberance
trans: effusively and almost uninhibitedly enthusiastic

name: filial
trans: of, pertaining to, or befitting a son or daughter

sentences.english: her filial duty
sentences.chinese: 她的孝道

detailed_translations.chinese: 孝顺的；子女的，当做子女的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the relationship of a son or daughter to their parents

name: camaraderie
trans: mutual trust and friendship among people

sentences.english: the camaraderie of the women’s basketball team
sentences.chinese: 女子篮球队的队友情谊

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship that a group of people have, especially when they work together

name: despair
trans: to give up as beyond hope or expectation, to despair of

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: credulous
trans: having or showing too great a readiness to believe things

sentences.english: Quinn charmed credulous investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 奎因花言巧语从轻信的投资者那里骗取了数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
detailed_translations.english: always believing what you are told, and therefore easily deceived

name: adulation
trans: flattery, fulsome praise

sentences.english: He basks in other people's adulation.
sentences.chinese: 他陶醉在别人的奉承中。

sentences.english: Being a multi-selling megastar hasn't always been mass adoration and adulation.
sentences.chinese: 作为多产的巨星并不总是有大众崇拜和谄媚。

sentences.english: We edit and exaggerate, we crave adulation, we pretend we don't notice the socialisolation.
sentences.chinese: 我们编辑、夸大、渴望得到奉承。我们假装没有注意到社交孤立。

detailed_translations.english: praise and admiration for someone that is more than they really deserve

name: avant-garde
trans: innovative, pioneering, especially when obviously so

name: adventitious
trans: from an external source, not innate or inherent

sentences.english: The adventitious birth of our fourth child completely changed our plan.
sentences.chinese: 第四个孩子偶然的出生，完全改变了我们的计画。

detailed_translations.english: happening by chance

name: chauvinist
trans: a person who believes one gender is superior to the other

name: encamp
trans: to build and/or inhabit a camp or temporary shelter

name: augury
trans: a divination based on the behaviour of animals

sentences.english: The auguries of death are fast gathering around his head.
sentences.chinese: 死亡的凶兆迅速展现在他的脑海中。

detailed_translations.english: An augury is a sign of what will happen in the future

name: gluttony
trans: the vice of eating to excess

name: err
trans: to make a mistake

sentences.english: It’s always best to err on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 过于谨慎永远比冒风险强。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯错；做错；犯罪；走上歧途
detailed_translations.english: to be more careful or safe than is necessary, in order to make sure that nothing bad happens

name: conduit
trans: a tube for protecting electric wiring

sentences.english: Introduce the tube into that conduit, please.
sentences.chinese: 请把电线插入那个导管内。

sentences.english: Secure the payload and base ends of the conduit using fittings removed previously.
sentences.chinese: 使用先前卸下来的配件将导管的有效负载端和底端固定住。

sentences.english: Apply a non-hardening sealant to the threads of the terminal box connection port flexible metal conduit and seal fitting for waterproofing.
sentences.chinese: 在接线盒连接口、挠性金属导管及密封件螺纹处涂上非硬化密封剂，用于防水。

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or passage through which water, gas, a set of electric wires etc passes

name: corrosive
trans: having the power of gradually wearing, or destroying matter

sentences.english: a highly corrosive substance
sentences.chinese: 一种腐蚀性很强的物质

detailed_translations.english: a corrosive liquid such as an acid can destroy metal, plastic etc

name: defray
trans: to spend (money)

sentences.english: The proceeds from the competition help to defray the expenses of the evening.
sentences.chinese: 比赛的收入帮助支付晚会的开销。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone back the money that they have spent on something

name: crestfallen
trans: sad because of a recent disappointment

sentences.english: He came back looking crestfallen .
sentences.chinese: 他回来时看上去垂头丧气的。

detailed_translations.english: looking disappointed and upset

name: emolument
trans: payment for an office or employment, compensation for a job

sentences.english: He could earn up to a million dollars a year in salary and emoluments from many directorships.
sentences.chinese: 他每年可赚高达一百万美金的薪水另加担任多个董事职位的酬金。

detailed_translations.english: Emoluments are money or other forms of payment that a person receives for doing work

name: differentiate
trans: to show, or be the distinction between two things

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: foil
trans: to prevent (something) from being accomplished

sentences.english: A massive arms-smuggling plan has been foiled by the CIA.
sentences.chinese: 一项大规模的军火走私计划已被中央情报局挫败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衬托；阻止，挡开；挫败；贴箔于
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad that someone is planning to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 箔，金属薄片；衬托，烘托；叶形片
detailed_translations.english: metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food

detailed_translations.chinese: 面向文件的翻译语言（file-Oriented interpretive language）

name: haste
trans: swiftness of motion, speed

sentences.english: Spelling mistakes are often just the result of haste.
sentences.chinese: 拼写错误经常是由于匆忙而造成的。

sentences.english: And if haste is the accelerator pedal, multitasking is overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果匆忙是加速器的踏板，一心多用就是超速档。

sentences.english: My workmate gestured, clarifying his intentions of using a forged(faked) passport in haste.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事打着手势，匆忙地解释着他使用假护照的意图。

detailed_translations.chinese: 匆忙， 急速； 草率
detailed_translations.english: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

name: dirge
trans: a funeral song or tune, expressing mourning for the dead

name: forbid
trans: to command not to do something, have something, etc

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: foot-note
trans: an explanatory or documenting note at the bottom of a page

name: dominance
trans: power and influence over others

sentences.english: The latest fighting appears to be an attempt by each group to establish dominance over the other.
sentences.chinese: 最近的战斗似乎是冲突各方在试图争夺控制权。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being more powerful, more important, or more noticeable than other people or things

name: decamp
trans: to break up camp and move on

detailed_translations.chinese: 离营； 匆忙秘密地离开

name: guile
trans: insidious cunning in attaining a goal, artful deception

sentences.english: With a little guile she might get what she wanted.
sentences.chinese: 她略施小计，也许就能得到自己想要的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the use of clever but dishonest methods to deceive someone

name: cite
trans: to quote

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: creamery
trans: a place where dairy products are prepared or sold

name: faun
trans: mythical woodland creature with pointed ears and short horns

name: bard
trans: a poet, often one who plays an instrument

sentences.english: Gnomeo and Juliet is directed and co-written by animation veteran Kelly Asbury, who makes no apologies to William Shakespeare or to the bard's, perhaps, most malleable tale.
sentences.chinese: 《格诺米欧和朱丽叶》的导演兼编剧是动漫老手凯利.阿斯博瑞，他对莎翁和古代的吟游诗人没有一丝愧疚之情，这大概是最具改编潜力的故事了。

detailed_translations.english: a poet

name: convolve
trans: to roll or coil together, entwine

name: eschew
trans: to abstain or keep away from, shun, avoid

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

name: egotist
trans: a person who talks excessively about himself

detailed_translations.chinese: 自私自利者； 自我主义者
detailed_translations.english: someone who likes to talk about how great and important they think they are

name: doff
trans: to remove a hat as a greeting or mark of respect

sentences.english: The peasants doff their hats.
sentences.chinese: 农夫们脱去他们的帽子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the hat you are wearing as a sign of respect

name: attest
trans: to affirm to be correct, true, or genuine

sentences.english: Police records attest to his long history of violence.
sentences.chinese: 警方记录证明他有长期的暴力史。

detailed_translations.english: to show or prove that something is true

name: aquatic
trans: relating to water

sentences.english: an aquatic plant
sentences.chinese: 水生植物

detailed_translations.chinese: 水生的；水栖的；在水中或水面进行的
detailed_translations.english: living or growing in water

detailed_translations.chinese: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

name: grate
trans: to shred things, usually food, by rubbing across a grater

sentences.english: grated cheese
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的干酪

sentences.english: Peel and grate the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯削皮磨碎。

detailed_translations.english: to rub cheese, vegetables etc against a rough or sharp surface in order to break them into small pieces
the metal bars and frame that hold the wood, coal etc in a  fireplace

name: brimstone
trans: about or pertaining to hell

name: cycloid
trans: resembling a circle, cyclical

name: competence
trans: the quality or state of being competent, able

sentences.english: Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.
sentences.chinese: 大多数雇主认为打字是一项基本技能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入
detailed_translations.english: the ability to do something well

name: enlighten
trans: to supply with light, to illuminate

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: concurrence
trans: agreement, concurring

name: clamor
trans: a loud and confused noise

sentences.english: On weekdays, the marmosets steered clear of the roar of traffic, and on Sundays they shunned the clamor of visiting crowds.
sentences.chinese: 工作日的时候，这些狨猴避开嘈杂的交通，星期天的时候它们就会避开喧闹的游客。

name: atrophy
trans: to wither or waste away

sentences.english: If you don't exercise your muscles, they weaken and atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果不锻炼你的肌肉，肌力就削弱和萎缩了。

sentences.english: If compassion can only be activated by sustained attention, which is prevented by fast-cut editing, then the ability to be genuinely moved by another’s story could atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果只能通过持续的关注激活同情心，而这种关注又受到快速切断编辑的阻碍，那么，被他人的故事真正打动的能力就会萎缩。

sentences.english: The compounds "likely have an effecton motor neurons"—responsible for controlling movements—"but that isa hunch at present, based on the type of atrophy we saw, " Hughes said inan email.
sentences.chinese: 这些化合物“可能对运动神经元（负责控制运动）产生作用”----“根据我们观察到的萎缩症类型，目前这只是个预测，”休斯在一封电子邮件中说。

name: aeronaut
trans: one who glides through the air in an airship or balloon

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞船或气球驾驶员；飞船或气球乘客

name: emissary
trans: a person sent on a special mission

sentences.english: Japan is sending two emissaries to Washington to discuss trade issues.
sentences.chinese: 日本将派两位特使去华盛顿商讨贸易问题。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sent with an official message or to do official work

name: blemish
trans: spoil the appearance of

sentences.english: Every piece is closely scrutinized, and if there is the slightest blemish on it, it is rejected.
sentences.chinese: 每一件都经过仔细检查，如果上面有哪怕最微小的瑕疵，都会被拒绝。

detailed_translations.english: a small mark, especially a mark on someone’s skin or on the surface of an object, that spoils its appearance
to spoil the beauty or appearance of something, so that it is not perfect

name: compunction
trans: a pricking of conscience or a feeling of regret

sentences.english: They used their tanks against the leftists without compunction .
sentences.chinese: 他们肆无忌惮地使用坦克来对付左派人士。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you should not do something because it is bad or wrong

name: amply
trans: abundantly

name: foppish
trans: like a fop, a man overly concerned with his appearance

detailed_translations.chinese: 纨绔子弟的； 浮华的， 俗丽的

name: glorious
trans: attributes, qualities, or acts that are worthy of glory

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: anemia
trans: a medical condition of too little hemoglobin

sentences.english: Interference with the normal production of heme or globin leads to anemia.
sentences.chinese: 血红素或球蛋白的正常产生收到干扰会导致贫血。

sentences.english: Perhaps the present concern with the values of liberal arts education portends an intellectual anemia.
sentences.chinese: 现在关心大学文科教育的重要性也许意味着患了智力贫血症。

name: caucus
trans: to hold or form such a group or meeting

sentences.english: ...the Black Caucus of minority congressmen.
sentences.chinese: …由少数派国会议员组成的黑人核心组织。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干部会议；核心会议；党团会议
detailed_translations.english: a meeting of the members of a political party to choose people to represent them in a larger meeting, election etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 召开干部会议；开核心会议

name: denomination
trans: the act of naming or designating

sentences.english: Christians of all denominations
sentences.chinese: 各教派的基督徒

detailed_translations.english: a religious group that has different beliefs from other groups within the same religion

name: captivate
trans: attract and hold interest and attention of, charm

sentences.english: I was captivated by her brilliant mind.
sentences.chinese: 我为她的聪慧所迷。

detailed_translations.english: to attract someone very much, and hold their attention

name: efficacious
trans: effective

sentences.english: an equally efficacious method of treatment
sentences.chinese: 同样有效的治疗方法

detailed_translations.english: working in the way you intended

name: felicity
trans: happiness, especially to a high degree

sentences.english: domestic felicity
sentences.chinese: 家庭幸福

detailed_translations.english: happiness

name: gastric
trans: of or relating to the stomach

sentences.english: gastric ulcers
sentences.chinese: 胃溃疡

detailed_translations.english: relating to your stomach

name: contumely
trans: insolent or insulting language or treatment

name: ensconce
trans: to place in a secure environment

sentences.english: ensconced in a chair

detailed_translations.english: to establish or settle firmly or comfortably

name: appease
trans: pacify or placate

sentences.english: Gandhi was accused by some of trying to appease both factions of the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 甘地被一些人指责试图对两派选民都加以姑息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使平息；使满足；使和缓；对…让步
detailed_translations.english: If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them from being angry by giving them what they want

name: floridness
trans: the quality of being florid

name: disinterested
trans: having no stake or interest in the outcome, free of bias

sentences.english: A lawyer should provide disinterested advice.
sentences.chinese: 律师应该提供客观公正的建议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无私的；公正的；冷漠的；廉洁的
detailed_translations.english: able to judge a situation fairly because you are not concerned with gaining any personal advantage from it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使不再有利害关系；使无兴趣（disinterest的过去分词）

name: equipoise
trans: an equal distribution of weight, even balance, equilibrium

sentences.english: Are we at some kind of evolutionary equipoise as a species?
sentences.chinese: 我们是否已经处于进化上的平衡， 作为一个物种？

sentences.english: Store control is a core course in logistics system, it can adjust and equipoise the manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 库存管理是物流系统的一个中心环节，起着缓冲、调节和平衡的作用。

detailed_translations.english: even balance of weight or other forces; equilibrium

name: courser
trans: a person who hunts with dogs using sight rather than scent

name: cursory
trans: hasty and therefore not thorough or detailed

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: discomfort
trans: to cause annoyance or distress

sentences.english: Some people use marijuana to fight pain or discomfort caused by disease.
sentences.chinese: 有些人使用大麻来对抗疾病引起的疼痛或不适。

sentences.english: Happily, there was no apparent discomfort to any of the animals, although therewere some changes in pigmentation and superficial damage to the skin.
sentences.chinese: 令人高兴的是，虽然有某些色素沉着的改变和皮肤表面的损伤，这些动物没有出现明显的不适。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of slight pain or of being physically uncomfortable

name: cryptogram
trans: a message or writing in code or cipher

name: enormity
trans: greatness of size, scope, extent, or influence, immensity

sentences.english: I was numbed by the enormity of the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我对责任的艰巨性感到不知所措。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极恶； 暴行； 巨大

name: diatomic
trans: consisting of two atoms

name: dissuasion
trans: the act or an instance of persuading against

name: disquietude
trans: a state of uneasiness or anxiety

name: deciduous
trans: falling off or shed at a particular season, point of growth

sentences.english: Deciduous antlers; deciduous leaves; deciduous teeth .
sentences.chinese: 脱落的鹿角；落叶；脱落的牙齿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非永久的； 短暂的； 脱落的； 落叶的
detailed_translations.english: deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter

name: bravado
trans: a swaggering show of defiance or courage

sentences.english: youthful bravado
sentences.chinese: 年轻人的逞强行为

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is deliberately intended to make other people believe you are brave and confident

name: contrite
trans: feeling or expressing remorse or penitence

sentences.english: a contrite apology
sentences.chinese: 深感悔悟的道歉

detailed_translations.english: feeling guilty and sorry for something bad that you have done

name: contumelious
trans: (of behavior) scornful and insulting, insolent

name: bombastic
trans: ostentatiously lofty in style

sentences.english: He was vain and bombastic.
sentences.chinese: 他既虚荣又浮夸。

sentences.english: ...the bombastic style adopted by his predecessor.
sentences.chinese: …他的前任采取的浮夸方式。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as bombastic, you are criticizing them for trying to impress other people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning

name: cozen
trans: to cheat, deceive or trick

detailed_translations.english: to trick or deceive someone

name: coagulate
trans: to become congealed

sentences.english: The blood had not coagulated.
sentences.chinese: 血未凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid coagulates, or something coagulates it, it becomes thick and almost solid

name: envenom
trans: to make poisonous

name: felicitate
trans: to congratulate, to compliment upon a happy event

sentences.english: Japan should felicitate the opening of branches of Japanese vessel building industries along the Indian docks and port.
sentences.chinese: 日本该庆祝印度港口里日本造船分厂的开设。

detailed_translations.english: to wish joy to; congratulate

name: aloof
trans: reserved and remote, physically or emotionally distant

sentences.english: Beneath that aloof exterior, Gayle is a warm, sympathetic person.
sentences.chinese: 在冷漠的外表下，盖尔是个有同情心的热心人。

detailed_translations.english: unfriendly and deliberately not talking to other people

name: assimilate
trans: to take in and incorporate as one's own

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: apathy
trans: complete lack of emotion or motivation about something

sentences.english: The campaign failed because of public apathy.
sentences.chinese: 由于公众反应冷淡，这次运动失败了。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of not being interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things

name: caustic
trans: capable of destroying or eating away by chemical action

sentences.english: caustic soda (= a chemical used for cleaning things )
sentences.chinese: 苛性钠，烧碱

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 腐蚀性的；[化学] 苛性的；刻薄的；焦散的
detailed_translations.english: a caustic substance can burn through things by chemical action

detailed_translations.chinese: [助剂] 腐蚀剂；苛性钠；焦散曲线

name: extricate
trans: to free, disengage, loosen, or untangle

sentences.english: It represents a last-ditch attempt by the country to extricate itself from its economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 这是该国摆脱经济危机的最后一搏。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a difficult or embarrassing situation, or to help someone escape

name: antiseptic
trans: of, or relating to antisepsis, or the use of antiseptics

sentences.english: The antiseptic properties of copper sulphate have never been questioned.
sentences.chinese: 硫酸铜具有防腐性，这是不曾有过问题的。

sentences.english: Polyurethane is a kind of excellent anticorrosion material, material has excellent antiseptic effect on metal substrate.
sentences.chinese: 聚胺又是一种优良的防腐材料，对金属底材具有优异的防腐作用。

sentences.english: Don't just give money, go volunteer somewhere so you can have direct interactions with people. Your life is too antiseptic and it is making you a bit boring.
sentences.chinese: 不要只是捐钱，去某个地方做志愿者吧，这样你就可以和别人直接互动。你的生活太“防腐”了，你开始觉得有点无聊了吧。

detailed_translations.english: a medicine that you put onto a wound to stop it from becoming infected

name: capillary
trans: of or pertaining to hair

sentences.english: When air cools at night, dew collects on the lizard’s skin and is pulled to its mouth by capillary action.
sentences.chinese: 待晚间空气温度下降，凝结在蜥蜴皮肤上的露珠就可以通过毛细管作用输送到它的口中。

sentences.english: On one side of the sheet, blood-vessel cells mimic a capillary wall; on the other, lung-cancer cells mimic lung epithelial cells.
sentences.chinese: 在这张图的上边，血管壁细胞模仿毛细血管，，在另一边，模拟肺癌细胞的肺上皮细胞。

sentences.english: One study published in 2007 on the cosmetic benefit of drinking water suggests that 500 ml of water increases capillary blood flow in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 2007年公布的一项饮用水的美容效益研究表明，饮用500毫升的水可加快皮肤下毛细血管内的血液流动。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest type of  blood vessel (= tube carrying blood )  in the body

name: caste
trans: any hereditary social class of south asian societies

sentences.english: the caste system
sentences.chinese: 种姓制度

detailed_translations.chinese: （印度社会中的）种姓；（具有严格等级差别的）社会地位；（排他的）社会团体
detailed_translations.english: one of the fixed social classes, which cannot be changed, into which people are born in India

name: concede
trans: to yield or suffer, to surrender, to grant (a point)

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: disagree
trans: to not agree (harmonize)

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

name: enervate
trans: to deprive of force or strength, weaken

sentences.english: The hot sun enervated her to the point of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 热辣辣的太阳把她晒得快要晕过去了。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive of strength or vitality; weaken physically or mentally; debilitate
deprived of strength or vitality; weakened

name: divulgence
trans: the act of making known (private or sensitive information)

name: brackish
trans: salty or slightly salty, as a mixture of fresh and sea water

sentences.english: Any of numerous small fishes of the family Cyprinodontidae, including the guppy and mosquito fish, inhabiting chiefly fresh and brackish waters in warm regions.
sentences.chinese: 鳉鱼属于鳉科的许多种小型鱼，包括虹鳉和蚊鱼，主要栖居在温暖地带的淡水和咸水中。

sentences.english: Israel extracts about 65% of the upper Jordan , leaving the occupied West Bank dependent on a brackish trickle and a mountain aquifer , access to which Israel also controls .
sentences.chinese: 以色列提取出约旦河上游约65%的水源，使供水中的约旦河西岸依赖于一条咸水细流和山脉地下蓄水层，其入口仍为以色列控制。

detailed_translations.english: brackish water is not pure because it is slightly salty

name: coalesce
trans: to grow together or into one body

sentences.english: As the number of moisture droplets increases, they begin to coalesce into small rivulets of fluid.
sentences.chinese: 当水滴数量增加，它们会汇集成细流。

detailed_translations.english: if objects or ideas coalesce, they combine to form one single group

name: gallant
trans: brave, valiant

sentences.english: a gallant attempt to save lives
sentences.chinese: 救人的勇敢之举

detailed_translations.chinese: 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的
detailed_translations.english: brave

name: gregarious
trans: fond of the company of others, sociable

sentences.english: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentences.chinese: 她就是这样一个爱社交而且外向的人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and preferring to be with other people

name: erudite
trans: characterized by great knowledge, learned or scholarly

sentences.english: There’s also the intrinsic pleasure you get from boosting your knowledge and becoming more erudite.
sentences.chinese: 这也有利于你发自内心地努力奋进获得更多学识变得更博学。

sentences.english: The supreme symbol for the author is the word; the erudite Hirst in The Voyage Out has the forename St John recalling the evangelist whose opening line was ‘In the beginning was the Word’.
sentences.chinese: 文字是作家最有力的表达符号，《远航》中博学的赫斯特的教名为圣·约翰，取自感召福音的传教士之名。 他在小说中的开场白为：“语言是世界的初始”。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study

name: context
trans: the circumstances that form the setting of an idea

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: frisson
trans: a sudden surge of excitement, shudder of emotion, thrill

name: derive
trans: to deduce (a conclusion) by reasoning

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: antechamber
trans: a small room used as an entryway area to a larger room

name: consignor
trans: the person who sends the shipment

name: evasive
trans: tending to avoid making revelations about oneself

sentences.english: an evasive reply
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可的答复

detailed_translations.english: not willing to answer questions directly

name: curt
trans: brief or terse, especially to the point of being rude

sentences.english: With a curt nod, he turned away and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 他简慢地点点头就转身坐下了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的
(Curt)人名；(法)屈尔；(英)柯特；(德、西、芬、罗、瑞典)库尔特

name: devise
trans: to use one's intellect to plan or design (something)

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: boycott
trans: to abstain, either as an individual or group

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: gradient
trans: an inclined surface, grade, ramp

sentences.english: a steep gradient
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope or a degree of slope, especially in a road or railway

name: floe
trans: a low, flat mass of floating ice

sentences.english: Two crew members parachuted on to a larger floe, and then crawled on their bellies to reach him.
