sentences.chinese: 两名搜救成员用降落伞落到一块更大的浮冰上，然后匍匐着去够他。

sentences.english: A lone Atlantic walrus rests on what looks to be an undersized ice floe amid a glassy sea in Canada's Foxe Basin.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大福克斯湾平静的海面，一头孤独的大西洋海象在一块较小的浮冰上休息。

detailed_translations.english: an  ice floe

name: escalate
trans: to increase (something) in extent or intensity, intensify

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: comely
trans: (woman) pleasant to look at, agreeable

sentences.english: With his gentle eyes and comely smile, he still leaves a sense of fortitude for his delicate nose and thin lips.
sentences.chinese: 他目光柔和，笑容清秀，精致的鼻子和薄薄的嘴唇却给人一种坚毅的感觉。

sentences.english: Lin jiaxin belongs to temperament melting model belle bingle lets her look resemble a false boy complaisant straight hair can foil more those who give her is melting and comely!
sentences.chinese: 林嘉欣属于气质甜美型的美女，短发让她看上去像个假小子，柔顺的直发更能衬托出她的甜美清秀！

detailed_translations.english: a comely woman is attractive

name: afflict
trans: to distress with mental/bodily pain

detailed_translations.english: to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

name: arcane
trans: known or understood by very few

sentences.english: the arcane language of the law
sentences.chinese: 晦涩难懂的法律语言

detailed_translations.english: secret and known or understood by only a few people

name: factionalism
trans: the splitting of a group into factions

name: cataclysm
trans: a sudden, violent event

sentences.english: In The Possessed the earth quakes: it is not the catastrophe that befalls the imaginative individual, but a cataclysm in which a large portion of humanity is buried, wiped out forever.
sentences.chinese: 在《魔鬼》中发生了地震，这不仅是降临在富于想象力的人头上的大灾难，而是一大半人类被埋葬于其中、永远被消灭的大地震。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难； 大洪水；  大变动
detailed_translations.english: a violent or sudden event or change, such as a serious flood or  earthquake

name: covey
trans: a small group of people or things

name: fetid
trans: having an offensive odor, stinking

sentences.english: the black fetid water of the lake
sentences.chinese: 又黑又臭的湖水

sentences.english: the dog’s fetid breath
sentences.chinese: 那条狗呼出的臭气

detailed_translations.english: having a strong bad smell

name: collage
trans: a work of art, made from assembling different items into one

sentences.english: ...a collage of words and pictures from magazines.
sentences.chinese: …用杂志上的词语和图片做成的拼贴画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抽象拚贴画（用报纸、布、压平的花等碎片拼合而成的）
detailed_translations.english: a picture made by sticking other pictures, photographs, cloth etc onto a surface

name: angelic
trans: belonging to, resembling, or proceeding from, angels

sentences.english: She had an angelic smile, but a dreadful temper.
sentences.chinese: 她笑起来像个天使，但脾气很可怕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天使的；似天使的；天国的
detailed_translations.english: looking good, kind, and gentle or behaving in this way

name: debris
trans: rubble, wreckage, scattered remains of something destroyed

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: abeyance
trans: temporary inactivity

sentences.english: The question is in abeyance until we know more about it.
sentences.chinese: 问题暂时搁置，直到我们了解更多有关情况''。

sentences.english: The abbot was taken aback and could not abide her abeyance .
sentences.chinese: 男修道院院长很吃惊并且不能忍受她的中止。

detailed_translations.english: something such as a custom, rule, or system that is in abeyance is not being used at the present time

name: decapod
trans: having ten legs

name: fiat
trans: an authoritative command or order, an effectual decree

sentences.english: He has tried to impose solutions to the country's problems by fiat.
sentences.chinese: 他已经试图采取强制性法令来解决该国的问题。

detailed_translations.english: an official order given by someone in a position of authority, without considering what other people want

name: arbiter
trans: a person empowered to make decisions

sentences.english: The European Court of Justice will be the final arbiter (=  make the final decision  ) in the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲法庭将对这宗争端作出最终裁决。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that settles an argument between two opposing sides

name: deferential
trans: respectful, reverential

sentences.english: They like five-star hotels and deferential treatment.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢五星级酒店和谦恭的礼遇。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is deferential is polite and respectful toward someone else

name: fraudulence
trans: characterized by, involving, or proceeding from fraud

name: bide
trans: (chiefly dialectal) to bear, to endure, to tolerate

sentences.english: They are stronger than us and can afford to bide their time.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我们有实力，可以耐心等待时机。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until the right moment to do something

name: boon
trans: a thing that is helpful or beneficial

sentences.english: It is for this reason that television proves such a boon to so many people.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个原因电视机成为这么多人的一大福音。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone

name: convalescent
trans: recovering one's health and strength after illness

sentences.english: ...an officers' convalescent home.
sentences.chinese: ...一个军官疗养院。

detailed_translations.chinese: 康复中的 recovering from illness)
detailed_translations.english: Convalescent means relating to convalescence

name: abstinence
trans: voluntary forbearance esp. from indulgence of an appetite

sentences.english: ...six months of abstinence.
sentences.chinese: …6个月的禁欲。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health

name: harmonious
trans: marked by agreement in feeling, attitude, or action

sentences.english: The decor is a harmonious blend of traditional and modern.
sentences.chinese: 这种装饰风格是传统与现代的和谐统一。

detailed_translations.english: arranged together in a pleasing way so that each part goes well with the others

name: disinherit
trans: to exclude from inheritance, to disown

name: feckless
trans: ineffective, incompetent, futile

sentences.english: Alice’s feckless younger brother
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯那个没出息的弟弟

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的；软弱的；没精神的；不负责任的；无气力的
detailed_translations.english: lacking determination, and not achieving anything in your life

name: beck
trans: a stream or small river

detailed_translations.english: (in N England) a stream, esp a swiftly flowing one

name: contributor
trans: a benefactor, someone who donates to charity or some cause

sentences.english: campaign contributors
sentences.chinese: 竞选捐助人

name: eclipse
trans: the complete or partial interception of light from a star

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

name: grandiose
trans: large and impressive, in size, scope or extent

sentences.english: The lack of such leaders may also be the hallmark of a largely post-ideological era in which far less need is felt for unifying doctrines or the grandiose figures who provide them.
sentences.chinese: 这种领袖人物的缺乏可能也是一个大后意识形态时代的重要象征，在这个时代，人们更少需要一个统一的教义或是一个提供给大众的浮夸形象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宏伟的；堂皇的；浮夸的；宏大的
detailed_translations.english: grandiose plans sound very important or impressive, but are not practical

name: arbitrary
trans: random, not based on reason or system

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: cosset
trans: to care for and protect in an overindulgent way

sentences.english: He cosseted her with flowers and champagne.
sentences.chinese: 他用鲜花和香槟向她大献殷勤。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone as much care and attention as you can, especially too much

name: canine
trans: of, or pertaining to, a dog or dogs

sentences.english: canine diseases
sentences.chinese: 犬类疾病

sentences.english: her loyal canine friend
sentences.chinese: 她那忠实的狗朋友

detailed_translations.chinese: 犬的；犬齿的；犬科的；似犬的
detailed_translations.english: relating to dogs
one of the four sharp pointed teeth in the front of your mouth

name: annunciation
trans: the act of announcing something

name: contumacious
trans: stubbornly or willfully disobedient to authority

sentences.english: There is another efficacious method for subduing the most obstinate, contumacious sinner.
sentences.chinese: 有另一个有效的方法来镇压那最为顽固、抗命不从的罪人。

name: equanimity
trans: mental or emotional stability or composure, calmness

sentences.english: He received the news with surprising equanimity.
sentences.chinese: 他得到消息时显得异常镇静。

detailed_translations.english: calmness in the way that you react to things, which means that you do not become upset or annoyed

name: bridle
trans: part of the harness of a horse, consisting of bit and reins

sentences.english: The metal mouthpiece of a bridle, serving to control, curb, and direct an animal.
sentences.chinese: 马勒， 嚼子放在嘴里的金属制马勒，用于控制约束和驾御牲畜。

sentences.english: Inadvertently the paper added a comma to the ad, which read instead:Horse, saddle and bridle for $50.
sentences.chinese: 无意中报纸在广告语中加了个逗号，读起来成这样了，50元卖马，马鞍和马缰绳。

sentences.english: These included a saddle, bridle, clay vase, wooden bowl, trough, iron kettle, the remains of an entire horse, and ancient clothing.
sentences.chinese: 这些物品包括一个鞍，缰绳，黏土花瓶，木碗，饲料槽，铁壶，一整匹马的遗骸以及一件古老的衣服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上笼头； 昂首 ； 抑制
detailed_translations.english: to put a bridle on a horse
a set of leather bands put around a horse’s head and used to control its movements

name: candid
trans: free from prejudice, impartial

sentences.english: It struck me as an unusually candid confession for a politician.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这对一个政治家来说是非常坦率的告白了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公正的；坦白的；率直的；偷拍的
detailed_translations.english: telling the truth, even when the truth may be unpleasant or embarrassing

name: equitable
trans: characterized by equity or fairness, fair, reasonable

sentences.english: an equitable distribution of food supplies
sentences.chinese: 所供应食品的合理分配

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；平衡法的
detailed_translations.english: treating all people in a fair and equal way

name: bandy
trans: to give and receive reciprocally, to exchange

name: congest
trans: to overfill or overcrowd

name: charisma
trans: personal charm or magnetism

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

name: anathema
trans: a person or thing detested or loathed

sentences.english: Campbell summed up by saying that nutrition is holistic, a concept which is “anathema” to most scientists’ method.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔总结说，营养是全面的，这个概念是对大多数科学家的方法的“诅咒”。

sentences.english: Naturally, these views are anathema to modern Austrians in the tradition of Murray Rothbard, who think the central bank should be abolished.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些观点是对罗斯巴德一派的现代奥地利学派的诅咒，因为奥地利学派认为中央银行必须取消。

name: expulsion
trans: the act of driving out or expelling

sentences.english: The headmaster threatened the boys with expulsion.
sentences.chinese: 校长警告这几名男生说要开除他们。

detailed_translations.english: the act of forcing someone to leave a place

name: consign
trans: to transfer to the custody of for sale, transport, etc.

detailed_translations.chinese: 交付；托运；寄存；把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere, especially in order to sell it

name: arrear
trans: work to be done, obligation

detailed_translations.chinese: 欠款，逾期债款；待完成的工作

name: atrocious
trans: frightful, evil, cruel or monstrous

sentences.english: The judge said he had committed atrocious crimes against women.
sentences.chinese: 该法官称他对妇女犯下了残暴的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's behaviour or their actions as atrocious, you mean that it is unacceptable because it is extremely violent or cruel

name: contiguity
trans: contact or proximity

name: genital
trans: of, or relating to biological reproduction

name: euphonious
trans: pleasant-sounding, agreeable to the ear

sentences.english: The sound of whistle is euphonious , emotional, and melodic.
sentences.chinese: 口哨的音色悦耳动听，抒情性极强，极富歌唱性。

sentences.english: By accident, some sweet and euphonious proverbs made her obsessed with language learning.
sentences.chinese: 一个偶然的机会，一些美妙悦耳的谚语使她迷恋上了语言学习。

sentences.english: “The music wasn’t bad,” Kathy replied. “I thought the violin and the piano produced a euphonious combination.”
sentences.chinese: “音乐还不错，”凯西回答，“我觉得小提琴和钢琴演奏出了悦耳的合音。”

detailed_translations.english: denoting or relating to euphony; pleasing to the ear

name: gaunt
trans: lean, angular, and bony

sentences.english: the old man’s gaunt face
sentences.chinese: 老人那瘦削的脸庞

detailed_translations.english: very thin and pale, especially because of illness or continued worry

name: fruition
trans: the fulfillment of something worked for

sentences.english: After months of hard work, our plans finally came to fruition .
sentences.chinese: 经过几个月的艰苦工作，我们的计划终于完成了。

sentences.english: The essentials of the reward system in science are "peer recognition" of scientists fruition of originality.
sentences.chinese: 科学奖励的实质是对科学家独创性成就的“同行承认”。

sentences.english: You'll learn whether or not you enjoy the work as well as improve your professional record for seeing things to fruition.
sentences.chinese: 你不仅可以知道自己是否喜欢这份工作，也可以因为完成任务而提高你的职业记录。

detailed_translations.english: if a plan, project etc comes to fruition, it is successfully put into action and completed, often after a long process

name: galvanic
trans: of or pertaining to galvanism, electric

name: drainage
trans: a removal of surface and sub-surface water from a given area

sentences.english: A handful of pebbles in the bottom of a flowerpot will help drainage.
sentences.chinese: 在花盆底下放一把鹅卵石能够帮助排水。

sentences.english: a plan to improve the town’s drainage system
sentences.chinese: 改善城里排水系统的计划

detailed_translations.english: the process or system by which water or waste liquid flows away

name: detritus
trans: waste or debris of any kind

sentences.english: In the distance, the detritus of a century of oil exploration lines the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 在远方地平线上，矗立着一个世纪以来开采石油产生的碎石堆。

sentences.english: We have emptied the bus of all our detritus.
sentences.chinese: 我们把所有零碎东西从巴士上清理下来。

sentences.english: Indeed, once this detritus of our ignorant past has been cleared away, we might see more clearly the nature of good, and pursue it aright at last.
sentences.chinese: 的确，一旦当我们这些琐碎的无知正为过去，我们将看到更加清晰的自然地面目，并且永远追随正确的步伐。

detailed_translations.english: pieces of waste that remain after something has been broken up or used

name: altruism
trans: regard for others, both natural and moral, kindness

sentences.english: Many choose to work in developing countries out of altruism.
sentences.chinese: 许多人无私地选择在发展中国家工作。

detailed_translations.english: when you care about or help other people, even though this brings no advantage to yourself

name: disperse
trans: to scatter in different directions

sentences.english: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分散， 赶散； 消散， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: cabal
trans: a secret political clique or faction

sentences.english: He had been chosen by a cabal of fellow senators.
sentences.chinese: 他被参议员同伴们选入了一个政治阴谋小集团。

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋（尤指政治上的）；阴谋集团
detailed_translations.english: a small group of people who make secret plans, especially in order to have political power

name: attain

trans: having exact and discernible limits or form

sentences.chinese: 爱抱怨的倔老头

sentences.english: an intellectual colossus like Leonardo
sentences.chinese: 像列奥纳多这样的智慧巨人

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is extremely big or extremely important

trans: to join, to combine

sentences.english: The wisdom of the retired generals and anti-war protesters conjoins.
sentences.chinese: 退役将军们和反战示威者们的智慧相结合。

detailed_translations.english: to join together, or to make things or people do this

trans: a situation requiring a choice between undesirable options

sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

trans: to disappear into a mist or dissipate in vapor

trans: likely to change, casually changeable

name: dislocate
trans: to put something out of its usual place

sentences.chinese: 踢足球时我的肩膀脱了臼。

name: divertible
trans: capable of being diverted

trans: the action or process of talking about something

trans: native or inhabitant of england prior to the norman conquest

sentences.chinese: 但研究所潘教授在大火中不幸辞世，潘教授的手写笔记在大火中消失。

sentences.english: Introduce:Zong Tianbao holds a post the scientific garden conflagration of the member that convoy, his sacrifice oneself saved female researcher Gao Yu.
sentences.chinese: 简介：宗天保任职护卫员的科学园大火，他舍身救了女研究员高玉。

name: bustle
trans: to move busily and energetically with fussiness

sentences.english: My mother bustled around the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里忙得团团转。

trans: a person's behavior or manners

sentences.chinese: 他的举止很有风度。

sentences.chinese: 这个礼仪规范包括信念、伦理、礼貌、举止、社会行为、礼仪和治国之道。

name: deity
trans: a god or goddess, divine status

sentences.chinese: 古希腊诸神

detailed_translations.english: a god or  goddess

name: appraise
trans: to assess the value or quality of

sentences.chinese: 绿色和平组织已受邀评估这样一次行动对环境的影响。

name: byline

sentences.english: The thesis topic, some containing subtitle. Topic is under the byline, signed prior to or below a line the school, hospital, Department, grade.
sentences.chinese: 论文题目，有的含副标题。题目之下是作者署名，署名之前或下边一行写作者的校、院、系、年级。

detailed_translations.english: A byline is a line at the top of an article in a newspaper or magazine giving the author's name

name: auriferous
trans: containing or producing gold, gold-bearing

name: forecastle
trans: a raised part of the upper deck at the front of a ship

trans: a legal officer, similar to a sheriff or deputy

sentences.chinese: 法院法警说，陪审员不想在宣判之前接受新闻媒体采访。

detailed_translations.english: an official of the legal system who watches prisoners and keeps order in a court of law

trans: to turn attention

sentences.chinese: 专家表示，该计划有望打破传统的“一刀切”式的广告播放模式。

sentences.english: For your viewing pleasure we have included a video clip of a Japanese advert for this abomination.
sentences.chinese: 我们剪辑了一段日本广告的视频让您在视觉上感受这份深恶痛绝。

sentences.english: This staggeringly offensive advert is attracting outrage on both the Chinese and wider web, with users blasting it for being racist.
sentences.chinese: 这则令人吃惊的攻击性广告，被认为带为严重的种族歧视，引起了国内外各大媒体的愤怒。

an advertisement

name: cynical

sentences.chinese: 一个新兴的共和国

sentences.chinese: 我们期望云相关的喋喋不休的喧闹在明年的这个时候变成真正的咆哮。

name: espouse

sentences.english: She ran away with him to Mexico and espoused the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 她与他一起逃到了墨西哥，支持革命事业。

trans: a precise description

trans: a shady sitting place, usually in a park or garden

trans: intended or likely to placate or pacify

sentences.chinese: 布鲁克斯不想作出和解。

sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.english: his disregard for her feelings
sentences.chinese: 他对她情感的忽略

when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

name: fictitious

sentences.chinese: 杜撰的地址

sentences.english: fictitious characters

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚构的；假想的；编造的；假装的

sentences.chinese: 迷人的微笑

sentences.chinese: …销售秘密武器所得收益的非法转移。

sentences.english: The party will make a pleasant diversion.

sentences.chinese: 有条件的接受

sentences.chinese: 解读目前紧张的医患关系是一个迫切的社会课题。

sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

sentences.chinese: 被告证词中的明显矛盾

name: calvish
trans: like a calf, stupid

trans: capable of making mistakes or being wrong

sentences.chinese: 人孰无过。

sentences.english: These surveys are often a rather fallible guide to public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这些调查往往会对舆论产生误导。

detailed_translations.english: able to make mistakes or be wrong

trans: the art or science of cultivating the ground

sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

trans: the process of burning something

sentences.chinese: 能量通过点火柴燃烧释放出来。

sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

sentences.chinese: 总部位于莫斯科的卡巴斯基实验室许久以来就是吸引俄罗斯年轻计算机英才的一块磁石，诱使他们远离自己平常的黑客特长，转而从事病毒分析。

sentences.english: His forte is on the operations”, says Ashok Kumar, an analyst at Rodman &Renshaw LLC, in a Bloomberg Television interview
sentences.chinese: “他的长处是运营”，在彭博电视采访中一名Rodman &Renshaw 公司的分析员Ashok Kumar曾说过。

name: bestow

sentences.chinese: 美国授予了二战期间的英国首相温斯顿·丘吉尔爵士荣誉公民的称号。

name: extrude

sentences.english: These crystals are then embedded in a plastic, and the plastic is extruded as a wire.
sentences.chinese: 然后将这些晶体嵌入一块塑料，再把这块塑料挤压成线。

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

name: confront
trans: to stand or meet facing, to oppose, to challenge

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

name: discolor
trans: to change or lose color

name: concession
trans: a thing that is granted, esp. in response to demands

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: assonant

name: domicile
trans: a home or residence

sentences.english: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
sentences.chinese: 服兵役需要频繁更换住所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 住宅；永久居住地；期票支付场所
detailed_translations.english: the place where someone lives

name: frigidarium
trans: in roman baths, a room with a bath of cold water

name: figurehead
trans: person who is head  of a group in title but has no authority

sentences.english: The Queen is merely a figurehead.
sentences.chinese: 女王只是名义上的元首。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破浪神；有名无实的领袖；装饰船头的人像
detailed_translations.english: a wooden model of a woman that used to be placed on the front of ships

name: convention
trans: a meeting or gathering

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: chary
trans: cautious, wary

sentences.english: I am chary of making too many idiotic mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我小心谨慎以免犯太多的愚蠢错误。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to risk doing something

name: aspersion
trans: an attack on somebody's reputation or good name

sentences.english: Should you hear my name blackened and maligned, will you credit the aspersion ?
sentences.chinese: 要是你听见我的名誉受到诽谤， 你会相信那谗言吗?。

sentences.english: Rather than casting aspersion on leaks about Mr. Flynn, these commentators praised their contributions to accountability journalism.
sentences.chinese: 这些评论者不但没有对弗林一事的消息泄露做出诽谤，还赞扬这是对问责新闻的贡献。

sentences.english: We cast no aspersion on the man or his program. Mr. Obama, in his short career, has not strongly associated himself with any policy idea.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意诽谤这个人或他的计划，然而奥巴马先生在他短暂的职业生涯里，从未对任何政策主张表现过强烈支持的态度。

name: despot
trans: a ruler with absolute power who exercise it cruelly

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a ruler, who uses power in a cruel and unfair way

name: cleave
trans: to split or sever something

sentences.english: The wooden door had been cleft in two.
sentences.chinese: 木门被劈成了两半。

detailed_translations.chinese: 裂开；披荆斩棘地前进；粘住；坚持
detailed_translations.english: to cut something into separate parts using a heavy tool, or to be able to be cut in this way

name: enact
trans: to make (a bill) into law

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: eligible
trans: having the right to do or obtain something

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: dank
trans: unpleasantly moist or humid

sentences.english: a dank prison cell
sentences.chinese: 阴冷的牢房

detailed_translations.english: unpleasantly wet and cold

name: accusation
trans: the act of with a crime or with a lighter offense

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: genesis
trans: the origin or point at which something begins to exist

sentences.english: Could that be the genesis?
sentences.chinese: 那有可能是起源吗？

sentences.english: This refers to the genesis and function of consciousness and language.
sentences.chinese: 这里指的是意识,和语言的起源及功能。

detailed_translations.english: the beginning or origin of something

name: dilatory
trans: slow to act, sluggish

sentences.english: You might expect politicians to smooth things out when civil servants are being dilatory.
sentences.chinese: 当公务员办事拖拉时，你可能期望政治家们能够把事情顺利解决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖拉的；缓慢的，不慌不忙的
detailed_translations.english: slow in doing something

name: esprit
trans: spirit, enthusiasm

name: archaeology
trans: the scientific study of historic or prehistoric peoples

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

detailed_translations.english: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

name: absence
trans: a state of being absent

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: epoch
trans: a period of history, esp. considered remarkable/noteworthy

sentences.english: the Victorian epoch
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

detailed_translations.english: a period of history

name: evolution
trans: any process of formation or growth, development

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: divination
trans: the practice of foretelling the future by supernatural means

name: consort
trans: a wife, husband, or companion

sentences.english: The public has accepted Camilla, Prince Charles’s former mistress, as his consort.
sentences.chinese: 公众接受了作为前任情妇的卡米拉成为查尔斯王子的新配偶。

sentences.english: Dressed as the Hindu deity Shiva and his consort, Parvati, children beg for money from tourists in Pushkar.
sentences.chinese: 打扮成印度教湿婆神和他的配偶帕尔瓦蒂，儿童从普什卡游客那里乞讨钱财。

detailed_translations.english: the wife or husband of a ruler

name: fresco
trans: painting on a moist, plaster surface

sentences.english: The medium of fresco makes great demands on a painter's techinical skill.
sentences.chinese: 壁画这种绘画形式对画家的技巧有很高要求。

sentences.english: We show this in a scene in the Sistine Chapel [in Rome] where we create a big crack in the fresco of God and Adam.
sentences.chinese: 我们将这个观点放到了发生在罗马西斯廷教堂的一幕里——一幅绘有上帝与亚当的壁画发生严重断裂。

sentences.english: Today, much of it is occupied by government offices and only vestiges of its beauty endure – admittedly including Gozzoli's fresco of the journey of the Magi.
sentences.chinese: 如今政府办公室占据了它很多的建筑，而梅迪奇·里卡尔第宫也仅保留一丝当年的痕迹--这其中包括戈佐利所绘的壁画《三圣贤之旅》。

detailed_translations.english: a painting made on a wall while the  plaster  is still wet

name: eventual
trans: happening at some indefinite future time

sentences.english: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。

sentences.english: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的
detailed_translations.english: happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened

name: formidable
trans: causing fear, apprehension, or dread

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: formation
trans: something possessing structure or form

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: diagnose
trans: to determine the root cause of (a disease)

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: elliptical
trans: in a shape reminding of an ellipse, oval

sentences.english: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609. 1609
sentences.chinese: 年开普勒公布他的发现，认为行星轨道为椭圆形。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of an ellipse

name: convergence
trans: the coming together from different directions to meet

sentences.english: With convergence to an ideal state, you can expect the system to be in or near that ideal state.
sentences.chinese: 通过收敛到一种理想状态，您可以期望系统处于或接近那一理想状态。

name: accession
trans: to make a record of (additions to a collection)

detailed_translations.english: an official process in which someone becomes king, queen, president etc

name: frugal
trans: avoiding unnecessary expenditure either of money

sentences.english: As children we were taught to be frugal and hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: He led a remarkably frugal existence.
sentences.chinese: 他过着极其节俭的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
detailed_translations.english: careful to buy only what is necessary

name: collier
trans: a ship for carrying coal

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in a coal mine

name: austere
trans: severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance

sentences.english: the church’s austere simplicity
sentences.chinese: 那座教堂的朴实无华

detailed_translations.chinese: 严峻的；简朴的；苦行的；无装饰的
detailed_translations.english: plain and simple and without any decoration

name: defensible
trans: capable of being defended against armed attack

sentences.english: a morally defensible prison system
sentences.chinese: 道德上合理的监狱体系

detailed_translations.chinese: 可防御的；可辩护的；可拥护的
detailed_translations.english: a defensible building or area is easy to protect against attack

name: antilogy
trans: a contradiction in related terms or ideas

detailed_translations.english: a contradiction in terms

name: artifact
trans: an object made or shaped by humans

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: confection
trans: a dish or delicacy made with sweet ingredients

detailed_translations.chinese: 糖果，蜜饯；调制；糖膏（剂）；精制工艺品

name: effervescent
trans: giving off bubbles, fizzy

sentences.english: an effervescent personality
sentences.chinese: 活泼乐观的个性

detailed_translations.english: a liquid that is effervescent produces small bubbles of gas

name: fallacy
trans: deceptive or false appearance, deceitfulness, deception

sentences.english: It’s a common fallacy that a neutered dog will become fat and lazy.
sentences.chinese: 说阉割过的狗会变得又胖又懒，这是普遍的谬见。

detailed_translations.english: a false idea or belief, especially one that a lot of people believe is true

name: haphazard
trans: random, chaotic, incomplete, not thorough

sentences.english: It was strings of words borrowed from the different languages around them and put together in sort of haphazard ways.
sentences.chinese: 它只不过是从身边的不同语言当中,借用了一些单词串,以随意的方式将它们放在一起

sentences.english: All the master had to do was shake the tree a little and the garden was full of leaves again, spread out in haphazard patterns.
sentences.chinese: 大师什么都没有做，只是摇了摇树。 花园又重新被凋落的树叶覆盖了，整个花园展现出随意的样式。

name: amiable
trans: friendly, sociable

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: She was in an amiable mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情很好。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to like

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

name: dead-heat
trans: run of finish a race exactly even

name: guise
trans: general external appearance, aspect, semblance

sentences.english: It’s the same idea in a different guise.
sentences.chinese: 还是一样的观点，只是形式不同。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something appears to be, which hides the truth or is only temporary

name: grotto
trans: a cave or cavern

sentences.english: Water trickles through an underground grotto.
sentences.chinese: 水流经一个地下岩洞。

detailed_translations.english: a small attractive  cave

name: descent
trans: an action of moving downward, dropping, falling

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: aristocrat
trans: one of a ruling class, a noble

sentences.english: ...a wealthy southern aristocrat.
sentences.chinese: …一位富有的南方贵族。

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

name: augment
trans: to make bigger

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: disinclination
trans: reluctance, unwillingness to do something

sentences.english: the increasing disinclination of farm workers’ children to consider a job in farming
sentences.chinese: 农场工人的子女越来越不愿意务农的趋势

detailed_translations.english: a lack of willingness to do something

name: anoint
trans: to rub or sprinkle on

name: digression
trans: a departure from the subject, course, or idea at hand

sentences.english: Thee direct address of an absent or imaginary person or of a personified abstraction, especially as a digression in the course of a speech or composition.
sentences.chinese: 呼语：直接称呼不在场或虚构的人物或称呼拟人的事物，尤指作为演讲或作文过程中的离题话。 。

sentences.english: In that speech in Alexandria, though, Nasser chose to delve back even further into history, in a long digression on the building of the Suez canal a century earlier.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在亚历山大港的那次演说，纳赛尔选择的是远远的向回探究历史，离题很远地谈到了早在一个世纪之前苏伊士运河的修建。

sentences.english: After this digression we return now to our original problem.
sentences.chinese: 在这一段插话以后，现在回到原来的问题。

name: defile
trans: to make impure, to make dirty

sentences.english: Hallam’s tomb had been defiled and looted.
sentences.chinese: 哈勒姆的坟墓遭到了亵渎和洗劫。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less pure and good, especially by showing no respect

name: antecede
trans: to go before, to precede

detailed_translations.english: to go before, as in time, order, etc; precede

name: forum
trans: a place for discussion

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: benefice
trans: to bestow a benefice upon

name: consignee
trans: the person to whom a shipment is to be delivered

name: cosmetic
trans: external or superficial, pertaining only to the surface

sentences.english: the cosmetic industry
sentences.chinese: 化妆品行业

sentences.english: cosmetic products
sentences.chinese: 美容产品

sentences.english: Are you on the diet for health or cosmetic reasons?
sentences.chinese: 你节食是为了健康还是为了美丽？

sentences.english: ...the cosmetics counter of a department store.
sentences.chinese: …一个百货商店的化妆品专柜。

detailed_translations.english: intended to make your hair, skin, body etc look more attractive
Cosmetics are substances such as lipstick or powder, which people put on their face to make themselves look more attractive

name: evangelist
trans: an itinerant or special preacher, especially a revivalist

detailed_translations.chinese: 福音传道者；圣经新约福音书的作者
detailed_translations.english: one of the four writers of the books in the Bible called the Gospels

name: expurgate
trans: to edit out incorrect, or otherwise undesirable information

sentences.english: He heavily expurgated the work in its second edition.
sentences.chinese: 在第二版中，他大幅删减了该作品。

detailed_translations.english: If someone expurgates a piece of writing, they remove parts of it before it is published because they think those parts will offend or shock people

name: blatant
trans: obvious

sentences.english: blatant discrimination
sentences.chinese: 公然的歧视

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧嚣的；公然的；炫耀的；俗丽的
detailed_translations.english: something bad that is blatant is very clear and easy to see, but the person responsible for it does not seem embarrassed or ashamed

name: deplorable
trans: deserving strong condemnation, shockingly bad

sentences.english: The prisoners were held in deplorable conditions .
sentences.chinese: 囚犯被关押在极其恶劣的环境里。

sentences.english: His conduct was deplorable.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为令人震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very bad, unpleasant, and shocking

name: dissident
trans: a person who opposes official policy

sentences.english: a political dissident
sentences.chinese: 持不同政见者

sentences.english: ...a dissident Russian novelist.
sentences.chinese: …一位与政府意见相左的俄罗斯小说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 持不同政见者，意见不同的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who publicly criticizes the government in a country where this is punished

detailed_translations.chinese: 持不同政见的，意见不同的
detailed_translations.english: Dissident people disagree with or criticize their government or a powerful organization they belong to

name: censurable
trans: deserving of censure, blameworthy

name: cultivate
trans: to prepare and use (land) for crops or gardening

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: collective
trans: gathered into a mass, sum, or body

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: decalitre
trans: ten litres

name: extradition
trans: surrender of an alleged fugitive by one authority to another

name: casuistry
trans: oversubtle reasoning in questions of morality

name: de facto
trans: in fact, whether by right or not

name: denounce
trans: to publicly declare to be wrong or evil

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: afresh
trans: anew

sentences.english: He moved to America to start afresh .
sentences.chinese: 他移居美国，重新开始生活。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something afresh, you do it again from the beginning

name: correlate
trans: to relate things having corresponding characteristics

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: advocacy
trans: active support

sentences.english: The study has also been cited as compelling evidence for screening by the patient advocacy group Lung Cancer Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 此研究已经被肺癌联盟的拥护此筛查方案的病人群体作为一种强有力的证据所引用。

detailed_translations.english: public support for a course of action or way of doing things

name: cosmopolitan
trans: familiar with and at ease in many different countries

sentences.english: a vibrant, cosmopolitan city
sentences.chinese: 一个充满活力的国际性都市

sentences.english: a lively hotel with a cosmopolitan atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 一家有着国际化氛围的、热闹的宾馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界性的；世界主义的，四海一家的
detailed_translations.english: a cosmopolitan place has people from many different parts of the world – use this to show approval

detailed_translations.chinese: 四海为家者；世界主义者；世界各地都有的东西

name: aspire
trans: to hope or dream, especially towards a profession

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: amour
trans: a love affair

sentences.english: The moundsman has a transitory amour.
sentences.chinese: 那个棒球投手和她有段短暂恋情。

sentences.english: The amour of two people comes pure to true, billows not Jing, but pure beauty nots allow at the world, it always should endure actual cruelty to be ground flintily pressure.
sentences.chinese: 两人的恋情至纯至真，波澜不惊，但是纯美从来不容于世，它总要经受现实残酷无情的碾压。

detailed_translations.english: An amour is a love affair, especially one that is kept secret

name: armada
trans: a fleet of warships

sentences.english: This armada of robots will be our eyes, ears, arms and legs in space, in the air, and on the ground, capable of responding to their environment without us, to explore and embrace the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 这个机器人舰队将是我们的眼睛、耳朵、手臂和腿，它们分布在太空中、大气层内，以及地面上，在没有我们的情况下也可以对自身所处的环境做出反应，接近并探测未知世界。

detailed_translations.english: An armada is a large group of warships

name: fatuous
trans: foolish or inane, especially in an unconscious manner, silly

sentences.english: fatuous questions
sentences.chinese: 愚昧的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 愚笨的；昏庸的；发呆的；自满的
detailed_translations.english: very silly or stupid

name: docile
trans: yielding to control or supervision, direction, or management

sentences.english: Labradors are gentle, docile dogs.
sentences.chinese: 拉布拉多犬温和驯服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温顺的，驯服的；容易教的
detailed_translations.english: quiet and easily controlled

name: discomfit
trans: to defeat completely, to rout

sentences.english: He will be particularly discomfited by the governor's dismissal of his plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长撤下他计划将让他尤其难堪。

sentences.english: The solemn intensity of Jade's gaze discomfited him.
sentences.chinese: 在杰德强烈而严肃的凝视下他狼狈不堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫败；扰乱，破坏；使…为难；使…破灭
detailed_translations.english: If you are discomfited by something, it causes you to feel slightly embarrassed or confused

name: digress
trans: to deviate from the main subject in writing or speaking

sentences.english: I've digressed a little to explain the situation so far, so let me now recap.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才稍微离题说明了迄今的情况，现在让我重述一下要点。

sentences.english: She digressed from her prepared speech to pay tribute to the president.
sentences.chinese: 她偏离了预先准备的讲稿，对总统表示了敬意。

detailed_translations.english: If you digress, you move away from the subject you are talking or writing about and talk or write about something different for a while

name: account
trans: to compute, to count

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: categorical
trans: absolute, having no exception

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对的（名词categoricalness，副词categorically，异体字categoric）；直截了当的；无条件的；属于某一范畴的
detailed_translations.english: a categorical statement is a clear statement that something is definitely true or false

name: abbreviate
trans: to make shorter

sentences.english: And, furthermore, he started to abbreviate.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他开始使用缩写词。

sentences.english: I like to abbreviate my name because it's easier for people to remember.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢缩写我的名字，因为这样人们更容易记住。

sentences.english: N You can even abbreviate and put Y or N.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可以缩写Y或。

name: condescend
trans: to stoop or deign to do something

sentences.english: When he condescended to speak, he contradicted himself three or four times in the space of half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 当他屈尊讲话时，半小时内有三四次前后矛盾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈尊；俯就；（对某人）表现出优越感
detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you think you are better, more intelligent, or more important than other people – used to show disapproval

name: beseech
trans: to beg or implore

sentences.english: She beseeched him to cut out his drinking and his smoking.
sentences.chinese: 她央求他戒酒戒烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到
detailed_translations.english: to eagerly and anxiously ask someone for something

name: glean
trans: to gather slowly and laboriously, bit by bit

sentences.english: At present we're gleaning information from all sources.
sentences.chinese: 目前我们正从所有渠道慢慢收集信息。

detailed_translations.english: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut

name: convulsion
trans: an intense, paroxysmal, involuntary muscular contraction

name: conscript
trans: to enrol compulsorily, to draft

sentences.english: How can private companies compete fairly when their military rivals enjoy access to cheap land, credit and conscript labour—and have guns?
sentences.chinese: 军方享有廉价的土地、信贷和士兵做劳工，而且手中有枪，私营公司怎么和他们公平竞争？

detailed_translations.english: to make someone join the army, navy etc

name: anxious
trans: greatly concerned, respecting something future or unknown

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: bestial
trans: beast-like

sentences.english: bestial and barbaric acts
sentences.chinese: 凶残野蛮的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 兽性的，卑劣的；残忍的；野蛮的
detailed_translations.english: behaving like an animal, especially in a cruel way

name: decimate
trans: to kill, destroy, or remove large percentages of

sentences.english: The population has been decimated by disease.
sentences.chinese: 疾病导致大量人口死亡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毁掉大部分； 大量杀死
detailed_translations.english: to destroy a large part of something

name: bombast
trans: high-sounding language with little meaning

sentences.english: There was no bombast or conceit in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他的发言里没有浮夸或自负。

detailed_translations.english: Bombast is trying to impress people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning

name: flaccid
trans: soft and limp, not firm, flabby

sentences.english: a flaccid penis
sentences.chinese: 疲软的阴茎

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 弛缓的；软弱的；无活力的
detailed_translations.english: soft and weak instead of firm

name: entree
trans: a dish served as the main course of a meal

name: gumption
trans: energy of mind and body, enthusiasm

sentences.english: At least she had the gumption to phone me.
sentences.chinese: 至少她有这个头脑，给我打了电话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 进取心， 魄力； 精明强干
detailed_translations.english: the ability and determination to decide what needs to be done and to do it

name: circumscribe
trans: to restrict (something) within limits

sentences.english: The President’s power is circumscribed by Congress and the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 总统的权力受到国会和最高法院的制约。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外切，外接；限制；在…周围画线
detailed_translations.english: to limit power, rights, or abilities

name: caveat
trans: to qualify a particular statement with a proviso or caveat

name: aria
trans: a musical piece written for a solo voice with accompaniment

sentences.english: It is a scenic art integrating music, performance, literature, aria, and face-painting.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个风景艺术集音乐，表演，文学，咏叹调，和画脸。

sentences.english: I hope my poem is about loss, not nostalgia, that the tenor singing an Italian aria, like the ruined pilasters of the theater, suggests an historical dimension of loss.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的诗表现的是失落，而非乡愁，如同那名男高音唱着意大利咏叹调，宛如剧院的断壁颓垣，都流露出历史的失落。

detailed_translations.english: a song that is sung by only one person in an  opera  or  oratorio

name: gauntlet
trans: a medieval glove, as of mail or plate, worn by a knight

name: evoke
trans: to cause a thing to manifest in someone's mind

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: difference
trans: the state or relation of being different, dissimilarity

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: envoy
trans: a representative, a diplomatic agent

sentences.english: The United Nations is sending a special envoy to the area.
sentences.chinese: 联合国将向该地区派遣一位特使。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sent to another country as an official representative

name: exclamation
trans: a loud calling or crying out, indicative of emotion

sentences.english: horrified exclamations of disgust
sentences.chinese: 厌恶的惊叫

detailed_translations.english: a sound, word, or short sentence that you say suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: cordial
trans: warm and friendly, courteous

sentences.english: The talks were conducted in a cordial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

detailed_translations.english: friendly but quite polite and formal

name: eminent
trans: (a person) famous and respected within a particular sphere

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: gambit
trans: an opening in chess, in which a minor piece is sacrificed

sentences.english: His favourite opening gambit is: "You are so beautiful, will you be my next wife?"
sentences.chinese: 他最喜欢的开场白是：“你真漂亮。愿意做我的下一任妻子吗？”

sentences.english: Bernard made no response to Tom's conversational gambits.
sentences.chinese: 伯纳德没有回应汤姆对话的开场白。

detailed_translations.chinese: 话题；开始；以取得优势的开局棋法；开场白
detailed_translations.english: A gambit is a remark which you make to someone in order to start or continue a conversation with them

name: altitude
trans: the height measured from sea level up to any given point

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

detailed_translations.english: the height of an object or place above the sea

name: acclivity
trans: a slope or inclination of the earth, as the side of a hill

sentences.english: Why did Ford's accelerator always have an accidental failure on acclivity?
sentences.chinese: 为什么福特的加速器在斜坡上总是有意外的出错？

detailed_translations.chinese: 向上的斜坡；[建] 上斜
detailed_translations.english: an upward slope, esp of the ground

name: barometer
trans: an instrument for measuring atmospheric pressure

sentences.english: The skin is an accurate barometer of emotional and physical health.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤是反映一个人身心健康状况的准确指标。

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 气压计；晴雨表；显示变化的事物
detailed_translations.english: an instrument that measures changes in the air pressure and the weather, or that calculates height above sea level

name: flippant
trans: frivolously disrespectful, shallow or lacking in seriousness

sentences.english: a rather flippant remark
sentences.chinese: 相当轻浮的话

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；嘴碎的；没礼貌的
detailed_translations.english: not being serious about something that other people think you should be serious about

name: barrister
trans: a lawyer who pleads in court

sentences.english: You've wanted to be a barrister since the year dot.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前你就一直想成为一名辩护律师了。

sentences.english: The barrister entirely renounce his right to object to a juror.
sentences.chinese: 这位律师完全放弃了反对陪审团成员的权力。

sentences.english: Our case was argued by an able barrister, who reduced the prosecutor's submissions almost to nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我们的案子由一位很有能力的律师为我们辩护，他驳得原告的呈辞一无是处。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer in Britain who can argue cases in the higher law courts

name: forfeit
trans: to suffer the loss of something by wrongdoing

sentences.english: The company’s property may even be forfeit.
sentences.chinese: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罚金；没收物；丧失的东西
detailed_translations.english: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake

detailed_translations.chinese: 因受罚而丧失的；被没收的
detailed_translations.english: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment

detailed_translations.chinese: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）

name: achromatic
trans: without colour

sentences.english: Achromatic: Without color. Black, white and gray are achromatic, but called colors by artist.
sentences.chinese: 无色：没有色彩。黑色，白色和灰色是无色的，但美术家却称之为颜色。

sentences.english: CCR : Short for Complementary Colour Removal. A method of achromatic separations by Hell Company.
sentences.chinese: 是英文字义“除去补色”的简称。是“海尔”公司所用的一种消色分色法。

detailed_translations.english: without colour

name: contrition
trans: the state of feeling remorseful and penitent

sentences.english: Blankfein was clearly trying to placate the locals and show some kind of contrition.
sentences.chinese: 布兰克费恩显然在尽力抚慰德国人，并表现出一定的悔悟。

sentences.english: An active conscience is a fine and healthy thing, of course. But contrition must not be limited to certain parties while innocence is accorded to anyone who claims to be persecuted.
sentences.chinese: 这种悔恨的思潮像流行病一样传遍了民间与政府，适度的表现良知是件好事，但是悔悟不应该仅仅局限于当事人一方，清白也不应该给予任何一个自称受到迫害的人。

detailed_translations.english: deeply felt remorse; penitence

name: canaanite
trans: a member of a people that inhabited ancient palestine

name: asinine
trans: foolish, unintelligent or silly

sentences.english: What an asinine remark!
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的话！

detailed_translations.chinese: 驴的；愚蠢的，固执的；驴子似的
detailed_translations.english: extremely stupid or silly

name: dwindle
trans: to decrease, shrink, diminish, reduce in size

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

name: executor
trans: a person who performs some duty, job, etc

sentences.english: You don’t have to be the executor of the full idea, but as a problem solver, you have some responsibility for implementing the solution.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要是整个计划的执行者，但作为一个解决问题者，你对整个方案的执行仍负有一定的责任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 执行者；[法] 遗嘱执行人
detailed_translations.english: someone who deals with the instructions in someone’s will

name: gladden
trans: to cause (something) to become glad

name: bole
trans: the trunk or stem of a tree

sentences.english: He cut off little branches from the bole.
sentences.chinese: 他把树干上的小分枝都剪掉。

detailed_translations.english: the main part of a tree

name: galleon
trans: a large sailing vessel of the 15th to the 17th centuries

name: brawn
trans: strong, well-developed muscles

name: bicker
trans: to quarrel in a tiresome, insulting manner

sentences.english: I went into medicine to care for patients, not to waste time bickering over budgets.
sentences.chinese: 我从医是为了治病救人，不是为了预算争吵而浪费时间。

sentences.english: ...as states bicker over territory.
sentences.chinese: …当国与国之间为领土而争执不断时。

sentences.english: The election will end months of political bickering.
sentences.chinese: 这场选举将结束几个月以来的政治争论。

detailed_translations.english: When people bicker, they argue or quarrel about unimportant things

name: cauterize
trans: to burn, sear, or freeze tissue for curative purposes

sentences.english: He cauterized the wound with a piece of red-hot iron.
sentences.chinese: 他用一块烧红的烙铁来给伤口进行烧灼治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a wound or a growth on your body by burning it with hot metal, a  laser  , or a chemical

name: dissuade
trans: to convince not to try or do

sentences.english: Doctors had tried to dissuade patients from smoking.
sentences.chinese: 医生曾试图说服病人不要抽烟。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone not to do something

name: curtail
trans: to cut short

sentences.english: The new law will curtail police powers.
sentences.chinese: 这条新法规将削弱警方的权力。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or limit something

name: gruff
trans: to have a rough, surly, or harsh nature

sentences.english: He picked up the phone expecting to hear the chairman's gruff voice.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起电话等着听主席那粗哑的声音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴的；粗哑的；脾气坏的
detailed_translations.english: A gruff voice sounds low and rough

name: eccentric
trans: unconventional and slightly strange

sentences.english: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted

name: disconsolate
trans: cheerless, dreary

sentences.english: He did not have much success, but tried not to get too disconsolate.
sentences.chinese: 他没有获得太大的成功，但也试着不让自己太过郁闷。

detailed_translations.chinese: 闷闷不乐的， 郁郁寡欢的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is disconsolate is very unhappy and depressed

name: electrotype
trans: to make such a plate

name: disconnect
trans: to sever or interrupt a connection

sentences.english: The family agreed to disconnect her life support system.
sentences.chinese: 家人同意切断她的生命维持系统。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the supply of power, gas, water etc from a machine or piece of equipment

name: disconcert
trans: to disturb the composure of, to unsettle

sentences.english: His compliments disconcerted her a little.
sentences.chinese: 他的恭维让她有点儿尴尬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使仓皇失措；使困惑；破坏
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly confused, embarrassed, or worried

name: destitution
trans: the action of deserting or abandoning

sentences.english: Physical education in the western regions lags behind that in the east, which mainly is a destitution of an innovation of sports culture.
sentences.chinese: 我国西部体育落后于东部地区，从根本上说，是缺乏体育文化创新。

sentences.english: Thanks to welfare schemes and unemployment benefits, many of which have their origins in those dark days, joblessness no longer plunges people into destitution, at least in the developed world.
sentences.chinese: 很多福利计划和失业救济金方案都发轫于那些灰暗的失业时期； 受惠于这些计划，至少发达国家的人们不再因为失业而陷入穷困。

detailed_translations.english: Destitution is the state of having no money or possessions

name: definitive
trans: explicitly defined

sentences.english: a definitive agreement to buy the company
sentences.chinese: 收购这家公司的最终协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 决定性的；最后的；限定的
detailed_translations.english: a definitive agreement, statement etc is one that will not be changed

name: efflorescence
trans: the state or a period of flowering

name: domination
trans: the exercise of control or influence over something

sentences.english: The imperialists use this ideology and culture as a lever for easily realizing their domination and subjugation, aggression and plunder of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 帝国主义者使用这种思想和文化作为一种杠杆，轻易地实现其统治、征服、侵略以及掠夺他国的目的。

name: augustinian
trans: pertaining to st. augustine of hippo

name: galvanism
trans: the chemical generation of electricity

name: gordian
trans: resembling the gordian knot in intricacy

name: effulgent
trans: shining, resplendent, with radiant splendor

detailed_translations.english: beautiful and bright

name: deviate
trans: to go off course from, to change course, to change plans

sentences.english: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.
sentences.chinese: 你一偏离剧本，他们就会叫停。

detailed_translations.english: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

name: expectancy
trans: anticipation, the state of expecting something

sentences.english: I saw the look of expectancy in the children’s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我从孩子们的眼神中看到了期盼。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something pleasant or exciting is going to happen

name: catastrophe
trans: a disaster

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: federate
trans: to unite in a federation

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟的；联邦制度下的；联合的
detailed_translations.english: federal; federated

detailed_translations.chinese: 使结成同盟；使结成联邦
detailed_translations.english: if a group of states federate, they join together to form a federation

name: frenetic
trans: frantic, frenzied

sentences.english: She rushes from job to job at a frenetic pace.
sentences.chinese: 她发疯似的不停地跳槽。

detailed_translations.english: frenetic activity is fast and not very organized

name: broadcast
trans: to transmit a message or signal via electronic means

sentences.english: The interview was broadcast live across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这次采访向整个欧洲进行了现场直播。

detailed_translations.chinese: 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）
detailed_translations.english: to send out radio or television programmes
a programme on the radio or on television

name: carnivorous
trans: feeding on other animals, meat-eaters

sentences.english: Snakes are carnivorous.
sentences.chinese: 蛇都是食肉动物。

detailed_translations.english: Carnivorous animals eat meat

name: evict
trans: to expel (one or more people) from their property

sentences.english: One cleric resigned over plans to evict the protesters forcibly, arguing that the Church should have been more supportive of their cause.
sentences.chinese: 一位因为计划强行驱逐示威者而辞职的神职人员辩解说国教会应当给予他们更多的支持。

sentences.english: It uses complex network analysis to identify where stealth attacks are taking place and provides the tools organisations need to evict the perpetrators and shore up the network against future threats.
sentences.chinese: 它使用复杂的网络分析，以确定哪些地方正在发生的隐蔽攻击，并提供必要的工具驱逐攻击者，支持网络抵御未来的威胁。

sentences.english: The family saw off attempts by Britain's Royal Navy to evict them and also an attempt in 1978 by a group of German and Dutch businessmen to seize Sealand by force.
sentences.chinese: 但英国海军却多次试图将贝茨家族从“海国”驱逐出去。 1978年，一群来自德国和荷兰的商人曾试图通过武力占领这块“领土”。

name: armful
trans: the amount an arm or arms can hold

sentences.english: He hurried out with an armful of brochures.
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞小册子匆忙出去了。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of something that you can hold in one or both arms

name: fretful
trans: irritable, bad-tempered, grumpy or peevish

sentences.english: Don't assume your baby automatically needs feeding if she's fretful.
sentences.chinese: 不要你的婴儿一焦躁就假定她必然需要喂食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 焦躁的；烦燥的；起波纹的
detailed_translations.english: If someone is fretful, they behave in a way that shows that they are worried or unhappy about something

name: dissidence
trans: protest against official policy

name: allure
trans: to invite by something flattering or acceptable, to entice

sentences.english: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到此游玩的人。

sentences.english: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentences.chinese: 它的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到那游玩的人。

name: confederate
trans: joined by an agreement or treaty

sentences.english: The young woman was his confederate, of course.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻女子当然是他的同谋。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a confederacy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使联盟；使联合；同伙；帮凶

name: crucible
trans: a cup-shaped piece of laboratory equipment

sentences.english: ...a system in which ideas are tested in the crucible of party contention.
sentences.chinese: ...一个在严峻党派纷争中检验不同观点的体系。

detailed_translations.english: Crucible is used to refer to a situation in which something is tested or a conflict takes place, often one which produces something new

name: antiquate
trans: to cause to become old or obsolete

detailed_translations.chinese: 废弃；使…过时；使…具有古旧形式或风格
detailed_translations.english: to make obsolete or old-fashioned

name: catalyst
trans: a person or thing that precipitates an event

sentences.english: I very much hope that this case will prove to be a catalyst for change.
sentences.chinese: 我非常希望这件事终将成为促成变化的催化剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without being changed itself

name: distrainor
trans: one who distrains, the party distraining goods or chattels

name: burly
trans: large, well-built, and muscular

name: clamber
trans: to climb something with some difficulty

sentences.english: We all clambered aboard and the boat pulled out.
sentences.chinese: 我们全都爬上船后，船就开了。

detailed_translations.english: to climb or move slowly somewhere, using your hands and feet because it is difficult or steep

name: comprehensible
trans: able to be understood

sentences.english: Her speech was slurred and barely comprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 她的发言含混不清，几乎无法听懂。

detailed_translations.english: easy to understand

name: baize
trans: a woollen fabric resembling felt

name: allusion
trans: an indirect reference, a hint, a reference to something

sentences.english: This last point was understood to be an allusion to the long-standing hostility between the two leaders.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一点曾被理解为对这两位领导人之间长久敌意的一种影射。

detailed_translations.english: something said or written that mentions a subject, person etc indirectly

name: deposition
trans: the process of giving sworn evidence

sentences.english: the deposition of the King
sentences.chinese: 废黜国王

detailed_translations.english: the act of removing someone from a position of power

name: calumny
trans: a misrepresentation intended to discredit another

sentences.english: He was the victim of calumny.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是诽谤的受害者。

detailed_translations.english: when someone says things like this

name: entrench
trans: to place in a position of strength, establish firmly

sentences.english: ...a series of measures designed to entrench democracy and the rule of law.
sentences.chinese: …一系列旨在巩固民主和法制的举措。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确立，牢固；用壕沟围住；挖掘
detailed_translations.english: If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it

name: estimable
trans: worthy of esteem, admirable

sentences.english: ...the estimable Miss Cartwright.
sentences.chinese: ...令人仰慕的卡特赖特小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: deserving respect and admiration

name: bureaucracy
trans: structure and regulations in place to control activity

sentences.english: the reduction of unnecessary bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 消除不必要的官僚体制

detailed_translations.english: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

name: develop
trans: to grow or cause to grow and become more mature

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: ensnare
trans: to entrap, to catch in a snare or trap

sentences.english: The spider must wait for prey to be ensnared on its web.
sentences.chinese: 蜘蛛一定要耐心等待，直到猎物被它的蛛网困住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诱捕；诱入陷阱；进入罗网
detailed_translations.english: If an animal is ensnared, it is caught in a trap

name: accompany
trans: to perform an accompanying part or parts in a composition

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: cessation
trans: a ceasing or discontinuance of action

sentences.english: He would not agree to a cessation of hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 他不会同意敌对状态的停止。

detailed_translations.english: a pause or stop

name: betide
trans: to happen to

sentences.english: The omens betide better results.
sentences.chinese: 这预兆表明会产生较好的效果。

name: doublet
trans: a close-fitting jacket, men's wear in the renaissance

name: battalion
trans: a large body of troop ready for battle

sentences.english: Ten hours later Anthony was ordered to return to his battalion.
sentences.chinese: 10小时之后安东尼被命令回营。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of soldiers consisting of several companies (  company  )

name: ambidextrous
trans: having equal ability in both hands

sentences.english: Jack is an ambidextrous hitter; he can bat right - handed or left - handed.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是一位双手都很灵巧的打击手； 他可以用右手或左手打击。

sentences.english: Not so for 24 year-old Chen Siyuan, an ambidextrous translator from northern China.
sentences.chinese: 不过这名24 岁，双手灵巧的翻译陈思远可是例外。

sentences.english: Attempt to be ambidextrous--even children who are left-handed in these cultures are taught to eat with their right hand--or at least explain yourself to your fellow diners before plunging in.
sentences.chinese: 还是努力让自己的双手都灵巧吧——在这些文化里，即使是左撇子的孩子也被教会用右手吃饭——或者至少吃饭前向同伴解释一下。

detailed_translations.english: able to use either hand equally well

name: amass
trans: to collect into a mass or heap

sentences.english: For 25 years, Darwin amassed evidence to support his theories.
sentences.chinese: 25年间，达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune after the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后，他积累了大量财富。

detailed_translations.english: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

name: debut
trans: to formally introduce, as to the public

sentences.english: She made her debut in a 1937 production of "Hamlet."
sentences.chinese: 她在1937年《哈姆雷特》的演出中首次登台。

detailed_translations.english: the first public appearance of an entertainer, sports player etc or of something new and important

name: ferocious
trans: marked by extreme and violent energy

sentences.english: a ferocious, hungry lion
sentences.chinese: 一头凶猛的饿狮

sentences.english: a ferocious battle
sentences.chinese: 残酷的战役

sentences.english: The storm grew more and more ferocious with each second.
sentences.chinese: 风暴每一秒钟都在加剧。

detailed_translations.english: violent, dangerous, and frightening

name: coxswain
trans: a person in charge of a ship's boat and its crew

name: fallow
trans: to make land fallow for agricultural purposes

sentences.english: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他们让土地休耕一年。

detailed_translations.english: fallow land is dug or  ploughed  but is not used for growing crops
land treated in this way
to leave (land) unseeded after ploughing and harrowing it

name: corps
trans: a battlefield formation composed of two or more divisions

sentences.english: My corps ! your corps ! our corps ! maring corps !
sentences.chinese: 我的、你的、大家的海军陆战队！

sentences.english: The corps' corn in the corner is scorned by the stubborn corporation.
sentences.chinese: 军团在角落里的谷物受到了顽固的公司司（社团）的嘲笑。

detailed_translations.english: a trained army unit made of two or more  divisions (= groups of soldiers )

name: flugel
trans: a grand piano or harpsichord, both being wing-shaped

name: debatable
trans: open to discussion or argument

sentences.english: a debatable point
sentences.chinese: 有争议的地方

sentences.english: Whether the object was used for rituals is highly debatable .
sentences.chinese: 这一物件是否曾用作礼器有很大的争议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 未决定的， 有争执的
detailed_translations.english: things that are debatable are not certain because people have different opinions about them

name: consul
trans: official in a country who protects their nation's interests

sentences.english: the British Consul in Paris
sentences.chinese: 英国驻巴黎领事

detailed_translations.english: a government official sent to live in a foreign city to help people from his or her own country who are living or staying there

name: chastise
trans: to punish or scold someone

sentences.english: ‘You’re a fool,’ she chastised herself.
sentences.chinese: “你真傻。”她自责道。

detailed_translations.english: to physically punish someone

name: apposite
trans: appropriate, relevant, well-suited, fit

sentences.english: Recent events have made his central theme even more apposite.
sentences.chinese: 近期发生的事件使他的主题思想显得更为恰当。

detailed_translations.english: suitable to what is happening or being discussed

name: detonate
trans: to explode or cause to explode

sentences.english: France is expected to detonate its first nuclear device in the next few days.
sentences.chinese: 预计法国将在未来几天内引爆它的第一个核装置。

detailed_translations.english: to explode or to make something explode

name: emergence
trans: the act of coming forth from envelopment or concealment

sentences.english: The day after that, the emergence of a new competitor.
sentences.chinese: 今后的每一天都可能出现新的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Language emerges and develops with the emergence and development of society.
sentences.chinese: 语言是随着社会的产生而产生，随着社会的发展而发展的。

sentences.english: They prefer to wait for the emergence of a new physics theory of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们更倾向于等待新的可以解释一切的理论的出现.

detailed_translations.english: when something begins to be known or noticed

name: cataract
trans: a waterspout

detailed_translations.chinese: [眼科] 白内障；大瀑布；暴雨，洪水；奔流
detailed_translations.english: a medical condition that causes the  lens  of your eye to become white, so that you slowly lose your sight

name: betroth
trans: to promise to give in marriage

name: faulty
trans: having or displaying faults not adequate or acceptable

sentences.english: Customers may ask for a refund if the goods are faulty.
sentences.chinese: 商品有问题的话，顾客可以要求退货。

sentences.english: a faulty gene that causes breast cancer
sentences.chinese: 引起乳腺癌的一种缺陷基因

sentences.english: an idea based on a faulty understanding of biology
sentences.chinese: 建立在对生物学错误认识之上的一个观点

detailed_translations.english: not working properly, or not made correctly

name: cabalism
trans: the principles or doctrines of the cabala

name: disapprove
trans: to condemn, consider wrong or inappropriate

sentences.english: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道父母会反对，但我还是去了。

sentences.english: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人极不赞同她的行为。
