detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong

name: devour
trans: to eat (food or prey) hungrily or quickly

sentences.english: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

detailed_translations.english: to destroy someone or something

name: amble
trans: slow walk, stroll

sentences.english: An old man came out and ambled over for a chat.
sentences.chinese: 一个老人出来，缓步走过去聊天。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly in a relaxed way

name: deadlock
trans: a situation in which no progress can be made

sentences.english: The talks have reached a complete deadlock .
sentences.chinese: 会谈完全陷入僵局。

sentences.english: a last-ditch effort to break the deadlock
sentences.chinese: 打破僵局的最后努力

sentences.english: Negotiations ended in deadlock.
sentences.chinese: 谈判最后陷入了僵局。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a disagreement cannot be settled

name: bray
trans: of a donkey, to make it cry

sentences.english: The donkey brayed and tried to bolt.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴嘶叫着，企图挣脱缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: if a  donkey  brays, it makes a loud sound
the loud harsh sound uttered by a donkey

name: electrolysis
trans: the passage of an electriccurrent through an electrolyte

sentences.english: Well, electrolysis of water consumes energy.
sentences.chinese: 好了，电解水消耗了能量。

sentences.english: Abstr: In zinc extraction process, fluorine and chlorine, leached into the solution, affect the normal operation of electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 文章摘要： 湿法锌冶炼中，随浸出进入系统的氟、氯离子影响电解的正常进行。

sentences.english: Instead, he says, the solution to large-scale hydrogen production lies in using renewable electricity to extract hydrogen from water via electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 相反他认为大规模生产氢的解决方案在于使用可更新的电通过电解方式从水中提取氢。

detailed_translations.english: the process of separating a liquid into its chemical parts by passing an electric current through it

name: addendum
trans: an addition or change

sentences.english: The quantum theory is not just an esoteric addendum .
sentences.chinese: 量子理论并不只是一个深奥的附录。

sentences.english: Six parts and one addendum are separated in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 论文由六章和一个附录组成。

sentences.english: You can use these as a résumé addendum or for your cover letter.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用它们作为简历附录或者用在求职信中。

detailed_translations.english: something you add to the end of a speech or book to change it or give more information

name: exclusion
trans: the act of shutting out

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: dilute
trans: to make thinner by adding a liquid or solvent

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: determination
trans: firmness of purpose, resoluteness

sentences.english: his dogged determination (= very strong determination ) to succeed
sentences.chinese: 他想要成功的坚定决心

detailed_translations.english: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

name: distensible
trans: capable of swelling or stretching

name: avenge
trans: to vindicate by inflicting pain or evil on a wrongdoer

sentences.english: He wanted to avenge his brother’s death.
sentences.chinese: 他要为弟弟的死复仇。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to hurt or punish someone because they have harmed or offended you

name: callous
trans: showing a cruel and insensitive disregard for others

sentences.english: We were shocked at the callous disregard for human life.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这种无视人类生命的冷漠感到震惊。

sentences.english: a callous attitude
sentences.chinese: 冷漠的态度

sentences.english: the callous slaughter of seals
sentences.chinese: 对海豹的无情残杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；麻木的；硬结的；起老茧的
detailed_translations.english: not caring that other people are suffering

detailed_translations.chinese: 使冷酷无情；使硬结；使生茧

name: congenital
trans: present since birth

sentences.english: congenital abnormalities
sentences.chinese: 先天畸形

sentences.english: a congenital defect
sentences.chinese: 先天性缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a congenital medical condition or disease has affected someone since they were born

name: deform
trans: to remove the form of

sentences.english: Wearing badly-fitting shoes can deform your feet.
sentences.chinese: 穿不合脚的鞋会使脚变形。

detailed_translations.english: if you deform something, or if it deforms, its usual shape changes so that its usefulness or appearance is spoiled

name: evince
trans: to show or demonstrate clearly, to manifest

sentences.english: She evinced no surprise at seeing them together.
sentences.chinese: 看到他们在一起，她没有表露出惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling or have a quality in a way that people can easily notice

name: despite
trans: in spite of

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

name: despotic
trans: characteristic of an absolute ruler or absolute rule

sentences.english: The country was ruled by a despotic tyrant.
sentences.chinese: 该国家被一位专横的暴君统治着。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is despotic, you are emphasizing that they use their power over other people in a very unfair or cruel way

name: avuncular
trans: in the manner of an uncle, pertaining to an uncle

sentences.english: an avuncular pat on the shoulder
sentences.chinese: 慈爱地拍拍肩膀

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a kind and nice way to someone who is younger, rather like an uncle

name: florist
trans: a person who sells flowers

sentences.english: He bought her some roses at the florist's in the mall.
sentences.chinese: 他在购物中心的花店里为她买了一些玫瑰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花商，种花人；花卉研究者
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells flowers and indoor plants for the home

name: anonymity
trans: the quality or state of being anonymous, anonymousness

sentences.english: Every step will be taken to preserve your anonymity.
sentences.chinese: 将采取各种措施确保你的姓名保密。

sentences.english: One official, who spoke on condition of anonymity (=  he would only speak if his name was not told  ) , said the White House took the threat very seriously.
sentences.chinese: 一位不愿公开姓名的官员称，白宫非常重视这一威胁。

sentences.english: the anonymity of city streets (=  you do not know anyone, and no one knows you  )
sentences.chinese: 城市街头人人互不相识

detailed_translations.english: when other people do not know who you are or what your name is

name: embody
trans: to represent in a physical form, to incarnate or personify

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: diacritical
trans: capable of distinguishing or of making a distinction

name: apiary
trans: a place where bees and their hives are kept

name: expeditious
trans: fast, prompt, speedy

sentences.english: The judge said that arbitration was a fair and expeditious decision-making process.
sentences.chinese: 法官说仲裁是一个公正且迅速有效率的决定过程。

detailed_translations.english: Expeditious means quick and efficient

name: culpable
trans: deserving blame

sentences.english: Both parties were held to be to some extent culpable.
sentences.chinese: 双方都被追究了一定的责任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有罪的；该责备的；不周到的；应受处罚的
detailed_translations.english: deserving blame

name: consolidate
trans: to combine into a single unit, to group together or join

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

name: brouhaha
trans: a stir, a fuss or uproar

name: abyss
trans: an immeasurably deep gulf or great space

sentences.english: The torrent, swollen by the melting snow, plunges into a tremendous abyss.
sentences.chinese: 因融化的雪水而高涨的急流泻入一个巨大的深渊之中。

detailed_translations.english: a deep empty hole in the ground

name: formula
trans: any fixed or conventional method for doing something

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

name: fluvial
trans: of or pertaining to a river

detailed_translations.chinese: 河流的， 生长在河中的
detailed_translations.english: relating to rivers or caused by rivers

name: congregate
trans: to collect into an assembly, to gather together

sentences.english: Crowds began to congregate to hear the President’s speech.
sentences.chinese: 人群开始聚拢，来聆听总统的演讲。

detailed_translations.english: to come together in a group

name: aseptic
trans: free of disease-causing microbes

sentences.english: The aseptic design of centrifugal separator and its application are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了离心分离机的无菌设计及其在系统中的应用。

sentences.english: Your equipment design and aseptic processing operator competencies appear to contribute to the lack of unidirectionality.
sentences.chinese: 你们的设备设计和无菌处理操作人员资质貌似与不能保证垂直气流有关。

sentences.english: These EM records provide critical data on environmental trends and whether environmental control is maintained during aseptic filling of a batch.
sentences.chinese: 这些EM记录提供了环境趋势的关键数据，以及环境控制在一个批次的无菌灌装期间是否维持良好。

detailed_translations.english: free from living pathogenic organisms; sterile

name: forepeak
trans: the part of the hold of a ship within the angle of the bow

name: acoustic
trans: designed to carry sound or to aid in hearing

sentences.english: In our case, we have found the true acoustic echo beacon.
sentences.chinese: 但在这种情况下，我们发现了真正的声学‘回声灯塔’ ”。

sentences.english: This gives it excellent thermal and acoustic properties, but the suitability of the product for a large-scale commercial project was questioned.
sentences.chinese: 这给了它出色的热学和声学属性，但是这种产品是否适合于一个大尺度的商业项目还是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有关声音的, 声学的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound and the way people hear things

name: fustian
trans: a kind of coarse twilled cotton or cotton and linen stuff

name: bromine
trans: a non-metallic chemical element, one of the halogens

sentences.english: In this way a bromine 'handle' for adding extra resveratrol units can be placed in one position or in two positions in a controlled manner.
sentences.chinese: 通过这种方法，一个用于结合其他白藜芦醇单元的溴“把手”就可以可控地放置在一个或两个位置。

sentences.english: Exposure to fumes from strong acids, ammonia, some organic solvents, chlorine, hydrogen sulfide, sulfur dioxide, and bromine can also cause irritative bronchitis.
sentences.chinese: 强酸，氨，有机溶液，氯，硫化氢，二氧化硫和溴也能引起刺激性支气管炎。

sentences.english: Supported by the favorable bromine pricing environment, we are confident that this is an optimal opportunity to leverage our strong balance sheet and invest in Gulf Resources.
sentences.chinese: 由于溴盐定价环境令人满意，我们相信此举将是海湾资源公司增加资本，进行投资的最佳时机。

detailed_translations.english: a pungent dark red volatile liquid element of the halogen series that occurs in natural brine and is used in the production of chemicals, esp ethylene dibromide

name: arboreal
trans: of or relating to trees

sentences.english: ...arboreal marsupials which resemble monkeys.
sentences.chinese: ...类猴树栖有袋动物。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trees, or living in trees

name: distillate
trans: something formed by distilling

name: arouse
trans: to evoke or awaken a feeling, emotion or response

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: balk
trans: to pass over or by

sentences.english: Even biology undergraduates may balk at animal experiments.
sentences.chinese: 即使是生物专业的大学生都可能会反对动物实验。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want

name: centilitre
trans: one 100th of a liter

name: dialectician
trans: a person skilled in philosophical debate

name: alter
trans: to change the form or structure of

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: edifice
trans: a building, esp. a large and imposing one

sentences.english: Their head office was an imposing edifice.
sentences.chinese: 他们的总部大楼是一幢宏伟建筑。

detailed_translations.english: a building, especially a large one

name: alto
trans: a musical section higher than tenor and lower than soprano

sentences.english: What are you, a soprano, an alto, or.
sentences.chinese: 你唱什么的， 女高音， 女低音，还是。

sentences.english: The four parts in singing are soprano , alto, tenor and bass.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌的四个声部是女高音、 女低音、 男高音和男低音。

sentences.english: It is a combination of the tenor and the alto.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女低音； 女低音歌手
detailed_translations.english: a singing voice that is lower than a  soprano  , or a singer with a voice like this

name: devious
trans: showing skillful use of underhanded tactics to achieve goals

sentences.english: a devious route
sentences.chinese: 迂回的路线

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的
detailed_translations.english: not going in the most direct way to get to a place

name: clarify
trans: to make clear or intelligible

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: duet
trans: a performance by two people, esp. musicians

sentences.english: Tonight she sings a duet with first husband Maurice Gibb.
sentences.chinese: 今晚她与第一任丈夫莫里斯∙吉布表演了二重唱。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music for two singers or players

name: belay
trans: to surround, environ, enclose

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is climbing a mountain etc safe by attaching a rope to them and to a rock

name: berth
trans: to bring (a ship or vehicle) into its berth

sentences.english: Goldring booked a berth on the first boat he could.
sentences.chinese: 戈德林在第一艘他能订到卧铺的船上订了个位子。

detailed_translations.english: a place where a ship can stop and be tied up
to bring a ship into a berth, or arrive at a berth

name: cobbler
trans: a person who repairs shoes

sentences.english: peach cobbler
sentences.chinese: 酥皮桃肉馅饼

detailed_translations.chinese: 补鞋匠；工匠；冷饮料；脆皮水果馅饼
detailed_translations.english: cooked fruit covered with a sweet bread-like mixture

name: conservatory
trans: a college for the study of classical music or other arts

detailed_translations.english: a room with glass walls and a glass roof, where plants are grown, that is usually added on to a house

name: cardinal
trans: of fundamental importance, crucial, pivotal

sentences.english: Having clean hands is one of the cardinal rules when preparing food.
sentences.chinese: 双手洁净是准备食物时的一项最基本要求。

sentences.english: an issue of cardinal importance
sentences.chinese: 至关重要的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 红衣主教；枢机主教；鲜红色；【鸟类】(北美)主红雀
detailed_translations.english: a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，基本的；深红色的
detailed_translations.english: very important or basic

name: endeavor
trans: to attempt through application of effort

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: allude
trans: to refer casually or indirectly

sentences.english: With friends, she sometimes alluded to a feeling that she herself was to blame for her son's predicament.
sentences.chinese: 和朋友们一起时，她有时暗示她感到儿子的困境要怪她自己。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗指，转弯抹角地说到；略为提及，顺便提到
detailed_translations.english: If you allude to something, you mention it in an indirect way

name: hackneyed
trans: made commonplace or trite, stale

sentences.english: Power corrupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely. That's the old hackneyed phrase, but it's true.
sentences.chinese: 权力导致腐败，绝对权力导致绝对腐败。这虽是老生常谈，但无半点虚言。

detailed_translations.english: a hackneyed phrase is boring and does not have much meaning because it has been used so often

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租（马匹、马车等）；役使（hackney的过去式）

name: copious
trans: abundant in supply or quantity

sentences.english: He could drink copious amounts of beer without ill effect.
sentences.chinese: 他可以豪饮啤酒而无不适。

sentences.english: She listened to me and took copious notes .
sentences.chinese: 她边听我说话边记下大量笔记。

detailed_translations.english: existing or being produced in large quantities

name: encapsulate
trans: to cover something as if in a capsule

sentences.english: The words of the song neatly encapsulate the mood of the country at that time.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌的歌词言简意赅地表现出国家当时的氛围。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装入胶囊； 压缩； 总结， 概述
detailed_translations.english: to express or show something in a short way

name: distiller
trans: a person who owns, works in or operates a distillery

name: askance
trans: turned to the side, especially of the eyes

sentences.english: The photograph of Christian that accompanied many of the news stories showed a boy with mussed-up hair and pierced ears with black plugs looking impishly askance at the camera.
sentences.chinese: 很多新闻报道配发了一张克里斯丁本人的照片，在那幅照片中是一个头发乱糟糟的男孩，耳朵插着一个黑色的耳塞，顽皮地斜视着相机的镜头。

name: close-hauled
trans: a bringing to an end, conclusion

name: forebode
trans: to predict a future event, to hint at something

sentences.english: can be, if I forebode aright, no power, short of the Divine mercy, to disclose, whether by uttered words, or by type or emblem, the secrets that may be buried with a human heart.
sentences.chinese: 如果我的预感不错的话，除去上天的仁慈，没有什么力量，无论是通过讲出来的语言或是任何形式的标志，能够揭示可能埋在一个人心里的秘密。

detailed_translations.english: to warn of or indicate (an event, result, etc) in advance

name: elegy
trans: a mournful or plaintive poem, a funeral song

sentences.english: ...a touching elegy for a lost friend.
sentences.chinese: ...致亡友的一首动人挽歌。

detailed_translations.english: a sad poem or song, especially about someone who has died

name: antic
trans: a ludicrous or extravagant gesture

name: console
trans: to comfort (someone) in a time of grief, disappointment, etc

sentences.english: No one could console her when Peter died.
sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed
a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

name: coup
trans: a highly successful, unexpected act

sentences.english: Haiti’s first elected President was deposed in a violent military coup .
sentences.chinese: 海地的第一位民选总统在一场动荡的军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.english: a coup attempt by junior officers
sentences.chinese: 低级军官发动的一场军事政变

sentences.english: He evaded capture after the failed coup .
sentences.chinese: 政变失败后他逃脱了抓捕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and sometimes violent attempt by citizens or the army to take control of the government

name: congeal
trans: to change from a liquid to solid state perhaps by cold

sentences.english: The fat had slowly congealed in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 油已经在平底锅里慢慢地凝结了。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood congeals, it becomes thick or solid

name: frontier
trans: lying on the exterior part, bordering

sentences.english: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

detailed_translations.english: the border of a country

name: effusion
trans: an outpouring of liquid

sentences.english: a massive effusion of poisonous gas
sentences.chinese: 毒气的大量逸出

name: chateau
trans: castle

sentences.english: I followed him to this island chateau where he's holding a party.
sentences.chinese: 我跟踪他来到这座岛上城堡。他将在这里举办宴会。

sentences.english: After lunch there will be a walk in the grounds of the chateau to see the Jugendstil nymph fountains, a work dating from 1903 by Walter Schott.
sentences.chinese: 午餐后，萨奥尔一行将在城堡四周“漫步”，参观（雕刻大师）沃尔特·肖特1903年的作品--德国“青年派”风格女神雕像喷泉。

sentences.english: So, he actually owned for a short time this huge chateau, and other relatives and friends lived in estates surrounding theirs.
sentences.chinese: 他只拥有这个巨大的城堡一段很短的时间，其他的亲戚朋友的房子都挨的很近。

detailed_translations.english: a castle or large country house in France

name: hangar
trans: a large garage-like structure where aircraft are kept

sentences.english: Walls on either side of the structure, making it resemble an aircraft hangar, will help isolate debris.
sentences.chinese: 与飞机库相似，这座建筑的墙在其两端。这两面墙会帮助隔离废墟。

sentences.english: Senator McCain and the former president came together in a hangar at Houston's Hobby airport and stood side by side with their wives as the 41st president offered his endorsement.
sentences.chinese: 参议员麦凯恩和前总统布什携他们的妻子一起出现在休斯敦机场的一个飞机库中。 第41届总统宣布他将支持麦克恩选举。

detailed_translations.english: a very large building in which aircraft are kept

name: gamester
trans: a person who plays games

name: fanciless
trans: having no fancy, without ideas or imagination

name: foment
trans: to instigate or foster (discord, rebellion, etc )

sentences.english: They were accused of fomenting rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动叛乱。

detailed_translations.english: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government

name: flora
trans: plants considered as a group, esp. those of one region

sentences.english: Tourism is damaging the flora and fauna (= plants and animals ) of the island.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业正在破坏该岛的动植物资源。

detailed_translations.english: all the plants that grow in a particular place or country

name: defamation
trans: act of injuring another's reputation by slander or libel

sentences.english: He sued the newspaper for defamation of character .
sentences.chinese: 他起诉那家报纸诽谤人格。

detailed_translations.english: the act of defaming someone

name: divine
trans: to foretell (something), especially by the use of divination

sentences.english: divine power
sentences.chinese: 神的力量

sentences.english: divine love
sentences.chinese: 上帝的慈爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 神圣的；非凡的；天赐的；极好的
detailed_translations.english: coming from or relating to God or a god

name: discerning
trans: showing good or outstanding judgment and understanding

sentences.english: an ideal tour for the discerning traveller
sentences.chinese: 对具鉴赏品位的游客而言一次理想之旅

detailed_translations.chinese: 有辨识能力的；眼光敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: showing the ability to make good judgments, especially about art, music, style etc

name: asset
trans: something or someone of any value

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: ardor
trans: passion

sentences.english: The difficulty and failure both didn't cool his ardor.
sentences.chinese: 困难和失败都没有降低他的热情。

sentences.english: "Here's fresh meat for your axe, Kreis, " he said; "a rose-white youth with the ardor of a lover for Herbert Spencer.
sentences.chinese: “克瑞斯，你那板斧有了新对象了，”他说，“一个纯洁得像白玫瑰的青年，对斯宾塞怀着恋人一样的热情。

sentences.english: Cathy Whitaker: That was the day I stopped believing in the wild ardor of things.
sentences.chinese: 凯西。惠特克：那一天，让我开始不再相信狂野的热情这样的事情。

name: creditable
trans: credible or believable

name: defuse
trans: to reduce the danger or tension in (a difficult situation)

sentences.english: Police have defused a bomb found in a downtown building.
sentences.chinese: 警察已拆除了在市中心一幢大楼里发现的一枚炸弹的引信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平息；去掉…的雷管；使除去危险性
detailed_translations.english: to improve a difficult or dangerous situation, for example by making people less angry or by dealing with the causes of a problem

name: antiquary
trans: a person who is knowledgeable of, or who collects antiques

detailed_translations.chinese: 古文物研究者；古董商人；收集古文物者
detailed_translations.english: An antiquary is a person who studies the past, or who collects or buys and sells old and valuable objects

name: aggrandize
trans: to widen in scope

sentences.english: At the dinner table, my father would go on and on, showing off, aggrandizing himself.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭时我父亲总是不停地夸耀和吹嘘自己。

sentences.english: ...plans to aggrandize the building.
sentences.chinese: ...使建筑物更加壮观的计划。

detailed_translations.english: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.

name: bibliophile
trans: one who loves books

sentences.english: Ted loves everything about books. He is a real bibliophile.
sentences.chinese: 泰德喜爱所有与书籍有关的事物。他真是一个爱书人。

sentences.english: They brought about a lot of valuable books that to a great extent made Qian Qianyi the greatest bibliophile at that time.
sentences.chinese: 这些书贾带来大量珍本、秘本，为钱谦益成为当时最大的藏书家做出了不容低估的贡献。

sentences.english: Dating a book nerd is serious business, and only a fellow bibliophile can keep pace with the obscure Jane Austen references or the conversation sprinkled with the witticism of Oscar Wilde.
sentences.chinese: 和一个书呆子约会是严肃的事情，只有一个藏书家才能听懂晦涩的简奥斯丁引语或与奥斯卡·王尔德的俏皮话并驾齐驱。

detailed_translations.english: someone who likes books

name: conformance
trans: the act of conforming, conformity

name: furtive
trans: taken, done, used, etc , surreptitiously or by stealth

sentences.english: There was something furtive about his actions.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为有点鬼鬼祟祟。

detailed_translations.english: behaving as if you want to keep something secret

name: desperate
trans: being filled with, or in a state of despair, hopeless

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: autumnal
trans: of or relating to autumn

sentences.english: autumnal colours
sentences.chinese: 秋天的色彩

detailed_translations.english: relating to or typical of autumn

name: excrescence
trans: something, usually abnormal, growing out of something else

name: deify
trans: to make a god of (something or someone)

sentences.english: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans.
sentences.chinese: 华伦天奴实际上被女性粉丝团神化了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…奉若神明；把…神化；崇拜
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone or something with extreme respect and admiration

name: circuitous
trans: roundabout, longer than the most direct way

sentences.english: a hard circuitous hike
sentences.chinese: 一次艰难曲折的徒步旅行

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂曲的；绕行的；迂回线路的
detailed_translations.english: going from one place to another in a way that is longer than the most direct way

name: coquette
trans: a woman who flirts or plays with men's affections

name: dearth
trans: a scarcity or lack of something

sentences.english: EXCEPT as Pearl, in the dearth of human playmates, was thrown more upon the visionary throng which she created.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是由于缺乏玩伴，她同自己创造出来的幻想中的人群更加接近而己。

sentences.english: So for now, this dearth of data means that scientists must rely on climate models to estimate the effects of large-scale burning by aborigines.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在数据的缺乏也就意味着科学家必须依靠气候模型来估计土著大规模焚烧对于气候的影响。

sentences.english: See there is no dearth of knowledge and entrepreneurial skills in we Indians. The only question is that shall we be considered while opting for technology from abroad?
sentences.chinese: 看到没有，我们印度人并不缺乏知识与创业技能。唯一的问题在于我们在追求外国技术的同时有没有考虑去挖掘自身的能力。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

name: divergence
trans: a difference or conflict in opinions, interests, wishes, etc

sentences.english: There's a substantial divergence of opinion within the party.
sentences.chinese: 党内意见严重分歧。

detailed_translations.english: A divergence is a difference between two or more things, attitudes, or opinions

name: entreaty
trans: the act of entreating or beseeching, urgent prayer

sentences.english: She declined the Republican Party's entreaties to run for his seat.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝了共和党让她竞选他的席位的数次恳求。

detailed_translations.english: a serious request in which you ask someone to do something for you

name: gastronomy
trans: the art or science of good eating

sentences.english: Burgundy has always been considered a major centre of gastronomy.
sentences.chinese: 勃艮第常被看作主要的美食中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 烹饪法，美食法；享乐主义
detailed_translations.english: the art and science of cooking and eating good food

name: abbot
trans: the superior or head of an abbey or monastery

detailed_translations.english: a man who is in charge of a  monastery (=  a place where a group of  monk s  live  )

name: amenity
trans: pleasantness

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

name: ceremonial
trans: of, relating to, or used in a ceremony, ritual or formal

sentences.english: the Mayor’s ceremonial duties
sentences.chinese: 市长的礼仪职责

sentences.english: Native American ceremonial robes
sentences.chinese: 美洲印第安人的礼袍

detailed_translations.english: used in a ceremony or done as part of a ceremony
a special ceremony, or special formal actions

name: don
trans: to put on (clothes)

sentences.english: He donned his cloak and gloves.
sentences.chinese: 他穿戴上他的披风和手套。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先生，阁下；指导教师，大学教师
detailed_translations.english: a university teacher, especially one who teaches at the universities of Oxford or Cambridge
to put on a hat, coat etc

name: ad hoc
trans: specifically for

name: anthropology
trans: the holistic scientific and social study of humanity

sentences.english: "In anthropology, you can't equate third gender with homosexuality," he said.
sentences.chinese: “在人类学中，你不能将同性恋和第三性别混同，”他说。

sentences.english: When I was a student at Cambridge I remember an anthropology professor holding up a picture of a bone with 28 incisions carved in it.
sentences.chinese: 当我还在剑桥读书的时候，我记得有一位人类学的教授拿出一张照片，上面是一根有28个切口的骨头。

sentences.english: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想成为派对上的讨厌鬼，但我认为很重要的是，要问清楚神经科学是否揭示出我们已知之外的东西，比如人类学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of people, their societies,  culture s  etc

name: abridge
trans: to shorten in duration

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

name: emigrant
trans: someone who leaves a country to settle in a new country

sentences.english: I happened to be a young, unwilling emigrant, yanked from my happy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 当时，我碰巧是个年轻的、不情愿的移民，被从快乐的儿童时代一把拽走。

sentences.english: What attachment can a poor European emigrant have for a country where he had nothing?
sentences.chinese: 一个贫苦的欧洲移民对一个他一无所有的国家会有什麽感情?

sentences.english: I began idly reading verses describing the shore of Ireland as seen by a returning, dying emigrant.
sentences.chinese: 无所事事时，我还开始阅读诗歌，读到一位返乡的爱尔兰移民在垂死时所见的海岸景象。

detailed_translations.english: someone who leaves their own country to live in another

name: bourgeois
trans: a member of the middle class

sentences.english: She came from a bourgeois family.
sentences.chinese: 她来自一个中产阶级家庭。

sentences.english: bourgeois morality
sentences.chinese: 中产阶级的道德准则

sentences.english: the backlash against bourgeois materialism
sentences.chinese: 对世俗的物质主义的鞭挞

sentences.english: bourgeois ideology
sentences.chinese: 资产阶级意识形态

detailed_translations.chinese: 中产阶级的；庸俗的；资产阶级的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the  middle class

name: cereal
trans: any plant of the grass family with an edible grain

sentences.english: a bowl of breakfast cereal
sentences.chinese: 一碗早餐麦片

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷类，谷物；谷类食品；谷类植物
detailed_translations.english: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

name: consensus
trans: general agreement, general opinion

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: cantonment
trans: temporary military living quarters

sentences.english: Our people's liberation army is now in the cantonment.
sentences.chinese: 我们的人民解决军现在正在宿营地。

detailed_translations.english: a camp where soldiers live

name: extensor
trans: a muscle whose contraction extends or straightens a limb

name: estrange
trans: to cause to feel less close or friendly, alienate

sentences.english: The more the physical causes incline mankind to inaction, the more the moral causes should estrange them from it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，物质的因素越使他们趋于懈怠时，精神的因素就越使他们远离物质的因素。

sentences.english: Their specific treatment of volume, apertures, and overall geometry interested us as tools to estrange conventional ideas of residential housing.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑在体量、孔径和整体几何形状上的处理手法都激发我们有了远离传统住宅的想法。

name: adumbrate
trans: to foreshadow vaguely

sentences.english: Lung cancer has what symptom, have adumbrate?
sentences.chinese: 肺癌有哪些症状，有预兆吗？

sentences.english: The recent development adumbrate a world - wide revolution in computer technology.
sentences.chinese: 最新事态的发展预示着一场全球性的计算机技术革命。

sentences.english: A lot of customers find this to be very helpful as chances are it will adumbrate the issue they are experiencing .
sentences.chinese: 许多消费者认为这是非常有帮助的因为很有可能将预示问题他们正经历。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest or describe something in an incomplete way

name: boisterous
trans: noisy, energetic, rowdy

sentences.english: a class of boisterous five-year-olds
sentences.chinese: 一班活泼爱动的五岁孩子

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child, who is boisterous makes a lot of noise and has a lot of energy

name: anemometer
trans: a device to measure wind speed

sentences.english: We've got a wind anemometer up there.
sentences.chinese: 我们在那装了一个风速计。

sentences.english: And provide the theory instruction for designing other types anemometer .
sentences.chinese: 为今后设计其它类型的风速计提供理论指导。

sentences.english: Wind speed measurements shall be made with a cup classified anemometer.
sentences.chinese: 用已分好类别的杯状风速计进行风速测量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 风力计，[气象] 风速计
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for recording the speed and often the direction of winds

name: continuity
trans: lack of interruption or disconnection

sentences.english: We should ensure continuity of care between hospital and home.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当保证医院护理和家庭护理的连续性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing for a period of time, without problems, interruptions, or changes

name: discard
trans: to throw away, to reject

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: adjacent
trans: close, or contiguous, neighboring, bordering on

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: cringe
trans: to bow or crouch in servility

sentences.english: A stray dog was cringing by the door.
sentences.chinese: 一条流浪狗畏缩在门旁。

sentences.english: She cringed away from him.
sentences.chinese: 她退缩着躲开他。

detailed_translations.english: to move away from someone or something because you are afraid

name: exuberant
trans: very high-spirited, extremely energetic or enthusiastic

sentences.english: exube-rant carvings
sentences.chinese: 充满生气的雕刻品

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；生气勃勃的，充溢的
detailed_translations.english: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful

name: debauch
trans: to morally corrupt someone, to seduce

detailed_translations.english: to lead into a life of depraved self-indulgence

name: collision
trans: an instance of violent contact between objects

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: faux pas
trans: a slip or blunder in etiquette, manners, or conduct

name: auburn
trans: of a reddish-brown colour

sentences.english: She let her short blonde perm grow shoulder-length and dyed it auburn.
sentences.chinese: 她任其金色短烫发长到齐及肩长，而后染成赤褐色。

sentences.english: Louise has straight, auburn hair and, judging by the only photograph I have of her, she's in her 30s.
sentences.chinese: 从我手上唯一一张她的照片可以看出，路易莎一头赤褐色的直发，30岁上下。

sentences.english: In middle age, this Shakespeare has a fresh-faced complexion, a closely trimmed auburn beard, a long straight nose and a full, almost bouffant hairstyle.
sentences.chinese: 这个莎士比亚是个中年人，有着精神饱满的脸色、仔细修剪整齐的赤褐色胡子，有一个高爽的鼻梁和几乎全部柔软而又膨松的发型。

detailed_translations.english: auburn hair is a reddish brown colour

name: apothecary
trans: a person who makes and provides/sells drugs and/or medicines

sentences.english: Peter is a famous apothecary of this town.
sentences.chinese: 彼得是这个镇上有名的药剂师。

sentences.english: Mrs. Lovett: She poisoned herself. Arsenic from the apothecary around the corner… and he's got your daughter.
sentences.chinese: 洛薇特夫人：她服毒自尽了，是从街拐角的药剂师那里得到的砒霜……他接管了你的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: someone who mixed and sold medicines in the past

name: gradation
trans: a sequence of gradual, successive stages

name: depth
trans: the vertical distance below a surface

sentences.english: What's the depth of the water here?
sentences.chinese: 这儿的水有多深？

sentences.english: the depth of her love
sentences.chinese: 她那爱之深

sentences.english: Astronomers may one day travel to the depths of space.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of sth

name: discover
trans: to remove the cover from, to uncover

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: enumerate
trans: to mention separately as if in counting, name one by one

sentences.english: I enumerate the work that will have to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我将必须要做的工作一一列举出来。

detailed_translations.english: to name a list of things one by one

name: calibrate
trans: to check or adjust by comparison with a standard

sentences.english: ...instructions on how to calibrate a thermometer.
sentences.chinese: …校准温度计的说明。

detailed_translations.english: If you calibrate an instrument or tool, you mark or adjust it so that you can use it to measure something accurately

name: affirmation
trans: a declaration that something is true, an oath

sentences.english: On the other hand, when he/she is being positive, reply in affirmation and enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，当他处于积极状态时，要用肯定和热情的话语来答复。

sentences.english: But when you’re wondering whether to press onward or give up entirely, what you need is affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 但是当你已经知道是否向前推进或彻底放弃的时候，你需要的是一个肯定。

sentences.english: On the other hand, when he/she is being positive, reply in affirmation and enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，如果他/她正处于积极状态，给予肯定积极的答复。

name: exhilarate
trans: to enliven, invigorate, stimulate

sentences.english: This dangerous task exhilarate his spirits.
sentences.chinese: 这项危险的任务使他精神振奋。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very excited and happy

name: facet
trans: one of the small, polished plane surfaces of a cut gem

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

name: apparent
trans: capable of being seen, or easily seen

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: dogma
trans: an official system of tenets, laid down by an authority

sentences.english: Their political dogma has blinded them to the real needs of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们的政治教条使他们对国家的真正需求视而不见。

detailed_translations.english: a set of firm beliefs held by a group of people who expect other people to accept these beliefs without thinking about them

name: emeritus
trans: having retired but retaining his title as an honor

sentences.english: ...emeritus professor of physics.
sentences.chinese: ...物理学荣誉教授。

sentences.english: He will continue as chairman emeritus.
sentences.chinese: 他将会继续担任荣誉主席。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保留头衔而退休的， 荣誉退休的
detailed_translations.english: Emeritus is used with a professional title to indicate that the person bearing it has retired but keeps the title as an honour

name: bitterness
trans: the quality of having a bitter taste

sentences.english: The flowers of the hop plant add bitterness to the beer.
sentences.chinese: 忽布花可增加啤酒的苦味。

sentences.english: The pay cut caused bitterness among the staff.
sentences.chinese: 降低工资使职员们十分愤懑。

name: covert
trans: not openly acknowledged or displayed

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

name: affinity
trans: a natural liking for or attraction to a person, thing, idea

sentences.english: He has a close affinity with the landscape and people he knew when he was growing up.
sentences.chinese: 他对他成长过程中所熟悉的景色和人们有一种很强的亲切感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 密切关系；吸引力；姻亲关系；类同
detailed_translations.english: a close relationship between two things because of qualities or features that they share

name: contradictory
trans: mutually opposed or inconsistent

sentences.english: Customs officials have made a series of contradictory statements about the equipment.
sentences.chinese: 海关官员们对于这种设备做出了一系列相互矛盾的陈述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；反对的；反驳的；抗辩的
detailed_translations.english: two statements, beliefs etc that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct

name: acrimony
trans: bitterness or sharpness of manner, speech, temper

sentences.english: Now, with an agreement put on the table, talks have broken down in acrimony .
sentences.chinese: 现在，当一份协议摆到了桌面上，对话却在尖酸刻薄中停止。

sentences.english: The Jesuits in a phase of ascendancy, persecuted and insulted the Buddhists with great acrimony .
sentences.chinese: 处于地位上升阶段的耶稣会修士迫害佛教徒，用尖刻的语言辱骂他们。

name: gesticulate
trans: to make gestures or motions, as in speaking, to use postures

sentences.english: Jane gesticulated wildly and shouted ‘Stop! Stop!’
sentences.chinese: 简拼命打着手势，喊着“停下！停下！”

detailed_translations.chinese: 用姿势示意；（讲话时）做手势
detailed_translations.english: to make movements with your arms and hands, usually while speaking, because you are excited, angry, or cannot think of the right words to use

name: genteel
trans: polite and well-mannered

sentences.english: She broke into a genteel run.
sentences.chinese: 她优雅地跑了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的
detailed_translations.english: polite, gentle, or graceful

name: expectorate
trans: to cough up fluid from the lungs

name: distention
trans: the state of being stretched beyond normal dimensions

name: emit
trans: to send out or give off

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: befog
trans: to envelop in fog

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困惑，使模糊；罩入雾中
detailed_translations.english: to surround with fog

name: cower
trans: to crouch or cringe in fear

sentences.english: The hostages cowered in their seats.
sentences.chinese: 这些人质蜷缩在其座位上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 退缩；抖缩；蜷缩；弯腰屈膝
detailed_translations.english: to bend low and move back because you are frightened

name: conjugate
trans: to list the inflected forms of a verb for each person

name: frieze
trans: a decorative band beneath the cornice of an interior wall

name: congregation
trans: a gathering of faithful in a place of worship

sentences.english: The congregation knelt to pray.
sentences.chinese: 会众跪下祈祷。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people gathered together in a church

name: coy
trans: artfully or affectedly shy or reserved

sentences.english: She gave him a coy smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他含羞一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腼腆的；忸怩作态的；怕羞的
detailed_translations.english: shy or pretending to be shy in order to attract people’s interest

name: farcical
trans: resembling a farce, ludicrous, absurd

sentences.english: Opposition leaders described the government’s plans as ‘farcical’.
sentences.chinese: 反对党领导人说政府的计划就像“一场闹剧”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑稽的；闹剧的；引人发笑的
detailed_translations.english: a situation or event that is farcical is very silly and badly organized

name: discourteous
trans: showing rudeness and a lack of consideration for others

sentences.english: It would be discourteous to ignore his request.
sentences.chinese: 忽视他的请求是失礼的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 失礼的，无礼貌的；粗鲁的
detailed_translations.english: not polite, and not showing respect for other people

name: creak
trans: to make a prolonged sharp grating or squeaking sound

sentences.english: The door was pulled open with a creak.
sentences.chinese: 门嘎吱一声被拉开了。

detailed_translations.english: Creak is also a noun

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出咯吱咯吱声；勉强运转

name: amatory
trans: of or relating to love

sentences.english: Within amatory range, can I also be kind with you?
sentences.chinese: 在爱情的范围内，我也可以对你好吗？

sentences.english: Be that I have blotted out our amatory tender shoot with own hands.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，我已经遮住了我们与自己的双手恋爱的嫩芽。

sentences.english: Discretion, it goes without saying, is the cornerstone of long-term success in the amatory arts.
sentences.chinese: 慎重，不用说，这是在爱情艺术中长期的基础。

detailed_translations.english: expressing sexual or romantic love

name: commodious
trans: spacious and convenient, roomy and comfortable

sentences.english: The students' cupboards are very commodious.
sentences.chinese: 学生们的橱柜非常宽敞。

sentences.english: Accidentally, I came across a cicada slough. I was really content with its commodious and safe place.
sentences.chinese: 无意中找到了一只蝉蜕，它壳内宽敞又安全的空间让我十分满意。

sentences.english: Open whereas commodious yard outside can serve as privately owned outdoors ground, also can become privately owned temporary parking lot for banquet guests.
sentences.chinese: 空旷而宽敞的庭院外，可作为私家户外休闲活动的场地，亦可成为私家宴会的客宾临时停车场。

detailed_translations.english: a house or room that is commodious is very big

name: aureole
trans: any encircling ring of light, halo

name: aptitude
trans: natural ability to acquire knowledge or skill

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: elocution
trans: the skill of a clear and expressive speech

sentences.english: When I was 11 my mother sent me to elocution lessons.
sentences.chinese: 在我11岁的时候，妈妈把我送去学习演说技巧课程。

name: adjudicate
trans: to settle a legal case or other dispute

sentences.english: The Dean adjudicates any faculty disputes.
sentences.chinese: 系主任裁决教师间的纠纷。

detailed_translations.english: to officially decide who is right in a disagreement and decide what should be done

name: diffidence
trans: lack of self-confidence

name: apotheosis
trans: the fact or action of becoming or making into a god

sentences.english: The Oriental in Bangkok is the apotheosis of the grand hotel.
sentences.chinese: 曼谷的东方酒店是大饭店的典范。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊为神， 神话； 典范
detailed_translations.english: If something is the apotheosis of something else, it is an ideal or typical example of it

name: alkali
trans: one of a class of caustic bases

sentences.english: The extremely salty, alkali lake holds little life, but its waters are a favorite spot for wading birds.
sentences.chinese: 其味极咸，碱湖保存了湖中的小生命，但其水域仍为涉水鸟所喜欢的地方。

sentences.english: To get similar characteristics from composites, the carbon fibres are first chemically treated with an alkali which creates lots of tiny pits on their surface.
sentences.chinese: 为了在复合碳材料上获取与电容器相似的性质，这种碳纤维首先经过碱化学处理以令其表面生成许多细微的凹点。

sentences.english: After seeing how this air makes the ugly sagebrush and the patches of alkali and brown earth a feast to the eye, one can understand how the light of heaven may make the ugliest faces beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的空气能使丑陋的灌木和斑驳的盐碱地、褐色的泥土变成视觉盛宴。 只要见过这些，你就明白为什么说天堂的圣光能让最丑的脸变得美好。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that forms a chemical salt when combined with an acid

name: confluence
trans: an act or process of merging

sentences.english: The 160-metre falls mark the dramatic confluence of the rivers Nera and Velino.
sentences.chinese: 这处160米的瀑布是维拉河和维里诺河壮观的汇合处的标志。

detailed_translations.english: the place where two or more rivers flow together

name: disallow
trans: to refuse to allow

sentences.english: Manchester United had a goal disallowed.
sentences.chinese: 曼联队的一个入球被判无效。

detailed_translations.english: to officially refuse to accept something, because a rule has been broken

name: grenadier
trans: a type of soldier, originally one who threw grenades

name: amity
trans: the cooperative and supportive relationship between people

sentences.english: a spirit of perfect amity
sentences.chinese: 亲善无间的精神

detailed_translations.chinese: 友好；亲善关系；友好关系
detailed_translations.english: friendship, especially between countries

name: bathos
trans: depth, bottom

name: bibliography
trans: a section of a written work with citations to all references

sentences.english: At the end of this chapter there is a select bibliography of useful books.
sentences.chinese: 本章末尾附着有用书籍的精选书目。

detailed_translations.english: a list of all the books and articles used in preparing a piece of writing

name: dissatisfy
trans: to fail to satisfy

sentences.english: More or other, they still dissatisfy.
sentences.chinese: 更多或另外一些，它们仍然不满足。

sentences.english: American's unilateralism act in fighting terrorism and its expansion tendency dissatisfy American's allied countries.
sentences.chinese: 第三，美国反恐中的“单边主义”行为和扩大化倾向令盟国极为不满。

sentences.english: Are your dissatisfy actions related to the content of your work your company culture or the people with whom you work?
sentences.chinese: 你不满意的是你工作的内容，公司文化，还是公司同事呢？

detailed_translations.english: to fail to satisfy; disappoint

name: antislavery
trans: opposed to the practice of slavery

name: centimetre
trans: one 100th of a meter

sentences.english: ...a tiny fossil plant, only a few centimetres high.
sentences.chinese: …一块小小的植物化石，只有几厘米高。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length. There are 100 centimetres in one metre.

name: bibliomania
trans: the obsession of owning valuable books

detailed_translations.chinese: 藏书癖；（尤指珍本书）收藏狂
detailed_translations.english: extreme fondness for books

name: buffoon
trans: to behave like a buffoon

sentences.english: "They are drawing their inner buffoon, " explains the teacher.
sentences.chinese: “他们在描绘自己内心的丑角，”老师解释说。

sentences.english: Dick Cheney appears less a brooding presence and more a red-faced buffoon, which may well be how history comes to regard him.
sentences.chinese: 迪克。切尼似乎没有那么沉思，更多的像个面红耳赤的丑角，这也可能是历史对他的看法。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does silly amusing things

name: functionary
trans: a person employed as an official who holds limited authority

name: distemper
trans: to disturb and disorder, hence to make sick

name: fungible
trans: being of such nature or kind as to be freely exchangeable

sentences.english: Oil is a globally traded and fully fungible commodity making it difficult for a producer to reliably cut off a customer.
sentences.chinese: 石油是全球交易、并完全可替代的大宗商品，产油国很难有效孤立某一家顾客。

sentences.english: Where the depository keeps any other fungible item it may return any item of the same type quality and quantity in accordance with the contract.
sentences.chinese: 保管其他可替代物的，可以按照约定返还相同种类、品质、数量的物品。

sentences.english: Goods which are not fungible shall be deemed fungible for the purposes of this act to the extent that under a particular agreement or document unlike units are treated as equivalents.
sentences.chinese: 为本法的目的，并使在一项特定协议或档中的不相似单位也可被视为相等物，则非可替代货物应被视为可替代的。

name: echelon
trans: a level or rank in an organization

name: furlough
trans: a usually temporary layoff from work

sentences.english: a young soldier home on furlough
sentences.chinese: 回国休假的年轻士兵

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a soldier or someone working in another country can return to their own country

name: descendant
trans: descending from a biological ancestor

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: calculable
trans: able to be calculated

sentences.english: clear and calculable benefits
sentences.chinese: 显而易见、算得出的好处

detailed_translations.chinese: 可计算的；能预测的；可靠的
detailed_translations.english: something that is calculable can be measured by using numbers, or studying the facts available

name: diurnal
trans: happening during daylight, or active during that time

sentences.english: Kangaroos are diurnal animals.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠是昼出动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白天的；每日的，一日间的
detailed_translations.english: happening or active in the daytime

name: consecutive
trans: following, in succession, without interruption

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: disclose
trans: to open up, unfasten

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: abash
trans: to make ashamed

sentences.english: When the child see all the room fille with stranger he is much abash.
sentences.chinese: 那小孩一看到满屋子都是陌生人，感到非常局促不安。

sentences.english: When the child see all the room fille with stranger, he is much abash .
sentences.chinese: 中文翻译：那小孩一看到满屋子都是陌生人， 感到非常局促不安。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使局促不安， 使困窘

name: empower
trans: to give permission or power to do something

sentences.english: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
sentences.chinese: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

name: deceit
trans: an act or practice intended to deceive, a trick

sentences.english: an atmosphere of hypocrisy and deceit
sentences.chinese: 充满虚伪和欺骗的氛围

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to make someone believe something that is not true

name: goad
trans: to prick or drive with, or as if with, a goad, prod

sentences.english: The offer of economic aid was a goad to political change.
sentences.chinese: 提供经济援助是政治改革的推动力。

sentences.english: Charles was always goading me.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯老是刺激我。

detailed_translations.english: something that forces someone to do something
If you goad someone, you deliberately make them feel angry or irritated, often causing them to react by doing something

name: cull
trans: to pick or take someone or something (from a larger group)

sentences.english: All this, needless to say, had been culled second-hand from radio reports.
sentences.chinese: 不必说，这一切都是从无线电广播报道中搜集来的第二手信息。

sentences.english: In the reserves of Zimbabwe and South Africa, annual culls are already routine.
sentences.chinese: 在津巴布韦和南非的自然保护区，对病弱动物每年所进行的宰杀剔除已成惯例。

detailed_translations.english: If items or ideas are culled from a particular source or number of sources, they are taken and gathered together

detailed_translations.chinese: 剔出来杀掉的动物；拣出的等外品
detailed_translations.english: Cull is also a noun

name: antonym
trans: a word which has the opposite meaning of another

sentences.english: a dictionary of synonyms and antonyms
sentences.chinese: 同义词和反义词词典

detailed_translations.english: a word that means the opposite of another word

name: discordancy
trans: the state of being at variance or in disagreement

name: garrote
trans: to execute by strangulation

name: equivocate
trans: to use unclear expressions, usually in order to mislead

sentences.english: He is equivocating a lot about what is going to happen if and when there are elections.
sentences.chinese: 他含含糊糊地说着很多如果进行选举会发生的状况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question

name: elicit
trans: to evoke, obtain, or provoke as a response or answer

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: exempt
trans: to grant (someone) freedom or immunity from

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: festive
trans: having the atmosphere,or attitude of a celebration

sentences.english: The atmosphere was festive and jolly.
sentences.chinese: 气氛喜庆欢乐。

sentences.english: John was obviously in a festive mood .
sentences.chinese: 约翰显然喜气洋洋的。

detailed_translations.english: looking or feeling bright and cheerful in a way that seems suitable for celebrating something

name: genealogy
trans: a record or account of the ancestry and descent of a person

name: censure
trans: to criticize harshly

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

name: credulity
trans: willingness to believe or trust too readily

sentences.english: Advertisers were accused of exploiting consumers’ credulity.
sentences.chinese: 广告商被指责利用了客户对他们的轻信。

detailed_translations.english: willingness or ability to believe that something is true

name: foolery
trans: foolish behaviour or speech

name: fecund
trans: highly fertile, able to produce offspring

sentences.english: The pampas are still among the most fecund lands in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这片南美无树大草原仍然是世界上最为肥沃的地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肥沃的；多产的；丰饶的；生殖力旺盛的
detailed_translations.english: able to produce many children, young animals, or crops

name: gloat
trans: to exhibit a conspicuous sense of self-satisfaction

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要幸灾乐祸，说不定同样的不幸会落到你的头上。

sentences.english: Yet, in announcing the news to the United States and the world, Obama was careful not to gloat, as his predecessor George W Bush might well have done had the killing taken place under his watch.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

name: frolicsome
trans: given to frolicking, playful

sentences.english: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and 26)frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.chinese: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.english: Grass was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1999 for his "frolicsome black fables [which] portray the forgotten face of history".
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯因他“嬉闹的黑色寓言、描绘历史被遗忘的一面”获得1999年诺贝尔文学奖。

detailed_translations.english: given to frolicking; merry and playful

name: exposition
trans: the act of expounding, setting forth, or explaining

sentences.english: a lucid exposition of educational theories
sentences.chinese: 对教育理论的清晰阐述

sentences.english: an art exposition
sentences.chinese: 一个艺术展览

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明，解释；展览会，博览会
detailed_translations.english: a clear and detailed explanation

name: engross
trans: to occupy completely, as the mind or attention

sentences.english: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
sentences.chinese: 景色非常美丽，一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

name: cadenza
trans: an elaborate solo passage in a piece of music

sentences.english: So here's Chuck Mangione with his saxophonist and a saxophone cadenza.
sentences.chinese: 这就是查克·曼卓林,和他的萨克斯手一起演出的一段华彩乐章

sentences.english: The violinist had the technical skill to execute the cadenza, with its double stops and harmonics, with brilliance .
sentences.chinese: 小提琴手有用双倍停顿及和弦来精彩地演奏华彩乐段的技能。

sentences.english: A cadenza should not break away from the style of the work, it should be like a summing up, an epilogue, but with a little touch of Whoops!
sentences.chinese: 一个华彩乐段应该保持在作品的风格范围内，它应该像一个总结、一个收场白，但是要有一个小小的闪现：喔唷！

detailed_translations.english: a difficult part of a long piece of music, which a performer plays alone in order to show his or her skill

name: elusion
trans: the act, or abstract properties, of eluding

name: bowdlerize
trans: to remove those parts of a text considered offensive, vulgar

sentences.english: a bowdlerized version of ‘Antony and Cleopatra’
sentences.chinese: 《安东尼和克里奥帕特拉》的删节本

detailed_translations.english: to remove all the parts of a book, play etc that you think might offend someone – used to show disapproval

name: decagram
trans: an si unit of mass equal to 101 grams

name: expedite
trans: to accelerate the progress of

sentences.english: strategies to expedite the decision-making process
sentences.chinese: 加快决策进程的策略

detailed_translations.english: to make a process or action happen more quickly

name: encourage
trans: to mentally support, to motivate, give courage

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: extol
trans: to praise highly, laud, eulogize

sentences.english: Now experts are extolling the virtues of the humble potato.
sentences.chinese: 现在专家们在颂扬粗陋的马铃薯的种种好处。

detailed_translations.english: to praise something very much

name: adjuration
trans: a grave warning

name: bewilder
trans: to cause someone to become perplexed and confused

sentences.english: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
sentences.chinese: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone

name: armistice
trans: a formal agreement to end fighting

name: didactic
trans: intended to teach, particularly having a moral lesson

sentences.english: His novel has a didactic tone.
sentences.chinese: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson

name: conceit
trans: overly high self-esteem, vain pride, hubris

sentences.english: The conceit of the woman!
sentences.chinese: 这个自负的女人！

detailed_translations.english: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance

name: barterer
trans: one who trades goods for other goods without involving money

name: flinch
trans: to make an involuntary movement in response to stimulus

sentences.english: Leo stared back at him without flinching.
sentences.chinese: 利奥毫不畏缩地回瞪着他。

detailed_translations.english: to move your face or body away from someone or something because you are in pain, frightened, or upset
the act or an instance of drawing back

name: conformity
trans: similarity in form or character, agreement

sentences.english: We must act in conformity with local regulations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须按当地的法规行事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that obeys rules, customs etc

name: collusion
trans: a secret agreement, especially for treacherous purposes

sentences.english: He found no evidence of collusion between record companies and retailers.
sentences.chinese: 他找不出唱片公司与零售商互相勾结的证据。

detailed_translations.english: a secret agreement that two or more people make in order to do something dishonest

name: gynecology
trans: a medical science dealing with women's reproductive health

name: gargantuan
trans: of the giant gargantua or his appetite

sentences.english: a meal of gargantuan proportions
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的大餐

sentences.english: gargantuan task
sentences.chinese: 艰巨的任务

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: anhydrous
trans: free from water

sentences.english: It is prepared by reacting anhydrous ammonia and carbon dioxide gas under very high pressure in the presence of a suitable catalyst.
sentences.chinese: 它是在某种催化剂参与下，由无水氨和二氧化碳气体在高压条件下反应生成的。

sentences.english: During ionic polymerization and group transfer polymerization, the absolute need to be transferred to the reactor anhydrous reagents.
sentences.chinese: 在进行离子型聚合和基团转移聚合时，需要将绝对无水试剂转移到反应装置。

sentences.english: Such vegetal essences as yeast and peony and anhydrous caffeine can constantly take effect in sensitive eye skin and restrain the production of melanin.
sentences.chinese: 酵母精华、牡丹精华等植物精华与无水咖啡因能持续作用于敏感的眼部肌肤，同时抑制黑色素的生成。

detailed_translations.english: containing no water, esp no water of crystallization

name: abstract
trans: to separate, to remove, to take away

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: badinage
trans: playful raillery, banter

sentences.english: ...light-hearted badinage.
sentences.chinese: ...轻松的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: conversation that involves a lot of jokes or humour

name: discretion
trans: the quality of being discreet or circumspect

sentences.english: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到
detailed_translations.english: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets

name: carnal
trans: relating to the physical and especially sexual appetites

sentences.english: carnal desires
sentences.chinese: 肉欲

detailed_translations.chinese: 肉体的；肉欲的；淫荡的；性欲的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sex or someone’s body

name: evangelical
trans: pertaining to the gospel(s) of the christian new testament

sentences.english: the evangelical church
sentences.chinese: 基督教福音派教会

sentences.english: evangelical missionaries
sentences.chinese: 基督教福音派传教士

detailed_translations.chinese: 福音的；福音派教会的；新教会的
detailed_translations.english: evangelical Christians believe that they should persuade as many people as possible to become Christians

name: affect
trans: to influence or alter

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

name: bomb
trans: to attack using one or more bombs, to bombard

sentences.english: The bomb went off at 9.30 in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹在早上9点半爆炸。

sentences.english: Enemy planes dropped over 200 bombs during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 袭击中敌机投下了两百多枚炸弹。

sentences.english: He was killed in a bomb explosion.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次炸弹爆炸中身亡。

sentences.english: The town was heavily bombed in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇在第二次世界大战中遭到猛烈轰炸。

detailed_translations.english: a weapon made of material that will explode
to attack a place by leaving a bomb there, or by dropping bombs on it from a plane

name: accordion
trans: to fold up, in the manner of an accordion

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我别致的手风琴好像变成了纸板盒。

sentences.english: All at once I pictured my own father, patiently enduring my nightly accordion practice sessions though he must have yearned for peace and quiet after his long days at the pizza factory.
sentences.chinese: 突然，我想起了我的父亲。 虽然他在比萨厂呆了一整天后一定非常渴望清静，但还是耐心地忍受着我每天晚上练习手风琴的那段时间。

sentences.english: So you may be saying to yourself, I have to sign up right now for Swahili and calculus and accordion lessons before my brain withers away!
sentences.chinese: 你或许因此对自己说，趁着我的大脑还没退化，赶紧报名学习史瓦西里文和微积分，还有手风琴班吧！

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a large box that you hold in both hands. You play it by pressing the sides together and pulling them out again, while you push buttons and  key s  .

name: aberrant
trans: straying from the right or normal way

sentences.english: aberrant behaviour
sentences.chinese: 异常行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 异常的；畸变的；脱离常轨的；迷乱的
detailed_translations.english: not usual or normal

name: banter
trans: the playful and friendly exchange of teasing remarks

sentences.english: As she closed the door, she heard Tom exchanging good-natured banter with Jane.
sentences.chinese: 她关门时听见汤姆与简在开着善意的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: Banter is teasing or joking talk that is amusing and friendly

name: feral
trans: existing in a natural state, not domesticated, wild

sentences.english: ...feral cats.

detailed_translations.english: Feral animals are wild animals that are not owned or controlled by anyone, especially ones that belong to species which are normally owned and kept by people

name: celibate
trans: abstaining from marriage and sexual relations

sentences.english: ...the U.S.A.'s biggest group of celibates.
sentences.chinese: …美国最大的独身宗教群体。

detailed_translations.english: A celibate is someone who is celibate
not married and not having sex, especially because of your religious beliefs

name: flaunt
trans: to parade, display with ostentation

sentences.english: The rich flaunted their wealth while the poor starved on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 富人摆阔，穷人却在大街上饿肚子。

detailed_translations.english: to show your money, success, beauty etc so that other people notice it – used to show disapproval

name: foreordain
trans: to predestine or preordain

sentences.english: To foreordain or elect by divine will or decree.
sentences.chinese: 预定预先决定、判决或颁布；

sentences.english: To appoint , decree , or ordain in advance foreordain .
sentences.chinese: 预定预先决定，判决或颁布；预先注定。

detailed_translations.english: to determine (events, results, etc) in the future

name: assessor
trans: one who assesses a property for tax evaluation

detailed_translations.chinese: 评审员；确定税款的人；顾问
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to calculate the value of something or the amount of tax someone should pay

name: evidential
trans: of or providing evidence

name: frightful
trans: frightened

sentences.english: There’s been a frightful accident.
sentences.chinese: 发生了一起可怕的意外。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or bad

name: embolism
trans: an obstruction or occlusion of an artery

detailed_translations.english: something such as a hard mass of blood or a small amount of air that blocks a tube carrying blood through the body

name: anatomy
trans: the art of studying the different parts of an organized body

sentences.english: a professor of anatomy
sentences.chinese: 解剖学教授

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

name: fanaticism
trans: the characteristic or practice of being a fanatic

name: enunciation
trans: the act of announcing, proclaiming, or making known

name: chromatic
trans: relating to or characterised by hue

sentences.english: These chromatic stone carvings are all made from a whole piece of stone.
sentences.chinese: 这些彩色石雕作品均为一块完整的石材雕刻而成。

sentences.english: As final touches, aimed to eliminate some "fake CG looks", we added to all the images some slight chromatic aberration, a very subtle vignette, a few glow and some flare effects on light source.
sentences.chinese: 在最后的处理上，去除了一些“虚假的CG外表”，我们给所有图像增加了一些轻微的色差，只是给光源稍微增加一点图案、发光和一些光斑效果。

detailed_translations.english: related to bright colours

name: epitome
trans: a person or thing that is typical of a whole class

sentences.english: She looked the epitome of elegance.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去像是优雅的典范。

sentences.english: He was the very epitome of evil.
sentences.chinese: 他是邪恶的典型。

detailed_translations.english: the best possible example of something

name: accuse
trans: to find fault with, to blame

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: affiliation
trans: the relationship resulting from association

sentences.english: The kidnappers had no affiliation with any militant group.
sentences.chinese: 这些绑架者与任何军事组织都没有紧密联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 友好关系；加入；联盟；从属关系
detailed_translations.english: the connection or involvement that someone or something has with a political, religious etc organization

name: bilge
trans: the widest circumference or belly of a cask

name: defraud
trans: to obtain money or property by fraud, to swindle

sentences.english: He faces charges of theft and conspiracy to defraud (= a secret plan to cheat someone, made by two or more people ) .
sentences.chinese: 他面临偷窃和合谋诈骗的指控。

detailed_translations.english: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them

name: deforest
trans: to destroy or to fell all the trees of a forest

name: dissolve
trans: to make a solution of, by mixing with a liquid

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: brogan
trans: a heavy working shoe, a brogue

name: grotesque
trans: distorted and unnatural in shape or size, abnormal, hideous

sentences.english: Grass's novels are peopled with outlandish characters: grotesques, clowns, scarecrows, dwarfs.
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯的小说充斥着稀奇古怪的人物：丑陋的怪人、小丑、邋遢的人以及侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: a grotesque style in art

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇形怪状的；奇怪的；可笑的
detailed_translations.english: unpleasant, shocking, and offensive

name: bete noire
trans: something especially disliked or dreaded

name: efficient
