trans: making good use of time or energy

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: aghast
trans: terrified, struck with amazement

sentences.english: Hank looked at her aghast.
sentences.chinese: 汉克惊恐地望着她。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

name: droll
trans: amusing in an odd way

sentences.english: Evelyn is entertaining company, with droll and sardonic observations on nearly everything.
sentences.chinese: 伊芙琳以其对几乎每件事情都冷嘲式的方式和离奇可笑的见解娱乐伙伴。

detailed_translations.english: amusing in an unusual way

name: chivalry
trans: knights, nobles and horsemen collectively

sentences.english: ...the age of chivalry.
sentences.chinese: ...骑士制度的时代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骑士精神（复数chivalries）；骑士制度
detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is honourable, kind, generous, and brave, especially men’s behaviour towards women

name: counterpart
trans: either of two parts that fit together or are complements

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: endow
trans: to furnish, as with some talent, faculty, or quality

sentences.english: The ambassador has endowed a $1 million public-service fellowships programme.
sentences.chinese: 大使资助了一个100万美元的公共服务奖学金项目。

sentences.english: You are endowed with wealth, good health and a lively intellect.
sentences.chinese: 你天生赋有财富、健康，和敏锐的智力。

detailed_translations.english: to give a college, hospital etc a large sum of money that provides it with an income

name: depository
trans: a place where something is deposited for safekeeping

detailed_translations.english: a place where something can be safely kept

name: equestrian
trans: of horseback riding or horseback riders

sentences.english: equestrian sports
sentences.chinese: 马术运动

detailed_translations.english: relating to horse-riding

name: ambulance
trans: emergency vehicle that transports sick or injured people

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: berate
trans: scold, chide

sentences.english: Marion berated Joe for the noise he made.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽恩指责乔制造的噪声。

detailed_translations.english: to speak angrily to someone because they have done something wrong

name: collide
trans: to impact directly, especially if violent

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

name: entangle
trans: to twist in such a manner as not to be easily separated

sentences.english: Bureaucracy can entangle applications for months.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义会使申请耽搁数月之久。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

name: energetic
trans: possessing, exerting, or displaying energy

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

name: deface
trans: to damage something in a visible or conspicuous manner

sentences.english: Most of the monuments had been broken or defaced.
sentences.chinese: 大多数纪念碑都被破坏或遭污损。

detailed_translations.english: to spoil the surface or appearance of something, especially by writing on it or breaking it

name: contagion
trans: a disease spread with or without contact

name: duplex
trans: something having two parts

name: decoy
trans: a person who entices or lures another person or thing

sentences.english: Officer Langley acted as a decoy to catch the rapist.
sentences.chinese: 警员兰利充当诱饵来抓捕那名强奸犯。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is used to trick someone into going somewhere or doing something, so that you can catch them, attack them etc

name: contretemps
trans: an unforeseen, inopportune, or embarrassing event, a hitch

name: constituency
trans: a district represented by one or more elected officials

sentences.english: a rural constituency
sentences.chinese: 一个乡村选区

sentences.english: constituency boundaries
sentences.chinese: 选区的分界线

sentences.english: He represents the Essex constituency of Epping Forest.
sentences.chinese: 他代表埃平森林区的埃塞克斯郡选区。

detailed_translations.chinese: （选区的）选民；支持者；（一批）顾客
detailed_translations.english: an area of a country that elects a representative to a parliament

name: dogmatic
trans: opinionated, pragmatic

sentences.english: Her staff find her bossy and dogmatic.
sentences.chinese: 她的员工认为她爱指挥别人而且自以为是。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is dogmatic is completely certain of their beliefs and expects other people to accept them without arguing

name: dogmatize
trans: to treat something as dogma

name: deficient
trans: lacking something essential, often construed with in

sentences.english: Women who are dieting can become iron deficient.
sentences.chinese: 节食的女性有可能缺铁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的
detailed_translations.english: not containing or having enough of something

name: frankincense
trans: type of incense obtained from the boswellia thurifera tree

name: classify
trans: to identify by or divide into classes, to categorize

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: acclaim
trans: applaud

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: bowler
trans: one who engages in the sport of bowling

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆顶礼帽；投球手；玩滚球的人
detailed_translations.english: a player in  cricket  who throws the ball at a  batsman

name: disservice
trans: an ill turn or injury

sentences.english: He said the protesters were doing a disservice to the nation.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，抗议者们的行为正对国家造成危害。

detailed_translations.english: If you do someone or something a disservice, you harm them in some way

name: accord
trans: to make to agree or correspond, to suit one thing to another

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
detailed_translations.english: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

name: benefactor
trans: somebody who gives one a gift

sentences.english: An anonymous benefactor donated $2 million.
sentences.chinese: 一位没留姓名的捐助人捐款二百万美元。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money for a good purpose

name: bestrew
trans: to strew or scatter about, throw or drop here and there

sentences.english: The Madagascar is located in African southeast ministry, separating a sound with African mainland, it is to bestrew bramble everywhere over there, cannot the bush of exceed.
sentences.chinese: 马达加斯加位于非洲东南部，与非洲大陆隔着一道海峡，那里到处是布满荆棘。无法逾越的灌木。

name: contend
trans: to strive in opposition, to contest, to dispute

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: countervail
trans: to have the same value as

sentences.english: In civil litigation, the defendant can offer to countervail creditor's rights in order to ban down creditor's litigant appeal.
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼中被告可以减少或消灭对方诉讼请求为目的提出债权抵销的主张。

detailed_translations.english: to act or act against with equal power or force

name: embolden
trans: to render (someone) more bold or courageous

sentences.english: Emboldened by her smile, he asked her to dance.
sentences.chinese: 她的微笑让他鼓起勇气邀请她跳舞。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more courage

name: dupe
trans: to swindle, deceive, or trick

sentences.english: He was accused of being a dupe of the Americans.
sentences.chinese: 他被控是美国人的傀儡。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is tricked, especially into becoming involved in something illegal
to trick or deceive someone

name: brae
trans: the sloping bank of a river-valley, any slope or hillside

sentences.english: In participating in daily activity to make them can independent, be necessary to establish brae channel beside stair and elevatory floor, place auxiliary stand in proper place.
sentences.chinese: 为让他们能独立参与到日常活动中，有必要在楼梯及升高的地板旁设斜坡通道，并在适当地点放置辅助支架。

detailed_translations.english: a hill or hillside; slope

name: dominate
trans: to govern, rule or control by superior authority or power

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: grantee
trans: the person to whom something is granted

name: craven
trans: cowardly

sentences.english: He had a craven fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 他非常害怕乘飞机。

detailed_translations.english: completely lacking courage

name: awe
trans: to inspire fear and reverence

sentences.english: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

detailed_translations.english: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something

name: grandiloquent
trans: overly wordy, pompous, flowery, or elaborate

detailed_translations.chinese: 夸张的；夸大的；大言不惭的

name: enjoin
trans: to lay upon, as an order or command, to order, to charge

sentences.english: She enjoined me strictly not to tell anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 她严令我不要告诉其他任何人。

detailed_translations.english: to order or try to persuade someone to do something

name: atrocity
trans: an extremely wicked or cruel act

sentences.english: The killing was cold-blooded, and those who committed this atrocity should be tried and punished.
sentences.chinese: 这场杀戮非常残酷，那些犯下此暴行的人应该受到审判和惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely cruel and violent action, especially during a war

name: belle
trans: an attractive woman

sentences.english: My younger sister is a belle, everyone likes her!
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹是个美女，每个人都喜欢她！

sentences.english: The boots with various design makes us dazzling, wear fashionably build the modern belle that helps you make spring.
sentences.chinese: 款式繁多的靴子让我们眼花缭乱，入时的穿搭帮你成为春季的时髦美女。

detailed_translations.english: a beautiful girl or woman

name: demean
trans: to debase, to do something that is beneath one's dignity

sentences.english: Some groups say that pornography demeans women and incites rape.
sentences.chinese: 一些组织声称色情作品贬低妇女，并引发强奸案。

detailed_translations.english: To demean someone or something means to make people have less respect for them

name: benign
trans: gentle, kindly

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: embark
trans: to get on a boat or ship or (outside the usa) an aeroplane

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: brazen
trans: bold and without shame

sentences.english: her brazen admission that she was cheating on him
sentences.chinese: 她恬不知耻地承认自己对他不忠

detailed_translations.english: used to describe a person, or the actions of a person, who is not embarrassed about behaving in a wrong or immoral way

name: extemporaneous
trans: without preparation or advanced thought, offhand

sentences.english: an extemporaneous speech
sentences.chinese: 即席演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 即席的，临时的；无准备的；不用讲稿的；善于即席讲话的
detailed_translations.english: spoken or done without any preparation or practice

name: ebullient
trans: cheerful and full of energy

sentences.english: ...the ebullient Russian president.
sentences.chinese: …精力充沛的俄罗斯总统。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as ebullient, you mean that they are lively and full of enthusiasm or excitement about something

name: extensible
trans: capable of being extended

name: balsam
trans: a sweet-smelling oil or resin derived from various plants

sentences.english: Soon a dark wall of trees—red spruce, balsam fir, beech, hemlock—surrounds you, and there's a sudden stony persistence.
sentences.chinese: 很快你会被一堵厚厚的树墙包围——红云杉、香脂冷杉、山毛榉和铁杉，这会持续一段时间。

sentences.english: The Christmas season has officially arrived at the White House in the form of a six-meter balsam fir tree.
sentences.chinese: 欢庆圣诞的季节随着一棵6米高的香脂冷杉树的到来已经正式在白宫拉开序幕。

detailed_translations.english: balm  , or the tree that produces it

name: abortive
trans: unsuccessful

sentences.english: an abortive military coup
sentences.chinese: 一场未遂的军事政变

detailed_translations.english: an abortive action is not successful

name: dedication
trans: the quality of being committed to a task or purpose

sentences.english: To reach a high level of skill requires talent, dedication, and a lot of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 要达到高级水平需要天分，还需要全身心的投入和很多的努力。

detailed_translations.english: hard work or effort that someone puts into a particular activity because they care about it a lot

name: brittle
trans: liable to break or snap easily under stress or pressure

sentences.english: In systems such as this we also often find that there are either no tests around this configuration code, or the tests that do exist are brittle and/or not realistic.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的系统中，我们经常会发现对于这些配置代码没有进行测试，或者尽管存在测试，但它很脆弱且/或不切实际。

sentences.english: But while our screens are brittle, theirs is flexible––at what they say is one tenth the price.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的屏幕都很脆弱，他们的却很柔软，而且价钱是我们的十分之一。

name: contraposition
trans: placement opposite or against

name: convenience
trans: the quality of being suitable, useful or convenient

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

name: fulminate
trans: to explode with a loud noise, detonate

sentences.english: The newspapers fulminate against the crime.
sentences.chinese: 报纸严厉谴责这个罪行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 猛烈抨击， 严厉谴责
detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone or something angrily

name: engage
trans: to occupy the attention or efforts

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: denominate
trans: to call, to name

detailed_translations.english: to give a specific name to; designate

name: ennui
trans: a listlessness or melancholia caused by boredom, depression

sentences.english: The patient's cheerful smile was just a facade ; actually she was suffering from ennui.
sentences.chinese: 那病人愉快的微笑只是表面上的；事实上她倦怠的很。

sentences.english: To overcome ennui, Orbuch said, both parties should focus on adding spice to the relationship, which can be as simple as a new restaurant or vacation spot.
sentences.chinese: 为了克服倦怠，欧布斯说，双方应集中于增加关系的情趣，这些情趣可以是简单的如一间新开的餐厅或是度假地。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being tired, bored, and unsatisfied with your life

name: bromide
trans: a binary compound of bromine and some other element

sentences.english: ...a dose of bromide.
sentences.chinese: ...一服溴化物镇静剂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 庸俗的人； 陈词滥调； 镇静剂， 安眠药
detailed_translations.english: a statement that is intended to make someone less angry but which is not effective

name: disrupt
trans: to throw into confusion or disorder

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: anthropocentric
trans: giving preference to humans above all other considerations

name: condensation
trans: the result of being made compact or dense

sentences.english: He used his sleeve to wipe the condensation off the glass.
sentences.chinese: 他用袖子擦去眼镜上凝结的水滴。

detailed_translations.english: when a gas becomes a liquid

name: anew
trans: over again

sentences.english: I was ready to leave everything behind and start anew in California.
sentences.chinese: 我准备好舍弃一切，在加利福尼亚开始新的生活。

detailed_translations.english: to begin a different job, start to live in a different place etc, especially after a difficult period in your life

name: amplitude
trans: the measure of something's size, largeness, magnitude

sentences.english: But that also reduces the amplitude of the motion, making it harder to detect.
sentences.chinese: 但这种做法同时也降低了运动的振幅，使运动更难被探测到。

sentences.english: So even if no energy is lost, you are still going to get less amplitude as it is spreading out.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果这中间没有能量损失的话，即便海啸传播到很远，它依然会保留较小的振幅。

sentences.english: Built-in stabilizers: relationships which reduce the amplitude of cyclical fluctuation in the economy without any direct action by government firms or individuals.
sentences.chinese: 内在稳定器：指减少经济中周期性波动的振幅而无需政府，企业或个人采取直接行动的内在关系。

detailed_translations.english: the distance between the middle and the top or bottom of a  wave  such as a  sound wave

name: dramatize
trans: to adapt a literary work so that it can be performed

sentences.english: a novel dramatized for television
sentences.chinese: 被改编成电视剧的小说

detailed_translations.chinese: 使戏剧化；编写剧本；改编成戏剧
detailed_translations.english: to make a book or event into a play or film

name: collate
trans: to gather pages in their proper sequence

sentences.english: Shall we collate the accounts today?
sentences.chinese: 今天我们要核对帐目吗？

detailed_translations.english: to gather information together, examine it carefully, and compare it with other information to find any differences

name: excursion
trans: a brief recreational trip, a journey out of the usual way

sentences.english: They've gone on an excursion to York.
sentences.chinese: 他们到约克旅游去了。

detailed_translations.english: a short journey made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people

name: adroit
trans: dexterous

sentences.english: an adroit negotiator
sentences.chinese: 一个谈判高手

detailed_translations.english: clever and skilful, especially in the way you use words and arguments

name: harangue
trans: to give a forceful and lengthy lecture or criticism

detailed_translations.chinese: 长篇大论；高谈阔论；热烈的演说
向…滔滔不绝地演讲；大声训斥

name: excitation
trans: the act of exciting or putting in motion

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of exciting or state of being excited

name: duckling
trans: a young duck

sentences.english: So away went the duckling.
sentences.chinese: 就这样这只小鸭离开了。

sentences.english: The poor duckling was chased and harassed by all the ducklings because he was very ugly.
sentences.chinese: 这只可怜的小鸭被所有的小鸭追逐和骚扰，因为他长得很丑。

sentences.english: Oh, kill me!" said the poor duckling, and he waited for his death bowing his head towards the water.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的小鸭说着朝水中低头，等待死亡的来临。 但他在清澈的水中看到什么样了呢？

detailed_translations.english: a young duck

name: expedient
trans: simple, easy, or quick, convenient

sentences.english: This solution is politically expedient but may well cause long-term problems.
sentences.chinese: 这种解决方法是政治上的权宜之计，但会引起长远的问题。

detailed_translations.english: helping you to deal with a problem quickly and effectively although sometimes in a way that is not morally right
a quick and effective way of dealing with a problem

name: autarchy
trans: a condition of absolute power

sentences.english: Although the European perspective has been instrumental in guiding young democracies out of the grip of authoritarianism and autarchy, this power to transform the fringe is slipping.
sentences.chinese: 尽管欧洲一直以来对指引新的民主国家脱离专政与独裁起到了帮助作用，但是，这种能够改变外围的力量正处在不稳定中。

detailed_translations.english: unlimited rule; autocracy

name: arable
trans: suitable for cultivation, such as by ploughing

sentences.english: arable farming
sentences.chinese: 耕作农业

sentences.english: arable land (=  land that is suitable for growing crops  )
sentences.chinese: 可耕地

detailed_translations.english: relating to growing crops

name: depreciate
trans: to reduce in value over time

sentences.english: New cars depreciate in value quickly.
sentences.chinese: 新车掉价很快。

detailed_translations.english: to decrease in value or price

name: allay
trans: to make quiet or put at rest, to pacify or appease

sentences.english: The president made a statement to allay public anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 总统发表了一项声明以缓解公众的忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less afraid, worried etc

name: accurse
trans: to devote to destruction

name: contemptible
trans: deserving of or held in contempt,  despicable

sentences.english: They were portrayed as contemptible cowards.
sentences.chinese: 他们被刻画成可鄙的胆小鬼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可鄙的；卑劣的；可轻视的
detailed_translations.english: not deserving any respect at all

name: apostasy
trans: the renunciation of a belief or set of beliefs

sentences.english: ...a charge of apostasy.
sentences.chinese: ...被控变节。

detailed_translations.english: when someone suddenly stops believing in a religion or supporting a political party

name: euphoria
trans: a feeling of happiness, confidence, or well-being

sentences.english: There was a general atmosphere of pessimism after the euphoria of last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年的狂喜过后出现了普遍的悲观气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神欢快，[临床] 欣快；兴高采烈；欣快症；幸福愉快感

name: causal
trans: of, relating to, or being a cause of something, causing

sentences.english: Rawlins stresses that it is impossible to prove a causal link between the drug and the deaths.
sentences.chinese: 罗林斯强调说证实毒品与死亡之间的因果关系是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the connection between two things, where one causes the other to happen or exist

name: disreputable
trans: not respectable, lacking repute, discreditable

name: disarray
trans: to throw into disorder, to break the array of

sentences.english: The nation is in disarray following rioting led by the military.
sentences.chinese: 该国发生由军队发动的暴乱后，陷入一片混乱。

detailed_translations.english: If people or things are in disarray, they are disorganized and confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 使混乱；弄乱；使脱去衣服

name: dendroid
trans: (of an organism or structure) tree-shaped, branching

name: archipelago
trans: a cluster of island

detailed_translations.english: a group of small islands

name: bulrush
trans: any of several wetland herbs

name: exponent
trans: one who expounds, represents or advocates

sentences.english: The fatigue life increases with decreasing modulus of surface layer in a power function with a negative exponent.
sentences.chinese: 沥青面层的疲劳寿命随着面层材料模量的降低以负指数的幂函数形式增加；

sentences.english: In addition, this paper also suggests that the reason for high burning rate-pressure exponent is deflagration of some components in propellant.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本文还提出，火药中某些组分的爆燃是导致一些火药燃速压力指数较高的原因。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

detailed_translations.english: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself

name: amphibious
trans: able to live in water and on land

sentences.english: amphibious creatures
sentences.chinese: 两栖生物

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 两栖的，水陆两用的；具有双重性的
detailed_translations.english: able to live both on land and in water

name: accouter
trans: to furnish with dress or equipments

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备；供以军用品，供以服装
detailed_translations.english: to provide with equipment or dress, esp military

name: chiffon
trans: a sheer silk or rayon fabric

name: domestic
trans: of or relating to the home

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

name: alluvion
trans: overflow, flood

name: exhaustive
trans: including every possible element

sentences.english: an exhaustive investigation
sentences.chinese: 彻底的调查

sentences.english: The list is by no means exhaustive.
sentences.chinese: 清单一点也不详尽。

detailed_translations.english: extremely thorough and complete

name: bight
trans: a corner, bend, or angle

detailed_translations.english: a slight bend or curve in a coast

name: begrudge
trans: to be reluctant

sentences.english: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定不会妒忌他得了获诺贝尔奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羡慕，嫉妒；吝惜，舍不得给
detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset with someone because they have something that you think they do not deserve

name: blithesome
trans: happy or spriteful, carefree

sentences.english: She's self-confidence, talking relaxable and make others relaxable and blithesome, let you know life is so lively.
sentences.chinese: 她很自信，说话很放松也让别人放松、愉快，让人觉得生活充满希望。

detailed_translations.english: cheery; merry

name: hap
trans: to happen, to befall, to chance

name: assail
trans: to make a concerted of violent attach on

sentences.english: Protesters assailed the proposed fare increase.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们抨击了提价的提议。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone or something violently

name: cornice
trans: an ornamental molding around the top of the wall of a room

name: chronic
trans: that continues over an extended period of time

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: capitulate
trans: to draw up in chapters, to enumerate

sentences.english: Helen finally capitulated and let her son have a car.
sentences.chinese: 海伦最终让步，同意让儿子买一辆车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 认输，屈服；屈从，停止反抗；有条件投降；让步
detailed_translations.english: to accept or agree to something that you have been opposing for a long time

name: consulate
trans: the residency of a consul

sentences.english: ...the Canadian consulate in Seattle.
sentences.chinese: …驻西雅图的加拿大领事馆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 领事；领事馆；领事任期；领事职位
detailed_translations.english: the building in which a consul lives and works

name: decalogue
trans: ten commandments

name: dissentient
trans: in opposition to a majority or official opinion

name: detumescence
trans: the process of subsiding from a state of tension

name: archbishop
trans: a senior bishop who is in charge of an archdiocese

sentences.english: When I speak to my archbishop in San Francisco and his role is to try to change my mind on the subject, well then he is exercising his pastoral duty to me as one of his flock.
sentences.chinese: 我在旧金山和我的大主教谈话时，他的任务是努力改变我在那个主题上的看法，那时，他是把我当作他的一只羔羊在实践其牧师的职责。

sentences.english: Only once, and then obliquely, were the uncounted mass of Iraqi dead referred to, when the archbishop prayed for "those whose memory we cherish, and those whose names we will never know".
sentences.chinese: 大主教只有一次、而且是拐弯抹角地提到了不可胜数的死去的伊拉克人，他为“那些受我们怀念的人，以及那些我们永远都不知道名字的人”做了祈祷。

detailed_translations.english: a priest of the highest rank, who is in charge of all the churches in a particular area

name: bedraggle
trans: to make something wet and limp

name: bent
trans: curved, crooked

sentences.english: a bent nail
sentences.chinese: 弯曲的钉子

sentences.english: Stand with your knees slightly bent.
sentences.chinese: 双膝微曲站立。

sentences.english: He breathed in deeply, bent double in pain (=  with the top part of your body leaning forward towards your legs  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他深深地吸着气，痛得直不起腰来。

sentences.english: a bent old man (=  not standing straight  )
sentences.chinese: 一个驼背老汉

detailed_translations.english: special natural skill or interest in a particular area
no longer straight

name: brogue
trans: to speak with an accent

name: exposure
trans: the condition of being exposed, uncovered, or unprotected

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: clairvoyant
trans: having the power to see beyond the natural range of vision

sentences.english: ...clairvoyant powers.
sentences.chinese: …未卜先知的能力

detailed_translations.chinese: 透视的， 有洞察力的

name: earthenware
trans: pottery of baked or hardened clay

sentences.english: ...colourful Italian china and earthenware.
sentences.chinese: ...五颜六色的意大利瓷器和陶器。

detailed_translations.english: Earthenware objects are referred to as earthenware

name: corruptible
trans: showing a willingness to act dishonestly

name: fragile
trans: easily broken or destroyed and often of subtle structure

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: awry
trans: crooked, distorted, out of place

sentences.english: He rushed out, hat awry.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子冲了出去。

detailed_translations.english: not in the correct position

name: dowry
trans: the money,or goods a wife brings to her husband at marriage

detailed_translations.english: property and money that a woman gives to her husband when they marry in some societies

name: access
trans: to gain or obtain access to

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: equilibrium
trans: the condition in which competing influences are balanced

sentences.english: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 均衡；平静；保持平衡的能力
detailed_translations.english: a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly

name: forsake
trans: to abandon, to give up, to leave (permanently), to renounce

sentences.english: She will never forsake her vegetarian principles.
sentences.chinese: 她绝不会放弃自己的素食主义原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy

name: disinfect
trans: to sterilize by the use of cleaning agent such as bleach

sentences.english: First use some iodine to disinfect the wound.
sentences.chinese: 先用碘酒给伤口消毒。

sentences.english: Disinfect the area thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 把这个区域彻底消毒。

detailed_translations.english: to clean something with a chemical that destroys  bacteria

name: diatribe
trans: a forceful and bitter verbal attack

sentences.english: The book is a diatribe against the academic left.
sentences.chinese: 该书是对学术左派的抨击。

detailed_translations.english: a long speech or piece of writing that criticizes someone or something very severely

name: antiphon
trans: a devotional piece of music sung responsively

name: haughty
trans: disdainfully proud, snobbish, scornfully arrogant

sentences.english: a haughty laugh
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的大笑

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

name: anecdote
trans: a short account of a history, usually amusing

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: flag-officer
trans: ship carrying the flag officer or commander, flying his flag

name: denouement
trans: the final part of a play, movie, or narrative

name: dragoon
trans: to force someone into doing something, to coerce

name: distill
trans: to make something (esp. a liquid) in this way

sentences.english: distilled water
sentences.chinese: 蒸馏水

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as  whisky  are made this way.

name: granary
trans: a storage facility for grain or sometimes animal feed

sentences.english: The Mid-West is the granary of the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 中西部是美国的粮仓。

sentences.english: Every journey has its low point, and ours was the granary of France, known as the Beauce.
sentences.chinese: 每次旅行都有低潮，我们的低潮是在贝奥斯，这里是有名的法兰西谷仓。

sentences.english: "Now, it fills one granary and half of another"—roughly a 50 percent increase in production.
sentences.chinese: 金多说，“现在的产量可以装满一个半粮仓了” ，粗略的计算，有50%的增产了。

detailed_translations.english: a place where grain, especially wheat, is stored

name: bibulous
trans: very absorbent

sentences.english: Therefore, to choose bibulous rate small insulation materials.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要选择吸水率小的绝热材料。

sentences.english: But it can control the bibulous of handsheet in the demanding range through accession suitable waterproof.
sentences.chinese: 但通过添加适量的防水剂可以使纸板的吸水值在要求的范围内。

sentences.english: Judgement ceramic tile is bibulous the way that leads on any account is very simple, want a water only, observe whether it is absorbed quickly.
sentences.chinese: 判定瓷砖吸水率高低的办法很简单，只要在样品瓷砖的背面滴上一滴水，观察它是否能迅速地吸收。

detailed_translations.english: liking to drink too much alcohol – sometimes used humorously

name: confident
trans: being very sure of or positive about something

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: epicurean
trans: pursuing pleasure, esp. in reference to food or comfort

name: drub
trans: to hit or beat (someone) repeatedly, thrash

detailed_translations.english: to beat as with a stick; cudgel; club

name: ashen
trans: of the pale gray color of ash

sentences.english: His face was ashen.
sentences.chinese: 他面如死灰。

detailed_translations.english: looking very pale because you are ill, shocked, or frightened

name: amenable
trans: open to influence or advice, agreeable

sentences.english: She was always a very amenable child.
sentences.chinese: 她一向是个很听话的孩子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有责任的：顺从的，服从的；有义务的；经得起检验的
detailed_translations.english: willing to accept what someone says or does without arguing

name: disputatious
trans: (of a person) fond of having heated arguments

name: condone
trans: accept and allow (morally wrong or offensive behavior)

sentences.english: I cannot condone the use of violence under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我不能原谅在任何情况下使用暴力。

detailed_translations.english: to accept or forgive behaviour that most people think is morally wrong

name: bronchitis
trans: an inflammation of the bronchi of the lungs

sentences.english: He was in bed with bronchitis.
sentences.chinese: 他身患支气管炎，卧病在床。

detailed_translations.english: an illness that affects your bronchial tubes and makes you cough

name: diffident
trans: lacking confidence in oneself

sentences.english: John was as bouncy and ebullient as Helen was diffident and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 约翰活泼、热情；而海伦却羞怯、矜持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you

name: competitor
trans: a person or organization against whom one is competing

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: affirmative
trans: pertaining to truth, asserting that something is true

sentences.english: an affirmative nod
sentences.chinese: 点头表示同意

detailed_translations.english: an affirmative answer or action means ‘yes’ or shows agreement

name: fidget
trans: to wiggle or twitch, to move around nervously or idly

name: cygnet
trans: a young swan

name: antichrist
trans: one who works against the teachings of christ

name: curator
trans: a keeper or custodian of a museum or other collection

sentences.english: He’s Curator of Prints at the Metropolitan.
sentences.chinese: 他是大都会艺术博物馆印刷品馆部的主管。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a  museum  or zoo

name: bigot
trans: a person utterly intolerant of any differing opinion

sentences.english: racist bigots
sentences.chinese: 偏执的种族主义者

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏执的人；顽固者；盲信者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is bigoted

name: compute
trans: to reckon or calculate

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

name: beguile
trans: to deceive or delude craftily

sentences.english: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
sentences.chinese: 我被马拉喀什剧场浪漫的异国情调迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
detailed_translations.english: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

name: financial
trans: pertaining or relating to money matters

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: eliminate
trans: to completely destroy (a thing) so that it no longer exists

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: flout
trans: to treat with disdain, scorn, or contempt, scoff at, mock

sentences.english: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law.
sentences.chinese: …一向无视法律的非法露营者。

detailed_translations.english: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

name: chastity
trans: the state of abstaining from sexual intercourse

sentences.english: He took a vow of chastity and celibacy.
sentences.chinese: 他发下了守贞和独身的誓。

detailed_translations.english: the principle or state of not having sex with anyone, or not with anyone except your husband or wife

name: almanac
trans: a book or table listing nautical, astronomical, etc. Events

sentences.english: a football almanac
sentences.chinese: 足球年鉴

sentences.english: a nautical almanac
sentences.chinese: 航海年鉴

detailed_translations.english: a book produced each year containing information about a particular subject, especially a sport, or important dates, times etc

name: haughtiness
trans: the state or property of being haughty, arrogance, snobbery

name: gourd
trans: the dried shell of a hard fruit used for utensils

sentences.english: I refused the last but washed down the fruit and vegetables with clear, cold water from a hollowed gourd.
sentences.chinese: 我没有动第三碗，只就着一只葫芦里干净的凉水，把水果和蔬菜风卷残云地吃了下去。

sentences.english: "I keep these stocks as my security, my backup, " he says, looking down at the gourd casks filled with what I now realize are seeds.
sentences.chinese: “我保存这些存货作为我的保障，我的后备，”他一边说，一边低头觑着那些葫芦罐，我这才认出那里面装满的是种子。

sentences.english: The practice of carving and lighting the gourd is a Celtic custom brought to America by Irish immigrants, who used the more-plentiful turnip back home.
sentences.chinese: 在葫芦上刻鬼脸并作为灯笼的习俗最早来自于凯尔特民族，由爱尔兰移民传至美国，而美国人更常用芜菁。

detailed_translations.english: a round fruit whose outer shell can be used as a container, or the container made from this fruit

name: autopsy
trans: a post-mortem examination to discover the cause of death

sentences.english: an autopsy report
sentences.chinese: 验尸报告

detailed_translations.chinese: 验尸；[病理][特医] 尸体解剖；[病理][特医] 尸体剖检
detailed_translations.english: an examination of a dead body to discover the cause of death

name: archangel
trans: a powerful angel that leads many other angels

name: circulate
trans: to move in circles or through a circuit

sentences.english: Swimming helps to get the blood circulating through the muscles.
sentences.chinese: 游泳有助于肌肉的血液循环。

sentences.english: Ceiling fans circulated warm air around the room.
sentences.chinese: 吊扇使暖空气在房间里循环。

detailed_translations.english: to move around within a system, or to make something do this
to move around within a system, or to make something do this

name: gristle
trans: cartilage, especially in meats

name: elan
trans: spirit, zeal, ardor

name: gratis
trans: free, without charge

name: dimly
trans: dull and subdued, indistinct

sentences.english: Ecological sciences were only dimly understood in the late 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪末，人们对生态科学只有朦胧的认识。

sentences.english: Ayer was dimly known to me, England being one of those rare countries in which each era has a few public philosophers — respected thinkers who are called upon to comment on the issues of the day.
sentences.chinese: 我对艾耶尔有些朦胧的认识，很少有国家在每个时代都有几个公众哲学家——曾受邀就当时问题发表看法的受人尊重的思想者，英国正是其中之一。

name: enduring
trans: lasting, permanent, present participle of endure

sentences.english: the enduring appeal of Shakespeare’s plays
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚戏剧经久不衰的感染力

sentences.english: enduring hatred
sentences.chinese: 宿仇

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a very long time

name: genitive
trans: the case which expresses origin or possession (grammar)

name: acknowledgment
trans: the act of acknowledging, admission

name: fitful
trans: irregular, unsteady, characterized by fits

sentences.english: John awoke from a fitful sleep .
sentences.chinese: 约翰从断断续续的睡眠中醒来。

sentences.english: The peace talks only seem to be making fitful progress.
sentences.chinese: 和平会谈似乎时而前进，时而停滞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一阵阵的；断断续续的；不规则的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: not regular, and starting and stopping often

name: asunder
trans: apart, divided

detailed_translations.chinese: 分离的； 化为碎片的
detailed_translations.english: If something tears or is torn asunder, it is violently separated into two or more parts or pieces

name: bilateral
trans: having two sides

sentences.english: ...bilateral talks between Britain and America.
sentences.chinese: …英美之间的双边会谈。

detailed_translations.english: involving two groups or nations

name: flair
trans: a natural or innate talent or aptitude, a knack

sentences.english: Jo has a flair for languages.
sentences.chinese: 乔有语言天赋。

detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to do something very well

name: fidelity
trans: faithfulness to one's duties

sentences.english: the importance of marital fidelity
sentences.chinese: 对婚姻忠贞的重要性

detailed_translations.english: when you are loyal to your husband, girlfriend etc, by not having sex with anyone else

name: botany
trans: the scientific study of plants, a branch of biology

sentences.english: He studied botany at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学学习植物学。

sentences.english: To what degree are you interested in botany?
sentences.chinese: 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度?

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物学领域，这些最早的著作是本草书。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of plants

name: deploy
trans: to arrange (usually a military unit or units) for use

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: dour
trans: stern, harsh and forbidding

sentences.english: ...a dour, taciturn man.
sentences.chinese: …一个阴沉、寡言的男人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严厉的；顽强的；阴沉的；不爱讲话的
detailed_translations.english: serious, never smiling, and unfriendly

name: contingency
trans: dependence on chance or the fulfillment of a condition

sentences.english: a contingency plan
sentences.chinese: 应变计划

sentences.english: Add up your outgoings, putting on a bit more for contingencies.
sentences.chinese: 把你的经常性开支加起来，再增加些钱用于意外开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶然性， 可能性； 意外事件； 附带事件
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that might happen in the future, especially one that could cause problems

name: blithe
trans: showing a casual indifference which is callous or improper

sentences.english: a blithe disregard for the facts
sentences.chinese: 对事实的漠视

detailed_translations.english: happy and having no worries

name: fondle
trans: to touch or stroke lovingly

sentences.english: She fondled his neck.
sentences.chinese: 她抚摸着他的脖子。

detailed_translations.english: to gently touch and move your fingers over part of someone’s body in a way that shows love or sexual desire

name: depravity
trans: moral corruption

sentences.english: ...the absolute depravity that can exist in war.
sentences.chinese: ...能够存在于战争中的绝对堕落。

detailed_translations.english: Depravity is very dishonest or immoral behaviour

name: corroborate
trans: to confirm or give support to (a statement, etc.)

sentences.english: We now have new evidence to corroborate the defendant’s story.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在有新的证据来证实被告人的说法。

sentences.english: Experiments elsewhere corroborate these results.
sentences.chinese: 其他地方的试验也证实了这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

name: denominator
trans: the expression written below the line in a fraction

sentences.english: You have to enter numerator and denominator.
sentences.chinese: 您需要输入结果的分子和分母。

sentences.english: In this exercise you have to convert a given number into a fraction by entering numerator and denominator. Do not forget to reduce the result!
sentences.chinese: 在此练习中您要将一个给定的数字转换成一个分数，输入转化结果的分子和分母。不要忘了将结果约分至最简分数！

sentences.english: In this exercise you have to convert a given number into a fraction by entering a numerator and denominator. Do not forget to reduce the result.
sentences.chinese: 在此练习中您要将一个给定的数字转换成一个分数，输入转化结果的分子和分母。不要忘了将结果约分至最简分数。

detailed_translations.english: the number below the line in a  fraction

name: aqueduct
trans: a small canal containing fluid

sentences.english: ...an old Roman aqueduct.
sentences.chinese: ...一条古罗马时代的高架渠。

detailed_translations.english: a structure like a bridge, that carries water across a river or valley

name: correlation
trans: a reciprocal, parallel or complementary relationship

sentences.english: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.
sentences.chinese: …吸烟和疾病之间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two ideas, facts etc, especially when one may be the cause of the other

name: connubial
trans: of or relating to the state of being married

name: deterrent
trans: a thing that is intended to discourage someone from some act

sentences.english: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.chinese: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.english: However, this is a new age and those attacks will be stopped by a small nukeand therefore, it is not a deterrent anymore.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如今是新的时代，这样的攻击只要一枚核弹就完了，因此，这种战术已经不再是威慑。

sentences.english: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们目前尚不明确为什么会这样，但是他们认为这可能是一种进化返祖现象，因为在蛮荒时代，哭泣在骚乱时是对发情男性的一种威慑。

name: dowdy
trans: plain and unfashionable in style or dress

sentences.english: a dowdy dress
sentences.chinese: 款式陈旧的连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: dowdy things are dull, unattractive, and unfashionable

name: brunt
trans: the chief consequences or negative results of something

sentences.english: an industry that bore the brunt of the recession
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退时受到最大冲击的一个行业

sentences.english: The car took the full brunt of the explosion.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车在这爆炸中受损最严重。

detailed_translations.english: to receive the worst part of an attack, criticism, bad situation etc

name: confer
trans: to discuss, exchange opinions

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: advisory
trans: able to give advice

sentences.english: The State Department issues travel advisories about conditions overseas.
sentences.chinese: 国务院就海外局势发布旅游警报。

detailed_translations.english: an official warning or notice that gives information about a dangerous situation

name: guzzle
trans: to drink quickly, voraciously, or to excess

sentences.english: They’ve been guzzling beer all evening.
sentences.chinese: 他们整个晚上都在狂饮啤酒。

detailed_translations.english: to eat or drink a lot of something, eagerly and quickly – usually showing disapproval

name: hapless
trans: unlucky, luckless, unfortunate

sentences.english: The hapless passengers were stranded at the airport for three days.
sentences.chinese: 倒霉的乘客在机场滞留了三天。

detailed_translations.english: unlucky

name: diversity
trans: the quality of being different

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: embarrass
trans: to cause confusion and shame to, disconcert, abash

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: geology
trans: science of the structure of the earth through study of rocks

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

name: dun
trans: to ask or beset a debtor for payment

name: aphorism
trans: a saying embodying a general truth

sentences.english: It's one thing to forget the past, with predictable consequences, as the favorite aphorism goes. But what about those who refuse to comprehend the present?
sentences.chinese: 正如格言所说，展望未来，忘记过去。话是这样说，但是那些拒绝理解现在的人怎么办呢？

sentences.english: That's more than a folksy aphorism when it comes to infectious diseases.
sentences.chinese: 对于传染疾病而言，这句格言可就不仅仅是一句民间习语了。

sentences.english: What’s the science behind this old aphorism?
sentences.chinese: 这句古老的格言背后有什么样的科学依据呢？

detailed_translations.english: a short phrase that contains a wise idea

name: complex
trans: to form a complex with another substance

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: crustacean
trans: any chiefly aquatic arthropod, such as lobster and shrimp

sentences.english: Researchers found the 70-millimeter crustacean in the dark shale of an Oklahoma quarry.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在俄克拉荷马采石场的页岩层发现这些70毫米的甲壳纲动物。

sentences.english: This is the world's largest crustacean and the seven king crabs introduced here from the North Pacific by Russian scientists in 1961 have multiplied at an astonishing rate.
sentences.chinese: 这是世界上最大的甲壳类动物。 俄罗斯科学家在1961年从北太平洋引进这里的七只帝王蟹已以惊人的速度成倍增长。

sentences.english: Daphnia has a large number of never-before seen genes, as well as a big chunk of the same genes found in humans, the most of any insects or crustacean so far known to scientists.
sentences.chinese: 水蚤有大量之前从未见过的基因，也有一大堆在人类身上就发现的相同基因，其数量是至今科学家所知的昆虫或甲壳类生物中最多的。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  lobster  or a  crab  that has a hard outer shell and several pairs of legs, and usually lives in water

name: dramatist
trans: playwright

sentences.english: After the boss left, the dramatist had a dozen buns for supper. Then he began to doze off.
sentences.chinese: 老板走后，剧作家吃了一打面包作为晚餐然后开始打瞌睡了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes plays, especially serious ones

name: coincide
trans: to occupy exactly the same space

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: affable
trans: pleasant, easy to approach

sentences.english: an affable guy
sentences.chinese: 一个平易近人的人

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to talk to

name: epic
trans: heroic, majestic, impressively great

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: bluff
trans: to mislead by a display of self-confidence or strength

sentences.english: The threat was only a bluff.
sentences.chinese: 这种威胁不过是吓唬人而已。

sentences.english: Whatever you say, you must do it. This isn’t a game of bluff .
sentences.chinese: 不管你说什么，你一定得去做，这可不是在唬人。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people

name: choral
trans: of, relating to, written for, or performed by a choir

sentences.english: an evening of choral music
sentences.chinese: 合唱音乐晚会

detailed_translations.english: related to music that is sung by a large group of people together

name: extinct
trans: no longer in existence, that has ended or died out

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: frequency
trans: the rate of occurrence of anything

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

name: dapper
trans: neat, trim

sentences.english: a dapper little man in a grey suit
sentences.chinese: 一身灰西装、打扮利落的小个子男人

detailed_translations.chinese: 短小精悍的；衣冠楚楚的；整洁的；整齐的
detailed_translations.english: a man who is dapper is nicely dressed, has a neat appearance, and is usually small or thin

detailed_translations.chinese: (Dapper)人名；(英)达珀；(意)达珀尔；(德)达佩尔

name: defunct
trans: no longer existing or functioning

sentences.english: the now-defunct nuclear reactor
sentences.chinese: 现已废弃的核反应堆

detailed_translations.english: not existing any more, or not useful any more

name: dermatology
trans: the medical study of skin

name: guess
trans: to reach a partly (or totally) unqualified conclusion

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

name: euthanasia
trans: the practice of painlessly killing for humane reasons

sentences.english: ...those in favour of voluntary euthanasia.
sentences.chinese: …那些支持自愿安乐死的。

detailed_translations.english: the deliberate killing of a person who is very ill and going to die, in order to stop them suffering

name: afoot
trans: on foot

sentences.english: Everybody knew that something awful was afoot.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都知道糟糕的事在酝酿之中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在进行中的；徒步的；准备中
detailed_translations.english: being planned or happening

name: aggregate
trans: to bring together, to collect into a mass or sum

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: chaff
trans: to use light, idle language by way of fun or ridicule

name: exegesis
trans: critical explanation or interpretation of a text

name: archaic
trans: of or characterized by antiquity

sentences.english: archaic words
sentences.chinese: 古词

detailed_translations.chinese: 古代的；陈旧的；古体的；古色古香的
detailed_translations.english: old and no longer used

name: giddy
trans: to make dizzy or unsteady

sentences.english: Greg stared down from the seventh floor and began to feel giddy .
sentences.chinese: 格雷格从七楼望下去，开始觉得头晕了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 头晕的；眼花的；令人眼花缭乱的；轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: feeling slightly sick and unable to balance, because everything seems to be moving

name: commitment
trans: a pledge or promise

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: epistolary
trans: of or relating to letters, or the writing of letters

sentences.english: an epistolary novel
sentences.chinese: 书信体小说

detailed_translations.chinese: 书信的；书信体的；用书信的
detailed_translations.english: written in the form of a letter or a series of letters

name: brigade
trans: to form troops into a brigade

sentences.english: Snowmobile brigades delivered food and medicine.
sentences.chinese: 雪车队送来了食物和药品。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of soldiers forming part of an army

name: cardiac
trans: pertaining to the heart

sentences.english: cardiac surgery
sentences.chinese: 心脏手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 心脏的；心脏病的；贲门的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the heart

name: disinfectant
trans: a chemical agent used to destroy harmful organisms

sentences.english: Alcohol may be a medical disinfectant,but should not be relied upon to sterilize water.
sentences.chinese: 酒精可能是医学上的消毒剂，但决不可用来消毒饮用水。

sentences.english: After washing their hands thoroughly, visitors walk through a pool of disinfectant and then into the plant itself.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，把手仔细洗过一遍之后，访客要穿过一个消毒池，最后进入厂房。

sentences.english: Cow dung is traditionally used as a fuel and disinfectant in villages, while cow urine and dung are often consumed in rituals to "purify" those on the bottom rungs of the Hindu caste system.
sentences.chinese: 在农村，牛粪是传统燃料和消毒剂，而牛尿和牛粪往往用在“净化”仪式上，目的是“净化”那些处于印度教等级制度最底层的教徒们。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or a cleaning product that destroys  bacteria

name: demolish
trans: to destroy, to full or knock down (a building)

sentences.english: The entire east wing of the building was demolished in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的整个东翼都被大火烧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a building

name: edible
trans: that can be eaten without harm, non-toxic to humans

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

name: ferocity
trans: the condition of being ferocious, savage fierceness

sentences.english: The armed forces seem to have been taken by surprise by the ferocity of the attack.
sentences.chinese: 武装部队好像被猛烈的进攻给镇住了。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being extremely violent and severe

name: adversity
trans: hardship (usually uncountable)

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

name: extort
trans: to take by illegal exercise of power or ingenuity

sentences.english: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的政府官员那时正向他勒索钱财。

detailed_translations.english: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

name: discourse
trans: to engage in discussion or conversation, to converse

sentences.english: "I do not know. " And thus ended their discourse.
sentences.chinese: “我也不晓得。”就这样，他们的谈话结束了。 。

sentences.english: They listened to his discourse on human relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。

sentences.english: In discourse thou must attend to what is said, and in every movement thou must observe what is doing.
sentences.chinese: 在谈话中你必须注意所说的话，在任何活动中你都必须观察在做什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲， 谈话， 论文
detailed_translations.english: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

name: feint
trans: a movement made in order to deceive an adversary

sentences.english: I feinted to the left, then to the right.
sentences.chinese: 我佯装要攻到左方，然后再到右方。

detailed_translations.english: a movement or an attack that is intended to deceive an opponent, especially in  boxing
to pretend to hit someone in  boxing

name: authentic
trans: of the same origin as claimed, genuine

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

name: charlatan
trans: a person falsely claiming to have special knowledge or skill

sentences.english: The charlatan boasted that he could charm off any disease.
sentences.chinese: 这个江湖骗子吹牛说他能用符咒治好各种疾病。

sentences.english: Incapable of moral clarity, he could never quite admit to himself that he was a charlatan and that his scheme was an impossible fiasco.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏明确的道德准则，他从来不承认自己是一个江湖骗子以及他的计划是个彻底的失败品。

sentences.english: If you are too trusting of the invisible, then you buy that $89 ebook that comes with the promise of instant riches, or you sign up for ear candling, or invest time and money with a charlatan.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对这些无形的事物相当信任，那么你可能会花89美元买一个承诺给你一夜暴富的电子书，或报名参加一次耳烛疗法，或跟一个江湖郎中花费你的时间和金钱。

name: fatalist
trans: one who maintains all things happen by inevitable necessity

name: autocracy
trans: a form of government in which one individual holds all power

sentences.english: Many poor countries are abandoning autocracy.
sentences.chinese: 很多贫穷国家都在推翻独裁统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独裁政治；专制政治；独裁政府；独裁统治的国家
detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which one person or group has unlimited power

name: desuetude
trans: disuse, obsolescence

sentences.english: those ceremonies had fallen into desuetude

detailed_translations.english: the condition of not being in use or practice; disuse

name: endurance
trans: the measure of a person's stamina or persistence

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: commiserate
trans: to feel or express compassion or sympathy for

sentences.english: When I lost, he commiserated with me.
sentences.chinese: 我失败时，他同情我。

detailed_translations.english: to express your sympathy for someone who is unhappy about something

name: critique
trans: to give detailed analysis and assessment of something

sentences.english: She had brought a book, a feminist critique of Victorian lady novelists.
sentences.chinese: 她带来了一本书，一本从女权主义角度对维多利亚时期女小说家进行的评论。

detailed_translations.english: a detailed explanation of the problems of something such as a set of political ideas
to say how good or bad a book, play, painting, or set of ideas is

name: aural
trans: of or pertaining to the ear

sentences.english: an aural stimulus
sentences.chinese: 听觉刺激

detailed_translations.chinese: 听觉的；耳的；气味的；先兆的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds

name: despotism
trans: an absolute or autocratic government

sentences.english: He can recognise a despot, and the occasions when despotism has to be checked, by force if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 他能够一眼识破专制的表象，以及这种专制应该何时有必要使用武力加以控制。

detailed_translations.english: rule by a despot

name: bronchus
trans: the primary branches of the trachea, leading into the lungs

sentences.english: The artificial bronchus was made up of biological material strengthened by a stent.
sentences.chinese: 这个人造支气管是用移植片固定模加固的生物材料制成的。

sentences.english: A medical team at Bobigny hospital in Paris removed a patient's cancerous growth, and then gave him an artificial airway, or bronchus.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎博比尼医院的一个医学研究小组切除了一个病人癌变组织，随后给予病人人工气道及支气管。

sentences.english: The artificial bronchus was made up of biological material strengthened by a stent.
sentences.chinese: 人工支气管由生物材料制成，利用支架植入来加强。

detailed_translations.english: either of the two main branches of the trachea, which contain cartilage within their walls

name: emergent
trans: in the process

sentences.english: Discovering these patterns is the key to emergent design.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些模式是紧急设计的关键。

sentences.english: The real trick in emergent design is discovering these patterns.
sentences.chinese: 紧急设计的真正诀窍就是发现这些模式。

name: anode
trans: electrode of an electrochemical cell where oxidation occurs

sentences.english: So the left electrode will be the cathode as I have configured it, and the right electrode will be anode.
sentences.chinese: 因此左边电极就成了阴极,正如我原来设定的一样，右边的电极就是阳极。

sentences.english: Second, they are "activating" some of the inactive components, by freeing lithium from the inactive material so that it can move between the cathode and the anode.
sentences.chinese: 其次，他们是“激活”消极的一些组件，通过释放从非活动的材料，以便可以移动它们之间的阴极和阳极锂。

sentences.english: The kit comes with an anode, a cathode, and an LED light.
sentences.chinese: 这种套装电池包括一根阳极、一根阴极和一颗LED灯。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a  battery  that collects  electron s  , often a wire or piece of metal with the sign (+)

name: forehead
trans: part of the face above the eyebrows and below the hairline

sentences.english: the lines on her forehead
sentences.chinese: 她前额上的皱纹

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face above your eyes and below your hair

name: concussion
trans: a violent collision or shock

name: canary
trans: to dance nimbly (as in the canary dance)

sentences.english: Tommy: I cleaned the bird cage and the canary disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 汤米：我刚才打扫鸟笼来着，金丝雀不见了。

sentences.english: Your software project might have its own kind of pit canary.
sentences.chinese: 您的软件项目也可以有自己的矿井金丝雀。

sentences.english: Look for some petal earth tones like canary yellow and light natural shades like aqua! There will be soon a dramatic transformation in your wedding that soon forms a fab.
sentences.chinese: 不妨寻找一些如金丝雀黄或如水流动的天然亮色作为裙摆的颜色，这将会使你的婚礼有一个充满戏剧性的出人意料的改变！

detailed_translations.english: a small yellow bird that people often keep as a pet

name: halcyon
trans: calm, peaceful, tranquil

sentences.english: It was all a far cry from those halcyon days in 1990, when he won three tournaments on the European tour.
sentences.chinese: 这和1990年的那些美好时光迥然不同，当时他在欧洲巡回赛中赢了三场锦标赛。

detailed_translations.english: A halcyon time is a time in the past that was peaceful or happy

name: dejection
trans: a state of melancholy or depression, low spirits, the blues

name: consolation
trans: the act of comforting someone

sentences.english: If it’s any consolation, things do get easier as the child gets older.
sentences.chinese: 聊可安慰的是，随着这孩子慢慢长大，境况也好起来了。

sentences.english: He had the consolation of knowing that he couldn’t have done any better.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己已经尽了最大努力，心中便有了安慰。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes you feel better when you are sad or disappointed

name: deport
trans: to expel someone from a country

sentences.english: ...a government decision earlier this month to deport all illegal immigrants.
sentences.chinese: …本月早些时候政府一项驱逐所有非法移民的决定。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a country and return to the country they came from, especially because they do not have a legal right to stay

name: apprehend
trans: to take or seize, to take hold of

sentences.english: The police have failed to apprehend the culprits.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能拘捕罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: if the police apprehend a criminal, they catch him or her

name: distrain
trans: to squeeze, press, to constrain, oppress

name: conquer
trans: to defeat in combat, to subjugate

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: compliant
trans: inclined to agree with others, especially submissively

sentences.english: For years I had tried to be a compliant and dutiful wife.
sentences.chinese: 多年来我都在努力做一个顺从尽职的妻子。

detailed_translations.english: willing to obey or to agree to other people’s wishes and demands

name: egoist
trans: a conceited and self-centered person

sentences.english: I never thought of myself as a bastard, an egoist .
sentences.chinese: 我从没想过我自己是个杂种， 利己主义者。

sentences.english: And so a hyper-inflated egoist from hyper-INFERIORITY Complex issue book after book to show cause of its LKYism wiseDOOM!
sentences.chinese: 一堆极度自卑的复杂问题产生了这么一个极度膨胀的利己主义者，显示出了其李光耀主义的智慧。

name: assassin
trans: to assassinate

sentences.english: Kennedy’s assassin is assumed to have been Lee Harvey Oswald.
sentences.chinese: 暗杀肯尼迪的人据说是李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德。

detailed_translations.english: someone who murders an important person

name: avidity
trans: greediness, strong appetite

sentences.english: The wiser, more cautious adults sense Jen 's avidity for rare and dangerous toys like the Green Destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这对较为聪明而谨慎小心的成年人觉察出玉娇龙对稀罕和危险玩物如“青冥剑”的贪婪之心。

detailed_translations.english: the quality or state of being avid

name: deprecate
trans: to belittle or express disapproval of

sentences.english: As a lawyer, I would deprecate any sort of legal control on gene therapy at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 作为律师，我会反对在现阶段对基因疗法进行任何形式的法律管制。

sentences.english: Though the environment doesn't have a mouth to deprecate what humans have done to her, she retaliates through action.
sentences.chinese: 尽管环境没有嘴巴来反对人类对她所做的一切，她通过行动来报复。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly disapprove of or criticize something

name: deplete
trans: to decrease seriously or exhaust the supply of (something)

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: deign
trans: to condescend, to accept as appropriate to one's dignity

name: cursive
trans: (handwriting) in flowing strokes with the letters connected

sentences.english: cursive script
sentences.chinese: 草体

detailed_translations.english: written in a style of writing with the letters joined together

detailed_translations.chinese: 草书；手写体（一种印刷字体）
detailed_translations.english: a cursive letter or printing type

name: drastic
trans: extreme, severe

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: ampersand
trans: the symbol "&"

name: citadel
trans: a strong fortress that sits high above a city

sentences.english: The citadel at Besançon towered above the river.
sentences.chinese: 贝桑松城堡高过河面。

detailed_translations.english: a strong  fort (= small castle )  built in the past as a place where people could go for safety if their city was attacked

name: cartridge
trans: a container holding a quantity of ink or other substance

sentences.english: computer game cartridges
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏卡

sentences.english: an ink cartridge for a printer
sentences.chinese: 打印机的墨盒

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹药筒，打印机的（墨盒）；[摄] 暗盒；笔芯；一卷软片
detailed_translations.english: a small container or piece of equipment that you put inside something to make it work

name: gyrate
trans: to revolve round a central point, to revolve

sentences.english: The dancers gyrated wildly to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈员随着音乐的节奏疯狂地旋转起舞。

detailed_translations.english: to turn around fast in circles

name: disputation
trans: debate or argument, formal academic debate

name: dictate
trans: to order, command, control

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

name: adjutant
trans: a military officer

sentences.english: He looked straight into his adjutant's face and did not recognise him.
sentences.chinese: 他直勾勾地望着他的副官的面孔，没有认出他是谁。

sentences.english: He rode at a walking pace to the right, and sent an adjutant to the dragoons with orders to attack the French.
sentences.chinese: 他向右方骑马缓行，将一名副官派至龙骑兵部队，并下令进攻法国军队。

sentences.english: After several persons had been let in and let out of the minister's room by the adjutant, an officer was admitted at the dreadful door, whose abject and panic-stricken face had struck Prince Andrey.
sentences.chinese: 当副官把这几个人从大臣办公室领进来又把他们领出去以后，有人让一个军官走进一扇可怕的房门里来，军官那低首下心的惊惶的样子使安德烈公爵大为愕异。

detailed_translations.english: an army officer responsible for office work

name: befriend

sentences.chinese: 我初到伦敦求学时，他们待我如同朋友。

sentences.english: In the Captain of the Axiom's cabin, there is a lit curio cabinet with a 1980's era white NASA Space Shuttle launch helmet with red and blue pin striping.
sentences.chinese: 在真理号船长室里，有一个发光的装古董的橱柜（见下图），里头陈列着上世纪80年代NASA太空船上使用的白色头盔，饰有红蓝条纹。

sentences.english: This curio has passed throgh many hands.
sentences.chinese: 这种古玩已经多次转手了。

detailed_translations.english: a small object that is interesting because it is beautiful or rare
