trans: capable of being flexed, bent or twisted, without breaking

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: assay
trans: to examine or analyze

detailed_translations.english: An assay is a test of a substance to find out what chemicals it contains. It is usually carried out to find out how pure a substance is.
to test a substance, especially a metal, to see how pure it is or what it is made of

name: felon

sentences.chinese: 按照法律，已判刑的重罪犯不能持有或使用枪支。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is guilty of a serious crime

name: decimal
trans: pertaining to or proceeding by tenths or the power of ten

sentences.english: changing to a decimal system

sentences.english: calculations accurate to three decimal places

detailed_translations.english: a decimal system is based on the number 10
a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

name: eclat
trans: brilliance of success or effort, splendor

sentences.english: Three different planar structural modes of 5 approximants have been put forward by using pentagon, decagon, flat hexagon and boat-shape respectively.
sentences.chinese: 从高分辨像出发，分别用十边形，五角形以及扁六边形和船形构筑了五种十次准晶近似相的各三种平面结构模型。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 十角形；[数] 十边形
detailed_translations.english: a polygon having ten sides

sentences.english: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches .
sentences.chinese: 今夜天气寒冷，部分地区可能有雾。

sentences.english: A blanket of fog covered the fields.
sentences.chinese: 大雾笼罩了田野。

sentences.chinese: 下午，雾散了。

sentences.chinese: 他们告诉他与他的妻子在一起呆在家里，不要出去和朋友们一起痛饮狂欢。

to do something very well, or much better than most people

sentences.english: glacial deposits
sentences.chinese: 冰川沉积

detailed_translations.chinese: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
detailed_translations.english: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

name: amnesty

sentences.english: Activists who were involved in crimes of violence will not automatically be granted amnesty.
sentences.chinese: 参与暴力犯罪的活跃分子不会被自动地给予赦免。

name: ascendant

detailed_translations.english: becoming more powerful or popular

name: forerun
trans: to run in front

name: drawl

sentences.chinese: “不能那样做。” 他懒洋洋地拖着长音。

sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

sentences.english: He entreated them to delay their departure.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求他们晚些再走。

sentences.chinese: 我们裁定被告无罪。

name: extensive

sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides

sentences.chinese: 对于我，它是一个抗抑郁剂曾用药物的强有力的助手，对一些病人来说，它是能够代替药丸的东西。

sentences.english: " Lyte urges caution as well."It MAY, in really big capitals, prove to be an adjunct to therapy, but there are a number of steps that need to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我们在花费了大量的人力物力之后，也许，也许证明它可以成为一种附属的治疗手段，但是我们仍然有大量的工作要做。

trans: the erectile hair on the back of an animal's neck

sentences.chinese: 他虽是个吃人恶魔，说话倒像个美食家。

sentences.english: This cookery book is writes by a real epicure.
sentences.chinese: 这本食谱是由一位真正的美食家写的。

sentences.english: This person is a famous eccentric, be like, be addicted to eats life, got however nevertheless " epicure " appellation.
sentences.chinese: 此人是一个有名的怪人，嗜吃如命，不过却得了一个“美食家”的称呼。

sentences.chinese: 这也是一个鼓励业余爱好者深思的现象层。

浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的
（在艺术、科学等方面）浅尝辄止

sentences.english: To this, use accredit statement is a very good processing means.
sentences.chinese: 对此，使用授权声明是一个很好的处理方式。

sentences.english: Other federal appellate courts have agreed with the government that one has no expectation of privacy in activity open to public view on city streets.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，其他几个联邦上诉法院却同意政府的意见，说任何个人在城市道路上活动即是对公众公开，因此不能指望享有隐私权。

sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

a car with a soft roof that you can fold back or remove

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["admissible evidence"]}
sentences.chinese: 可采信的证据

sentences.chinese: 塞缪尔斯医生马上否认了报纸上的这条新闻。

sentences.english: These cavils aside, most of the essays are very good indeed.

sentences.chinese: 五月份，约翰·保罗教皇将为吉娜·伯莱塔宣福。

sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长前来求助。

sentences.english: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

sentences.english: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

name: chutzpah

name: amicable

sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: adage
trans: an old saying, which has obtained credit by long use

name: dereliction
trans: willful neglect of one's duty

sentences.english: The previous owners had rescued the building from dereliction.
sentences.chinese: 以前的主人把这座建筑物从废墟中挽救了出来。

detailed_translations.english: when someone fails to do what they should do as part of their job

name: dominant
trans: most important, powerful, or influential

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: flagrant
trans: obvious and offensive, blatant, scandalous

sentences.english: His failure to turn his attention to flagrant wastes of public money is inexcusable.
sentences.chinese: 他未能注意到公共资金的公然浪费，这是不可原谅的。

sentences.english: In a world flagrant with the failures of civilization, what is there particularly immortal about our own?~G. K. Chesterton.
sentences.chinese: 在一个世界公然与文明的失败，有什么特别的不朽的自己?~G.K。切斯特顿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪恶昭彰的； 公然的
detailed_translations.english: a flagrant action is shocking because it is done in a way that is easily noticed and shows no respect for laws, truth etc

name: deflect
trans: to make (something) deviate from its original path

sentences.english: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

name: fractious
trans: refractory or unruly

sentences.english: Children become fractious when they are tired.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的；倔强的，难以对待的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fractious becomes angry very easily

name: aloft
trans: in or into the air

sentences.english: But in the stratosphere they can stay aloft for years, spread by fast winds known as jets, meaning the threat is global.
sentences.chinese: 但在平流层，它们可以在高处停留数年，高速的风对其进行传播，这意味着全球都受到了威胁。

detailed_translations.english: high up in the air

name: derogatory
trans: showing a degrading or disrespectful attitude

sentences.english: Their conversation contained a number of derogatory racial remarks .
sentences.chinese: 他们的谈话包含了一些带有种族偏见的侮辱性言论。

detailed_translations.english: derogatory remarks, attitudes etc are insulting and disapproving

name: detest
trans: to dislike intensely

sentences.english: The two men detested each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: to hate something or someone very much

name: exemplar
trans: something fit to be imitated, ideal or model

sentences.english: They viewed their new building as an exemplar of taste.
sentences.chinese: 他们将自己的新建筑视为一个品味的典范。

detailed_translations.english: a good or typical example

name: excess
trans: more than is normal, necessary or specified

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: chasm
trans: a deep, steep-sided rift, gap or fissure, a gorge or abyss

sentences.english: a rope bridge across the chasm
sentences.chinese: 峡谷上的索桥

detailed_translations.english: a very deep space between two areas of rock or ice, especially one that is dangerous

name: bombardier
trans: a bomber crew member who sights and releases bombs

detailed_translations.english: the person on a military aircraft who is responsible for dropping bombs

name: disentangle
trans: to free something from entanglement, to extricate or unknot

sentences.english: In this new book, Harrison brilliantly disentangles complex debates.
sentences.chinese: 在这本新书里，哈里森出色地在复杂的争论中理顺了头绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决；松开；解开纠结；解决（纠纷）
detailed_translations.english: to remove knots from ropes, strings etc that have become twisted or tied together

name: cameo
trans: a brief appearance of a prominent actor in a video

sentences.english: a cameo brooch
sentences.chinese: 浮雕宝石胸针

detailed_translations.chinese: （影视剧中的）配角；刻有浮雕的宝石或贝壳；小品文
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of jewellery with a raised shape, usually a person’s face, on a flat background of a different colour

name: embodiment
trans: a tangible or visible form of an idea, quality, or feeling

name: finesse
trans: extreme delicacy or subtlety in action, performance, etc

sentences.english: Dario played the sonata with great finesse.
sentences.chinese: 达里奥以高超的技艺弹奏了这首奏鸣曲。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something with finesse, you do it with a lot of skill and style

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧妙处理；以偷牌方式先出
detailed_translations.english: to handle a situation well, but in a way that is slightly deceitful

name: characteristic
trans: being a distinguishing feature of a person or thing

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: brevity
trans: concise and exact use of words in writing or speech

sentences.english: Letters published in the newspaper are edited for brevity and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 报上刊登的来信都要编辑得简洁明了。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of expressing something in very few words

name: fraternal
trans: of brothers (fraternal twins)

sentences.english: fraternal solidarity amongst union members
sentences.chinese: 工会成员兄弟般的团结

detailed_translations.english: showing a special friendliness to other people because you share interests or ideas with them

name: commensurate
trans: corresponding in size or degree

sentences.english: Employees are paid salaries commensurate with those of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 发给雇员的薪水与发给教师的薪水相当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相称的；同量的；同样大小的
detailed_translations.english: matching something in size, quality, or length of time

name: delusion
trans: a false belief that is resistant to confrontation with fact

sentences.english: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 我有一种错觉，他要娶我。

detailed_translations.english: a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in

name: defiant
trans: showing open resistance, provocative

sentences.english: The players are in a defiant mood as they prepare for tomorrow's game.
sentences.chinese: 在准备明天的比赛时，球员们态度挑衅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的；目中无人的，蔑视的；挑战的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is defiant, you mean they show aggression or independence by refusing to obey someone

name: exigency
trans: exigent  state or character, urgency

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧急要求， 迫切需要

name: culmination
trans: the highest or climactic point of something

sentences.english: This little book represented the culmination of 15 years’ work.
sentences.chinese: 这本小书是15年工作的结晶。

detailed_translations.english: something, especially something important, that happens at the end of a long period of effort or development

name: dissonant
trans: unsuitable in combination

sentences.english: The so-called noise is chaotic, dissonant sounds, and more than normal people psychology, the volume of the hearing.
sentences.chinese: 所谓噪音即是混乱、不谐和的声音，以及超过人们正常心理、听觉的音量。

sentences.english: All that is harsh and dissonant in my life melts into one sweet harmony---and my adoration spreads wings like a glad bird on its flight across the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我生命中所有的浅陋和纠结，化入一道甜蜜的和谐---对你的崇敬如一只快乐的飞鸟，在海面上张开双翼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不和谐的， 不一致的
detailed_translations.english: discordant; cacophonous

name: desistance
trans: the act or state of desisting, cessation

name: conventional
trans: based on or in accordance with what is generally done

sentences.english: Internet connections through conventional phone lines are fairly slow.
sentences.chinese: 通过传统的电话线来连接因特网速度很慢。

sentences.english: Bake for 20 minutes in a conventional oven; 8 in a microwave.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的烤炉中烘烤20分钟，在微波炉里则烤8分钟。

detailed_translations.english: a conventional method, product, practice etc has been used for a long time and is considered the usual type

name: gourmand
trans: a person who is fond of good eating

name: chancery
trans: the office or department of a chancellor, chancellery

name: extrapolate
trans: to infer (an unknown) from something that is known

sentences.english: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

name: forbearance
trans: restraint under provocation

sentences.english: There is too much torment, renunciation, and anxiety in this love for it to be anything but infinite forbearance.
sentences.chinese: 这爱中有太多的折磨、太多的自制、与太多的焦虑，除了无穷无尽的忍耐，这些就成了它的一切。

sentences.english: But forbearance alone cannot be a long-term answer to the problem of Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 但是仅仅是忍耐不能做为巴基斯坦问题的一个长期答案。

sentences.english: The second principle is forbearance.
sentences.chinese: 第二个原则是忍耐。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being patient, able to control your emotions, and willing to forgive someone who has upset you

name: amiss
trans: wrong, faulty, out of order, improper

sentences.english: Their instincts warned them something was amiss.
sentences.chinese: 他们的直觉警告他们某些地方不对头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有毛病的，有缺陷的；出差错的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong

name: fungus
trans: any member of the kingdom fungi

sentences.english: The roses have fungus.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花长了真菌。

sentences.english: So how do you kill a fungus without harming its host?
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，我们如何才能做到不伤害宿主只杀死真菌呢?。

sentences.english: Monokaryons of this fungus will grow readily as saprophytes in plate or liquid culture .
sentences.chinese: 这种真菌的单核体在平板或液体培养时能像腐生菌那样容易生长。

detailed_translations.english: a simple type of plant that has no leaves or flowers and that grows on plants or other surfaces.  mushrooms  and  mould  are both fungi.

name: fusible
trans: able to be fused or melted

name: educe
trans: to draw out or bring out, elicit or evoke

name: discontinuance
trans: the occurrence of something being terminated, a cessation

name: alliance
trans: the state of being allied, the act of allying or uniting

sentences.english: independent organizations and alliances
sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

name: complacent
trans: smug or uncritical satisfaction with one's achievements

sentences.english: There’s a danger of becoming complacent if you win a few games.
sentences.chinese: 赢了几场比赛可能就会变得沾沾自喜。

sentences.english: a complacent attitude towards the problem
sentences.chinese: 对问题满不在乎的态度

detailed_translations.english: pleased with a situation, especially something you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

name: besmear
trans: to smear over, sully

detailed_translations.english: to smear over; daub

name: accentuate
trans: to pronounce with an accent or vocal stress

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: counterfeit
trans: to falsely produce what appears to be official or valid

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

name: conviction
trans: a belief, a judgement that someone is guilty of a crime

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: flexion
trans: the act of bending a limb

name: capacious
trans: having a lot of space inside, roomy

sentences.english: a capacious suitcase
sentences.chinese: 容量很大的手提箱

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽敞的；广阔的；容积大的
detailed_translations.english: able to contain a lot

name: chattel
trans: a movable article of personal property

sentences.english: a society in which women are considered to be chattels
sentences.chinese: 视女人为私人财产的社会

detailed_translations.english: a piece of personal property that you can move from one place to another

name: encumbrance
trans: something that encumbers, a burden that must be carried

name: egocentric
trans: regarding the self as the center of all things

sentences.english: He was egocentric, a man of impulse who expected those around him to serve him.
sentences.chinese: 他自我中心，易冲动，希望周围的人为他服务。

detailed_translations.chinese: [心理] 自我中心的；利己主义的
detailed_translations.english: thinking only about yourself and not about what other people might need or want

name: disparage
trans: to regard or represent as being of little worth

sentences.english: ...Larkin's tendency to disparage literature.
sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them

name: catapult
trans: a device that launches an object some distance

name: dotard
trans: a person with impaired intellect, especially an old person

name: apprentice
trans: a person who's learning a trade from a skilled employer

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: foresight
trans: the ability to foresee or prepare wisely for the future

sentences.english: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
sentences.chinese: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑
detailed_translations.english: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future

name: adept
trans: well skilled, completely versed, thoroughly proficient

sentences.english: I’m afraid she’s also an adept liar.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕她还是一个撒谎专家。

detailed_translations.english: good at something that needs care and skill

name: astound
trans: to overwhelm with amazement

sentences.english: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们所做的都是我们擅长的事情，我们最终将使自己大吃一惊。

sentences.english: “You astound me!” Mrs. Willoughby said, pressing her clasped hands to her lips, a gesture she normally bestowed upon seniors who were making their final appearance in the spring choral concert.
sentences.chinese: “你真是令我大吃一惊啊！” 威洛比太太说道，双手紧紧的按在嘴唇上——这是她通常在毕业班学生参加春季合唱音乐会上最后献唱时才会做出的姿势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊骇, 使大吃一惊

name: dissent
trans: to differ in opinion

sentences.english: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

name: diplomatist
trans: a person tactful in negotiation

name: annal
trans: occurring once a year

name: entrail
trans: the internal parts of the trunk of a body, the intestines

name: convex
trans: curved or bowed outward like the outside of a circle

sentences.english: a convex lens
sentences.chinese: 凸透镜

sentences.english: a convex mirror
sentences.chinese: 凸镜

detailed_translations.english: curved outwards, like the surface of the eye

name: antenatal
trans: occurring or existing before birth

sentences.english: an antenatal clinic
sentences.chinese: 产前检查诊所

sentences.english: regular antenatal care
sentences.chinese: 定期产前保健

sentences.english: Many young mothers do not attend antenatal classes .
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻的母亲不参加产前学习班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the medical care given to women who are going to have a baby

name: amateur
trans: non-professional

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: deter
trans: to prevent something from happening

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

name: anthracite
trans: a slow-burning coal

name: bask
trans: to revel in, to lie exposed to warmth and light

sentences.english: All through the hot, still days of their holiday Amy basked in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在整个炎热、寂静的假期里埃米都在晒太阳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 晒太阳；取暖；愉快或舒适
detailed_translations.english: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

name: dehydrate
trans: to lose or remove water, to dry

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: actionable
trans: affording grounds for legal action

name: flimsy
trans: likely to bend or break under pressure, weak, shaky

sentences.english: a flimsy cotton dress
sentences.chinese: 一件又轻又薄的棉布连衣裙

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的；浅薄的；易损坏的；不周密的
detailed_translations.english: flimsy cloth or clothing is light and thin

name: agnostic
trans: the doubt of a higher power/being

sentences.english: When an atheist or agnostic asks me about Sunday School for their children, I recommend exposing their children to a religion.
sentences.chinese: 当一个无神论者或不可知论者问我星期天学校的事时，我的建议是让孩子去了解宗教。

sentences.english: I have mentioned that Locke was very agnostic.
sentences.chinese: 我提到过，洛克是个不可知论者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that people cannot know whether God exists or not

name: demurrage
trans: the delaying in port of a ship beyond the time allowed

name: fauna
trans: animals of a given region or period considered as a whole

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

name: aerostat
trans: an aircraft that derives its lift from buoyancy

sentences.english: Transient thermal response of a spherical aerostat in rising process was studied based on this model.
sentences.chinese: 通过建立平流层浮空器的热模型，对球形浮空器升空过程中的瞬态热响应进行了数值模拟。

sentences.english: The ability of intercepting and tracking for air defense antimissile system can be effectively improved by top observation with aerostat.
sentences.chinese: 利用浮空器进行俯视观测可有效提高防空反导系统的截获、跟踪目标能力。

detailed_translations.english: a lighter-than-air craft, such as a balloon

name: cleft
trans: a space or opening made by cleavage, a split

sentences.english: ...a narrow cleft in the rocks too small for humans to enter.
sentences.chinese: ...石块上一个对于人想钻进来说太小了的裂口。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has a cleft chin, they have a cleft in their chin
a natural crack in something, especially the surface of rocks or the Earth

name: commission
trans: to send or officially charge someone to do something

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: acclimate
trans: to habituate to a climate not native

sentences.english: Several things can be done to help the snake acclimate.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过几件事帮助这些蛇去适应新环境。

sentences.english: Some earth plants that I will try to acclimate to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我将设法使一些地球植物适应月球的环境。

detailed_translations.english: Acclimate means the same as

name: deficiency
trans: inadequacy or incompleteness

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

name: emphasize
trans: to stress, give emphasis or extra weight to (something)

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: evanescent
trans: vanishing, fading away, fleeting

sentences.english: ...the evanescent scents of summer herbs.
sentences.chinese: ...夏季香草逐渐消散的味道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 容易消散的；逐渐消失的；会凋零的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is evanescent gradually disappears from sight or memory

name: eureka
trans: an exclamation of triumph at a discovery

name: demonstrative
trans: that serves to demonstrate, show or prove

sentences.english: My mother wasn’t demonstrative; she never hugged me.
sentences.chinese: 母亲感情内敛，从未拥抱过我。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明的；证明的；公开表露感情的
detailed_translations.english: willing to show that you care about someone
In grammar, the words "this," "that," "these," and "those" are sometimes called demonstratives

name: disburse
trans: to pay out, expend, usually from a public fund or treasury

sentences.english: The aid will not be disbursed until next year.
sentences.chinese: 援助款项到明年才能拨出。

detailed_translations.english: to pay out money, especially from a large sum that is available for a special purpose

name: alternative
trans: relating to a choice between two or more possibilities

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: decipher
trans: to succeed in understanding or interpreting

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

name: aviary
trans: an enclosure for keeping birds confined

sentences.english: Already he had begun to forget them, and Shepperton soon became an extraordinary aviary, filled with birds of every species.
sentences.chinese: 他已经把那些邻居们给忘记了，谢伯顿不久就变成了一个特别的鸟类饲养场，拥有各类品种的鸟。

detailed_translations.english: a large  cage  where birds are kept

name: animadversion
trans: a criticism, a critical remark

sentences.english: The teacher gives public recognition, the animadversion has never appeared her name as well.
sentences.chinese: 老师表扬、 批评也从未出现过她的名字。

sentences.english: But , suffer in the " Barbie " public extensive welcome of at the same time, also suffered the animadversion from everyone's.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在“芭比”受到公众广泛欢迎的同时，也受到了来自各方面的批评。

detailed_translations.english: criticism or censure

name: forensic
trans: relating to the use of science in investigation of evidence

sentences.english: They were convicted on forensic evidence alone.
sentences.chinese: 他们被仅凭法庭科学证据定了罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法院的；辩论的；适于法庭的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the scientific methods used for finding out about a crime

name: devastate
trans: to destroy or ruin (something)

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

name: extempore
trans: carried out with no preparation, impromptu

name: buxom
trans: having a voluptuous figure, especially having large breasts

sentences.english: Melissa was a tall, buxom blonde.
sentences.chinese: 梅丽莎是一位高挑丰腴的金发美女。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is buxom is attractively large and healthy and has big breasts

name: diaphanous
trans: light, delicate, and translucent

sentences.english: ...a diaphanous dress of pale gold.
sentences.chinese: ...一件浅金色薄得几乎透明的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: diaphanous cloth is so thin that you can almost see through it

name: conservatism
trans: a political philosophy that advocates traditional values

sentences.english: people’s innate conservatism in matters of language
sentences.chinese: 人们在语言方面天生的守旧

detailed_translations.english: dislike of change and new ideas

name: grapple
trans: to seize something and hold it firmly

sentences.english: The police warned the public that it would be dangerous to grapple with the wanted man, as he was armed.
sentences.chinese: 警察当局警告公众，与那个通缉犯格斗是危险的，因为他携带武器。

name: composed
trans: calm, tranquil, serene

sentences.english: He appeared very composed despite the stress he was under.
sentences.chinese: 尽管压力很大，他看起来仍十分镇定。

detailed_translations.english: seeming calm and not upset or angry

detailed_translations.chinese: 组成；作曲（compose的过去分词）；著作

name: abate
trans: to put an end to

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: eclectic
trans: made up of things selected from various sources

sentences.english: But they are the tip of an eclectic iceberg in the country.
sentences.chinese: 其实这只不过是折衷主义在这个国家表现出来的冰山一角。

sentences.english: One of my (several) frustrations in life is the eclectic way the word “science” is used in human discourse.
sentences.chinese: 我在生活中遇到的挫折之一，是试图改变人类在使用“科学”一词时的折衷的态度。

sentences.english: At the same time, countless of Jazz clubs, discotheques and the endless music from open air beer garden even made the OrdRoad turn into a popular gathering location for eclectic today.
sentences.chinese: 同时不计其数的爵士俱乐部，迪斯科舞厅和露天啤酒花园的无休止的音乐也使乌节路成为了今天折中主义者聚集的场所。

name: expend
trans: to consume or exhaust some resource

sentences.english: Children expend a lot of energy and may need more high-energy food than adults.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们耗能多，可能比成人需要更多高能量的食物。

detailed_translations.english: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

name: fulsome
trans: offensive to good taste, especially as being excessive

sentences.english: Newspapers have been fulsome in their praise of the former president.
sentences.chinese: 报界对前任总统的赞扬过于恭维了。

name: ethos
trans: characteristic spirit of a culture, era, or community

sentences.english: a community in which people lived according to an ethos of sharing and caring
sentences.chinese: 人们本着分享与关爱精神来生活的社区

detailed_translations.chinese: 民族精神；气质；社会思潮

name: clumsy
trans: awkward, lacking coordination, not graceful, not dextrous

sentences.english: A clumsy waiter spilled wine all over her new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 一名笨手笨脚的服务员把葡萄酒洒得她新裙子上到处都是。

sentences.english: a clumsy attempt to catch the ball
sentences.chinese: 笨拙的接球动作

detailed_translations.english: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

name: assert
trans: to state a fact or belief confidently and forcefully

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: ewe
trans: a female sheep, especially when fully mature

sentences.english: The ewe milks well.
sentences.chinese: 这头母羊出奶率高。

sentences.english: On one occasion, two eagles were trying to take a lamb from its mother and were struggling. A third eagle came in to distract the ewe and one of the others got the lamb.
sentences.chinese: 有可能情况是这样的，两只金雕试图从母羊手里夺走小羊羔，相持不下，第三只雕飞来转移了母羊的注意力，后来前面两只中的一只抓走了羊羔。

sentences.english: The resulting hybrid was grown into a tiny embryo known as a blastocyst, implanted into the womb of a surrogate mother, and went on to become Dolly, the world's most famous ewe.
sentences.chinese: 杂交后的细胞渐渐成长为一个小小的叫做胚泡的胚胎，被植入代孕母亲的子宫，然后就变成了多莉——世界最著名的母羊。

detailed_translations.english: a female sheep

name: encroach
trans: to advance gradually and in a way that causes damage

sentences.english: The shrubs encroached ever more on the twisting drive.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛蚕食了越来越多蜿蜒的车道。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should

name: carnage
trans: death and destruction

sentences.english: a scene of terrible carnage
sentences.chinese: 可怕的大屠杀场面

detailed_translations.english: when a lot of people are killed and injured, especially in a war

name: booming
trans: having a great period of prosperity

detailed_translations.chinese: 发展迅速的； 激增的

name: bland
trans: mild, soft, gentle

sentences.english: a few bland comments
sentences.chinese: 不痛不痒的几句评语

detailed_translations.english: without any excitement, strong opinions, or special character

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…变得淡而无味；除掉…的特性
变得平淡无奇；丧失特性

name: commandeer
trans: to seize for military use

name: bemuse
trans: to confuse or bewilder

sentences.english: The sheer quantity of detail would bemuse even the most clear-headed author.
sentences.chinese: 大量的细节会让即使是头脑最清醒的作者都感到困惑。

detailed_translations.english: If something bemuses you, it puzzles or confuses you

name: forfend
trans: to prohibit, to forbid, to avert

name: apex
trans: the highest point of something

sentences.english: the apex of the roof
sentences.chinese: 房顶的尖端

sentences.english: the apex of a pyramid
sentences.chinese: 金字塔塔尖

detailed_translations.english: the top or highest part of something pointed or curved

name: demagnetize
trans: to remove the magnetic propreties of something

sentences.english: When you rent or buy a DVD, the checkout clerk rubs it across a pad to demagnetize the metallic glass so it won't trigger an alarm when you leave.
sentences.chinese: 当你租或者买DVD光盘时，收银员会把它滑过一个垫子使其中的金属玻璃退磁，所以在你离开的时候不会引起警报。

detailed_translations.english: to take away the  magnetic  qualities of something

name: emigrate
trans: to leave the country in which one lives and settle elsewhere

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: duration
trans: an amount of time or a particular time interval

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: constellation
trans: an arbitrary formation of stars perceived as a figure

sentences.english: a star in the constellation of Orion
sentences.chinese: 猎户座的一颗恒星

detailed_translations.chinese: [天] 星座；星群；荟萃；兴奋丛
detailed_translations.english: a group of stars that forms a particular pattern and has a name

name: course
trans: to run or flow, especially of liquids

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: adhere
trans: to stick fast or cleave, to become joined or united

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: connive
trans: to cooperate with others secretly in order to commit a crime

sentences.english: He accused them of conniving with foreign companies to weaken employment rights.
sentences.chinese: 他指控他们与外国公司共谋来削弱雇用权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 默许； 纵容； 共谋
detailed_translations.english: to not try to stop something wrong from happening

name: frizz
trans: of hair, to form into a mass of tight curls

name: effectual
trans: producing the intended result, entirely adequate

sentences.english: This is the only effectual way to secure our present and future happiness.
sentences.chinese: 这是确保我们现在和未来幸福的唯一有效途径。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奏效的；会应验的；有法律效力的
detailed_translations.english: producing the result that was wanted or intended

name: combatant
trans: an armed fighter

sentences.english: I have never suggested that U.N. forces could physically separate the combatants in the region.
sentences.chinese: 我从未表示过联合国部队能将该地区的参战者们实际隔离开。

detailed_translations.english: someone who fights in a war

name: aide-de-camp
trans: a military officer who assists a higher ranking officer

name: dismal
trans: disappointingly inadequate

sentences.english: The future looks pretty dismal right now.
sentences.chinese: 目前前景似乎相当暗淡。

sentences.english: a dismal, grey afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一个阴沉灰暗的下午

detailed_translations.chinese: 凄凉的，忧郁的；阴沉的，沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: if a situation or a place is dismal, it is so bad that it makes you feel very unhappy and hopeless

name: britannia
trans: the ancient Roman name for Great Britain

name: advent
trans: coming, arrival

sentences.english: the advent of the computer
sentences.chinese: 计算机的问世

detailed_translations.chinese: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
detailed_translations.english: the time when something first begins to be widely used

name: beleaguer
trans: to lay siege to

sentences.english: Curiger sees “a lot of commonalities between the Venetian master's quest and the eagerness of some contemporary artists to defy the conventions which beleaguer art in our time.”
sentences.chinese: Curiger 看到“在威尼斯大师的探求和当代艺术家热心反抗习俗中的许多共性，在我们这个时代，艺术被围攻，这些当代艺术家们敢公然反抗习俗。”

name: fodder
trans: to feed animals (with fodder)

sentences.english: ...fodder for horses.
sentences.chinese: …马的饲料。

detailed_translations.english: food for farm animals

name: calescence
trans: growing warm, increasing in heat

name: frontal
trans: of, in, or at the front

sentences.english: the frontal armour of the new tanks
sentences.chinese: 新型坦克的正面装甲

detailed_translations.english: at or relating to the front part of something

name: garrulous
trans: excessively talkative, rambling

sentences.english: Ian isn’t normally this garrulous!
sentences.chinese: 伊恩一般不这么唠叨！

detailed_translations.chinese: 唠叨的；喋喋不休的；多嘴的
detailed_translations.english: always talking a lot

name: ancillary
trans: subordinate, secondary, auxiliary, accessory

sentences.english: Agreement was reached on several ancillary matters.
sentences.chinese: 就一些相关问题达成了协议。

detailed_translations.english: workers who provide additional help and services for the people who do the main work in hospitals, schools etc

name: ample
trans: large, great in size, extent, capacity, or bulk, spacious

sentences.english: an ample bosom
sentences.chinese: 丰满的胸部

detailed_translations.english: more than enough

name: diplomat
trans: a person appointed to conduct international relations

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: ambrosial
trans: succulently sweet or fragrant

sentences.english: The ambrosial aroma of the roast whetted our appetites.
sentences.chinese: 烤肉的香味刺激了我们的食欲。

sentences.english: Next, you can delicately dip your content into a warm bath of ambrosial CSS—but before you jump to the hard candy shell, there are some additional considerations.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，你可以将内容小心地浸入芳香美味的CSS暖浴中了。不过在你跳进糖果硬壳之前，还有些额外的考虑。

name: conjunction
trans: the formation of a link or connection between things

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result

name: alternate
trans: to perform by turns or in succession, interchange regularly

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: gullibility
trans: the quality of believing information, truthful or otherwise

name: annotate
trans: to add annotation

sentences.english: an annotated edition of ‘Othello’
sentences.chinese: 《奥赛罗》的注释本

detailed_translations.english: to add short notes to a book or piece of writing to explain parts of it

name: emanate
trans: to come from a source, stem out of

sentences.english: Intelligence and cunning emanated from him.
sentences.chinese: 聪明和机灵从他身上散发出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放射（过去式emanated，过去分词emanated，现在分词emanating，第三人称单数emanates，形容词emanative）；发散
detailed_translations.english: If a quality emanates from you, or if you emanate a quality, you give people a strong sense that you have that quality

name: finery
trans: fine  or showy dress, ornaments, etc

sentences.english: The guests arrived in all their finery.
sentences.chinese: 宾客们盛装到来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 服饰；华丽的服饰，鲜艳服装；装饰
detailed_translations.english: clothes and jewellery that are beautiful or very expensive, and are worn for a special occasion

name: abstain
trans: refrain from (something)

sentences.english: Three countries abstained in the vote.
sentences.chinese: 三个国家在投票中弃权了。

detailed_translations.english: If you abstain during a vote, you do not use your vote

name: diddle
trans: to cheat, swindle, hoax

sentences.english: They diddled their insurance company by making a false claim.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过提出虚假索赔来诈骗保险公司。

detailed_translations.english: to get money from someone by deceiving them

name: flux
trans: flowing or flow

sentences.english: Everything is in flux at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下一切都变化不定。

detailed_translations.chinese: [流][机] 流量；变迁；不稳定；流出

name: fortify
trans: to protect or strengthen against attack

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: fetus
trans: an unborn vertebrate showing signs of the mature animal

sentences.english: Pregnant women who are heavy drinkers risk damaging the unborn fetus.
sentences.chinese: 酗酒的孕妇冒有伤害胎儿的危险。

detailed_translations.english: A fetus is an animal or human being in its later stages of development before it is born

name: contentious
trans: causing or likely to cause an argument, controversial

sentences.english: Sanctions are expected to be among the most contentious issues.
sentences.chinese: 制裁预计位居最具有争议的问题之列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诉讼的；有异议的，引起争论的；爱争论的
detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of argument and disagreement between people

name: confluent
trans: (of wind) which converges, esp. When seen on a weather chart

name: censorious
trans: addicted to censure and scolding

sentences.english: His tone was censorious.
sentences.chinese: 他语气苛刻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑剔的；受批判的（名词censoriousness，副词censoriously）
detailed_translations.english: criticizing and expressing disapproval

name: consistency
trans: degree of density, viscosity, firmness, etc.

sentences.english: She scores goals with remarkable consistency.
sentences.chinese: 她以非凡的连贯性进球得分。

detailed_translations.english: how thick, smooth etc a substance is

name: deceive
trans: to trick or mislead

sentences.english: He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人骗了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true
to make someone believe something that is not true

name: blockade
trans: an obstruction of passage or progress

sentences.english: The ships blockaded the port.
sentences.chinese: 船只封锁了港口。

detailed_translations.english: to put a place under a blockade
something that is used to stop vehicles or people entering or leaving a place

name: amalgamate
trans: blend, merge

sentences.english: The firm has amalgamated with another company.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司已经与另一家公司合并了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合并；汞齐化；调制汞合金
detailed_translations.english: if two organizations amalgamate, or if one amalgamates with another, they join and make one big organization

name: automaton
trans: a robot designed to follow a sequence of instructions

sentences.english: The paper introduces the working principle of the whole system of gold foil manipulating automaton and PLC control system.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了金箔装叠精细操作机器人自动化系统总体工作原理及PLC控制系统原理。

sentences.english: Man like every other animal is by nature indolent. if nothing spurs him on then he will hardly think and will bahave from habit like an automaton.
sentences.chinese: 人如其他动物一样本性慵懒，如果没有什么鞭策著他，他几乎不思考，只是象机器人一样按照习惯去做。

detailed_translations.english: a machine, especially one in the shape of a human, that moves without anyone controlling it

name: atone
trans: to make reparation, compensation, or amends, for an offence

sentences.english: He felt he had atoned for what he had done to his son.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得他已弥补曾对儿子所做的错事。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you are sorry for having done something wrong

name: conciliate
trans: make calm and content, placate

sentences.english: efforts to conciliate the unions
sentences.chinese: 对工会进行调停的努力

detailed_translations.chinese: 安抚，安慰；调和；驯服；怀柔；赢得
detailed_translations.english: to do something to make people more likely to stop arguing, especially by giving them something they want

name: gist
trans: the most essential part, the main idea or substance

sentences.english: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist (= understand the main meaning ) of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要去管各个细节，只要理解主要意思就行了。

detailed_translations.english: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

name: hardihood
trans: boldness and daring

detailed_translations.chinese: 刚毅，大胆；厚颜；胆大无敌

name: apartheid
trans: any system that separates people according to race

sentences.english: He praised her role in the struggle against apartheid.
sentences.chinese: 他赞扬了她在反对种族隔离制的斗争中所起的作用。

detailed_translations.english: Apartheid was a political system in South Africa in which people were divided into racial groups and kept apart by law

name: germane
trans: related to the topic being discussed or considered

sentences.english: ...the suppression of a number of documents which were very germane to the case.
sentences.chinese: ...对几份与本案密切相关的文件的隐瞒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有密切关系的；贴切的；恰当的
detailed_translations.english: an idea, remark etc that is germane to something is related to it in an important and suitable way

name: decency
trans: conformity to accepted standards of respectability

sentences.english: a judgment reflecting the decency and good sense of the American people
sentences.chinese: 反映美国人民正直和智慧的判断

sentences.english: Is there no sense of decency left in this country?
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的道德观难道已经泯灭了吗？

sentences.english: If they’re going to charge people a fee, they ought to at least have the decency to tell them in advance.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们要对人们收费，至少也应该事先告诉一声。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正派；体面；庄重；合乎礼仪；礼貌
detailed_translations.english: polite, honest, and moral behaviour and attitudes that show respect for other people

name: benison
trans: a blessing, benediction

sentences.english: If you can hear my benison.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能听见我的祝祷。

sentences.english: If you are admired by your success, my benison is warmly and hortative contemplation traversing congested crowd.
sentences.chinese: 假若你成功受景仰，那麽我的祝福就是穿越拥挤的人群给你温暖鼓历的注视；

sentences.english: If you are admired by your success, my benison is warmly and hortative contemplation traversing congested crowd.
sentences.chinese: 假若你成功受景仰，那么我的祝福就是穿越拥挤的人群给你温暖鼓历的注视；

detailed_translations.english: a blessing, esp a spoken one

name: embezzle
trans: to steal or misappropriate money one has been trusted with

sentences.english: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
sentences.chinese: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money from the place where you work

name: bruit
trans: to spread, promulgate or disseminate a rumour, news etc

sentences.english: it was bruited about that the king was dead

detailed_translations.english: to report; rumour

name: articulate
trans: express (an idea of feeling) fluently and coherently

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: caret
trans: a mark made in writing to show something is to be inserted

name: actuality
trans: the state of existing, existence

sentences.english: the grim actualities of prison life
sentences.chinese: 监狱生活的严酷现实

detailed_translations.english: facts, rather than things that people believe or imagine

name: globular
trans: roughly spherical in shape

name: extraordinary
trans: not ordinary, exceptional, unusual

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: disadvise
trans: to advise against, to dissuade from

name: depopulate
trans: to reduce the population of a region

sentences.english: Disease depopulated the whole region.
sentences.chinese: 疾病使整个地区人口大量减少。

detailed_translations.english: to greatly reduce the number of people living in a particular area

name: abbey
trans: a monastery or society of people

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was an abbess in a small abbey .
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，一个小修道院里有一个女修道院院长。

detailed_translations.english: a large church with buildings next to it where  monk s  and  nun s  live or used to live

name: gusto
trans: enthusiasm, enjoyment, vigor

name: circumlocution
trans: a roundabout or indirect way of speaking

detailed_translations.chinese: 婉转曲折的说法，累赘的陈述；遁辞
detailed_translations.english: the practice of using too many words to express an idea, instead of saying it directly

name: analyze
trans: to subject to analysis

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: glazier
trans: a person who fits windows or the like with glass

name: commotion
trans: a state of turbulent motion

sentences.english: He heard a commotion outside.
sentences.chinese: 他听到外面一阵骚动。

detailed_translations.english: A commotion is a lot of noise, confusion, and excitement

name: conceive
trans: to develop an idea

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: encomium
trans: a piece of writing that praises someone or something highly

name: avocation
trans: a calling away, a diversion

sentences.english: He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation.
sentences.chinese: 他在印刷厂工作，同时是个博物学爱好者。

detailed_translations.english: Your avocation is a job or activity that you do because you are interested in it, rather than to earn your living

name: duplicity
trans: deceitfulness, double dealing

sentences.english: Strange I was stubborn like duplicity said every word is the public taste.
sentences.chinese: 怪我生性倔强喜欢口是心非说的每一句话都不合大众口味。

sentences.english: Since the promotion of a new era is more focused on inner beauty why duplicity of people to meet others vanity and so praised it?
sentences.chinese: 既然新时代提倡的是更加注重于内在美，那为什么口是心非的人为了满足他人的虚荣心而如此称赞呢？

name: desiccant
trans: causing dryness

sentences.english: amount of desiccant must be used to offset the wooden bracing if placed inside of the barrier
sentences.chinese: 经常在屏蔽袋外部使用木制支架。 合适数量的干燥剂必须使用在木制支架内。

sentences.english: A patent-pending University of Maryland student design, the liquid desiccant waterfall is arranged into the wall and helps provide high-efficiency humidity control.
sentences.chinese: 由马里兰大学学生设计、正在申请专利的液态干燥剂水幕被设置在墙体中，以提供高效的湿度控制。

sentences.english: It is a low-tech version of the “Do Not Eat” desiccant packets that may have been packed in the box the phone came in, to keep moisture away from the circuitry during shipping and storage.
sentences.chinese: 这是“禁止食用”干燥剂的低技术版。 和那些手机盒子里为了在运输和贮藏过程中防潮的小包有同样功效。

detailed_translations.english: desiccating or drying
a substance, such as calcium oxide, that absorbs water and is used to remove moisture; a drying agent

name: epigram
trans: any witty, ingenious, or pointed saying tersely expressed

detailed_translations.english: a short sentence that expresses an idea in a clever or amusing way

name: disciple
trans: a person who is a pupil of the doctrines of another

sentences.english: ...a major intellectual figure with disciples throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: …一位信徒遍布欧洲的重要知识分子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in the ideas of a great teacher or leader, especially a religious one

name: aliment
trans: that which nourishes, food

detailed_translations.english: something that nourishes or sustains the body or mind

name: forge
trans: to form by heating and hammering, beat into shape

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: despicable
trans: fit or deserving to be despised, contemptible

sentences.english: It’s despicable the way he treats those kids.
sentences.chinese: 他那样对待那些孩子，真卑鄙。

sentences.english: a despicable act of terrorism
sentences.chinese: 卑劣的恐怖主义行径

sentences.english: a despicable crime
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的罪行

detailed_translations.english: extremely bad, immoral, or cruel

name: esoteric
trans: understood by or meant for only a select few

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

name: demise
trans: a person's death

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

name: disheveled
trans: untidy, disordered (of clothes, appearance)

sentences.english: A disheveled pile of books on the library table.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的桌子上摆着一堆凌乱不整的书。

sentences.english: Hair disheveled like wind-blown withered grass, eyes blood-shot, shuffle languidly in the slippers.
sentences.chinese: 头发凌乱得像吹乱的枯草，眼睛布满血丝，颓然地趿拉着拖鞋。

sentences.english: In reality, Gates is a smooth operator who, despite his uncombed hair, baby face and disheveled appearance, knew exactly what he was doing every step of the way.
sentences.chinese: 在现实中，尽管盖茨的头发总是乱糟糟的，又长着张娃娃脸，不修边幅，他可是个老练的生意人，每走一步都成竹在胸。

name: aggravate
trans: to make worse, or more severe

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: fungous
trans: of or pertaining to a fungus, fungal

name: adversary
trans: an enemy

sentences.english: His business rivals knew they could expect no quarter from such a ruthless adversary.
sentences.chinese: 他的业务对手都知道他们不能指望这样无情的对手的慈悲。

sentences.english: They tell us, sir, that we are weak -- unable to cope with so formidable an adversary.
sentences.chinese: 先生，他们告诉我们，我们是弱小的——不能应付如此强大的对手。

sentences.english: If we use exponentiation to encrypt or decrypt , the adversary can use logarithm to attack .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们运用求幂运算来加密和解密，对手就可以运用对数进行攻击。

detailed_translations.english: a country or person you are fighting or competing against

name: encyclical
trans: intended for general circulation

name: chronometer
trans: a device for measuring time, such as a watch or clock

sentences.english: Murchison followed with his eye the hand of his chronometer.
sentences.chinese: 莫奇生的眼睛追随着他的时计的秒针。

sentences.english: 'Where's Walter, I wonder! ' said Solomon Gills, after he had carefully put up the chronometer again. 'Here's dinner been ready, half an hour, and no Walter! '
sentences.chinese: “不知道沃尔特在哪里！”吉尔斯把精密计时表重新小心地藏好以后，说道，“晚饭已经准备好半个小时了，可是却不见沃尔特！”

detailed_translations.english: a very exact clock, used for scientific purposes

name: doleful
trans: mournful, bringing feelings of sadness

sentences.english: a doleful song about lost love
sentences.chinese: 一首关于逝去的爱情的哀歌

detailed_translations.chinese: 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的
detailed_translations.english: very sad

name: gaseous
trans: relating to, or existing as, gas

sentences.english: Freon exists both in liquid and gaseous states.
sentences.chinese: 氟利昂既有液态也有气态。

detailed_translations.english: like gas or in the form of gas

name: actuary
trans: registrar, clerk

detailed_translations.chinese: [保险] 保险计算员；保险精算师
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise insurance companies on how much to charge for insurance, after calculating the risks

name: delirium
trans: an acutely disturbed state of mind that occurs in fever

sentences.english: Before she died she had fits of delirium.
sentences.chinese: 去世前她一阵阵地胡言乱语。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神智昏迷，说胡话；极度兴奋
detailed_translations.english: extreme excitement

name: ambiance
trans: mood, quality, atmosphere

name: conjugal
trans: of, or relating to marriage, or the relationship of spouses

sentences.english: conjugal love
sentences.chinese: 夫妻之爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 婚姻的；结婚的；夫妻之间的
detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

name: accomplice
trans: partner in activity, usually crime

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: gynecocracy
trans: a society ruled by women

name: committal
trans: of or relating to a committee

name: fleeting
trans: passing swiftly, vanishing quickly, transient, transitory

sentences.english: Time is fleeting.; Time flies.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝。

sentences.english: I watched, smiling, knowing how fleeting these moments when they are small are.
sentences.chinese: 我微笑的看着这一切，我知道这个时刻是多么的短暂。

sentences.english: Most touches were only about five seconds, but in these fleeting moments, we’re capable of communicating distinct emotions, just as we are with the face.
sentences.chinese: 大部分触摸只有五秒左右，然而就是在这么短暂的时间里，我们有能力传达明确的情绪，正像我们通过表情所做的那样。

name: globose
trans: having a globular form

name: distinction
trans: a difference or contrast between similar things or people

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: bilk
trans: to obtain money fraudulently

sentences.english: They are charged with bilking investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他们被控骗取投资者数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗，诈骗；使受挫折；赖帐
detailed_translations.english: to cheat someone, especially by taking their money

name: askew
trans: turned or twisted to one side

sentences.english: There were no shutters at the windows, and some of the doors hung askew.
sentences.chinese: 窗户上没有百叶窗，有些门也是歪斜着安装的。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is askew is not straight or not level with what it should be level with
not quite straight or in the right position

name: diffuse
trans: to pour out and spread, as liquid

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: annuity
trans: a specified income payable at stated intervals for period

sentences.english: He received a paltry annuity of $100.
sentences.chinese: 他收到了微不足道的100美元年金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年金，养老金；年金保险；年金享受权
detailed_translations.english: a fixed amount of money that is paid each year to someone, usually until they die

name: bale
trans: a large, wrapped bundle of something (ie, cotton, hay)

sentences.english: a bale of straw
sentences.chinese: 一大捆稻草

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something such as paper or  hay  that is tightly tied together especially into a block

name: ethereal
trans: light, airy, or tenuous, delicate

sentences.english: ethereal beauty
sentences.chinese: 超凡的美丽

sentences.english: His music is ethereal.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐超凡脱俗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 优雅的；轻飘的；缥缈的；超凡的
detailed_translations.english: very delicate and light, in a way that does not seem real

name: havoc
trans: great destruction or devastation

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这座城市造成了大破坏。

sentences.english: He points out that some past offenders in Michigan have been released only to cause havoc and end up in jail again.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，过去密歇根释放的一些犯人只是与造成严重破坏的人有关，而且最后又都重新回到监狱里。

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。

name: acquit
trans: to declare or find not guilty, innocent

sentences.english: All the defendants were acquitted.
sentences.chinese: 所有被告都被判无罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无罪释放；表现；脱卸义务和责任；清偿
detailed_translations.english: to do something well, especially something difficult that you do for the first time in front of other people

name: facilitate
trans: to make easy or easier

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: ecumenical
trans: interdenominational, sometimes by extension, interreligious

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界范围的， 普遍的

name: contribution
trans: something given or offered that adds to a larger whole

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: epistle
trans: a letter, or a literary composition in the form of a letter

sentences.english: Now immediately we can see that this is an epistle which has a great deal to teach us as we live in the last times of the Gentiles.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们能看见当我们住在非犹太人的最后时期，这是一封常常有教我们的书信。

sentences.english: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
sentences.chinese: 你们念了这书信，便交给老底嘉的教会，叫他们也念。 你们也要念从老底嘉来的书信。

detailed_translations.english: a long or important letter

name: contemplate
trans: to ponder or consider

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: apocryphal
trans: of doubtful authenticity

sentences.english: These are apocryphal advertisements in order to racket from customers.
sentences.chinese: 那些都是欺骗顾客花钱的虚假广告。

name: collaborate
trans: to work together with others to achieve a common goal

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: compatible
trans: able to co-exist or occur together without conflict

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: eulogize
trans: to praise or pay homage to, especially in a formal eulogy

sentences.english: The poem does not eulogize the dead soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗并未歌颂阵亡的士兵。

sentences.english: Commentators are eulogizing about the 17-year-old left-hander.
sentences.chinese: 解说员都在夸赞这位17岁的左撇子选手。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something very much

name: anthology
trans: a book or collection of writings

sentences.english: an anthology of American literature
sentences.chinese: 美国文学选集

detailed_translations.english: a set of stories, poems, songs etc by different people collected together in one book

name: contender
trans: someone who competes with one or more other people

sentences.english: Her trainer said yesterday that she would be a strong contender for a place on the Olympic team.
sentences.chinese: 她的教练昨天说，她会是取得奥运代表队里一个席位的一名强有力的竞争者。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is in competition with other people or things

name: antique
trans: of, or belonging to the past, not modern

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

name: cosmogony
trans: a branch of science dealing with the origin of the universe

name: desecration
trans: an act of disrespect towards something considered sacred

name: cosmology
trans: the study of the physical universe, its structure, etc.

name: coiffure
trans: to style or arrange hair

name: briticism
trans: an idiom used in britain but not in other eng-speaking areas

name: donor
trans: one who donates, typically, money

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: corrugate
trans: to draw or bend into folds or alternate furrows and ridges

detailed_translations.english: to fold or be folded into alternate furrows and ridges

name: bashful
trans: shy, inclined to avoid notice

sentences.english: a bashful grin
sentences.chinese: 腼腆的笑容

sentences.english: Don’t be bashful about telling people how you feel.
sentences.chinese: 不要羞于说出自己的感受。

detailed_translations.english: easily embarrassed in social situations

name: conductible
trans: able to conduct

name: concise
trans: brief but comprehensive

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

name: froward
trans: willfully contrary, not easily managed

name: drachma
trans: the currency of greece until 2001, with the symbol ?

name: alchemy
trans: the search for a universal panacea (became chemistry)

sentences.english: The supernovae make the chemical elements through real alchemy, transforming one element, the light elements into the heavy ones.
sentences.chinese: 超新星通过真正的点金术制造化学元素，把一种元素，轻的元素转变成重的。

sentences.english: At the same time alchemy was much influenced by ideas from the East about magic and astrology foretelling the future from the stars.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时．炼金术也受到了来自东方的关于巫术和占星术（根据星象预知未来）的观念的很大影响。

detailed_translations.english: a science studied in the Middle Ages, that involved trying to change ordinary metals into gold

name: condolence
trans: an expression of sympathy, esp. on the occasion of death

sentences.english: a letter of condolence
sentences.chinese: 吊唁信

detailed_translations.english: sympathy for someone who has had something bad happen to them, especially when someone has died

name: exorcise
trans: to drive out an evil spirit from a person, place or thing

sentences.english: Like the legend of the snake-shaped genie who protects the gold from prospectors and holy men trying to exorcise it with tricks and prayers.
sentences.chinese: 这里的晚上充满着噪声和故事。 传说中蛇妖保护黄金，淘金者和虔诚的人试图用巫术和祷告来驱除妖魔。

name: condense
trans: to decrease size or volume by concentration

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: dissension
trans: an act of expressing dissent, especially spoken

sentences.english: The Labour Party was torn by internal dissensions .
sentences.chinese: 工党因内部纷争产生分裂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纠纷；意见不合；争吵；倾轧
detailed_translations.english: disagreement among a group of people

name: decapitate
trans: to remove the head of

sentences.english: a decapitated body
sentences.chinese: 一具无头尸体

detailed_translations.english: to cut off someone’s head

name: foreground
trans: the ground  or parts situated in the front

sentences.english: There were three figures in the foreground.
sentences.chinese: 前景有三个人。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the view in a picture or a photograph that is closest to you when you are looking at it

name: condonance
trans: the overlooking or implied forgiving of an offense

name: hauteur
trans: haughtiness or arrogance, loftiness

sentences.english: Once, she had been put off by his hauteur.
sentences.chinese: 她以前对他的傲慢很反感。

detailed_translations.english: a proud, very unfriendly manner

name: decelerate
trans: to reduce speed, to slow down

sentences.english: ...the sensation of the train decelerating.
sentences.chinese: ... 火车减速的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: to go slower, especially in a vehicle

name: geniality
trans: the quality of being warmly and pleasantly cheerful

name: desultory
trans: lacking a plan, purpose, or enthusiasm

sentences.english: They talked briefly in a desultory manner.
sentences.chinese: 他们随意地谈了一小会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断断续续的；散漫的；不连贯的，无条理的
detailed_translations.english: done without any particular plan or purpose

name: brigadier
trans: an army rank, an officer commanding a brigade

sentences.english: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.chinese: 他的军人生涯升至准将，随后在1966年退伍。

sentences.english: It says three army officers, including a brigadier-general, were ambushed and killed on Sunday by armed criminal gangs who then mutilated the bodies with sharp tools.
sentences.chinese: 据称，周日，武装犯罪团伙伏击了包括一名准将在内的三名陆军军官，并使用利器将他们的尸体砍断。

detailed_translations.english: a high military rank in the British army, or the person who has this rank

name: glacier
trans: a large body of ice which flows under its own mass

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: fluctuation
trans: a motion like that of waves, a moving back and forth

sentences.english: Prices are subject to fluctuation.
sentences.chinese: 价格可能会有波动。

detailed_translations.english: a change in a price, amount, level etc

name: abduct
trans: to take away secretly by force

sentences.english: The diplomat was abducted on his way to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 外交官在去机场途中遭绑架。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone away by force

name: concoct
trans: to create or devise

sentences.english: John concocted an elaborate excuse for being late.
sentences.chinese: 约翰为迟到编了一个巧妙的借口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 捏造；混合而制；调合；图谋
detailed_translations.english: to invent a clever story, excuse, or plan, especially in order to deceive someone

name: beget
trans: to cause, to produce

sentences.english: Hunger begets crime.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿滋生犯罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 产生；招致；引起；当…的父亲
detailed_translations.english: to cause something or make it happen

name: chronology
trans: the sequential order in which events occured

sentences.english: The book includes a chronology of his life and works.
sentences.chinese: 本书附有他的生平和著作年表。

detailed_translations.english: an account of events in the order in which they happened

name: bolster
trans: to support or strengthen

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

name: exasperation
trans: to irritate or provoke to a high degree, annoy extremely

sentences.english: Carol sighed in exasperation.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔恼怒地叹了口气。

detailed_translations.english: when you feel annoyed because someone continues to do something that is upsetting you

name: beneficial
