trans: helpful or good to something or someone

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: essence
trans: the inherent nature of a thing or idea

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: appertain
trans: to relate to

detailed_translations.english: to belong (to) as a part, function, right, etc; relate (to) or be connected (with)

name: accumulate
trans: to heap up in a mass, to collect

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: baritone
trans: the male voice between tenor and bass

sentences.english: a famous baritone
sentences.chinese: 著名男中音

detailed_translations.english: a male singing voice that is lower than a  tenor  but higher than a  bass  , or a man with a voice like this
a baritone voice or instrument is lower than a  tenor  but higher than a  bass

name: emollient
trans: having the quality of softening or soothing the skin

sentences.english: The choice of emollient should be made taking into account budgetary limitations and ease of supply.
sentences.chinese: 选择润肤剂应考虑到预算的多少，以及是否容易供应。

detailed_translations.english: An emollient is a liquid or cream that you put on your skin to make it softer or to reduce pain
making someone feel calmer when they have been angry

name: ad infinitum
trans: to infinity

name: abrogate
trans: to abolish by authoritative action

sentences.english: Both governments voted to abrogate the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 两国政府均投票通过废除这项条约。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a legal agreement, practice etc

name: empirical
trans: pertaining to or based on experience

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: hackney
trans: to make uninteresting or trite by frequent use

sentences.english: He did trace them easily to Clapham, but no farther; for on entering that place they removed into a hackney-coach and dismissed the chaise that brought them from Epsom.
sentences.chinese: 他一路追踪觅迹，追到克拉普汗，这倒还不费什么事，可是再往前追便不容易，因为他们两人到达此地后，便把从艾普桑雇来的马车打发走了，重新雇了出租马车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘用马；出租马车；出租汽车；操贱役的人

name: analgesic
trans: of or relating to analgesia, anodyne

name: anteroom
trans: a waiting room, a small room before a larger one

name: deprave
trans: to make morally bad or evil

sentences.english: ...material likely to deprave or corrupt those who see it.
sentences.chinese: ...可能会使那些看到的人堕落或腐败的东西。

detailed_translations.english: to be an evil influence on someone, especially someone who is young or not very experienced

name: arrogant
trans: haughty, conceited

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

name: discountenance
trans: to have an unfavorable opinion of, to disapprove

detailed_translations.english: disapproval

name: debilitate
trans: to make someone weak and infirm

sentences.english: He was debilitated by his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他由于生病身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone ill and weak

name: billow
trans: present participle of billow

sentences.english: It is almost startling to hear this warning of departed time sounding among the tombs, and telling the lapse of the hour, which, like a billow, has rolled us onward towards the grave.
sentences.chinese: 坟墓间 回荡着的钟声，听来令人悚然惊惧，它警告你又一个钟头业已过去，而时光的消逝，就像一个大浪，在不停地把我们卷向坟墓。

sentences.english: ...thick plumes of smoke billowing from factory chimneys.
sentences.chinese: …从工厂烟囱里冒出来的滚滚浓烟。

sentences.english: Steam billowed out from under the hood.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽从机罩下冒了出来。

detailed_translations.english: a wave, especially a very large one
When smoke or cloud billows, it moves slowly upward or across the sky

name: detraction
trans: the act of taking away

sentences.english: But if it is detraction, you might feel horrible, and you may self-deprecation.
sentences.chinese: 但如果那是诽谤，你会感觉很糟糕，你可能还会自我贬低。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, circumstance, etc, that detracts

name: gesticulate
trans: to make animated gestures while speaking

sentences.english: Jane gesticulated wildly and shouted ‘Stop! Stop!’
sentences.chinese: 简拼命打着手势，喊着“停下！停下！”

detailed_translations.chinese: 用姿势示意；（讲话时）做手势
detailed_translations.english: to make movements with your arms and hands, usually while speaking, because you are excited, angry, or cannot think of the right words to use

name: eloquent
trans: fluently persuasive and articulate

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: dishabille
trans: extreme casual or disorderly dress

name: beneficiary
trans: one who benefits or receives an advantage

sentences.english: One of the main beneficiaries of the early election is thought to be the former president.
sentences.chinese: 前总统被认为是早期选举的主要受益者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [金融] 受益人，受惠者；封臣
detailed_translations.english: someone who gets advantages from an action or change

name: conspicuous
trans: obvious or easy to notice, attracting notice or attention

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: exceed
trans: to be larger, greater than (something)

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: edict
trans: a proclamation of law or other authoritative command

sentences.english: The emperor issued an edict forbidding anyone to leave the city.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝下令禁止任何人出城。

detailed_translations.english: an official public order made by someone in a position of power

name: bellwether
trans: the leading sheep of a flock, usually wearing a bell

name: blunderbuss
trans: an action regarded as lacking in subtlety

name: gratuitous
trans: being without apparent reason, cause, or justification

sentences.english: children’s books which include gratuitous violence
sentences.chinese: 包含无谓暴力内容的儿童书籍

detailed_translations.chinese: 无理由的，无端的；免费的
detailed_translations.english: said or done without a good reason, in a way that offends someone

name: abscission
trans: the act of cutting off

name: counter-claim
trans: a claim  made to offset another claim

name: bungalow
trans: a small house or cottage usually having a single story

sentences.english: I remember changing cars twice when visiting her bungalow in New Delhi in 1998.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1998年去她在新德里的小平房拜访时，中途两次换车。

sentences.english: Belinda and Clive, who worked on the railways, moved to a bungalow not far from Barry Island.
sentences.chinese: 贝琳达和克里夫在铁路工作，并且搬到离巴厘岛不远的一处平房居住。

sentences.english: It would never have happened if he had stayed in Australia, for Australia is still the land of the bungalow.
sentences.chinese: 要是他居住在澳大利亚的话这种情况绝对不可能发生，因为现在澳大利亚土地上所座落的依然是平房。

detailed_translations.english: a house that is all on ground level

name: eatable
trans: able to be eaten, edible

name: bumptious
trans: obtrusively pushy, self-assertive to a pretentious extreme

detailed_translations.english: offensively self-assertive or conceited

name: deracinate
trans: to pull up by the roots, to uproot, to extirpate

detailed_translations.english: to pull up by or as if by the roots; uproot; extirpate

name: crevasse
trans: a crack or fissure in a glacier or snow field, a chasm

name: coniferous
trans: bearing cones, as the pine and cypress

name: elapse
trans: to pass or move by

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: daunt
trans: to make (someone) feel intimidated or apprehensive

sentences.english: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.chinese: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something

name: dogged
trans: persistent in effort, stubbornly tenacious

sentences.english: a dogged determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 不屈不挠的成功决心

detailed_translations.english: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something

name: germinal
trans: pertaining or belonging to a germ

name: careen
trans: turn (a ship) of its side for cleaning or repair

name: finicky
trans: fastidious and fussy, difficult to please, exacting

sentences.english: She’s very finicky about what she eats.
sentences.chinese: 她吃东西非常讲究。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过分讲究的；过分注意的；过分繁琐的
detailed_translations.english: too concerned with unimportant details and small things that you like or dislike

name: emend
trans: make corrections and improvements to a text

sentences.english: When they do, rule aficionados will say, “Well, we can emend it and make it more supple by adding to the circumstances it covers.
sentences.chinese: 当发生这种情况的时候，爱好制定规则的人们就会说，“好吧，我们可以修订一下规则，让它能适应更多的环境。

sentences.english: It can avoid repeat manual word account and copy out when we emend teaching plan. It is important to enhance level of teaching management and work efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 该设计可以避免修订教学计划过程中反复人工计算、誊写的麻烦，对提高教学管理水平和工作效率有重要作用。

sentences.english: Firstly, based on the introduction of the developmental theories of real-estate, the dissertation puts forward the new developing styles and tries to make emend for the traditional theories.

sentences.chinese: 根据耳廓与人体控制关系。

sentences.english: Also known as the auricle, it works like a funnel, directing sounds into the ear canal.
sentences.chinese: 耳廓也被称为外耳，能起到漏斗一样功用，将声音导入耳道。

sentences.english: Firm elevation of the auricle in reconstruction of microtia with a retroauricular fascial flap wrap-ping an autogenous cartilage wedge.
sentences.chinese: 在重建小耳症时以耳后筋膜皮瓣包覆一自体锲形软骨达成稳定的耳廓立起。

detailed_translations.english: a small sac in the atrium of the heart

name: discipline
trans: to train someone by instruction and practice

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: foresail
trans: the lowest (and usually the largest) square sail

name: fernery
trans: specialized garden for the cultivation and display of ferns

name: frivolous
trans: silly, especially at an inappropriate time

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是认定自己有点儿太轻率，不适合当医生。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible

name: exodus
trans: a sudden departure of a large number of people

sentences.english: The medical system is facing collapse because of an exodus of doctors.
sentences.chinese: 由于医生大批离去，该医疗体系正面临崩溃。

detailed_translations.english: If there is an exodus of people from a place, a lot of people leave that place at the same time

name: efficiency
trans: the extent to which time is well used for the intended task

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: exemplary
trans: worthy of imitation, commendable

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: glutton
trans: a person who eats and drinks excessively or voraciously

sentences.english: He was a glutton for hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他是个酷爱努力工作的人。

sentences.english: Ivy must be a glutton for punishment.
sentences.chinese: 艾威肯定是个不怕受罚的人。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is a glutton for something, you mean that they enjoy or need it very much

name: gaiety
trans: the state of being happy

sentences.english: Lars enjoyed the warmth and gaiety of these occasions.
sentences.chinese: 拉斯喜欢这类场合温馨而欢乐的气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 快乐，兴高采烈；庆祝活动，喜庆；（服饰）华丽，艳丽
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is cheerful and fun

name: freethinker
trans: a person who forms opinions on the basis of reason

name: grandiloquence
trans: lofty, pompous or bombastic speech or writing

sentences.english: A hero is more than one hundred times grandiloquence! ! ! ! !
sentences.chinese: 一次见义勇为胜过百次豪言壮语！

detailed_translations.chinese: 豪言壮语， 夸张之言

name: denizen
trans: to grant rights of citizenship to, to naturalize

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, or person that lives or is found in a particular place

name: arcade
trans: a row of arches

sentences.english: The short, squat man in the Dallas Cowboys windbreaker staggers out from the arcade, propping himself against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 身穿达拉斯牛仔风衣的矮胖男人蹒跚的从拱廊走出来，支撑着自己靠在墙上。

sentences.english: No matter how much you think you know about the varied and nuanced spectrum of human sexuality, you realize you don’t know squat until you work in a porn store with a vibrant and active arcade.
sentences.chinese: 无论你认为自己是多么了解人类性行为的多样性和各种细微差别，如果没在色情商店工作过，没见识过店中那条活力四射的拱廊，就不知道半蹲是什么含义。

detailed_translations.english: a covered passage at the side of a row of buildings with  pillar s  and  arch es  supporting it on one side

name: concord
trans: agreement or harmony between people or groups

sentences.english: They expressed the hope that he would pursue a neutral and balanced policy for the sake of national concord.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望他能为国家的和谐而追求一种中立而平衡的政策。

detailed_translations.english: the state of having a friendly relationship, so that you agree on things and live in peace

name: clandestine
trans: kept secret or done secretly

sentences.english: a clandestine affair
sentences.chinese: 秘密关系

sentences.english: clandestine meetings
sentences.chinese: 秘密会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的
detailed_translations.english: done or kept secret

name: dissipation
trans: squandering of money, energy, or resources

name: affiliate
trans: to adopt, to receive into a family as a son, to ally

sentences.english: He wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed expert advice in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

name: fiducial
trans: accepted as a fixed basis of reference

name: doggerel
trans: verse or words that are badly written or expressed

name: desecrate
trans: to profane or violate the sacredness/sanctity of something

sentences.english: She shouldn't have desecrated the picture of a religious leader.
sentences.chinese: 她不该亵渎宗教领袖的肖像。

detailed_translations.english: to spoil or damage something holy or respected

name: brandish
trans: to move or swing a weapon back and forth

sentences.english: A man leapt out, brandishing a kitchen knife.
sentences.chinese: 一个男人挥着一把菜刀跳了出来。

detailed_translations.english: to wave something around in a dangerous or threatening way, especially a weapon

name: corrigible
trans: able to be corrected or set right

name: conferee
trans: a person who participates in a conference

name: cornerstone
trans: an important quality or feature on which a thing depends

sentences.english: Research is the cornerstone of the profession.
sentences.chinese: 研究是该职业的基石。

detailed_translations.english: something that is extremely important because everything else depends on it

name: canto
trans: one of the chief divisions of a long poem, a book

sentences.english: It's the passage from Spenser's cave of Mammon canto that describes this same scene of violation, the violation of mother earth.
sentences.chinese: 这是斯潘塞笔下描写贪神之洞的长诗的篇章,它描述了对于大地母亲粗暴冒犯的场景。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts into which a very long poem is divided

name: deject
trans: make sad or dispirited

name: avarice
trans: greediness over wealth, covetousness

sentences.english: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
sentences.chinese: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足了房东的贪心。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong

name: allegiance
trans: loyalty to a person, group, or cause

sentences.english: an oath of allegiance
sentences.chinese: 效忠宣誓

sentences.english: The people here have strong political allegiances .
sentences.chinese: 这里的民众政治忠诚度很高。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a leader, country, belief etc

name: epiphany
trans: a manifestation of a divine or superhuman being

name: entice
trans: to lure, to attract by arousing desire or hope

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

name: dutiable
trans: on which duty must be paid when imported or sold

name: comport
trans: to tolerate, bear

sentences.english: He comported himself in a way that won him respect.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为为自己赢得了尊重。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way

name: barograph
trans: a recording aneroid barometer

name: generally
trans: usually, commonly, ordinarily

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

name: archdeacon
trans: (anglican,eastern orthodox) a senior administrative official

name: beatific
trans: blessed, blissful, heavenly

sentences.english: ...a beatific smile.
sentences.chinese: ...一个幸福的微笑。

detailed_translations.english: a beatific look, smile etc shows great peace and happiness

name: dexterous
trans: skillful with one's hands

sentences.english: dextrous use of the needle
sentences.chinese: 灵巧的针法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；敏捷的；惯用右手的
detailed_translations.english: skilful and quick when using your hands

name: fluctuate
trans: to vary irregularly, to swing

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: bullion
trans: a bulk quantity of precious metal, usually gold or silver

sentences.english: gold bullion
sentences.chinese: 金条

detailed_translations.english: bars of gold or silver

name: assess
trans: to determine, estimate or judge the value of, to evaluate

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: delicacy
trans: the quality of being delicate

sentences.english: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑
detailed_translations.english: something good to eat that is expensive or rare

name: commentary
trans: a series of comments or annotations on another work

sentences.english: Commentary is by Tom Ferris.
sentences.chinese: 由汤姆•费里斯现场解说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实况报道， 解说词； 评论， 评论文章
detailed_translations.english: a spoken description of an event, given while the event is happening, especially on the television or radio

name: excoriation
trans: the act of excoriating or flaying

name: egalitarian
trans: characterized by equality for all people

sentences.english: an egalitarian society
sentences.chinese: 人人平等的社会

detailed_translations.english: based on the belief that everyone is equal and should have equal rights

name: abjure
trans: to renounce upon oath

sentences.english: ...a formal statement abjuring military action.
sentences.chinese: ...一个宣布撤回军事行动的正式声明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发誓放弃；公开放弃；避免
detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you will give up a particular belief or way of behaving

name: epidermis
trans: the outer, protective layer of the skin of vertebrates

sentences.english: The pigment in the upper layer of skin (epidermis) that gives your skin its normal color is called melanin.
sentences.chinese: 在浅层皮肤（表皮）中有种色素能让你的皮肤保持其正常的颜色，称为黑色素。

sentences.english: Skin color is due to melanin, a pigment produced in the epidermis to protect us from the sun's potentially cancer-causing ultraviolet (UV) rays.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种产生于表皮的色素，能够保护我们免受来自紫外线的侵袭。 紫外线正是来自太阳的潜在致癌物。

detailed_translations.english: the outside layer of your skin

name: effeminacy
trans: the quality of showing feminine traits (in a man)

name: ascertain
trans: to find out definitely, to discover or establish

sentences.english: A postmortem was ordered to try to ascertain the cause of death.
sentences.chinese: 下令验尸以查明死因。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄清， 查明； 确定
detailed_translations.english: to find out something

name: endure
trans: to hold out against, sustain without impairment or yielding

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: antistrophe
trans: the second section of an ancient Greek choral ode

name: aforesaid
trans: a previously stated statement

sentences.english: ...the aforesaid organizations and institutions.
sentences.chinese: …上述组织和机构。

name: feminine
trans: of the female sex, biologically female, not male, womanly

sentences.english: traditional feminine roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的女性角色

sentences.english: Dianne loved pretty feminine things.
sentences.chinese: 黛安娜喜爱漂亮有女人味的东西。

detailed_translations.english: relating to being female

name: antedate
trans: to occur before an event or time, to predate

sentences.english: The economic troubles antedate the current administration.
sentences.chinese: 这些经济问题早在现任政府就职之前就已出现。

detailed_translations.english: to come from an earlier time in history than something else
an earlier date

name: denote
trans: to indicate, to mark

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: dissonance
trans: inharmonious or harsh sound, cacophany

detailed_translations.chinese: 不一致；不调和；不和谐音
detailed_translations.english: a combination of notes that sound strange because they are not in  harmony

name: altercate
trans: to argue, quarrel or wrangle with someone

name: foist
trans: to introduce or insert surreptitiously or without warrant

detailed_translations.chinese: 偷偷插入；混入；蒙骗；硬卖给；采用欺骗手段出售；把…强加于

name: disarm
trans: to take away the weapons of, to render defenceless

sentences.english: Getting the rebels to disarm will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons

name: assuage
trans: make an unpleasant feeling less intense

sentences.english: Nothing could assuage his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 什么都不能减轻他的内疚。

detailed_translations.english: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

name: accessory
trans: aiding in a secondary way, being additional,

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

name: emerge
trans: to come into view

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: expostulate
trans: to protest or remonstrate

sentences.english: I expostulate with her on the impropriety.
sentences.chinese: 因行为不当我向她提出告诫。

name: hale
trans: free from disease or infirmity, robust, vigorous

sentences.english: She’s still hale and hearty at 74.
sentences.chinese: 她74岁仍然精神矍铄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矍铄的（尤指老人）；强壮的
detailed_translations.english: someone, especially an old person, who is hale and hearty is very healthy and active
to pull or drag; haul

name: dissemble
trans: to disguise or conceal something, to feign

sentences.english: Henry was not slow to dissemble when it served his purposes.
sentences.chinese: 形势一对他有利，亨利就马上开始隐瞒。

detailed_translations.english: to hide your true feelings, thoughts etc

name: discreet
trans: respectful of privacy or secrecy, quiet, diplomatic

sentences.english: He assured her that he would be discreet.
sentences.chinese: 他向她保证会谨慎行事。

sentences.english: I stood back at a discreet distance.
sentences.chinese: 我谨慎地保持一段距离站在后面。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you say or do, so that you do not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell secrets

name: frivolity
trans: frivolous acts, state of being frivolous

sentences.english: I don’t think such frivolity helps the organization’s public image.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这种愚蠢的行为无益于这个组织的公众形象。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or activities that are not serious or sensible, especially when you should be serious or sensible

name: elite
trans: of high birth or social position, aristocratic or patrician

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: conundrum
trans: a confusing and difficult problem or question

sentences.english: the conundrum of our purpose on Earth
sentences.chinese: 我们为何目的活在世上这一难题

detailed_translations.english: a confusing and difficult problem

name: assonance
trans: the repetition of similar or identical vowel sounds

sentences.english: The sound form of poetry is often manifested in onomatopoeia, sound symbolism and some other musical devices such as alliteration, assonance, repetition, internal rhyme and so on.
sentences.chinese: 声韵形式通常表现在拟声、语音联觉以及其他一些音乐手法诸如头韵、谐内韵、重复和行内韵等；

sentences.english: In English poetry, aesthetic sense and English pronunciation are closely linked, reflecting especially in the metre, such as alliteration, assonance, rhyme, semi-assonance and onomatopoeia.
sentences.chinese: 英语诗歌中的美感和英语语音息息相关，尤其体现在韵律的运用上，最常见的有头韵、尾韵、谐音、半谐音和拟音。

detailed_translations.english: similarity in the vowel sounds of words that are close together in a poem, for example between ‘born’ and ‘warm’

name: deist
trans: someone who believes in the existence of a supreme being

name: grimace
trans: to distort one's face, to make faces

sentences.english: She started to sit up, grimaced, and sank back weakly against the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 她开始坐起来，痛苦地皱着脸，又虚弱地靠回到枕头上。

detailed_translations.english: If you grimace, you twist your face in an ugly way because you are annoyed, disgusted, or in pain
an expression you make by twisting your face because you do not like something or because you are feeling pain

name: cajole
trans: persuade someone to do something by flattery or coaxing

sentences.english: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.english: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

name: arbitrator
trans: a person delegated the authority to settle a dispute

sentences.english: If negotiations are deadlocked , an arbitrator must be called in.
sentences.chinese: 如果谈判陷入僵局，就必须请一位仲裁人。

sentences.english: The dispute shall be submitted for arbitration by a mutually nominated arbitrator.
sentences.chinese: 这起纠纷应由一位双方共同指定的仲裁人提交仲裁。

sentences.english: The arbitrator's decision on the dispute is final and binding on the both parlies.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁人对争执所做的裁决为最后裁决，对双方均具有约束力。

name: drowsy
trans: inclined to drowse, heavy with sleepiness, lethargic, dozy

sentences.english: The drug can make you drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 这种药会让人昏昏欲睡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏昏欲睡的；沉寂的；催眠的
detailed_translations.english: tired and almost asleep

name: compress
trans: to press or squeeze together

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: exorcism
trans: the ceremony or the formula used in exorcising

name: correlative
trans: mutually related, corresponding

name: debacle
trans: a sudden and ignominious failure, a fiasco

sentences.english: the debacle of the 1994 elections
sentences.chinese: 1994年大选的惨败

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that is a complete failure

name: enigma
trans: a puzzling or inexplicable occurrence or situation

sentences.english: Iran remains an enigma for the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗对外部世界而言依然是个谜。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something or someone as an enigma, you mean they are mysterious or difficult to understand

name: burlesque
trans: to make a burlesque parody of

sentences.english: The book read like a black comic burlesque.
sentences.chinese: 这本书读起来就像一部黑色滑稽剧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 讽刺或滑稽的戏剧， 滑稽剧
detailed_translations.english: speech, acting, or writing in which a serious subject is made to seem silly or an unimportant subject is treated in a serious way

name: enigmatic
trans: perplexing, mysterious, resembling an enigma

sentences.english: She starred in one of Welles's most enigmatic films.
sentences.chinese: 她主演了威尔斯最神秘的电影当中的一部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；高深莫测的；谜一般的
detailed_translations.english: Someone or something that is enigmatic is mysterious and difficult to understand

name: collegian
trans: a student (or a former student) of a college

sentences.english: I was an English collegian and now I work as a sales manager in a testing lab.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名英语专业的学生，我现在已经是一家实验室的销售经理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院的学生；学院的一员
detailed_translations.english: a member of a college

name: eminence
trans: someone of high rank, reputation or social station

sentences.english: Many of the pilots were to achieve eminence in the aeronautical world.
sentences.chinese: 其中的很多飞行员后来在航空界都取得了显赫的声名。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being famous and important

name: daunting
trans: causing fear or discouragement

name: bodily
trans: of, relating to, or concerning the body

sentences.english: The column was transferred bodily to a new site by the bank of the river.
sentences.chinese: 那根圆柱被整体迁到河堤边的一个新址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 整体地；亲自地；以肉体形式
detailed_translations.english: by moving a large object in one piece
related to the human body

name: contemporaneous
trans: existing or occurring in the same period of time

name: gouge
trans: to scoop out or turn with or as if with a gouge

sentences.english: He heard the heavy rounds gouge the ancient concrete, followed by the panicked cries of Grunts in the distance as they dove for cover—and into the semi-gelatinous, ankle-deep liquid.
sentences.chinese: 子弹凿击古老混凝土的声音清晰可辨，接着远处传来了野猪兽卧倒在深及脚踝的半凝胶状液体中隐蔽时恐慌的呼喊声。

name: alcoholism
trans: a chronic disorder characterized by dependence on alcohol

sentences.english: ...a physician who specialized in the problems of alcoholism.
sentences.chinese: …一位专攻酗酒问题的医生。

detailed_translations.chinese: 酗酒；[内科] 酒精中毒
detailed_translations.english: the medical condition of being an alcoholic

name: graceless
trans: without grace

name: asexual
trans: having no distinct sex, having no interest in sex

sentences.english: asexual reproduction
sentences.chinese: 无性繁殖

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 无性的；无性生殖的
detailed_translations.english: not having sexual organs or not involving sex

name: covenant
trans: an agreement between two or more persons, like a pact

sentences.english: ...the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
sentences.chinese: …公民权利和政治权利国际公约。

detailed_translations.chinese: 契约，盟约；圣约；盖印合同
detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement in which someone promises to pay a person or organization an amount of money regularly

name: dabble
trans: to work at anything in an irregular or superficial manner

sentences.english: He dabbled in business.
sentences.chinese: 他曾涉足商界。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or be involved in something in a way that is not very serious

name: empathy
trans: the ability to understand and share the feelings of others

sentences.english: Having begun my life in a children's home, I have great empathy with the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 在一家儿童福利院长大使我对这些小孩子们怀有深深的同感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同感， 移情； 全神贯注
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems

name: brigand
trans: an outlaw or bandit

sentences.english: ...a notorious brigand who hijacked trains.
sentences.chinese: ...一名臭名昭著的火车劫匪。

detailed_translations.english: a thief, especially one of a group that attacks people in mountains or forests

name: auditor
trans: a person appointed to examine accounting records

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to officially examine a company’s financial records

name: conscientious
trans: thorough, careful, or vigilant

sentences.english: A conscientious teacher may feel inclined to take work home.
sentences.chinese: 一个认真负责的教师可能会想着把工作带回家去做。

sentences.english: a conscientious and hard-working student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉刻苦的学生

detailed_translations.english: careful to do everything that it is your job or duty to do

name: dentifrice
trans: toothpaste or any other substance for cleaning the teeth

name: consecrate
trans: to make or declare (something) sacred

sentences.english: The bones will be reburied in consecrated ground .
sentences.chinese: 尸骨将被重新安葬在圣地里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奉献；使神圣；供神用；献身于

name: brooch
trans: women’s jewellery having a pin to be fixed to garments

sentences.english: “No birthday, ” she repeated, fingering the brooch on her breast.
sentences.chinese: “没有生日”，她复述道，一边玩弄着胸口的胸针。

sentences.english: A lady with a large, sparkly spider brooch asks me what size I think she would take in a black dress she is admiring.
sentences.chinese: 一位带着一枚大而闪亮的蜘蛛胸针的女士，正在欣赏着一件黑色的礼服，过来问我她能穿多大号的？

sentences.english: “Ultimately, we envision the camera becoming so small that it integrates into clothing, such as the button of a shirt, a brooch, or a pendant”, he said.
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克说：“我们想象一下，如果这个摄影机非常小巧，我们就可以把它放进衣服里，像衬衫扣子、胸针、或是项链的坠子一样。”

detailed_translations.english: a piece of jewellery that you fasten to your clothes, usually worn by women

name: churlish
trans: boorish, vulgar

sentences.english: She would think him churlish if he refused.
sentences.chinese: 如果他拒绝，她会觉得他不礼貌。

sentences.english: The room was so nice it seemed churlish to argue.
sentences.chinese: 这房间这么好，吵架的话就显得无礼了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有礼貌的；脾气暴躁的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is churlish is unfriendly, bad-tempered, or impolite

name: engulf
trans: to overwhelm

sentences.english: despair so great it threatened to engulf him
sentences.chinese: 几乎要将他压垮的绝望情绪

detailed_translations.english: if an unpleasant feeling engulfs you, you feel it very strongly

name: filibuster
trans: to force a decision

sentences.english: Opponents of the bill tried to filibuster its final stages.
sentences.chinese: 反对者发表长篇大论，试图阻挠议案的最终通过。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；暴兵，掠夺兵；阻挠议事的议员；阻挠议事的行动

name: adorn
trans: to decorate

sentences.english: His watercolour designs adorn a wide range of books.
sentences.chinese: 他的水彩设计装饰着各种各样的书籍。

detailed_translations.english: to decorate something

name: bivouac
trans: to set up camp

name: appropriate
trans: suitable or fitting for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: cupidity
trans: greed for money or possessions

sentences.english: the cupidity of some businessmen
sentences.chinese: 一些商人的贪婪

detailed_translations.english: very strong desire for something, especially money or property

name: boll
trans: the rounded seed-bearing capsule of a cotton or flax plant

detailed_translations.english: the fruit of such plants as flax and cotton, consisting of a rounded capsule containing the seeds

name: ascribe
trans: to attribute a cause or characteristic to something

sentences.english: The report ascribes the rise in childhood asthma to the increase in pollution.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告认为儿童哮喘发病率上升是因为污染加剧。

sentences.english: He ascribed his failure to bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 他认为自己的失败是运气不好。

detailed_translations.english: to claim that something is caused by a particular person, situation etc

name: browse
trans: to casually look through in order to find items of interest

sentences.english: a feature that allows you to browse your hard drive and choose the graphic you want to display
sentences.chinese: 让你可以浏览硬盘驱动器选择自己想要显示的图像的一个功能

sentences.english: ...a browse around the shops.
sentences.chinese: …在商店的一番闲逛。

detailed_translations.english: to look through the pages of a book, magazine etc without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts
Browse is also a noun

name: discrepancy
trans: an inconsistency between two or more facts

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

name: fealty
trans: fidelity, faithfulness

sentences.english: When they act with predictability, restraint, and fealty to the rule of law, ordinary people gain faith in their government.
sentences.chinese: 当警察的行为有规可循、有节制并忠诚于法治时，会加深普通人民对政府的信任。

sentences.english: Whether a 17th-century swordsman in the service of a local warlord or a 21st-century turbine engineer, Japanese are brought up with a strong sense of fealty and duty.
sentences.chinese: 无论是一个17世纪的剑客服务于当地军阀，或是一个21世纪的涡轮工程师，日本养成了一种强烈的忠诚和责任意识。

sentences.english: Inside that circle a wholesome, tacit emotional feudalism develops: you give me protection, I’ll give you fealty.
sentences.chinese: 在这个圈子里一个有益健康的、心照不宣的传统情感的建立:你给我保护，我回报忠诚。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a king, queen etc

name: egoism
trans: the tendency to think of self and self-interest

sentences.english: They seemed to love the land and the people with a sort of fierce egoism.
sentences.chinese: 他们似乎是带著强烈的利己主义来爱这里的人和土地的。

sentences.english: When egoism gains the upper hand, many people find it growingly hard to help others.
sentences.chinese: 当利己主义获得了上风，许多人觉得越来越难去帮助别人。

sentences.english: People shelve the out - of - fashion moral icon and espouse the philosophy of egoism.
sentences.chinese: 搁置了人民的时尚图标和拥护道德哲学的利己主义。

name: defame
trans: to try to diminish the reputation of

sentences.english: Sgt. Norwood complained that the article defamed him.
sentences.chinese: 诺维德中士抱怨这篇文章诽谤他。

detailed_translations.english: to write or say bad or untrue things about someone or something, so that people will have a bad opinion of them

name: connote
trans: to signify beyond its literal or principal meaning

sentences.english: The term "organization" often connotes a sense of neatness.
sentences.chinese: “组织”这个词常常给人一种整洁的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: If a word or name connotes something, it makes you think of a particular idea or quality

name: arraign
trans: to officially charge someone in a court of law

sentences.english: He was arraigned for criminally abetting a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 他因非法怂恿一名叛国者而被传讯。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone come to court to hear what their crime is

name: belabor
trans: to work at something more than necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛打；抨击；过度说明；反复讨论

name: creed
trans: any system, doctrine or formula of religious belief

sentences.english: It has never been weaker as a political creed .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种政治信条，它从来没有像现在这样衰微过。

sentences.english: a religious creed
sentences.chinese: 宗教信条

sentences.english: people of all colours and creeds
sentences.chinese: 各种肤色和信仰的人

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs or principles

name: anachronism
trans: a chronological mistake, the erroneous dating of an event

sentences.english: The monarchy is something of an anachronism these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今君主制是一种过时的体制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时代错误；不合潮流的人或物
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that seems to belong to the past, not the present

name: dormant
trans: inactive, idle

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: foray
trans: to scour (an area or place) for food, treasure, booty etc

sentences.english: These base camps were used by the PKK guerrillas to make forays into Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 这些基地营被库尔德工人党游击队用来对土耳其进行突袭。

detailed_translations.english: a short sudden attack by a group of soldiers, especially in order to get food or supplies

name: decry
trans: to publicly denounce, to condemn

sentences.english: It may be tempting for some to decry incentives as nothing but a poisonous fruit of Con-Lib responsibility thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对一些人谴责激励机制只是作为“新政治”责任思考的毒果这样的结论本身是很冒险的。

sentences.english: I know ‘tis the season to decry all things materialistic, but just as we’re inspired by people we are also inspired by things.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是谴责所有事情物质化的时候了，然而正如我们被人所激励一样，我们也受事物的激励。

sentences.english: All of that is grist for the mill for the Russian media, which is popular in the east of the country and uses every opportunity to decry "fascism" in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都像谷物被放进研磨机中一样，被俄国媒体粉碎，后者在这个国家的东部地区广受欢迎，并利用一切机会谴责乌克兰国内的“法西斯主义”。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

name: elude
trans: to evade, or escape from someone or something through skill

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

name: ambitious
trans: possessing, or controlled by ambition

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: corrosion
trans: the process of eating away by degrees

sentences.english: They are sprayed with oil to prevent corrosion.
sentences.chinese: 它们被喷了油以防腐蚀。

sentences.english: Check for signs of corrosion.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下有没有腐蚀的痕迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐蚀；腐蚀产生的物质；衰败
detailed_translations.english: the gradual destruction of metal by the effect of water, chemicals etc or a substance such as  rust  produced by this process

name: duress
trans: coercion, compulsion by threat or force

sentences.english: He thought her confession had been made under duress.
sentences.chinese: 他认为她是被迫坦白的。

detailed_translations.english: illegal or unfair threats

name: behest
trans: to promise, vow

name: forage
trans: to wander or go in search of provisions

sentences.english: Do notlet animals graze until you are notified that forage in your area is safe.
sentences.chinese: 得到你所在区域的饲料安全的通知前，不要让动物吃青草。

detailed_translations.english: food supplies for horses and cattle
to go around searching for food or other supplies

name: espionage
trans: the act or practice of spying

sentences.english: a campaign of industrial espionage against his main rival
sentences.chinese: 针对他主要竞争对手展开的商业间谍活动

detailed_translations.english: the activity of secretly finding out secret information and giving it to a country’s enemies or a company’s competitors

name: explicate
trans: to explain meticulously or in great detail, to analyze

sentences.english: It is essentially a simple notion, but explicating it is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 它实质上是一个简单的概念，但要详细解释还是很难。

detailed_translations.english: to explain an idea in detail

name: excretion
trans: the process of removing material that has no further utility

name: bevel
trans: to give a canted edge to a surface

name: braze
trans: the joining together of two metal pieces without melting

sentences.english: The braze and interfacial microstructures were characterized by optical microscopy, scanning electron microscopy, and energy dispersive spectroscopy.
sentences.chinese: 在钎焊和界面微观结构的特点是光学显微镜，扫描电子显微镜和能谱。

sentences.english: The method and technology of oxyacetylene flame braze welding for main cable wrapping at Shantou Bay Bridge were introduced, and the difficulties of the welding were analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 介绍汕头海湾大桥主缆缠丝所采用的氧- 乙炔火焰钎接焊方法及其工艺，并对主缆缠丝焊接的难点进行了分析。

sentences.english: It's also superior for braze welding of steel.
sentences.chinese: 这对钢的黄铜焊接也是较优的。

detailed_translations.english: to decorate with, make like, or make of brass

name: degradation
trans: a lowering from one's standing in office or society

sentences.english: ...air pollution, traffic congestion, and the steady degradation of our quality of life.
sentences.chinese: …空气污染、交通阻塞以及我们生活质量的持续恶化。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: gaily
trans: merrily, joyfully

sentences.english: ‘Morning, Albert,’ she called gaily.
sentences.chinese: “早安，艾伯特。”她快乐地喊道。

detailed_translations.english: in a happy way

name: benefit
trans: to be or to provide a benefit to

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: bauble
trans: a cheap showy ornament piece of jewellery, a gewgaw

sentences.english: ...Christmas trees decorated with coloured baubles.
sentences.chinese: ... 装饰着五颜六色小饰物的圣诞树。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小玩意；美观而无价值的饰物
detailed_translations.english: a cheap piece of jewellery

name: enormous
trans: deviating from the norm, unusual, extraordinary

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: auditory
trans: of, or relating to hearing

sentences.english: ...the limits of the human auditory range.
sentences.chinese: …人类听觉范围的局限。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to hear

name: crag
trans: a rocky outcrop

detailed_translations.english: a high and very steep rough rock or mass of rocks

name: contuse
trans: to injure without breaking the skin, to bruise

name: advocate
trans: to speak in favor of

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: glut
trans: to fill to capacity, to satisfy all requirement or demand

name: attache
trans: an official associated with an embassy

detailed_translations.chinese: 专员，公使；使馆随员；大使馆专员

name: diffusible
trans: able to intermingle by diffusion

name: compressible
trans: able to be compressed

sentences.english: compressible, since text files such as SQL or properties are highly redundant
sentences.chinese: 可压缩，因为文本文件，如SQL或配置文件压缩率很高

sentences.english: But plain old bzip2 on the original XML file does 11 bytes better at generating a compressible structure than do my attempts.
sentences.chinese: 原始 XML 文件上普通的旧 bzip2 在生成可压缩的结构上比我的尝试好 11 个字节。

sentences.english: The second technique is to take advantage of the very specific structure of XML documents to produce more compressible representations.
sentences.chinese: 第二种技术是利用 XML 文档非常特定的结构生成更 可压缩的表示。

name: codicil
trans: a document that amends a previously executed will

sentences.english: In codicil, keep your plans somewhat flexible so that you can change ships at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 在遗嘱，让您的计划一定灵活性，以便您可以更改船舶在最后一分钟。

detailed_translations.english: a document making a change or addition to a  will (= a legal document saying who you want your money and property to go to when you die )

name: arrant
trans: complete, total

sentences.english: What arrant nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 一派胡言！

detailed_translations.chinese: 极恶的；声名狼藉的；彻头彻尾的
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how bad something is

name: blanch
trans: to grow or become white

sentences.english: Patrick visibly blanched.
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克的脸色明显地变得苍白。

detailed_translations.english: to become pale because you are frightened or shocked

name: claque
trans: a group of people hired to attend a performance to applaud

name: acquaint
trans: to make familiar

sentences.english: Have steps been taken to acquaint breeders with their right to apply for licenses?
sentences.chinese: 已经采取措施让饲养动物者了解他们申请执照的权利了吗？

detailed_translations.english: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself with something, you learn about it.

name: amalgam
trans: a combination of different things

sentences.english: The new religion is an amalgam of superstitious beliefs and modern science.
sentences.chinese: 这种新宗教是迷信和现代科学的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of different things

name: facile
trans: easily accomplished or attained

sentences.english: facile generalizations
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的概括

detailed_translations.english: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding

name: cynosure
trans: that which serves to guide or direct

sentences.english: The princess, dressed head to foot in gold, was the cynosure of all eyes.
sentences.chinese: 公主全身上下披金戴银，是众目注视的焦点。

name: divergent
trans: tending to be different or develop in different directions

sentences.english: Two people who have divergent views on this question are George Watt and Bob Marr.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上意见相左的两个人是乔治·瓦特和鲍勃·马尔。

detailed_translations.english: Divergent things are different from each other

name: antidepressant
trans: a substance that is used in the treatment of mood disorders

name: emphasis
trans: special weight given to something considered important

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: convoy
trans: to escort a group of vehicles, and provide protection

sentences.english: a military convoy
sentences.chinese: 军方的护送舰队

detailed_translations.english: a group of vehicles or ships travelling together, sometimes in order to protect one another
to travel with something in order to protect it

name: comprehensive
trans: complete, including all or nearly all elements or aspects

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: forcible
trans: done or effected by force

sentences.english: the forcible overthrow of the government
sentences.chinese: 暴力推翻政府

sentences.english: signs of forcible entry into the building
sentences.chinese: 强行入楼的迹象

detailed_translations.chinese: 强制的；暴力的；有说服力的；强有力的
detailed_translations.english: done using physical force

name: aqueous
trans: consisting mostly of water

sentences.english: ...an aqueous solution containing various sodium salts.
sentences.chinese: ...一种含各种钠盐的水溶液。

detailed_translations.english: containing water or similar to water

name: enfranchise
trans: to admit to citizenship, especially to grant voting rights

sentences.english: The company voted to enfranchise its 120 women members.
sentences.chinese: 公司投票决定给予其120名女员工选举权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给予选举权；给予自治权；解放，释放
detailed_translations.english: to give a group of people the right to vote

name: divisible
trans: capable of being divided without a remainder

sentences.english: Twenty-eight is divisible by seven.
sentences.chinese: 二十八可以被七整除。

detailed_translations.english: able to be divided, for example by a number

name: crass
trans: lacking in sensitivity or due consideration

sentences.english: a crass remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的言语

sentences.english: an act of crass stupidity
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的行为

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a stupid and offensive way which shows that you do not understand or care about other people’s feelings

name: blazon
trans: to describe a coat of arms

sentences.english: Contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon , coat of arms, etc.
sentences.chinese: 包含一个纹章学的常规或词汇，通常是装饰、或盾形纹章等的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: a conventional description or depiction of heraldic arms

name: disquiet
trans: make (someone) worried or anxious

sentences.english: The disquiet will boil over in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 这种不安情绪终有一天会爆发的。

sentences.english: Of course it was a brutal and harrowing time, but that isn't the reason for my disquiet.
sentences.chinese: 那当然是一段残忍而痛苦的岁月，但这并非我不安的原因。

sentences.english: Recent reports speculated that disquiet among political and military elites over Kim's choice of successor was the real reason behind the meeting's delay.
sentences.chinese: 近期有报道推测，金正日选择金正云做接班人导致政界和军界高层不安，是党代会推迟的真正原因。

detailed_translations.english: anxiety or unhappiness about something

name: complicate
trans: to make complex

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: blight
trans: to suffer blight

sentences.english: All you can do to prevent potato blight is keep an eye on your crops.
sentences.chinese: 为预防马铃薯枯萎病你惟一能做的就是留意你的庄稼。

detailed_translations.english: an unhealthy condition of plants in which parts of them dry up and die

name: addle
trans: to make or become confused

sentences.english: I suppose the shock had addled his poor old brain.
sentences.chinese: 我想这个打击已经使他可怜的老脑筋变糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone so they cannot think properly

name: devitalize
trans: to deprive of vitality, make lifeless, weaken

name: disparity
trans: the state of being unequal, difference

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two or more things, especially an unfair one

name: decameron
trans: a collection of 100 tales (1353) by boccaccio

name: conformation
trans: manner of formation, structure

name: diorama
trans: a model representing a scene with 3d figures

name: commissarial
trans: a shop supplying food and equipment, as for a military camp

name: abstemious
trans: restraint especially in the consumption of food or alcohol

sentences.english: Ireland looks like an abstemious jogger that has suffered a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰看似一位心脏病发作的有节制的慢跑者。

sentences.english: In this foundation, Proposed further deepening idea of energy conservation and taking measures to build an abstemious corporation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上提出了进一步深化节能理念，建立节约型企业所采取的措施。

sentences.english: The women also mentioned the "rampant" sex that the supposedly spiritual and abstemious monks practiced with each other in the Gelugpa sect.
sentences.chinese: 这些妇女还提及在理论上应该精神化并有节制的格鲁派僧侣之间“疯狂的”性行为。

detailed_translations.english: careful not to have too much food, drink etc

name: dignitary
trans: an important or influential person, or one of high rank

sentences.english: Flowers were presented to visiting dignitaries.
sentences.chinese: 到访的各位要员收到了献上的鲜花。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has an important official position

name: aye
trans: an affirmative vote, one who votes in the affirmative

sentences.english: Everyone in favor of the amendment, say "aye!"
sentences.chinese: 所有赞成修改章程的，请说“赞成”！

sentences.english: The Senate vote was 89 to 11, with 37 Democrats voting aye and only one Republican voting nay. Reaganomics had officially begun.
sentences.chinese: 参议员以89票对11票表决通过，赞成票中包括37位民主党议员，只有一位共和党议员投了反对票。

detailed_translations.english: The ayes are the people who vote in favour of something
used to say yes when voting

name: benevolent
trans: having a disposition to do good

sentences.english: A benevolent uncle paid for her to have music lessons.
sentences.chinese: 一位叔叔慷慨解囊，出钱供她上音乐课。

sentences.english: a benevolent smile
sentences.chinese: 慈祥的笑容

detailed_translations.english: kind and generous

name: countercharge
trans: a charge by an accused person against their accuser

name: fervent
trans: having or showing great warmth or intensity of spirit

sentences.english: a fervent appeal for peace
sentences.chinese: 对和平的强烈呼吁

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的；强烈的；炽热的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

name: condescending
trans: showing patronizing descent from dignity orsuperiority

sentences.english: Professor Hutter’s manner is extremely conde-scending.
sentences.chinese: 赫特教授的态度极为傲慢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现出优越感的；居高临下的
detailed_translations.english: behaving as though you think you are better, more intelligent, or more important than other people – used to show disapproval

name: abusive
trans: treating badly or injuriously

sentences.english: Smith denies using abusive language to the referee.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯否认辱骂裁判。

sentences.english: He became abusive and his wife was injured in the struggle.
sentences.chinese: 他动了粗，妻子在扭打中受伤。

detailed_translations.english: using cruel words or physical violence

name: filch
trans: to steal, to illegally take possession of

sentences.english: He filched a bottle of wine from the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 他从地窖里偷了一瓶酒。

detailed_translations.english: to steal something small or not very valuable

name: frigid
trans: very cold, lacking warmth, icy

sentences.english: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: agglomerate
trans: to wind or collect into a ball, to gather into a mass

sentences.english: In general fine particles tend to clump and agglomerate if they are moist or tacky .
sentences.chinese: 通常潮湿和粘性的微细颗粒易于聚集和结块。

detailed_translations.english: formed into a mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成团， 使成块， 使凝聚
detailed_translations.english: to form or be formed into a mass or cluster; collect

name: corpuscle
trans: a minute particle, an atom, a molecule

name: differential
trans: of, or relating to a difference

sentences.english: differential rates of pay
sentences.chinese: 工资级差

sentences.english: differential treatment of part-time and full-time staff
sentences.chinese: 对兼职员工和全职员工的区别对待

detailed_translations.english: based on or depending on a difference
a difference between things, especially between the wages of people doing different types of jobs in the same industry or profession

name: cosmic
trans: of or from or pertaining to the cosmos or universe

sentences.english: ...the cosmic laws governing our world.
sentences.chinese: …主宰我们世界的宇宙法则。

detailed_translations.english: relating to space or the universe

name: devilry
trans: wicked activity

name: genial
trans: warmly and pleasantly cheerful, cordial

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

name: fad
trans: a temporary fashion, notion, manner of conduct, etc

sentences.english: Interest in organic food is not a fad, it’s here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 对有机食品的兴趣不是一时的风尚，它是长久的喜好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时尚；一时的爱好；一时流行的狂热
detailed_translations.english: something that people like or do for a short time, or that is fashionable for a short time

name: fourth
trans: being one of four equal parts

sentences.english: the fourth of July
sentences.chinese: 7月4日

sentences.english: one-fourth/three-fourths

detailed_translations.english: the fourth thing in a series
¼; one of four equal parts

name: accustom
trans: to make familiar by use, to cause to accept

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

name: cosmography
trans: the creation of maps of the universe

name: baffle
trans: totally bewilder, confuse or perplex

sentences.english: The question baffled me completely.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

name: breaker
trans: something that breaks

name: forgo
trans: to let pass, to leave alone

sentences.english: I had to forgo lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我只得放弃午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable

name: descry
trans: to see by looking carefully

detailed_translations.english: to discern or make out; catch sight of

name: acquire
trans: to get

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: aura
trans: distinctive atmosphere or quality associated with something

sentences.english: She had an aura of authority.
sentences.chinese: 她有一种权威气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 光环；气氛；（中风等的）预兆；气味
detailed_translations.english: a quality or feeling that seems to surround or come from a person or a place

name: braggart
trans: someone who boasts

sentences.english: Her father was an old unmarried professor of mathematics, a brutal man and a braggart, who went out to give lessons in spite of his age.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲是个性情粗暴、爱吹牛的老数学教师，从没正式结过婚，虽然上了年纪，却还靠替人补课度日。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is always talking too proudly about what they own or have done
boastful

name: exemplify
trans: to show or illustrate by example

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: diction
trans: the style of enunciation in speaking or singing

detailed_translations.chinese: 措辞, 用语, 言语
detailed_translations.english: the choice and use of words and phrases to express meaning, especially in literature

name: chafe
trans: to wear or abrade by rubbing

sentences.english: My shorts were chafing my thighs.
sentences.chinese: 我的短裤蹭得我大腿疼。

detailed_translations.english: to rub part of your body to make it warm

name: desiccate
trans: lacking interest, passion, or energy

sentences.english: The device was able to desiccate the salty water and to condense the moisture into drinkable water.
sentences.chinese: 这个装置能先把盐水蒸干，再让水蒸气冷凝成可饮用的水。

sentences.english: Although many bdelloids live in desiccation-prone habitats, such as ephemeral ponds, there are substantial numbers found in permanently aquatic habitats that are unable to desiccate.
sentences.chinese: 尽管许多轮虫生活在干燥的栖息地，如短时间的小水塘，但是有许多轮虫却生活在不会干涸的多水环境里。

sentences.english: Tympanic center leaves the alveolus of one desiccate.
sentences.chinese: 鼓膜中心则留下一变干的小孔。

name: extravagance
trans: excessive or superfluous expenditure of money

sentences.english: When the company went under, tales of his extravagance surged through the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司破产时，有关他的奢靡的传言传遍了整个业界。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢侈，浪费；过度；放肆的言行
detailed_translations.english: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford

name: bondage
trans: the state of being enslaved or the practice of slavery

sentences.english: the bondage of early motherhood
sentences.chinese: 刚刚做母亲时所受的束缚

detailed_translations.english: the state of having your freedom limited, or being prevented from doing what you want

name: centenary
trans: of, pertaining to, or completing a period of 100 years

sentences.english: Some say he was alluding to the centenary of the Fabian Society, founded in 1884.
sentences.chinese: 有些人说他是暗示1884年成立的费边社成立一百年。

detailed_translations.english: the day or year exactly 100 years after a particular event

name: dialect
trans: a socially or geographically distinct variant of a language

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

name: declamation
trans: rhetorical delivery, loud speaking in public

name: adjudge
trans: to declare to be

name: adapt
trans: to make suitable, to make to correspond, to fit or suit

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: countermand
trans: to rescind by giving an order contrary to a previous one

sentences.english: Please countermand our order for same.
sentences.chinese: 对上述订单，请取消。

sentences.english: I can't countermand an order Winger's given.
sentences.chinese: 我无法撤销温格下达的命令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取消，撤消；下反对命令召回
detailed_translations.english: If you countermand an order, you cancel it, usually by giving a different order

name: bodice
trans: the part of a woman's dress covering between neck and waist

name: fallacious
trans: containing a fallacy,  logically unsound

sentences.english: Such an argument is misleading, if not wholly fallacious.
sentences.chinese: 这种论点即使不完全是谬误，也是误导人的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谬误的；骗人的；靠不住的；不合理的
detailed_translations.english: containing or based on false ideas

name: demonstrable
trans: clearly apparent or capable of being logically proved

sentences.english: We must provide demonstrable improvements in health services.
sentences.chinese: 在公共医疗服务方面我们必须有实实在在的改进。

detailed_translations.english: able to be shown or proved

name: grindstone
trans: an abrasive wheel for sharpening, polishing or grinding

name: decrepit
trans: weakened or worn out from age or wear

sentences.english: The buildings were in a decrepit state.
sentences.chinese: 这些建筑物破旧不堪。

sentences.english: He was a rather decrepit old man.
sentences.chinese: 他年老体弱。

detailed_translations.english: old and in bad condition

name: decasyllable
trans: a verse having ten syllables

name: azan
trans: (Islam) the call to prayer proclaimed five times a day

name: credible
trans: believable or plausible

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: catharsis
trans: the process of releasing strong or repressed emotions

sentences.english: Music is a means of catharsis for me.
sentences.chinese: 音乐是我宣泄情感的一种途径。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of removing strong or violent emotions by expressing them through writing, talking, acting etc

name: fanatical
trans: having an extreme zeal or enthusiasm for something

sentences.english: He is a fanatical fan of Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名莫扎特音乐的狂热爱好者。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as fanatical, you disapprove of them because you consider their behaviour or opinions to be very extreme

name: conspire
trans: to plot something unlawful or harmful

sentences.english: They'd conspired to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾合谋推翻政府。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly plan with someone else to do something illegal

name: dismount
trans: to get off (something)

name: choreography
trans: the art of creating, and arranging dance movements

sentences.english: The choreography of Eric Hawkins is considered radical by ballet audiences.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克·霍金斯的舞蹈编排被芭蕾舞剧的观众认为是不同凡响的。

detailed_translations.english: the art of arranging how dancers should move during a performance

name: audacious
trans: showing willingness to take bold risks, recklessly daring

sentences.english: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
sentences.chinese: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的；大胆鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking

name: exacting
trans: rigid or severe in demands or requirements

sentences.english: She was an exacting woman to work for.
sentences.chinese: 她是一位对下属要求严格的女性。

detailed_translations.english: demanding a lot of effort, careful work, or skill

name: aegis
trans: the shield or breastplate of zeus or athena, protection

name: commingle
trans: to blend, to mix

sentences.english: Many towns allow recyclable items to be commingled for collection in a single container.
sentences.chinese: 在许多城镇，可回收物品可以混放在一个容器里统一收走。

detailed_translations.english: to mix together, or to make different things do this

name: flatulence
trans: the state of having gas, trapped in the digestive system

name: forefather
trans: ancestor

sentences.english: They were determined to go back to the land of their forefathers.
sentences.chinese: 他们决意要回到老祖宗的土地。

detailed_translations.english: the people, especially men, who were part of your family a long time ago in the past

name: depress
trans: to press down on

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: deviltry
trans: extreme cruelty

name: axiom
trans: a self-evident truth requiring no proof

sentences.english: ...the long-held axiom that education leads to higher income.
sentences.chinese: ...教育会带来高收入这一长期公认的观念。

detailed_translations.english: a rule or principle that is generally considered to be true

name: bon mot
trans: a witty remark or comment, clever saying, witticism

name: disrobe
trans: to undress someone or something

name: enlist
trans: to join a cause or organization, especially military

name: embargo
trans: any restriction placed on commerce by a government

sentences.english: The United Nations imposed an arms embargo against the country.
sentences.chinese: 联合国对该国施行了武器贸易禁运。

sentences.english: The fruit was embargoed.
sentences.chinese: 水果被禁运了。

sentences.english: They embargoed oil shipments to the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们禁止了对美国石油船运。

detailed_translations.english: an official order to stop trade with another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止， 禁止出入港口
detailed_translations.english: If goods of a particular kind are embargoed, people are not allowed to import them from a particular country or export them to a particular country

name: congruent
trans: agreeing, accordant, congruous

sentences.english: They want to work in an organization whose values are congruent with their own.
sentences.chinese: 他们想在一家与他们自己的价值观相同的组织里工作。

detailed_translations.english: congruent  triangles  are the same size and shape

name: expound
trans: to set forth or state in detail

sentences.english: Schmidt continued to expound his views on economics and politics.
sentences.chinese: 施密特继续阐释他关于经济与政治的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to explain or talk about something in detail

name: bulwark
trans: to fortify something with a wall or rampart

detailed_translations.english: something that protects you from an unpleasant situation

name: galvanize
trans: to stimulate by or as if by a galvanic (electric) current

sentences.english: The report galvanized world opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道一出，世界舆论一片哗然。

detailed_translations.english: to shock or surprise someone so that they do something to solve a problem, improve a situation etc

name: alimony
trans: a court-enforced allowance made to a former spouse

sentences.english: He needed something to renew his energies and, not incidentally, a means of making his alimony and child-support payments.
sentences.chinese: 他需要一些事情来恢复他的活力，并且并非偶然地需要一种能挣赡养费和孩子抚养费的方法。

sentences.english: If a trial is necessary, the court has the authority to order one spouse to pay the other’s attorney fees in alimony, child support and child custody matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果审判是必要的，法院有权判定双发有一方要为其配偶支付律师费，赡养费，子女抚养费和子女监护权问题。

detailed_translations.english: money that a court orders someone to pay regularly to their former wife or husband after their marriage has ended

name: curmudgeon
trans: a bad-tempered or surly person

sentences.english: ...such a terrible old curmudgeon.
sentences.chinese: ...一个脾气如此糟糕的老头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脾气坏的人，乖戾的人；吝啬鬼；存心不良的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is often annoyed or angry, especially an old person

name: clarion
trans: loud and clear

name: erasure
trans: the action of erasing, deletion, obliteration

sentences.english: a way to avoid accidental erasure of data from your computer
sentences.chinese: 避免无意中删除计算机资料的方法

detailed_translations.english: when you erase something, or when something is erased

name: eleemosynary
trans: relating to charity, alms, or almsgiving

name: acetic
trans: of, pertaining to, or producing vinegar

name: fracture
trans: to break, or cause something to break

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: ancestry
trans: condition as to ancestors, ancestral lineage

sentences.english: Most people of European or African ancestry have the "wet" kind: thick and sticky.
sentences.chinese: 大多数欧洲或者非洲血统的人耳垢是湿的，厚的，有粘性的。

sentences.english: Martin has shown that, of the eukaryotic genes whose ancestry can be traced, 75 per cent or more came from bacteria rather than the host cell.
sentences.chinese: 马丁揭示，在哪些可以追溯到祖先的线粒体基因上，有75%或更多的成分来自当时外来的细菌而非宿主细胞。

sentences.english: You can only explain this by evolutionary common ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 你只能通过存在“进化上的共同祖先”来解释。

detailed_translations.english: the members of your family who lived a long time ago

name: abscess
trans: to form such a collection of pus
