name: grandeur
trans: the state of being grand or splendid, magnificence

sentences.english: the grandeur of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山峦的巍峨壮丽

detailed_translations.english: impressive beauty, power, or size

name: engender
trans: to produce, cause, or give rise to

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

name: dragnet
trans: a net dragged across the bottom of a body of water

name: comparative
trans: perceptible by comparison, relative

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: dendrology
trans: the study of trees and other woody plants

name: feudalism
trans: social system based on personal resources and fealty

sentences.english: As feudalism decayed in the West it gave rise to a mercantile class.
sentences.chinese: 随着西方封建制度解体，商业阶层应运而生。

detailed_translations.english: a system which existed in the Middle Ages, in which people received land and protection from a lord when they worked and fought for him

name: disobedience
trans: refusal to obey

sentences.english: A single act of rebellion or disobedience was often enough to seal a woman's fate.
sentences.chinese: 仅一次反抗或不服从的行为在以前就往往足以决定一个女人的命运。

detailed_translations.english: Disobedience is deliberately not doing what someone tells you to do, or what a rule or law says that you should do

name: dialogue
trans: a conversation between two or more persons

sentences.english: a boring movie full of bad dialog
sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

name: fuse
trans: to melt together, to blend, to mix indistinguishably

sentences.english: two 13 amp fuses
sentences.chinese: 两根13安培的保险丝

sentences.english: I taught him how to change a fuse .
sentences.chinese: 我教他怎么换保险丝。

sentences.english: A bomb was deactivated at the last moment, after the fuse had been lit.
sentences.chinese: 一枚炸弹在导火线已被点燃后的最后一刻被解除。

sentences.english: The skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five.
sentences.chinese: 颅骨在15和25岁之间长合。

detailed_translations.english: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合; 融合; 熔合
detailed_translations.english: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted

name: derision
trans: mockery, taunt

sentences.english: His speech was greeted with derision by opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲遭到反对党领袖的讥笑。

detailed_translations.english: when you show that you think someone or something is stupid or silly

name: abide
trans: to wait for

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: courtesy
trans: given or done as a polite gesture

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

name: esquire
trans: to attend, wait on, escort

name: glib
trans: readily fluent, often thoughtlessly or insincerely so

sentences.english: glib politicians
sentences.chinese: 巧舌如簧的政客

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆滑的， 能言善道的， 善辩的

name: equivocal
trans: of doubtful nature or character, questionable, dubious

sentences.english: His answer was equivocal.
sentences.chinese: 他的回答模棱两可。

sentences.english: She was rather equivocal about her work.
sentences.chinese: 她谈到她的工作时有点含糊其词。

detailed_translations.english: if you are equivocal, you are deliberately unclear in the way that you give information or your opinion

name: adulterate
trans: to make impure by adding improper, or inferior ingredients

sentences.english: The food had been adulterated to increase its weight.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物被掺了假以增加其重量。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink less pure by adding another substance of lower quality to it

name: bedeck
trans: to deck, ornament, or adorn, to grace

sentences.english: ...flags bedecking the balcony.
sentences.chinese: ... 装饰阳台的旗子。

detailed_translations.english: to decorate something such as a building or street by hanging things all over it

name: accompaniment
trans: that which gives support or adds to the background

sentences.english: White wine makes an excellent accompaniment to fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒是吃鱼时绝佳的佐餐酒。

detailed_translations.english: music that is played in the background at the same time as another instrument or singer that plays or sings the main tune

name: diffusion
trans: the spreading of something more widely

sentences.english: Dissemination, as of news; diffusion.
sentences.chinese: 散布，如消息的传开；扩散。

sentences.english: A diffusion method for the preparation of ferrous oxalate in a gel system was presented.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了一种在凝胶体系中用扩散法制备草酸亚铁的结晶方法。

sentences.english: The crack grouting diffusion radius is the basic gist of the grouting construction design and grouting craftwork control.
sentences.chinese: 灌浆扩散半径是进行灌浆结构设计和灌浆工艺流程控制的基本依据。

name: acrimonious
trans: of or pertaining to words, arguments, quarrels

sentences.english: The meeting ended in an acrimonious dispute.
sentences.chinese: 会议在激烈的辩论中结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖酸刻薄的， 激烈的
detailed_translations.english: an acrimonious meeting or discussion is one in which people argue a lot and get very angry

name: admittance
trans: the act of admitting

sentences.english: Gaining admittance to the club was no easy matter.
sentences.chinese: 获准进入那家俱乐部并非易事。

detailed_translations.english: permission to enter a place

name: atomizer
trans: an instrument for reducing a liquid to spray or vapor

name: garrison
trans: to assign troops to a military post

sentences.english: The garrison was called out when news of the enemy’s advance was received.
sentences.chinese: 收到敌人推进的情报后，卫戍部队奉命出动。

sentences.english: a garrison town
sentences.chinese: 有部队驻防的城镇

detailed_translations.english: a group of soldiers living in a town or fort and defending it
to send a group of soldiers to defend or guard a place

name: compendium
trans: a collection of concise but detailed info about one subject

sentences.english: The Roman Catholic Church has issued a compendium of its teachings.
sentences.chinese: 罗马天主教会已经发行了一份其教义的概略。

detailed_translations.english: A compendium is a short but detailed collection of information, usually in a book

name: agile
trans: active, quick and coordinated

sentences.english: Dogs are surprisingly agile.
sentences.chinese: 狗出奇地敏捷。

detailed_translations.english: able to move quickly and easily

name: conclusive
trans: serving to prove a case, convincing

sentences.english: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师们声称没有任何发生过谋杀的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的； 最后的； 决定性的
detailed_translations.english: showing that something is definitely true

name: efficacy
trans: the ability to produce a desired or intended result

sentences.english: Recent medical studies confirm the efficacy of a healthier lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 近来的医学研究证实了更健康的生活方式的功效。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to produce the right result

name: catholic
trans: all embracing, general

sentences.english: She has catholic tastes (= likes a lot of different things ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的兴趣非常广泛。

sentences.english: a catholic collection of records
sentences.chinese: 包罗万象的唱片收藏

sentences.english: At least nine out of ten Mexicans are baptized Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 至少十分之九的墨西哥人是受过洗礼的天主教徒。

detailed_translations.english: including a very wide variety of things
A Catholic is a member of the Catholic Church

name: dissertation
trans: a written essay, or thesis, especially for a doctoral degree

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

name: consternation
trans: feelings of anxiety or dismay

sentences.english: The government’s plans have caused considerable consternation among many Americans.
sentences.chinese: 政府的计划在许多美国人中间引起了相当大的恐慌。

name: contentment
trans: a state of happiness and satisfaction

sentences.english: He gave a sigh of contentment , and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 他满意地舒了口气后就睡着了。

sentences.english: a feeling of deep contentment
sentences.chinese: 深深的满足感

detailed_translations.english: the state of being happy and satisfied

name: contemptuous
trans: scornful, disdainful

sentences.english: a contemptuous glance
sentences.chinese: 轻蔑的一瞥

detailed_translations.english: showing that you think someone or something deserves no respect

name: affront
trans: to insult intentionally, especially openly

sentences.english: He stepped back, affronted by the question.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得这个问题语带冒犯，退后了几步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯，有意冒犯；面对；公开侮辱
detailed_translations.english: to offend or insult someone, especially by not showing respect
a remark or action that offends or insults someone

name: consonance
trans: agreement or compatibility between opinion or actions

sentences.english: Cognitive consonance is a consistency between the knowledge, ideas and beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 认识一致是知识、思想和信念之间的一致。

sentences.english: One becomes sharply aware, but without regret, of the limits of mutual understanding and consonance with other people.
sentences.chinese: 人们会清楚地发觉，同别人的相互了解和协调一致是有限度的，但这不值得惋惜。

sentences.english: The feelings and mood are thick at every moment in the day time, which need more deposition and consonance, letting us taste blessedness and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 白天的每一刻思绪与心情都是浑浊的，它需要更多的沉淀与调和，让我们品味幸福与快乐的味道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致， 调和； 和音
detailed_translations.english: agreement, harmony, or accord

name: cohesive
trans: having unity

sentences.english: a cohesive community
sentences.chinese: 团结的社区

detailed_translations.english: connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: ennoble
trans: to bestow with nobility, honour or grace

sentences.english: art which ennobles the human race
sentences.chinese: 使人类更为崇高的艺术

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…成为贵族；使…高贵；授予爵位
detailed_translations.english: to improve your character

name: foreknowledge
trans: knowing beforehand, prescience, foresight, precognition

sentences.english: She has maintained that the General had foreknowledge of the plot.
sentences.chinese: 她已断言将军早就预感有此密谋。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge that something is going to happen before it actually does

name: cryptic
trans: having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

name: dishearten
trans: to cause someone to lose confidence

name: brindled
trans: of a brownish, tawny or gray colour, with streaks or spots

name: bullock
trans: a castrated bull

detailed_translations.english: a young male cow that cannot breed

name: decadence
trans: a state of moral or artistic decline or deterioration

sentences.english: But even your dreams will be but a pale shadow of my true decadence.
sentences.chinese: 但你的梦不过是我真实衰落中一个苍白的影子罢了。

sentences.english: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
sentences.chinese: 美国是唯一一个直接从野蛮进入颓废、中间没有经过文明阶段的社会。

sentences.english: America a is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
sentences.chinese: 美国是唯一一个直接从野蛮进入颓废、中间没有经过文明阶段的社会。 ?。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that shows that someone has low moral standards and is more concerned with pleasure than serious matters

name: atheist
trans: of or relating to atheists or atheism, atheistic

sentences.english: I was an atheist at the time.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候我是一个无神论者。

sentences.english: So the assumption at that time of course, was that if you were an atheist there was nothing for you to make you moral.
sentences.chinese: 当然了这在当时只是假设而已，如果你是一个无神论者,那么对你来说将没有任何道德上的教义。

detailed_translations.english: An atheist is a person who believes that there is no God. Compare .

name: discrete
trans: separate, distinct, individual, non-continuous

sentences.english: The change happens in a series of discrete steps.
sentences.chinese: 这个变化在一系列分离的步骤中发生。

detailed_translations.english: clearly separate

name: augur
trans: to foretell events, to exhibit signs of future events

sentences.english: The renewed violence this week hardly augurs well for smooth or peaceful change.
sentences.chinese: 本周新的暴力事件预示着顺利的平稳转变几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: If something augurs well or badly for a person or a future situation, it is a sign that things will go well or badly

name: fluent
trans: able to speak a language accurately, rapidly and confidently

sentences.english: She was fluent in English, French, and German.
sentences.chinese: 她的英语、法语和德语都很流利。

detailed_translations.english: able to speak a language very well

name: discursiveness
trans: passing aimlessly from one subject to another, digressive

name: disapprobation
trans: an act or expression of condemnation or disapproval

name: disparate
trans: essentially different in kind, not allowing comparison

sentences.english: a meeting covering many disparate subjects
sentences.chinese: 涉及许多不同议题的会议

sentences.english: the difficulties of dealing with disparate groups of people
sentences.chinese: 和不同的人群打交道的难处

detailed_translations.chinese: 不同的；不相干的；全异的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of things or people that are very different and not related to each other

name: convalescence
trans: a gradual healing after illness or injury

name: dialectical
trans: the art of investigating or discussing the truth of opinions

sentences.english: The essence of dialectical thought is division.
sentences.chinese: 辩证思想的实质是二分法。

detailed_translations.english: In philosophy, dialectical is used to describe situations, theories, and methods which depend on resolving opposing factors

name: comprehension
trans: thorough understanding

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: conjecture
trans: speculation, to express an idea without proof

sentences.english: What she said was pure conjecture .
sentences.chinese: 她所说的纯属猜测。

sentences.english: There has been some conjecture about a possible merger.
sentences.chinese: 有人猜测公司可能会合并。

detailed_translations.english: when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on
to form an idea or opinion without having much information to base it on

name: consanguineous
trans: related by birth, having the same ancestry

name: cynicism
trans: a distrustful attitude

sentences.english: I found Ben's cynicism wearing at times.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得本的愤世嫉俗论有时让人烦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩世不恭，愤世嫉俗；犬儒主义；冷嘲热讽

name: dislodge
trans: to remove or force out from a position previously occupied

sentences.english: the revolution that failed to dislodge the British in 1919
sentences.chinese: 未能推翻英国统治的1919年革命

detailed_translations.chinese: 逐出，驱逐；使……移动；用力移动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a place or lose a position of power

name: conducive
trans: tending to contribute to, encourage

sentences.english: an environment conducive to learning
sentences.chinese: 有助于学习的环境

detailed_translations.english: if a situation is conducive to something such as work, rest etc, it provides conditions that make it easy for you to work etc

name: absolute
trans: free from imperfection, complete

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: buttress
trans: to provide a structure with projecting supports

sentences.english: ...the neo-Gothic buttresses of Riverside Church in Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: …曼哈顿的里弗赛德教堂中的新哥特式扶璧。

detailed_translations.english: a brick or stone structure built to support a wall
to support a system, idea, argument etc, especially by providing money

name: anguish
trans: to suffer pain

sentences.english: And we know of your anguish.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解你们的痛苦。

sentences.english: She suffered the anguish of despair.
sentences.chinese: 她忍受着绝望的痛苦。

sentences.english: And in their anguish, they both forgot the nearness of my bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 极度的痛苦让他们忘记我的卧室就在附近。

detailed_translations.english: mental or physical suffering caused by extreme pain or worry

name: confiscate
trans: to take or seize (someone's property) with authority

sentences.english: Miss Williams confiscated all our sweets.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯老师没收了我们所有的糖果。

sentences.english: Many opposition supporters had their goods confiscated.
sentences.chinese: 许多反对党支持者的财产被充公了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially take private property away from someone, usually as a punishment

name: citizenry
trans: a whole body of citizens

sentences.english: He used the medium of radio when he wanted to enlist public support or reassure the citizenry.
sentences.chinese: 当他想得到公众支持或恢复民信时，他使用广播作载体。

detailed_translations.english: all the citizens in a particular town, country, or state

name: furtherance
trans: the act of furthering or helping forward

name: enrage
trans: to fill with rage, to provoke to frenzy or madness

sentences.english: Many readers were enraged by his article.
sentences.chinese: 许多读者被他的文章激怒了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very angry

name: contempt
trans: feeling that a person or a thing is beneath consideration

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: expansion
trans: the act or process of expanding

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: exalt
trans: to raise in rank, honor, power, character, quality

sentences.english: But it can also inspire and uplift and exalt, because power can be used to help people accomplish marvelous things.
sentences.chinese: 但是，权力也可以激励人、振奋人和提升人，因为它可以帮助人们成就非同寻常的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something into a high rank or position

name: deliberate
trans: to consider carefully

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: aspiration
trans: ambition, goal

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: harass
trans: to fatigue or to tire with repeated and exhausting efforts

sentences.english: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击
detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

name: folk-lore
trans: the traditional beliefs, legends, customs, etc

name: besmirch
trans: to make dirty, to soil

sentences.english: He has accused local people of trying to besmirch his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他指责当地人企图败坏他的名誉。

detailed_translations.english: If you besmirch someone or their reputation, you say that they are a bad person or that they have done something wrong, usually when this is not true

name: domesticity
trans: affection for the home and its material comforts

sentences.english: a scene of happy domesticity
sentences.chinese: 一个幸福家庭生活的场景

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭生活；专心于家务；对家庭的挚爱
detailed_translations.english: life at home with your family

name: evert
trans: to turn inside out

name: abort
trans: to miscarry, to bring forth something prematurely

sentences.english: The disease causes pregnant animals to abort.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会导致怀孕的动物流产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流产；堕胎；夭折；发育不全
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately end a  pregnancy  when the baby is still too young to live

name: blurt
trans: to speak quickly or without thought

sentences.english: "I was looking for Sally," he blurted, and his eyes filled with tears.
sentences.chinese: 他眼含热泪，突然脱口说道：“我在找莎丽。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 未加思索地冲口说出；突然说出
detailed_translations.english: If someone blurts something, they say it suddenly, after trying hard to keep quiet or to keep it secret

name: fissure
trans: narrow opening produced by cleavage or separation of parts

sentences.english: This is an amazing cave that can be accessed througha fissure in the ground with a rope.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个非常奇妙的山洞，可以利用绳索从一个地上的裂缝进入其中。

sentences.english: The cave narrowed after a while, but we were able to continue through a narrow gap by crawling into a water-filled fissure in the rock.
sentences.chinese: 爬了不久，山洞变得越来越窄，爬过一条满是水的岩石裂缝，穿过狭窄的山口，我们得以继续前行。

sentences.english: We could send a lander to drop a drilling probe through the kilometers-thick ice or attempt to find a huge fissure to access the sub-surface ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以发射一个着陆器，向该星球投放一个有钻头的探测器，钻通其几公里厚的冰面；或者尝试去寻找一个巨大的裂缝进入地下海洋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 裂缝；裂沟（尤指岩石上的）
detailed_translations.english: a deep crack, especially in rock or earth

name: counteract
trans: to act in opposition to, to hinder, defeat, or frustrate

sentences.english: They gave him drugs to counteract his withdrawal symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他服药以消除他的脱瘾症状。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or prevent the bad effect of something, by doing something that has the opposite effect

name: encipher
trans: convert (a message or piece of text) into a coded form; encrypt

detailed_translations.english: to convert (a message, document, etc) from plain text into code or cipher; encode

name: birthright
trans: something owed since birth, due to inheritance

sentences.english: Freedom of speech is every American’s birthright.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由是每一个美国人与生俱来的权利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 与生俱来的权利；长子继承权
detailed_translations.english: something such as a right, property, money etc that you believe you should have because of the family or country you belong to

name: granular
trans: consisting of, or resembling, granules or grains

sentences.english: ...a granular fertilizer.
sentences.chinese: ...一种粒状化肥。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of granules

name: cabinet
trans: a cupboard for storing or displaying articles

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: biography
trans: a written account of another person's life

sentences.english: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.chinese: …近年的斯大林传记。

detailed_translations.english: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

name: abrasive
trans: rough enough to wear away the outer surface

sentences.english: She was a tough girl with rather an abrasive manner.
sentences.chinese: 她是个举止相当粗鲁的泼辣女孩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗糙的；有研磨作用的；伤人感情的
detailed_translations.english: rude or unkind
a rough powder or substance that you use for cleaning something or making it smooth

name: detrude
trans: to push downwards with force

name: forensics
trans: the use of science to answer questions for the legal system

name: extortion
trans: obtaining something  by the abuse of office or authority

sentences.english: He has been charged with extortion and abusing his powers.
sentences.chinese: 他被控犯有敲诈勒索罪和滥用职权罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒索；敲诈；强夺；被勒索的财物
detailed_translations.english: Extortion is the crime of obtaining something from someone, especially money, by using force or threats

name: endorse
trans: to support or give one's approval to, especially officially

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: elaborate
trans: to give further detail or explanation (about)

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: dismissal
trans: the act of sending someone away

sentences.english: Wilson was claiming compensation for unfair dismissal .
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊正在就无理解雇要求赔偿。

sentences.english: No dismissals have been announced yet.
sentences.chinese: 尚未宣布有人被解雇。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is removed from their job

name: derring-do
trans: valiant deeds in desperate times

name: convey
trans: to make an idea or feeling know or understandable

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: foreclose
trans: repossess property whose owner has failed to make payments

sentences.english: The bank foreclosed on the mortgage for his previous home.
sentences.chinese: 银行取消了他先前住房的抵押赎回权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻止；排除；取消抵押品赎回权
detailed_translations.english: if a bank forecloses, it takes away someone’s property because they have failed to pay back the money that they borrowed from the bank to buy it

name: anagram
trans: a word/phrase formed from another rearranging its letters

sentences.english: ‘Silent’ is an anagram of ‘listen’.
sentences.chinese: silent是listen的变位词。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相同字母异序词，易位构词，变位词
detailed_translations.english: a word or phrase that is made by changing the order of the letters in another word or phrase

name: alloy
trans: to mix

sentences.english: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
sentences.chinese: 黄铜是铜和锌的合金。

detailed_translations.english: to mix one metal with another
a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

name: cholera
trans: any of several acute infectious diseases

sentences.english: The cholera outbreak has been contained.
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发已被遏制住。

sentences.english: What is cholera?
sentences.chinese: 什么是霍乱？

sentences.english: People began to feel alarmed about the cholera.
sentences.chinese: 人们开始对霍乱感到惊恐起来。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease that causes sickness and sometimes death. It is caused by eating infected food or drinking infected water.

name: crustaceous
trans: of the nature of or pertaining to a crust or shell

name: forthright
trans: going straight to the point, frank, direct

sentences.english: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
sentences.chinese: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

detailed_translations.english: direct and honest - used in order to show approval

name: flabbergasted
trans: simple past tense and past participle of flabbergast

name: concomitant
trans: accompanying, concurrent

sentences.english: war with all its concomitant sufferings
sentences.chinese: 战争及其引起的一切苦难

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening together, especially as a result of something
something that often or naturally happens with something else

name: alteration
trans: the act of making different

sentences.english: Making some simple alterations to your diet will make you feel fitter.
sentences.chinese: 对你的饮食做一些简单的改变会使你感觉更健康。

detailed_translations.english: a small change that makes someone or something slightly different, or the process of this change

name: arduous
trans: difficult and tiring

sentences.english: ...a long, hot and arduous trip.
sentences.chinese: …一段漫长、灼热、艰难的旅程。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of strength and effort

name: disrepute
trans: a loss or lack of credit or repute

sentences.english: He faces six charges of bringing the game into disrepute .
sentences.chinese: 他面临六项破坏这项运动声誉的指控。

sentences.english: This theory fell into disrepute in the fifties.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论在50年代时声誉尽失。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people no longer admire or trust someone or something

name: haggard
trans: looking exhausted and unwell, in poor condition

sentences.english: Sam looked tired and haggard.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆看起来疲惫而憔悴。

sentences.english: a haggard face
sentences.chinese: 憔悴的面容

detailed_translations.english: someone who looks haggard has lines on their face and dark marks around their eyes, especially because they are ill, worried, or tired
a hawk that has reached maturity before being caught

name: allege
trans: to assert without proof

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

name: deformity
trans: a misshapen part, esp. of the body

sentences.english: a hip deformity
sentences.chinese: 臀部畸形

detailed_translations.english: a condition in which part of someone’s body is not the normal shape

name: consonant
trans: characterized by harmony or agreement

sentences.english: This policy is scarcely consonant with the government’s declared aims.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策与政府所宣称的目标基本上不符。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a combination of musical notes that sounds pleasant
a speech sound made by partly or completely stopping the flow of air through your mouth

name: clement
trans: lenient or merciful, charitable

sentences.english: The planet’s history contains many less stable and clement eras than the Holocene.
sentences.chinese: 地球的历史是包含了许多不如全新世稳定温和的时期的。

detailed_translations.english: clement weather is neither too hot nor too cold

name: constrict
trans: to narrow, especially by applying pressure

sentences.english: Caffeine constricts the blood vessels in your body.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡因会使体内的血管收缩。

sentences.english: Linda’s throat constricted and she started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 琳达喉咙发紧，哭了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to make something narrower or tighter, or to become narrower or tighter

name: fixture
trans: to furnish with, as, or in a fixture

sentences.english: light fixtures
sentences.chinese: 照明设备

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

name: administrator
trans: one who administers affairs, one who directs or manages

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

name: gibe
trans: to utter mocking or scoffing words

sentences.english: It's impolite to gibe at a foreign student's English.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑外国学生的英语是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: It's unkind to gibe at a foreign student's english even though it may sound amusing.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑一个外国学生的英语是不应该的，就算他的英语令人捧腹。

sentences.english: "Please don't gibe me, " Lydia said. "I feel as repulsive and small as one of those deadly germs often portrayed in the horror movie genre. "
sentences.chinese: “请不要嘲笑我，”利迪娅说。“我觉得自己令人讨厌，渺小，像恐怖类电影描述的那些致命的细菌那样。”

name: dissect
trans: to cut apart (something) to study its anatomy

sentences.english: books in which the lives of famous people are dissected
sentences.chinese: 剖析名人生平的书籍

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

name: antithesis
trans: a proposition diametrically opposite of another proposition

sentences.english: The antithesis of the Middle Eastern buyer is the Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 与中东买主截然相反的是日本买主。

detailed_translations.english: the complete opposite of something

name: accede
trans: (obsolete) to approach, to arrive, to come forward

sentences.english: Other countries could accede to the deal if they wanted.
sentences.chinese: 其他国家如果需要，却可能同意这种开放。

sentences.english: The foreign Ministers expressed satisfaction with the latest developments of efforts of some ASEAN countries to accede to the World Trade Organization and support for their early entry.
sentences.chinese: 外长们对部分东盟国家争取加入世界贸易组织的最新进展感到满意，并支持其早日加入。

name: append
trans: to add as supplement or in addition

sentences.english: She appended a note at the end of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她在信件尾部附加了一个说明。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to a piece of writing

detailed_translations.chinese: 设置数据文件的搜索路径

name: bristle
trans: to be on one's guard or raise one's defenses

sentences.english: His chin was covered with bristles.
sentences.chinese: 他满下巴都是胡茬。

detailed_translations.english: a short stiff hair, wire etc that forms part of a brush
to behave in a way that shows you are very angry or annoyed

name: harrowing
trans: extremely disturbing or distressing, grievous

sentences.english: a harrowing experience
sentences.chinese: 可怕的经历

sentences.english: a harrowing story
sentences.chinese: 恐怖的故事

detailed_translations.english: very frightening or shocking and making you feel very upset

name: discernible
trans: possible to perceive or recognize (something)

sentences.english: Far away the outline of the island is just discernible.
sentences.chinese: 远远的，那岛的轮廓依稀可见。

detailed_translations.english: If something is discernible, you can see it or recognize that it exists

name: epidemic
trans: like or having to do with an epidemic, widespread

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: frailty
trans: the condition of being frail, physically, mentally, etc

name: assurance
trans: a declaration tending to inspire full confidence

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: febrile
trans: feverish, or having a high temperature

sentences.english: a febrile imagination
sentences.chinese: 狂想

detailed_translations.english: full of nervous excitement or activity

name: afire
trans: on fire

sentences.english: One of the boats had been set afire .
sentences.chinese: 其中有一艘船遭人纵火。

detailed_translations.english: burning

name: concur
trans: to unite or agree, to have a common opinion

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: callosity
trans: hardheartedness

sentences.english: Seismic callosity , love immensity greatly, hope this vivid kinetic energy helps the people of disaster area.
sentences.chinese: 地震无情，大爱无边，希望这个活动能帮助到灾区的人们。

sentences.english: Saw your reality, pouring into apartness of callosity , concealing in the unanimated eyes, inhabiting the senseless.
sentences.chinese: 看见你的现实，倾泻于无情的冷漠，掩藏在无瞳的双眼，占据着无谓的灵魂。

sentences.english: Seismic callosity ground each fresh life put an end to at Acheron , how many family to destroy?
sentences.chinese: 地震无情地将一个个鲜活的生命葬送于黄泉，毁灭了多少个家庭？

name: bicameral
trans: pertaining to, two separate legislative chambers or houses

sentences.english: On legislative system for a bicameral legislature, both Chambers of the elected directly by the voters in a house of representatives of the senate and state elected;
sentences.chinese: 在立法体制上实行两院制，两院由一个选民直接选举产生的众议院和各州选举产生的参议院组成；

detailed_translations.chinese: 两院制的， 有两个议院的
detailed_translations.english: a bicameral  legislature (=  part of the government that makes laws  )  consists of two parts, such as the Senate and the House of Representatives in the US Congress

name: aggrieve
trans: to give pain or sorrow to, to afflict, to oppress

sentences.english: it aggrieved her much that she could not go

detailed_translations.chinese: 使悲痛；冒犯；侵害…的合法权利
detailed_translations.english: to grieve; distress; afflict

name: accost
trans: to approach and speak to boldly or aggressively

sentences.english: He was accosted by four youths and forced to give them all his money.
sentences.chinese: 四个少年走上前来和他搭讪，逼迫他交出身上所有的钱。

name: bier
trans: a litter to transport the corpse of a dead person

name: further
trans: to encourage growth

sentences.english: They walked a little further.
sentences.chinese: 他们又往前走了一点。

sentences.english: His hands moved further down her back.
sentences.chinese: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。

sentences.english: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place
more or additional

name: foretell
trans: to tell what's going to happen in the future

sentences.english: the birth of Christ, foretold by prophets
sentences.chinese: 先知们所预言的基督的诞生

detailed_translations.english: to say what will happen in the future, especially by using special magical powers

name: bigamy
trans: the state of having two spouses simultaneously

sentences.english: During her life Elizabeth Barrett Browning conjectured that Browning would indulge in some "feeble bigamy" after her death.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白·巴雷特·勃朗宁在生时推测丈夫在她死后会陷入“虚弱的重婚罪”里。

sentences.english: But because a court in Liverpool also found him guilty of bigamy and fraud, with all the charges bundled together, his case provides an iffy precedent, if one at all.
sentences.chinese: 该男子目前已被定罪，却是因为利物浦一法院还判定他犯有重婚和诈骗等罪行。 这一数罪并罚的案件提供了一个模棱两可的先例，如果也算是一个先例的话。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of being married to two people at the same time

name: cul-de-sac
trans: a blind alley or dead end street

name: effigy
trans: a dummy or crude representation of something that is hated

sentences.english: In Paraguay, people create an effigy and dress him up like a scarecrow when the new year comes.
sentences.chinese: 每逢新年来临，巴拉圭人都会专门制作雕像，然后把雕像打扮成稻草人的样子。

sentences.english: He stated that the charity was actually initiated by two sisters named Preston and that the effigy on the cake was that of two poor widows.
sentences.chinese: 他认为该慈善活动最初是由普列斯顿两姐妹发起的，糕饼上的肖像则是两位贫穷的寡妇。

sentences.english: Protesters set fire to government building and burned his likeness in effigy.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者点燃了政府大楼和卡扎菲的肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a statueof a famous person

name: exhume
trans: to dig out of the ground, to take out of a place of burial

sentences.english: His remains have been exhumed from a cemetery in Queens.
sentences.chinese: 他的遗体已被从昆士郡的一个墓地里挖了出来。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a dead body from the ground, especially in order to check the cause of death

name: fertile
trans: capable of growing abundant crops, productive

sentences.english: the product of a fertile imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力丰富的产物

detailed_translations.english: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

name: designate
trans: to mark out and make known, indicate

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: flourish
trans: to thrive or grow well

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: flotsam
trans: debris floating in a sea, fragments from a shipwreck

name: gentile
trans: non-jewish

name: epilogue
trans: a concluding part added to a literary work, as a novel

sentences.english: a disastrous epilogue to his career
sentences.chinese: 他事业的灾难性终结

detailed_translations.english: a speech or piece of writing that is added to the end of a book, film, or play and discusses or explains the ending

name: antagonism
trans: a strong natural dislike or hatred, antipathy

sentences.english: There is still much antagonism between environmental groups and the oil companies.
sentences.chinese: 环境组织与石油公司之间仍有很多敌意。

detailed_translations.english: hatred between people or groups of people

name: abnormal
trans: not conforming to rule or system

sentences.english: abnormal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 反常行为

sentences.english: an abnormal level of cholesterol
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇水平异常

sentences.english: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
sentences.chinese: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

detailed_translations.english: very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous

name: enclave
trans: a country, or part thereof, that is surrounded by another

sentences.english: the former Portuguese enclave of East Timor
sentences.chinese: 东帝汶的前葡萄牙人聚居地

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞地（指在本国境内的隶属另一国的一块领土）；被包围的领土；被包围物
detailed_translations.english: a small area that is within a larger area where people of a different kind or nationality live

name: catholicism
trans: the faith, practice and order of the roman catholic church

name: girder
trans: a beam of steel, wood,etc, used as a main support

sentences.english: Listen, when you start to feel weak, just tell yourself, ‘I’m as strong as a girder’ .
sentences.chinese: 听着，当你开始觉得虚弱的时候，就对自己说：‘我像 钢梁 一样强壮’。

sentences.english: The motor that drives the robot's tail and a curved, girder-like stabilizer bar attach to the robot's upper body.
sentences.chinese: 发动机驱动着机器人的尾巴和连接它上身那弯曲的像梁一样的固定装置。

sentences.english: A worker walks on a steel girder at a building under construction in Nanjing, Jiangsu province, on May 5, 2011. (Reuters/Sean Yong)
sentences.chinese: 一名工人在建筑工地的钢梁上散步，摄于2011年5月5日江苏省南京市。

detailed_translations.english: a strong beam, made of iron or steel, that supports a floor, roof, or bridge

name: dilapidated
trans: fallen into partial ruin or decay, as from age or neglect

sentences.english: ...an old dilapidated barn.
sentences.chinese: …一座破旧的谷仓。

detailed_translations.chinese: 荒废的，要塌似的；破坏的
detailed_translations.english: A building that is dilapidated is old and in a generally bad condition

name: distraught
trans: deeply upset and agitated

sentences.english: Relatives are tonight comforting the distraught parents.
sentences.chinese: 亲戚们今晚都在安慰这对忧心如焚的父母。

detailed_translations.english: so upset and worried that you cannot think clearly

name: gait
trans: a manner of walking, stepping, or running

sentences.english: a slow shuffling gait
sentences.chinese: 迟缓拖沓的步子

detailed_translations.english: the way someone walks

name: granulate
trans: to segment into tiny grains or particles

name: finite
trans: having bounds or limits, not infinite, measurable

sentences.english: the earth’s finite resources
sentences.chinese: 地球有限的资源

detailed_translations.chinese: 有限的， 有限制的； 限定的
detailed_translations.english: having an end or a limit

name: exhort
trans: to urge, advise, or caution earnestly, admonish urgently

sentences.english: Kennedy exhorted his listeners to turn away from violence.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪劝告他的听众要远离暴力。

sentences.english: He exhorted his companions, "Try to accomplish your aim with diligence."
sentences.chinese: 他勉励他的同志，“尝试以勤奋来实现目标。”

detailed_translations.english: If you exhort someone to do something, you try hard to persuade or encourage them to do it

name: alacrity
trans: cheerful readiness

sentences.english: She accepted with alacrity.
sentences.chinese: 她欣然接受了。

detailed_translations.english: quickness and eagerness

name: datum
trans: a single piece of information

detailed_translations.english: Datum is the singular form of data

name: claimant
trans: a person who makes a claim

sentences.english: benefit claimants
sentences.chinese: 救济金申请人

detailed_translations.chinese: 原告；[贸易] 索赔人；提出要求者
detailed_translations.english: someone who claims something, especially money, from the government, a court etc because they think they have a right to it

name: ferment
trans: living organisms (yeasts, molds) that cause fermentation

sentences.english: The whole country has been in a state of political ferment for some months.
sentences.chinese: 整个国家几个月来一直处在政治骚动的状态中。

detailed_translations.english: a situation of great excitement or trouble in a country, especially caused by political change
if fruit, beer, wine etc ferments, or if it is fermented, the sugar in it changes to alcohol

name: condescension
trans: behaviour that is patronizing or condescending

sentences.english: There was a tinge of condescension in her greeting.
sentences.chinese: 她的问候中有些许的纡尊降贵。

detailed_translations.english: Condescension is condescending behaviour

name: epizootic
trans: like or having to do with an epidemic among animals

name: antediluvian
trans: old, ancient

sentences.english: antediluvian ideas about women
sentences.chinese: 关于女性的陈旧观念

detailed_translations.chinese: 大洪水前的；远古的；陈旧的；旧式的
detailed_translations.english: very old-fashioned

detailed_translations.chinese: 大洪水以前的人；年迈的人；不合时宜的人

name: dissever
trans: to separate, split apart

detailed_translations.english: to break off or become broken off

name: apostate
trans: a person who forsakes his religion, cause, party

sentences.english: But as Kinzer explains, "For most of Turkey's modern history, the Muslim world has seen [the country] as an apostate," having "no religious legitimacy" and acting "as Washington's lackey.
sentences.chinese: 但作者认为“在土耳其的现代历史中，穆斯林世界将那时的土耳其视为一种变节，一点没有宗教气节，完全是美国的走狗。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who has stopped believing in a religion or supporting a political party

name: exotic
trans: foreign, with the connotation of excitingly foreign

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: extradite
trans: to move a person from one state to another by legal process

sentences.english: A judge agreed to extradite him to Texas.
sentences.chinese: 一位法官同意将他引渡到德克萨斯州。

detailed_translations.english: to use a legal process to send someone who may be guilty of a crime back to the country where the crime happened in order to judge them in a court of law

name: deft
trans: quick and neat in action, skillful

sentences.english: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
sentences.chinese: 他给她画素描，下笔又快又熟练。

sentences.english: deft footwork
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的步法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
detailed_translations.english: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

name: bifurcate
trans: to divide or fork into two channels or branches

sentences.english: The blood supply bifurcates between eight and thirty times before reaching each particular location in the body.
sentences.chinese: 血液在到达身体各个特定部位前要分流8到30次。

detailed_translations.english: If something such as a line or path bifurcates or is bifurcated, it divides into two parts which go in different directions

name: awaken
trans: to cause to become awake

sentences.english: She was awakened by a noise at two in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨两点，她被一个声音吵醒。

sentences.english: Bill slept a little until he was awakened to take his turn on guard.
sentences.chinese: 比尔睡了一会儿，直到被叫醒去换岗。

detailed_translations.english: to wake up or to make someone wake up

name: comestible
trans: suitable to be eaten, edible

sentences.english: A way of separating some comestible red pigment from the red turnip is studied by this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文以胭脂萝卜为原料进行食用红色素的提取研究。

sentences.english: Ethyl lactate is one kind of comestible synthetic spicery . It is also one kind of good solvent.
sentences.chinese: 乳酸乙酯是一种食用合成香料，它还是一种非常好的溶剂。

sentences.english: Deepen as what current system reforms commissariat, how does grain do industrial business to walk out of predicament without policy meal comestible ?
sentences.chinese: 随着粮食流通体制改革的深化，没有政策饭可吃的粮办工业企业如何走出困境？

detailed_translations.english: food

name: etymology
trans: the derivation of a word, word origin

sentences.english: From the etymology speaking, anthropology is the study of science.
sentences.chinese: 从语源学上讲，人类学是研究人的科学。

sentences.english: So the real etymology is that it appeared, evidently as slang, in around 1700.
sentences.chinese: 真正的词源似乎是这样的：它作为俚语出现在1700年左右。

sentences.english: Some of it is about etymology, about the nature of words and their casual links with the elements around us.
sentences.chinese: 有一些故事是关于语源学的，关于语言的本质以及那些词语与我们周围的元素的偶然联系。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the origins, history and changing meanings of words

name: ampere
trans: the base si unit of electrical current

sentences.english: And I prefer to an ampere meter being made of aluminum even though it has analog to another one.
sentences.chinese: 我还想要一个铝制的安培表，虽然它与另一个类似。

sentences.english: A static magnetic field is measured in units of ampere per metre, (A/m) but is usually expressed in terms of the corresponding magnetic induction measured in units of tesla, (T) or millitesla (mT).
sentences.chinese: 静电磁场以每米具有的安培单位衡量(A/m)，但是通常以相应的电磁感应单位特斯拉(T)或毫伏特斯拉(mT)表示。

sentences.english: Five nanogenerators working together produced about 1 micro ampere output current at 3 volts about the same voltage generated by two regular AA batteries.
sentences.chinese: 5个纳米发电机同时工作可以产生1微安培3伏特的输出电流，与2节普通的5号电池所产生的电压差不多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安培（计算电流强度的标准单位）

name: commend
trans: to praise formally or officially

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

name: gnarled
trans: knotty and misshapen

sentences.english: ...a large and beautiful garden full of ancient gnarled trees.
sentences.chinese: ...一座长满各种形状的古树的大型美丽花园。

detailed_translations.chinese: [木] 多节的；粗糙的；多瘤的
detailed_translations.english: a gnarled tree or branch is rough and twisted with hard lumps

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…扭曲；长木瘤（gnarl的过去分词）

name: disillusion
trans: to free or deprive someone of idealism, belief, etc

sentences.english: I hate to disillusion you, but I don’t think she’s coming back.
sentences.chinese: 我真不愿意让你失望，但我想她是不会回来了。

sentences.english: There is disillusion with established political parties.
sentences.chinese: 对各个确立的政党有幻灭感。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone realize that something which they thought was true or good is not really true or good
Disillusion is the same as

name: euphemism
trans: an indirect expression substituted for an offensive one

sentences.english: ‘Pass away’ is a euphemism for ‘die’.
sentences.chinese: “去世”是“死”的委婉语。

detailed_translations.english: a polite word or expression that you use instead of a more direct one to avoid shocking or upsetting someone

name: courageous
trans: of a person, displaying or possessing bravery

sentences.english: He was wrong, and courageous enough to admit it.
sentences.chinese: 他是错了，而且有勇气承认自己错了。

sentences.english: a courageous decision
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的决定

detailed_translations.english: brave

name: ductile
trans: capable of being made into thin wire without breaking

sentences.english: In turn, this prevents issues concerning corrosion, as the ductile material doesn't crack.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这也避免了一些腐蚀性问题，比如一些可延展的材料不易开裂。

detailed_translations.english: ductile metals can be pressed or pulled into shape without needing to be heated

name: contrivance
trans: a thing that is obviously planned, forced, or artificial

name: adieu
trans: a farewell, a goodbye, especially a fond farewell

name: construe
trans: to interpret or explain the meaning of something

sentences.english: What may seem helpful behaviour to you can be construed as interference by others.
sentences.chinese: 在你看来似乎有助益的行为会被他人看作干涉。

sentences.english: He may construe the approach as a hostile act.
sentences.chinese: 他可能把这种方法理解为一种不友善的行为。

detailed_translations.english: If something is construed in a particular way, its nature or meaning is interpreted in that way

name: expediency
trans: suitability for particular circumstance or situation

sentences.english: the ethics of political expediency
sentences.chinese: 政治上权宜之举的伦理问题

detailed_translations.english: action that is quickest or most effective in a particular situation, even if it is morally wrong

name: compassion
trans: feeling the suffering of others with the wish to relieve it

sentences.english: I was shocked by the doctor’s lack of compassion .
sentences.chinese: 我对这个医生如此缺乏同情心感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of sympathy for someone who is suffering, and a desire to help them

name: brine
trans: to preserve food in a salt solution

sentences.english: fish pickled in brine
sentences.chinese: 用盐水腌制的鱼

detailed_translations.english: water that contains a lot of salt and is used for preserving food

name: dolorous
trans: feeling or expressing great sorrow or distress

sentences.english: With a broken-hearted smile, he lifted a pair of dolorous eyes.
sentences.chinese: 带著伤心的微笑，他抬起了一双痛苦的眼睛。

sentences.english: Mr Carter's tone was dolorous, but there is an extraordinary lilt to Mr Obama's rhetoric which puts a bounce back into everyone's step.
sentences.chinese: 卡特的语调是忧伤的，而奥巴马的言辞给人的感觉是极其轻快的，给每一个人的前进步伐都带去了动力。

detailed_translations.english: causing or involving pain or sorrow

name: demonstrator
trans: a person who takes part in a public protest meeting or march

name: enthuse
trans: to cause (someone) to feel enthusiasm or to be enthusiastic

name: anglophobia
trans: fear or dislike of england

name: extravagant
trans: spending much more than is necessary or wise, wasteful

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: equable
trans: unvarying, calm and steady, constant and uniform

sentences.english: a young man with a naturally equable temperament
sentences.chinese: 生性温和的年轻人

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的， 不变的； 温和的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is equable remains calm and happy and does not often get annoyed

name: gratuity
trans: a reward, or payment provided freely, without obligation

sentences.english: The porter expects a gratuity.
sentences.chinese: 那个搬运工想要小费。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赏钱，小费；赠物；[劳经] 退职金
detailed_translations.english: a small gift of money given to someone for a service they provided

name: breadth
trans: the extent or measure of how broad or wide something is

sentences.english: The boat measured 15 feet in length and 4 feet in breadth.
sentences.chinese: 这条船长15英尺，宽4英尺。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from one side of something to the other

name: cognate
trans: related by birth, of the same parentage

sentences.english: This one branch is the Liberty of Thought: from which it is impossible to separate the cognate liberty of speaking and of writing.
sentences.chinese: 这条支线就是思想的自由。 把同源的言语的自由与写作的自由和思想的自由分开是不可能的。

sentences.english: There is no Hebrew or Greek cognate word in the Biblical text to reflect the modern term "same-sex orientation" or "homosexuality."
sentences.chinese: 在《圣经》文本中，没有关于现代概念“同性恋取向”或“同性恋”的希伯来文或希腊文的同源词。

detailed_translations.english: cognate words or languages have the same origin
a word in one language that has the same origin as a word in another language

name: captious
trans: apt to notice and make much of trivial defaults

sentences.english: Terry: Oh, Ben. I was assigned to see that captious client this afternoon. He is really the most ticklish client I have ever met. Seeing is believing!
sentences.chinese: 泰瑞：噢，本，今天指派我去会见那个吹毛求疵的客户，他真是我见过最难对付的客户了，真是百闻不如一见啊！

sentences.english: The noodle in cattle bone soup, fresh shrimp wonton, unique port sauce and soup, elastic fine and coarse noodles, will satisfy you captious taste with endless aftertaste.
sentences.chinese: 精炖熬煮的牛骨汤面。现剥沙虾现做的鲜虾馄饨，加上独家肉燥与汤头，特制弹性十足的细、粗面条，绝对让口味挑剔的您一再回味。

sentences.english: Introduce:" sweet secret " the mom that told about optimistic adamancy and equal cut is stroked each other between callous captious man external, comprehend real love and close feeling.
sentences.chinese: 简介：《甜蜜的秘密》讲述了开朗坚强的妈妈和对外冷酷的挑剔男人之间互相抚平伤口，领悟到真正爱情和亲情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吹毛求疵的； 挑剔的
detailed_translations.english: apt to make trivial criticisms; fault-finding; carping

name: garble
trans: to confuse unintentionally or ignorantly, jumble

detailed_translations.english: to jumble (a story, quotation, etc), esp unintentionally
the act of garbling

name: badger
trans: to pester, to annoy persistently

sentences.english: She badgered me for weeks until I finally gave in.
sentences.chinese: 她缠了我好几个星期，直到我最终答应了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 獾；獾皮；（大写）獾州人（美国威斯康星州人的别称）；<动><澳>毛鼻袋熊
detailed_translations.english: an animal that has black and white fur, lives in holes in the ground, and is active at night
to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times

name: fabulous
trans: extraordinary, especially in being very large

sentences.english: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
sentences.chinese: 那位公爵的巨额财富

sentences.english: You look fabulous!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.english: a fabulous meal
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

sentences.english: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

name: demarcation
trans: the act of marking off a boundary or setting a limit

name: ex officio
trans: by right of position or office

name: ford
trans: to cross a stream using a ford

sentences.english: They were guarding the bridge, so we forded the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时守着那座桥，我们就涉水过了那条河。

detailed_translations.english: a place where a river is not deep, so that you can walk or drive across it
If you ford a river or stream, you cross it without using a boat, usually at a shallow point

name: abstruse
trans: difficult to comprehend

sentences.english: Maths is a mix of abstruse theory and detailed calculations.
sentences.chinese: 数学既有深奥的理论，又有精密的计算。

detailed_translations.english: unnecessarily complicated and difficult to understand

name: gosling
trans: a young goose

detailed_translations.english: a young  goose

name: grievance
trans: something which causes grief

sentences.english: anyone who has a legitimate grievance against the company
sentences.chinese: 凡是有正当理由对公司感到不满的人

sentences.english: a means of overcoming genuine grievances
sentences.chinese: 化解委屈的一个办法

sentences.english: There must be an opportunity for both sides to air their grievances .
sentences.chinese: 一定要有一个机会让双方都说出心中的不满。

sentences.english: The teachers’ contract established a grievance procedure .
sentences.chinese: 教师合同建立了一个申诉程序。

sentences.english: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时惯有的不满情绪

detailed_translations.english: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you

name: ambiguous
trans: to be vague, non-specific

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: dilate
trans: to enlarge, to make bigger

sentences.english: dilated pupils
sentences.chinese: 扩大的瞳孔

detailed_translations.english: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

name: connoisseur
trans: an expert judge in matters of taste

sentences.english: a wine connoisseur
sentences.chinese: 品酒专家

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about something such as art, food, or music

name: attainment
trans: the act of arriving at or reaching

sentences.english: a low level of educational attainment
sentences.chinese: 教育程度低

detailed_translations.english: success in achieving something or reaching a particular level

name: cudgel
trans: a short, thick stick used as a weapon, like a club

sentences.english: Thenardier noted the enormous size of the cudgel and the solitude of the spot.
sentences.chinese: 德纳第望着那根粗壮无比的棍棒和那一片荒凉的地方。

sentences.english: He took Cosette by his left hand, and with his right he picked up his cudgel, which was lying on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手牵着珂赛特，用右手从地上拾起他的那根棍棒。

detailed_translations.english: a short thick stick used as a weapon

name: conscience
trans: the moral sense of right and wrong

sentences.english: Well, at least I can face them all with a clear conscience (= the knowledge that you have done nothing wrong ) .
sentences.chinese: 好吧，至少我可以问心无愧地面对他们所有人。

sentences.english: I can’t tell you what to do – it’s a matter of conscience (= something that you must make a moral judgment about ) .
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你怎么办——这是良心问题。

sentences.english: a crisis of conscience among medical staff (= a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what is the right thing to do )
sentences.chinese: 医务人员中的良心危机

detailed_translations.english: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong

name: foliage
trans: the leaves of plants

sentences.english: dark green foliage
sentences.chinese: 墨绿色的叶子

detailed_translations.english: the leaves of a plant

name: dutiful
trans: accepting of one's obligations and willing to do them well

sentences.english: a dutiful son
sentences.chinese: 孝顺儿子

sentences.english: Dutiful applause greeted his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他的讲话被报以礼节性的鼓掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忠实的；顺从的；守本分的
detailed_translations.english: doing what you are expected to do and behaving in a loyal and obedient way

name: gastritis
trans: inflammation of the lining of the stomach

sentences.english: Don’t use if you have an ulcer or gastritis.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你患的是胃溃疡或胃炎，就不能用这招了。

sentences.english: They cause gastritis, and are also the most common cause of stomach ulcers.
sentences.chinese: 这种细菌引起胃炎，也是胃溃肠最常见的病因。

sentences.english: I had to find out if the bacteria could really affect a healthy person and cause gastritis.
sentences.chinese: 我必须弄清楚这些细菌是否真的可以感染健康人并且造成胃炎。

detailed_translations.english: an illness which makes the inside of your stomach become swollen, so that you feel a burning pain

name: demonstrate
trans: clearly show the truth of (something) through proof

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: expressive
trans: effectively conveying thought or feeling

sentences.english: You can train people to be more expressive.
sentences.chinese: 你可以培训人们使其更富于表现力。

sentences.english: ...the present fashion for intuitive, expressive painting.
sentences.chinese: …当前凭直觉的、富于表现力的绘画风尚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions

name: acidulous
trans: slightly sour, sub-acid

name: complication
trans: an involved or confused state

sentences.english: The fact that the plane was late added a further complication to our journey.
sentences.chinese: 飞机误点给我们的旅行带来了更大的麻烦。

sentences.english: Pneumonia is one of the common complications faced by bed-ridden patients.
sentences.chinese: 肺炎是卧床病人所面临的常见并发症之一。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation that makes something more difficult to understand or deal with

name: corporal
trans: of the human body, physical

sentences.english: He was demoted to the rank of corporal.
sentences.chinese: 他被降为下士。

sentences.english: He was advanced to the rank of corporal.
sentences.chinese: 他被提升为下士。

sentences.english: As punishment,the corporal was demoted to private.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，这下士被降为士兵。

detailed_translations.english: of or relating to the body; bodily
a low rank in the army, air force etc

name: displace
trans: to move something/someone, especially forcibly from a home

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: domineer
trans: to rule over or control arbitrarily or arrogantly

sentences.english: It pleased me to domineer over her, and she generally submitted to my tyranny rather than risk a hand-to-hand encounter.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢对她作威作福，而她通常宁可屈从我的专横，不愿冒著和我直接冲突的危险。

name: demerit
trans: a quality of being inadequate, a fault, a disadvantage

sentences.english: Demerits were given to students for late attendance at prayers.
sentences.chinese: 祷告会上迟到的学生被记过了。

detailed_translations.english: a bad quality or feature of something

name: chaste
trans: abstaining from sexual intercourse, celibate

sentences.english: She led a chaste decent life.
sentences.chinese: 她过着贞洁正派的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纯洁的；贞洁的；有道德的；朴素的
detailed_translations.english: not having sex with anyone, or not with anyone except your husband or wife

name: apothegm
trans: a short, witty, instructive saying, an aphorism or maxim

name: disgruntle
trans: to put into a bad mood or into bad humour

detailed_translations.english: to make sulky or discontented

name: gigantic
trans: very large

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.english: extremely big

name: elusive
trans: evading capture, comprehension or remembrance

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: anthropomorphous
trans: resembling a human being

name: abet
trans: to assist or encourage by aid, especially in crime

name: folio
trans: a leaf of a book or manuscript

name: amorous
trans: inclined to love, having a propensity to love

sentences.english: She resisted his amorous advances .
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝了他的挑逗。

sentences.english: He was always boasting about his amorous adventures .
sentences.chinese: 他老是吹嘘自己的风流韵事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多情的；恋爱的；热情的；色情的
detailed_translations.english: showing or concerning sexual love

name: dissentious
trans: not in agreement or harmony

sentences.english: Ecological discourse' can thus be seen as the most productive cultural form for generating and mobilising ideological consensus and dissentious in modern societies.
sentences.chinese: 生态学讨论可被视为最有效的文化形式，它产生和推动现代社会的思想共识和争论。

detailed_translations.english: argumentative

name: foible
trans: a minor weakness or failing of character, slight flaw

sentences.english: We all have our little foibles .
sentences.chinese: 我们大家都有各自的小毛病。

detailed_translations.english: a small weakness or strange habit that someone has, which does not harm anyone else

name: conveyance
trans: the act or process of transporting something

name: abdicate
trans: to surrender, renounce or relinquish

sentences.english: King Alfonso XIII abdicated in favour of his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 国王阿方索十三世把王位让给了长子。

sentences.english: The king was forced to abdicate the throne .
sentences.chinese: 国王被迫退位。

detailed_translations.english: to give up the position of being king or queen

name: bawl
trans: to shout or utter in a loud and intense manner

sentences.english: ‘Tickets, please!’ bawled the conductor.
sentences.chinese: “请大家买票！”售票员大声叫着。

detailed_translations.english: to shout in a loud voice

name: effective
trans: successful in producing a desired or intended result

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: bethink
trans: to think about, to recollect

detailed_translations.chinese: 想起，忆起；使……思考；使……考虑
detailed_translations.english: to cause (oneself) to consider or meditate

name: astute
trans: shrewd, sharp

sentences.english: an astute politician
sentences.chinese: 机敏的政治家

sentences.english: astute investments
sentences.chinese: 精明的投资

detailed_translations.chinese: 机敏的；狡猾的，诡计多端的
detailed_translations.english: able to understand situations or behaviour very well and very quickly, especially so that you can get an advantage for yourself

name: antispasmodic
trans: referring to something that suppresses spasms, like a drug

name: complicit
trans: involved with others in an illegal activity or wrongdoing

name: apportion
trans: to divide and distribute portions of a whole

sentences.english: It’s not easy to apportion blame (=  say who deserves to be blamed  ) when a marriage breaks up.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂很难说是谁的错。

detailed_translations.english: to decide how something should be shared among various people

name: foreman
trans: the leader of a work crew

sentences.english: There was applause as the foreman of the jury announced the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团团长宣布裁定结果时响起了一片掌声。

detailed_translations.english: a worker who is in charge of a group of other workers, for example in a factory

name: freemason
trans: a member of a guild of skilled masons during the middle ages

name: entirety
trans: wholeness, fullness, the whole

sentences.english: We stayed in the hotel throughout the entirety of the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我们整个周末都待在酒店里。

detailed_translations.english: the whole of sth

name: bestride
trans: to be astride something

sentences.english: They even bestride the carriage lamps.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至骑在马车的灯笼上。

sentences.english: The man from the Pru will bestride the continent like a colossal salesman, hoping to convert the aspirations and fears of these new middle classes into sterling.
sentences.chinese: 信诚公司象个优秀的推销员，横跨欧洲大陆，希望把这些新的中产阶层的志向和机遇变成英镑。

name: explicit
trans: very specific, clear, or detailed

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: equine
trans: of or relating to a horse or horses

sentences.english: ...an outbreak of equine influenza.
sentences.chinese: ...一次马流感的爆发。

detailed_translations.english: relating to horses, or looking like a horse

name: batten
trans: to become better, improve in condition

name: deliquesce
trans: to melt and disappear

name: drudgery
trans: tedious, menial and exhausting work

sentences.english: People want to get away from the drudgery of their everyday lives.
sentences.chinese: 人们想摆脱日常生活中的苦差事。

detailed_translations.english: hard boring work

name: debility
trans: a state of physical or mental weakness

sentences.english: physical and mental debility
sentences.chinese: 身体和精神上的衰弱

detailed_translations.english: weakness, especially as the result of illness

name: galore
trans: in abundance

sentences.english: You can prepare as much as you like and amass material galore, but unless you come in fresh, like an athlete onto the track, you aren’t going to do the job required.
sentences.chinese: 只要你喜欢，你可以尽量准备、丰富材料，但只有像运动员一样新鲜地走上跑道，你才能保证自己完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: in large amounts or numbers

name: extraneous
trans: not belonging to, or dependent upon, a thing

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: asperity
trans: harshness of tone or manner

sentences.english: "I told you Preskel had no idea," remarked Kemp with some asperity.
sentences.chinese: "我跟你说过普瑞克一无所知"，坎普有点儿不耐烦地说。

detailed_translations.chinese: （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴
detailed_translations.english: if you speak with asperity, you say something in a way that is rough or severe, showing that you are feeling impatient

name: freshness
trans: the state or quality of being fresh

name: convalesce
trans: to recover health and strength gradually after sickness

name: felonious
trans: having the quality of felony, malignant, malicious

detailed_translations.english: of, involving, or constituting a felony

name: deceitful
trans: deliberately misleading or cheating

sentences.english: His manner was sly and deceitful.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗的；欺诈的；谎言的；虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want

name: divisive
trans: having a quality that divides or separates

sentences.english: The strike was a divisive issue in the community.
sentences.chinese: 这场罢工导致社区内部分歧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分裂的；区分的；造成不和的
detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement between people

name: bilious
trans: peevish, irritable

name: erroneous
trans: containing error, mistaken, incorrect, wrong

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: appurtenance
trans: an appendage added to something else

name: corroboration
trans: the act of strengthening or confirming, addition of strength

sentences.english: Definitely more independent corroboration is necessary .
sentences.chinese: 有必要更明确地进一步证实。

sentences.english: Yet there is no corroboration of the most intriguing reports, such as an attempt to poison the drinks of NATO troops.
sentences.chinese: 然而对最有趣的报道却没有得到证实，比如，曾有人试图在北约军队的饮料中下毒。

name: frizzle
trans: to fry something until crisp and curled

detailed_translations.english: to form (the hair) into tight crisp curls; frizz
a tight crisp curl

name: gullible
trans: easily deceived or cheated
