sentences.english: Plastic replicas of the Greek pottery are sold to gullible tourists.
sentences.chinese: 仿古希腊陶器的塑料复制品被卖给易受骗的游客。

detailed_translations.english: too ready to believe what other people tell you, so that you are easily tricked

name: falderol
trans: nonsense or foolishness

name: animosity
trans: strong hostility

sentences.english: When I came to have feelings just like those foreigners, I realized that on the inside, it felt more like animosity.
sentences.chinese: 当我也有了其他外国人那样的感受时，我意识到在自己内心，我的感受更像是憎恶。

detailed_translations.english: strong dislike or hatred

name: cathode
trans: the electrode by which current leaves an electrolytic cell

sentences.english: And if I evacuate it, I have a cathode ray tube.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对其抽真空，我会得到一根阴极射线管。

sentences.english: So the left electrode will be the cathode as I have configured it, and the right electrode will be anode.
sentences.chinese: 因此左边电极就成了阴极，正如我原来设定的一样，右边的电极就是阳极。

sentences.english: Second, they are "activating" some of the inactive components, by freeing lithium from the inactive material so that it can move between the cathode and the anode.
sentences.chinese: 其次，他们是“激活”消极的一些组件，通过释放从非活动的材料，以便可以移动它们之间的阴极和阳极锂。

detailed_translations.english: the negative  electrode  , marked (-), from which an electric current leaves a piece of equipment such as a  battery

name: exploit
trans: to use for one’s own advantage

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: artless
trans: having or displaying no guile, cunning, or deceit

sentences.english: artless sincerity
sentences.chinese: 天真烂漫

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；朴实的；无虚饰的
detailed_translations.english: natural, honest, and sincere

name: baleful
trans: threatening harm, menacing

sentences.english: a baleful look
sentences.chinese: 恶狠狠的目光

detailed_translations.english: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone

name: diligence
trans: determination or perseverance when doing something

sentences.english: Genius is nothing but labor and diligence.
sentences.chinese: 天才无非是工作和勤奋。

sentences.english: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.chinese: 我们要养成勤俭节约的好风气。

name: compel
trans: (literally) to drive together, round up

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: archive
trans: any extensive record or collection of data

sentences.english: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

name: decorous
trans: in keeping with good taste and propriety

sentences.english: It's a very mannered, decorous language.
sentences.chinese: 是一种非常礼貌且高雅的语言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有礼貌的，高雅的；端正的
detailed_translations.english: having the correct appearance or behaviour for a particular occasion

name: gape
trans: to open the mouth wide as in a yawn or surprise

sentences.english: The front door was missing. A hole gaped in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 前门没有了，屋顶裂开一个洞。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something such as a hole or a wound gapes, you are emphasizing that it is big or wide

name: depredation
trans: the act of preying upon or plundering

sentences.english: Much of the region's environmental depredation is a result of poor planning.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的环境破坏大都是规划不周的结果。

detailed_translations.english: an act of taking or destroying something

name: genealogist
trans: a person who studies, professes or practices genealogy

name: discrepant
trans: showing difference, inconsistent, dissimilar

sentences.english: Even Enrico Fermi apparently did not bother to read Hasenöhrl's papers properly before concluding wrongly that the discrepant 3/4 prefactor was due to the electron self-energy identified by Abraham.
sentences.chinese: 就连恩里科·费米显然也没有下功夫好好拜读哈泽内尔的著作，才会错误地将3／4前因数的误差归咎于亚伯拉罕的电子自能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有差异的；相差的；矛盾的

name: baste
trans: to sew with long, loose stitches

name: durance
trans: confinement or restraint by force, imprisonment

name: effulgence
trans: a state of being bright and radiant, splendor, brilliance

sentences.english: Trust us! Work together, We'll be effulgence in the future path of cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 相信我们！在未来携手合作的事业道路上，我们一定风光无限、灿烂辉煌！

sentences.english: They began to loose the spiritual effulgence and grace that was bestowed on them.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始松散的精神光辉和优雅这是赋予他们。

sentences.english: Fuelled by morbid energy, a Great Unclean One pays careful attention to all of his followers, delighting in the smallest boil, reveling in the variety and effulgence of their poxes .
sentences.chinese: 充斥于病疫的活力之中，大不净者关注着所有他手下的方方面面，从最小的疮疖中获得了欣喜，又陶醉于他们多种多样闪着光辉的脓包之中。

name: fiasco
trans: a complete and ignominious failure

sentences.english: The first lecture I ever gave was a complete fiasco .
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讲课糟得一塌糊涂。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is completely unsuccessful, in a way that is very embarrassing or disappointing

name: execrable
trans: utterly detestable, abominable, abhorrent

sentences.english: Accusing us of being disloyal to cover his own sorry behaviour is truly execrable.
sentences.chinese: 用指控我们的不忠来掩盖他个人的不当行为真是很恶劣。

sentences.english: ...an execrable meal.
sentences.chinese: ...糟透了的一顿饭。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as execrable, you mean that it is very bad or unpleasant

name: erudition
trans: knowledge acquired by study, research, etc.,  learning

sentences.english: His erudition was apparently endless.
sentences.chinese: 他显然学识渊博。

detailed_translations.english: Erudition is great academic knowledge

name: ephemeral
trans: lasting a very short time, short-lived, transitory

sentences.english: Fashion is by nature ephemeral.
sentences.chinese: 从本质上说，时尚不过是一时的潮流。

detailed_translations.english: existing or popular for only a short time

name: averse
trans: to turn away

sentences.english: Some banks are risk averse (=  do not like taking a risk  ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些银行不喜欢冒风险。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to do something or not liking something

name: circumference
trans: the outer boundary of a circular area

sentences.english: ...a scientist calculating the Earth's circumference.
sentences.chinese: …一位正在计算地球周长的科学家。

detailed_translations.english: the distance or measurement around the outside of a circle or any round shape

name: aperture
trans: an opening or gap in something

sentences.english: Through the aperture he could see daylight.
sentences.chinese: 通过这个孔隙他能看到日光。

detailed_translations.chinese: 孔，穴；（照相机，望远镜等的）光圈，孔径；缝隙
detailed_translations.english: a small hole or space in something

name: contemporary
trans: from the same time period, coexistent in time

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: afrikaans
trans: an official language of south africa, developed out of dutch

name: disciplinary
trans: corrective, administering or used for discipline

sentences.english: He will now face a disciplinary hearing for having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 他将因一起风流韵事而面对一场纪律听证会。

detailed_translations.english: Disciplinary bodies or actions are concerned with making sure that people obey rules or regulations and that they are punished if they do not

name: auspice
trans: patronage or protection

detailed_translations.english: a sign or omen, esp one that is favourable

name: enthrall
trans: to captivate or charm

sentences.english: The author enthrall, enthralled the minds of his readers.
sentences.chinese: 那位作者于读者着迷。

sentences.english: Such trends do not enthrall neutrals, many of whom would prefer to see free-scoring Barcelona win tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这些趋势并没有迷惑住中立者，他们中的很多人更愿意火力十足的巴萨明天赢球。

sentences.english: Even now, having been tortured and imprisoned by Voldemort, the idea of the Dark wizard in possession of this wand seemed to enthrall him as much as it repulsed him.
sentences.chinese: 现在，即使在被伏地魔拷问和关押后，这老头儿对于黑巫师拥有老魔杖的想法，似乎仍是既反感又着迷。

name: apogee
trans: the point in orbit around Earth when the object is farthest

sentences.english: If this is an ellipse around the Earth, then this would be perigee and this would be apogee .
sentences.chinese: 如果这是一个围绕，地球的椭圆形轨道，那么这是近地点，这是远地点。

sentences.english: At the time of Shakespeare's death, such luminaries as Ben Jonson hailed him as the apogee of Renaissance theatre.
sentences.chinese: 当时莎士比亚的死亡，这种灯具作为本琼森称赞他为远地点文艺复兴剧院举行。

sentences.english: Mistakenly believe that doing elliptical motion of the satellite perigee and apogee of the orbit radius of curvature different.
sentences.chinese: 错误地认为做椭圆运动的卫星在近地点和远地点的轨道曲率半径不同。

name: cranium
trans: the skull of a vertebrate

sentences.english: The brain itself does not fossilise, but the inside of the cranium retains an impression of its contours.
sentences.chinese: 脑部分本身是不会变成化石的，但在头盖骨内部却还保留着脑的轮廓。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your head that is made of bone and covers your brain

name: barb
trans: a sharp projection near the end of an arrow or similar item

sentences.english: The barb stung her exactly the way he hoped it would.
sentences.chinese: 他的讽刺如期伤到了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 箭头鱼钩等的倒钩；伤人的话
detailed_translations.english: the sharp curved point of a hook,  arrow  etc that prevents it from being easily pulled out

name: gauche
trans: awkward or lacking in social graces, bumbling

sentences.english: It would be gauche to mention the price.
sentences.chinese: 提及价格是不得体的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨拙的， 不会社交的
detailed_translations.english: doing or saying wrong or impolite things, especially because you do not know the right way to behave

name: brethren
trans: fellow members

sentences.english: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.
sentences.chinese: 所以我弟兄们，你们聚会吃的时候，要彼此等待。

sentences.english: Therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith.
sentences.chinese: 所以弟兄们， 我们在一切困苦患难之中， 因着你们的信心就得了安慰。

detailed_translations.english: used to address or talk about the members of an organization or group, especially a religious group

name: epistemology
trans: the branch of philosophy dealing with the study of knowledge

name: dolor
trans: sorrow, grief, misery or anguish

name: conservative
trans: tending to resist change

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: component
trans: making up a larger whole, as a component word

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: arrangement
trans: the act of arranging

sentences.english: Have you made all your travel arrangements?
sentences.chinese: 你的旅行都安排好了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 整理， 排列； 安排； 准备工作
detailed_translations.english: plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen

name: bode
trans: to indicate by signs, as future events

sentences.english: She says the way the bill was passed bodes ill for democracy.
sentences.chinese: 她说议案通过的方式预示民主的恶运。

detailed_translations.english: If something bodes ill, it makes you think that something bad will happen in the future. If something bodes well, it makes you think that something good will happen.

name: castigate
trans: to punish, reprimand someone severely

sentences.english: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism.
sentences.chinese: 马克思从不放过任何谴责殖民主义的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize or punish someone severely

name: generality
trans: the quality of being general

name: dispossess
trans: to deprive someone of the possession of land

name: contrive
trans: to form by an exercise of ingenuity, to devise, invent

sentences.english: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.chinese: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明; 设计; 设法；造成
detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties

name: egotism
trans: a tendency to talk excessively about oneself

sentences.english: The improper performances rise from selfish egotism, or what he called "Me-ism", said Roberts. Such thinking leads people to break rules.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯茨表示，种种不良行为很多时候是基于一种狭隘的自我为中心的意识，他用了一个词"Me-ism"来形容，正是这种凡事都先想到"我"的思维方式，造成了人们不顾秩序，不守规章。

sentences.english: Even as late as the 19th century, the poet Samuel Coleridge, in one of his essays on Shakespeare, could describe the villain Iago as “the very alcohol of egotism.”
sentences.chinese: 就在十九世纪，诗人萨缪尔·柯勒律治 (Samuel Coleridge) 在他论述莎士比亚的一篇短文中还将反面角色伊阿古描述为“the very alcohol of egotism” (自尊自大的化身)。

detailed_translations.english: the belief that you are much better or more important than other people

name: bovine
trans: of, relating to, or affecting cattle

sentences.english: bovine diseases
sentences.chinese: 牛病

detailed_translations.english: relating to cows

name: foreordination
trans: previous ordination or appointment, predetermination

name: bilingual
trans: fluent in two languages

sentences.english: a bilingual dictionary
sentences.chinese: 双语词典

sentences.english: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
sentences.chinese: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

detailed_translations.english: written or spoken in two languages

name: catalogue
trans: a list or record, systematically arranged

sentences.english: a mail order catalog
sentences.chinese: 邮购商品目录

sentences.english: an online catalogue
sentences.chinese: 网上目录

detailed_translations.english: a complete list of things that you can look at, buy, or use, for example in a library or at an art show
to make a complete list of all the things in a group

name: esteem
trans: to regard someone with respect

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: amputate
trans: to surgically remove a part of the body, especially a limb

sentences.english: Two of her toes were amputated because of frostbite.
sentences.chinese: 她的两个脚趾因为冻伤被截掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off someone’s arm, leg, finger etc during a medical operation

name: emaciate
trans: to make extremely thin or wasted

detailed_translations.english: to become or cause to become abnormally thin

name: constituent
trans: part of a whole

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

name: diligent
trans: performing with intense concentration, focus

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

name: extinguish
trans: to put out, as in fire, to end burning, to quench

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: arroyo
trans: a small watercourse, usually dry except for heavy rains

name: auxiliary
trans: helping, giving assistance or support

sentences.english: a nursing auxiliary
sentences.chinese: 护理辅助人员

detailed_translations.chinese: 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构
detailed_translations.english: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

name: assonate
trans: to correspond in (particularly vowel) sounds

detailed_translations.chinese: 音相谐，  成为准押韵

name: anthropoid
trans: having characteristics of a human being

sentences.english: From the point of view of evolution, men originated millions of years ago from the anthropoid, a species commonly referred to as the ape man.
sentences.chinese: 从进化的观点来看，人类起源于几百万年前的类人猿，通常又称作猿人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类人猿的；类人的；（猿等）似人类的
detailed_translations.english: an anthropoid animal, such as an  ape  , looks like a human
any primate of the suborder Anthropoidea, including monkeys, apes, and man

name: engrave
trans: to carve text or symbols into (something)

sentences.english: Your wedding ring can be engraved with a personal inscription at no extra cost.
sentences.chinese: 你的结婚戒指可以刻上个人题字不另收费。

sentences.english: The shop will also engrave your child's name on the side.
sentences.chinese: 商店也将在一侧刻上你孩子的名字。

sentences.english: ...a bottle engraved with her name.
sentences.chinese: …一个刻有她名字的瓶子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻；  铭记， 深印于 ， 铭刻
detailed_translations.english: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface

name: colloquial
trans: ordinary or familiar language rather than formal language

sentences.english: ...a colloquial expression.
sentences.chinese: …一个口语表达法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白话的；通俗的；口语体的
detailed_translations.english: language or words that are colloquial are used mainly in informal conversations rather than in writing or formal speech

name: extrovert
trans: an outgoing, gregarious person

sentences.english: Her sister was always more of an extrovert.
sentences.chinese: 她妹妹总是更外向些。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外向；外倾者；性格外向者（等于extravert）
detailed_translations.english: someone who is active and confident, and who enjoys spending time with other people

name: ersatz
trans: made in imitation, artificial

sentences.english: ersatz coffee
sentences.chinese: 代用咖啡

detailed_translations.english: artificial, and not as good as the real thing

name: cadet
trans: a student in training at a military school

sentences.english: ...army cadets.
sentences.chinese: …陆军军校学员们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼子，次子；实习生；候补军官；陆海军官学校的学员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is training to be an officer in the army, navy,  air force  , or police

name: appalling
trans: causing dismay or horror

sentences.english: She suffered appalling injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她伤势非常严重。

sentences.english: He was kept in appalling conditions in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他被关在环境极其恶劣的监狱中。

sentences.english: an appalling famine
sentences.chinese: 骇人听闻的饥荒

detailed_translations.english: very unpleasant and shocking

name: aficionado
trans: a fan or devotee

name: fishmonger
trans: a person who sells fish

sentences.english: Some people go back to local small businesses: the Asian greengrocer, a Greek baker and a Greek fishmonger.
sentences.chinese: 一些人愿意与当地的小商贩打交道，比如：亚洲菜贩，希腊面包师和希腊鱼贩。

sentences.english: The creature, three times the size of an average British edible oyster, was discovered in the bottom of a box of fish bought by a Cornish fishmonger, Peter Randall.
sentences.chinese: 这只比英国中等大小的食用牡蛎还大两倍的巨型牡蛎，被康沃尔的鱼贩彼得·兰德尔在他买下的一箱鱼的底部发现的。

sentences.english: 'We heard about this more than 10 days ago, ' a local fishmonger, surnamed Zhang, said in a telephone interview Friday. 'We dare not drink tap water, and nobody eats freshwater fish these days.'
sentences.chinese: 一位姓张的当地鱼贩周五接受电话采访时说，10多天前我们就听说了，我们不敢喝自来水，这些日子没人吃淡水鱼。

detailed_translations.english: someone who sells fish

name: autocrat
trans: an absolute ruler with infinite power

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有造诣的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个杰出的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: She wrote a lot of books that exposed the avarice of the authoritarian . the autocracy of the autocrat and the falsity of the autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 她写了许多书，暴露了权力主义者的贪婪，独裁者的独裁政体和自治权的虚伪。

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country

name: exorbitant
trans: exceeding proper limits, extravagant

sentences.english: Exorbitant housing prices have created an acute shortage of affordable housing for the poor.
sentences.chinese: 过高的房价使穷人负担得起的房源严重短缺。

detailed_translations.english: an exorbitant price, amount of money etc is much higher than it should be

name: furbish
trans: to polish or burnish

sentences.english: If you furbish up these old chairs you'll have a better chance of selling them.
sentences.chinese: 你要是把这些旧椅子擦亮，就会更好卖些。

detailed_translations.english: to make bright by polishing; burnish

name: carrion
trans: dead flesh, carcasses

sentences.english: Proletarian, be aware of the raid to the USSR planned by the carrion crows!
sentences.chinese: 无产者们，要看到由吃腐肉的乌鸦计划的突袭苏联行动！

sentences.english: In India, veterinary use of the drug Diclofenac may be largely responsible for the crash in vulture and other carrion bird populations.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，秃鹫以及其他以腐肉为食的鸟类数量大量减少可能主要归咎于兽医对双氯芬酸的使用。

detailed_translations.english: the decaying flesh of dead animals, which is eaten by some animals and birds

name: altar
trans: a table or similar flat-topped structure for religious rites

sentences.english: a crucifix above the high altar
sentences.chinese: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像

sentences.english: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
sentences.chinese: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

detailed_translations.english: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies

name: gluttonous
trans: given to excessive eating, prone to overeating

sentences.english: ...a selfish, gluttonous and lazy person.
sentences.chinese: ...一个自私、贪食而又懒惰的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: If you think that someone eats too much or is greedy, you can say they are gluttonous

name: demulcent
trans: soothing or softening

name: abomination
trans: anything greatly disliked or abhorred

sentences.english: Slavery was an abomination.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶制令人深恶痛绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶；憎恨；令人厌恶的事物
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is extremely offensive or unacceptable

name: concurrent
trans: happening at the same time, simultaneous

sentences.english: The exhibition reflected concurrent developments abroad.
sentences.chinese: 该展览反映了国外的同期发展情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并发的；一致的；同时发生的
detailed_translations.english: existing or happening at the same time

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 共点；同时发生的事件

name: demur
trans: to raise doubts or objections or show reluctance

sentences.english: They demurred politely, but finally agreed to stay.
sentences.chinese: 他们礼貌地推却，但最后还是同意留下。

detailed_translations.english: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion
disagreement or disapproval

name: despond
trans: to give up the will, courage, or spirit

name: futurist
trans: in the style of futurism

name: contagious
trans: of a disease, easily transmitted to others

sentences.english: her contagious enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 她那富有感染力的热情

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, attitude, or action is contagious, other people are quickly affected by it and begin to have it or do it

name: ballast
trans: any heavy material used to stabilize a ship

detailed_translations.chinese: 压舱物，[建] 压载物；道渣，碎石
detailed_translations.english: heavy material that is carried by a ship to make it more steady in the water

name: edify
trans: to instruct or improve (someone) morally or intellectually

sentences.english: A sermon, especially one intended to edify a congregation on a practical matter and not intended to be a theological discourse.
sentences.chinese: 布道一次讲道，尤其是旨在于实际问题上启发会众，而不在于成为神学讲演。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the morality, intellect, etc, of, esp by instruction

name: evade
trans: to get away from by artifice, to avoid by dexterity

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: confectionery
trans: foodstuffs that taste very sweet, candies

name: enshroud
trans: to cover with (or as if with) a shroud

name: flax
trans: a plant of the genus linum which has a single, slender stalk

sentences.english: Cherries, sunflower and flax seeds have traces of this hormone.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃，向日葵籽和亚麻籽都含有这种荷尔蒙。

sentences.english: He understood well the importance of international trade and the potential wealth to be gained from the export of flax, hemp, pitch, furs, hides and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他非常了解国际贸易的重要性，以及亚麻、大麻、沥青、皮草、兽皮和木材等物资出口所能获得的巨大潜在财富。

sentences.english: Both soybeans and flax showed changes in their proteins, but not enough to stop them from thriving in the soil contaminated by the 1986 disaster.
sentences.chinese: 1986年灾后，大豆和亚麻的蛋白质有所改变，但这不足以阻止它们在受到污染的土壤中发芽。

detailed_translations.english: a plant with blue flowers, used for making cloth and oil

name: apostle
trans: a missionary, or leader of a religious mission

name: declarative
trans: a statement in the form of a formal announcement

name: complicity
trans: the state of being involved as a partner or accomplice

sentences.english: Recently a number of policemen were sentenced to death for their complicity in the murder.
sentences.chinese: 近来很多警察因参与这起谋杀而被判死刑。

detailed_translations.english: involvement in a crime, together with other people

name: artesian
trans: pertaining to a well in which water rises from pressure

sentences.english: Each guestroom also features celebrated local and regional works of art, paying tribute to the true artesian nature of the indigenous painters, sculptors, and basket-weavers.
sentences.chinese: 每个客房还设有著名的地方和地域性的艺术作品，赞颂的土著画家、雕塑家真正的自流性，和编织篮子。

name: august
trans: inspiring reverence or admiration, majestic

sentences.english: an august institution
sentences.chinese: 庄严的机构

detailed_translations.english: impressive and respected

name: capricious
trans: given to sudden, unaccountable changes of mood or behavior

sentences.english: She was as capricious as her mother had been.
sentences.chinese: 她和她母亲当初一样反复无常。

detailed_translations.english: likely to change your mind suddenly or behave in an unexpected way

name: fluke
trans: to obtain a successful outcome by pure chance

sentences.english: He agreed that the second goal was a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他也认为第二个进球实属侥幸。

detailed_translations.english: something good that happens because of luck
